address: Apartment 9.02, The Arc, City Road, London EC1V
detailedDescription:
This unique one bedroom apartment is located on the 9th floor of The Arc in Shoreditch and measures 538 sq ft.

The Arc is a collection of 100 apartments, just five minutes' walk from Old Street station.

The interiors have been beautifully designed by the award-winning Bowler James Brindley and floor-to-ceiling windows mean the apartments are flooded with light.

Residents will benefit from an exclusive collection of amenities, making The Arc a perfect investment. Amenities include a landscaped 7th-floor terrace, yoga studio, cinema room, golf simulator, residents' lounge and a fitness suite.

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many virtual viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

*Please note that the CGIs used are for illustrative purposes only

Located in the heart of Tech City, The Arc is just a short walk to both Shoreditch and Islington. From Old Street station, Bank and King's Cross are just 3 minutes and 5 minutes away by tube, respectively.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A spacious split level one bedroom apartment, located on the 2nd and 1st floors. Beautifully presented with newly refurbished kitchen and bathroom. South facing reception with full height/width windows/glass sliding door leading to a balcony with pretty views of Beech gardens, including the pond and fountain. Kitchen has a generous dining area. Bedroom has built in wardrobes. A lovely feature of the apartment a wood staircase leading down to the reception area. Underfloor heating included in the service charge. Lift. 24hr car park attendants can hold keys and receive packages. Car parking and bike storage by separate negotiation with the City of London. The Barbican Estate includes the Barbican Arts Centre, cinemas, art gallery, concert hall, restaurants, bars and cafes. Waitrose, Marks & Spencer and Tesco’s are close at hand.
Service Charge: 31st March - 1st April 2021/2022 Estimated £3875. Lease: 125 years from July 1981.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description We are delighted to offer for sale this huge apartment in the heart of Highbury. Spanning over 1000 sq ft, this charming dwelling offers great accommodation with fantastic local attractions. To the quieter rear of the apartment are two good sized double bedrooms, a family bathroom is in the middle. The main selling point of the flat is the incredibly large reception and kitchen, spanning the whole width of the building. An unusually large building, this splendid conversion banks the Church on one side giving it a wonderfully light aspect.

The reception rooms overlook Highbury New Park, a wide tree lined avenue populated mainly with substantial Victorian architecture. This dwelling is presented to a tasteful and high standard throughout - and of note is the fact that this building was once the home of none other than Douglas Adams - with whom this firm has a well known association!

A lovely apartment, oozing character and timeless style.

Situation and tenure St Augustine's path, on the other side of the church, leads almost directly through to the wide open space of Clissold Park, and then on through to the eclectic shops, restaurants and boutiques of Stoke Newington. Canonbury station, at one end of Highbury New Park gives great access to Shoreditch High St for the City on one side, and Brick Lane on the other.

A pleasant stroll across Highbury Fields transports you to Highbury & Islington which has access to Victoria and Overground lines. Nearby Highbury Barn hosts perennial favourites Godfreys Butchers, Bournes Fishmongers, La Fromagerie and Da Mario's deli. Islington's trendy Upper Street is also within reach for even more shopping and dining options

This apartment enjoys a Share of the Freehold and the costs for the maintenance of the building are shared between the owners

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Stunning one bedroom on Liverpool Road.

Location

Set in the St Mary Magdalene Conservation Area, this house makes up part of an elegant terrace of similar villa style houses on the east side of Liverpool Road. It is well placed for the many amenities on Upper Street and has excellent transport links including Highbury and Islington station (Victoria Line and Overground) and many bus routes. Angel Station (Northern Line) is also conveniently close by.

Description

Set within a Georgian conversion on the raised ground floor, this is a beautiful and extremely spacious one bedroom apartment.

Offering an abundance of modern and period features with high ceilings throughout, the property has a large reception and dining room, fully integrated kitchen, modern bathroom and a large principal bedroom with built-in custom wardrobes and large windows looking out on to a shared garden. There is a separate laundry room which also provides ample further storage.

Square Footage: 720 sq ft

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Rarely available, this smart, well presented one bedroom garden flat offers almost 550 sq ft of accommodation and is arranged over the lower ground floor of an attractive Grade II listed late Georgian townhouse on one of Canonbury's most sought after streets.

Accommodation comprises a generous reception room with wooden floors, a modern open-plan kitchen and a large sash window with a pretty aspect on to the front courtyard.

The double bedroom is to the rear and has a pair of french doors opening to a small terrace together with an adjacent sleek contemporary bathroom.

There is an attractive paved courtyard garden to the front of the property, ideal for summer entertaining.

Please note, the lease has recently been extended and has 169 years remaining.

Canonbury Park North is an attractive residential street in the heart of leafy Canonbury running from Grange Grove to St Pauls Road. The nearest Underground station can be found at Highbury & Islington (Victoria, Overground and Mainline services - 0.6 miles). Canonbury station (Overground - 0.2 miles) is also easily accessible. Islington's Upper Street with its fashionable shops, bars and restaurants is a short distance away (0.8 miles) and provides excellent bus connections to the City, the West End and beyond. Please note that all distances are approximate.

detailedDescription:
Spacious two bedroom apartment just outside the City.

Location

Located at the Shoreditch end of City Road, The City Approach is perfectly positioned for those who want to be within easy reach of Old Street tube station and local amenities found in Shoreditch and Islington.

The development is also within walking distance of the shops, bars and restaurants that can be found in Angel, Hoxton, the City, Brick Lane and Clerkenwell.

Description

This expansive two bedroom apartment is within a beautiful mansion block on the edge of the City.

On the third floor of the building, the apartment has a floor space exceeding 1,000 square feet with two bedrooms, two bathrooms and an open plan lounge and kitchen.

There is ample storage space and the property has a bright and fresh feel throughout. The block was recently renovated and is a fantastic position to enjoy the delights of the City.

detailedDescription:
A newly decorated one bed flat with private garden in red brick mansion block in the heart of Barnsbury.

This charming ground floor flat is in a period red-brick mansion block just moments from vibrant Upper Street.

It boasts stripped wooden floors and has been recently redecorated thoughout.

The spacious lounge offers plenty of room for both a sofa and dining table for entertaining friends.

The private garden, which has direct access to the street, is accessed through double doors in the lounge and has been decked making it ideal for summer bbqs.

The fully fitted kitchen offers a washing machine, dishwasher, gas hob, oven, built in microwave and fridge freezer.

The bathroom has a full-sized bath with shower overhead.

This flat is perfectly located for the diverse array of shops, restaurants and bars on bustling Upper Street and Chapel Market.

It is also ideally located just 10 minutes walk to either King's Cross station or Angel tube station.

Offered chain free.

address: Lofting Road, Barnsbury, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription: A spacious 2 double bedroom garden flat set on the ground floor of this centrally located low rise modern development, benefitting from a private patio garden and residents private off-street parking. Accommodation comprises 2 good size double bedrooms both with range of built-in wardrobes providing ample storage, spacious bathroom with 'his & hers' sinks, 20ft open-plan kitchen/ dining/ reception room with double doors opening to the secluded and immensely private patio garden. The flat affords superb access to Angel Underground (Northern line) and to the transport at Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), Caledonian road & Barnsbury station (London Overground) as well as Caledonian road station (Piccadilly line Zone 2) with all the buzz and vibrancy of the amenities of Upper Street within easy reach. The celebrated Gastropubs the Duchess Of Kent, the Albion and the Drapers Arms can be found locally within Barnsbury, and the incredibly popular restaurant/café Sunday is situated just two streets away. The transport hub of Kings Cross/ St Pancras International and the new Kings Cross regeneration/development which includes Granary Square & Coal Drops Yard with an array of eateries offering food from around the globe and boutique shops & galleries also within close proximity.

detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire an impressive two double bedroom, two bathroom split level apartment, bathed in natural light and featuring a terrace and patio, converted from a former industrial building, located within the heart of De Beauvoir. Accommodation is well balanced comprising; a jaw dropping reception space, featuring a dual aspect and vaulted ceilings, retaining original beams and providing access to a bedroom and bathroom suite, as well as a terrace. The lower level houses a vast semi open plan kitchen/dining room, providing access to a further patio and featuring a part double height ceiling. There is also a further double bedroom on this level featuring a walk in wardrobe, as well as another bathroom. This is a special property that must be viewed to be appreciated. This property occupies a prominent position in the heart of De Beauvoir, set back within a secure and quiet gated mews, moments form the delights of the locally renowned De Beauvoir deli. The Regents Canal provides some wonderful walks along towards both Angel & London Fields. The closest station is Haggerston forming part of the London Overground network, whilst a plethora of shops, bars and restaurants can be found locally. For those wishing to travel by bus, Kingsland Road and Southgate Road provide a number of good routes, with the delights of vibrant, trendy Hoxton and Shoreditch just a short journey away as are London Fields and Broadway Market.

detailedDescription:
Located just moments from St Paul's Cathedral is this fantastic refurbished and well presented two bedroom apartment on the raised ground floor of a highly sought-after building called milton house in little britain. This property includes a new high specification re fitted kitchen, re fitted bathroom and re fitted shower room. detailedDescription:
Postmark marks one of the most unique, central London developments where the energetic, eclectic East meets the traditional, prestigious West.

Location

Sitting across two postcodes, WC1 and EC1, and surrounded by Farringdon, Clerkenwell, King's Cross and Chancery Lane, Postmark is at the epicentre of the leading creative, technology and knowledge industries and will be a symbol of connectivity.

Description

Delivering an inspiring new neighbourhood to the heart of London and built on the foundations of a global British icon, Postmark will bring new life to the historic flagship site of the Royal Mail postal service.

Signature Place, the second phase of this iconic development will comprise of 109 one, two and three bed apartments designed by acclaimed interior architects Conran + Partners. Residents will benefit from a gym, wellness centre with 18m swimming pool. 24-hour concierge service, private lounge, rooftop terrace and a beautifully landscaped courtyard situated in the centre of the development.

Square Footage: 914 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 996 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Set on a peaceful road close to Canonbury station is this delightful two bedroom split-level apartment that occupies the top two floors of a handsome period conversion. This beautifully presented property has been lovingly maintained in a manner that accentuates its original period charm whilst blending in a smart modern style, there are fantastic levels of natural light throughout due to its elevation. On the second floor is a bright and airy 18’10 x 14’3 reception room with two wooden sash window and a separate contemporary eat-in kitchen that overlooks gardens to the rear, off the hallway is a smart modern bathroom. Upstairs (third floor) are two spacious double bedrooms, the larger one has lots of built-in wardrobe space as well as eaves storage.

Situation
Beresford Road is an attractive residential street just off Petherton Road in Canonbury. At the end of the road is Newington Green with all of its wonderful deli's and eateries, if you want more choice Upper Street is just moments away which offers not only eating and drinking but also boutiques, cinemas and theatres. Transport links can be found at Canonbury station (Overground), Highbury & Islington (Victoria line, Overground) and Angel (Northern line). Numerous bus links are available in to The City and West End.

address: Carleton Road, Tufnell Park, London N7
detailedDescription:
A stunning two bedroom apartment, elegantly presented and beautifully designed with contemporary colour palette and great attention to detail. This superb property benefits from grand proportions, spacious light filled rooms and exceptionally high ceilings as well as a share of the freehold and mature communal garden.

The property is in very good order throughout with a recently refreshed kitchen and newly refurbished bathroom, both with high specification fittings. The sitting room has a lovely open aspect and is orientated to receive sunshine in the afternoon whilst the main bedroom is sunny and light filled and benefits from built in wardrobes. The building has a large communal garden, mature and well cared for with potting shed, greenhouse and pond with fountain.

The apartment has an enviable location close to the amenities of Tufnell Park with its array of small independent shops and cafes. Kentish Town is also within easy reach as are the open spaces of Hampstead Heath. Transport links are also excellent with Tufnell Park and Kentish Town Stations within a short walk and a number of bus routes on your doorstep whilst there are a number of well regarded schools nearby.

address: 5 Stapleton Hall Road, Stroud Green N4
detailedDescription:
Well presented two double bedroom flat with gated allocated off-road parking, situated within an attractive Grade II listed Queen Anne style building, set back from the road and laid out around beautifully maintained courtyard style gardens. The property provides light and spacious accommodation, well appointed throughout, including a large reception room, separate metro-tiled kitchen and modern bathroom. Further features include gas central heating, original sash windows, recessed lighting, attractive oak flooring, bicycle storage, and share of the freehold.

Accommodation comprises entrance lobby with security entry phone, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with dual front aspect sash windows and plenty of space for both relaxing and dining. A doorway leads through to the separate kitchen area with sash window to the side and comprising a full range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset stainless steel sink unit, 4 ring gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well proportioned double bedrooms, both with quiet rear aspect and one with inbuilt wardrobe, plus a modern family bathroom with white three piece suite and power shower over the bath.

The property is conveniently located within a short distance of Stroud Green boasting an array of shops, bars and restaurants. Crouch Hill and Finsbury Park stations are close-by, offering excellent overground and underground connections into the City and West End, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing fast and frequent cross-London connections. The lovely open spaces of Finsbury Park itself are also within easy reach in this superb central location.

Stunning newly refurbished two bedroom ground floor flat set within a small purpose built block in a highly sought after Islington location with off-street parking space available, just moments from Caledonian Road station. Boasting a delightful wall enclosed west-facing private garden, and additional separate south-facing private patio area, the property provides bright and modern, open plan accommodation with stylish interiors throughout. Features include an impressive triple aspect reception room with skylight window and bi-folding doors onto the garden, well equipped kitchen area, elegant shower room, double glazing, wood effect flooring, and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises a wide entrance hallway with inbuilt storage and sliding doors onto the patio area, flowing through into the bright and spacious, open plan triple aspect reception/kitchen, flooded with natural light from the skylight, windows and bi-folding doors which open onto the wall enclosed wrap-around garden. The room provides a superb space for both relaxing and dining, connecting with the kitchen area with the option of closing off with the in-wall pocket door for privacy. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized interconnecting bedrooms - one with a large inbuilt wardrobe - plus a stylish shower room with modern walk-in shower suite and elegant tiling.

detailedDescription:
Stunning three bedroom period conversion flat with roof terrace and own section of garden, enviably located close to excellent transport links and fashionable amenities. The property, set within the top floors of an attractive Victorian terrace, boasts bright and spacious accommodation laid out over two floors, with period appeal further enhanced by stylish interiors and high quality finish throughout. Features include an inviting open plan reception/fitted kitchen, two bathrooms, gas central heating, sash windows, high quality walnut flooring and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises a wide entrance hallway with stairs rising to the upper level, and direct access out onto a wonderful West facing private terrace with impressive unobstructed views over green surroundings. The hallway leads into a bright and spacious open plan reception/kitchen, with cast iron feature fireplace, bespoke inbuilt shelving/storage and ample space for relaxing, entertaining and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating a ceramic sink, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. A generously sized double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe and a modern family bathroom with white three-piece suite completes the lower level accommodation. To the upper floor, there are a further two well sized double bedrooms, including a master with dual Velux windows, and access to plentiful eaves storage space. A stylish additional bathroom with free-standing roll top bath suite, heated towel rail and separate walk-in rainfall shower cubicle completes the accommodation.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

A cleverly designed spiral staircase takes you up into a larger than average eat in kitchen with ample worktop space and storage while both bedrooms can be found on separate levels, one with built in wardrobes and en-suite. The property is completed with a modern family bathroom and is offered to the market on a chain free basis.
Vale Row, Gillespie Road is perfectly located for a selection of fantastic transport links as well as an excellent selection of local shops. Godfrey's butchers, Bournes Fishmongers, La Fromagerie and Da Mario's deli are amongst a selection of sought-after shops at the nearby Highbury Barn whilst numerous cafes and restaurants are found on Highbury Park and Blackstock road. The property is in clear view of the sought-after Gillespie School and is close to many other great primary schools. Clissold Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields are all within easy reach and offer wonderfully green outdoor spaces in an incredibly central location.
Transport links are well serviced with Arsenal underground station (Piccadilly line) and Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and East London lines), Finsbury Park and Drayton Park stations are also a short distance away, along with Canonbury overground station. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Residing along one of Finsbury Park’s most desirable tree lined streets is this two double bedroom home. Discover high ceilings and deep bays, sitting pretty across the first floor of a beautiful terracotta brick Victorian conversion.

Classic checkerboard walkway welcomes you inside, where rich wood flooring and fresh white walls proliferate. A deep bay fronted reception room awaits to the front of the apartment, with space for both lounge furniture and office areas if desired. Recessed spot lighting illuminates two inbuilt shelving alcoves, each framing a thick wooden fireplace surround.

Next door you’ll find the first bedroom, hosting views across neighbouring rooftops and enough space for your double bed, wardrobe and perhaps a study area should you wish. Through the hallway, the cream and wooden kitchen resides towards the rear of the property. A multitude of space saving solutions reside here, including a solid wood foldable worktop, inbuilt spice racks and floating kitchen towel holder surround a wealth of cabinetry and contemporary appliances.

Your bathroom sits adjacent, with double glazed windows spilling light over the contemporary rectangular washbasin, mirrored wall cabinet and two shower heads over the full sized bathtub. Last but not least your second double bedroom awaits next door, in neutral shades and wooden floors, providing more treetop views from the original sash window.

Stapleton Hall Road is an attractive, long and winding street full of Victorian and Edwardian buildings. The area is in close proximity to Finsbury Park tube station which is serviced by the Victoria, Piccadilly and National Rail lines. Local primary and secondary schools have both been rated as good with many outstanding features in the most recent Ofsted reports. For more information on the local area, check out our Neighbourhood Guides.

A super first floor flat in a desirable convenient location.

Location

Bus routes provide easy access into the City and West End whilst Canonbury Station (London Overground) is approximately 0.2 miles away.

Description

A most attractive flat on the first floor of the classic late Victorian town house. The accommodation is both light and airy and being on the first floor enjoys particularly high ceilings and large sash windows. The current owner has maintained the apartment to a high standard with care and attention to detail. There are fine fixtures and fittings throughout. The bedroom is at the rear of the building and is very quiet. The entrance hall is a good size with the mid bathroom off it, which contains a full-size bath with strong power shower. The open plan living space is at the front of the building and is very light throughout the day. The fitted kitchen is cleverly built-in on the side wall leaving a really useful space for a work station. The discreet colour changing spot-lights can be set by remote control, lighting up the walls in an array of atmospheric and relaxing colours. For cyclists you have sole use of the bike pulley in the entrance hallway, for your easy access to cycle.

Altogether a very appealing flat in a convenient and desirable location.

Square Footage: 333 sq ft

address: Widford Court, Brownswood Road, Finsbury Park N4
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?
It's a gorgeous layout with so much room and unusual amount of storage space. We fell in love when we walked in, every room was flooded with light even on the greyest day, thanks to the floor to ceiling windows in every room. The flat is fitted with high spec appliances (smeg and Blanco) and very well kitted out, including air filtration system, digital meter to track heating bills and the fasted broadband we've had - fibre to premise BT. With only 8 flats in our block we know our neighbours very well and its a close knit community.

Why are you moving?
Our family is growing with a dog and an under 1 year old baby. With both sides of the family living abroad we are looking to upgrade to a 3-4 bedroom to be able to have our families over.

What do you love about the area?
We live right bang in the middle of a vibrant community. It especially became clear to us during the pandemic, where even the wider community knows each other on a first name basis. There are amazing local businesses sprinkled on Church Street and Blackstock road. Our favourite coffee shops are Finks and Hourglass just 2 minutes away, Clarence Tavern and Bank of Friendship have beautiful beer gardens. We are spoilt for choice whether it's Spence Bakery for their delicious egg cress n mayo, Good Egg for brunch or the numerous boutique shops like Search n Rescue, Gathering Moss, Ollie Loves Alfie etc for those Sunday strolls. Clissold Park is the best! Dog and kid friendly with loads of stuff to do for adults too! We love the brand new tennis courts and spend quite a few weekends there, they even have deer and goats. The water reservoir and the adjacent nature reserve is a 5 minute walk as well.

Property Details:
Boasting fantastic modern style living space, beautifully appointed with floor-to-ceiling triple glazed windows and finished to a high specification throughout, this beautiful property offers ready-to-move-into accommodation in a fantastic central location. Accommodation comprises entrance hall with plentiful inbuilt storage and attractive wood effect flooring (evident through much of the property), leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen with ample space for both relaxing and dining, and direct access onto a delightful covered private balcony. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white high gloss wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, wall mounted electric oven, and further integrated appliances (smeg and Blanco). There are two well sized double bedrooms, with a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling enjoying 'Jack and Jill' access via both the master bedroom and the hallway.

The property is very conveniently located close to beautiful Clissold Park, and within easy reach of Finsbury Park, Arsenal, Manor Park, Canonbury and Highbury & Islington stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes linking the surrounding area. There are also an array of fashionable local amenities, shops, bars and restaurants within just a short distance, with Church Street also close by.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Set within the highly sought-after Roof Gardens development is this fabulously spacious two double bedroom flat.

Originally serving as a textiles and clothing warehouse the building was converted into apartments in the late 90’s. The building offers communal roof gardens giving inspiration to the name of the conversion.

The flat comprises a fantastic open-plan reception space ideal for entertaining. The kitchen with its fully integrated appliances, double wine coolers, and falcon double oven is perfect for those who enjoy cooking when they tire of the plethora of restaurants and gastropubs Clerkenwell has to offer. With wooden floors and an abundance of natural light from the large Crittal windows, the flat pays homage to its original warehouse roots. The master bedroom boasts a walk-in wardrobe, a stylish en-suite bathroom which has been fully tiled to create a walk-in wet room and a Juliet balcony overlooking the communal gardens. The second double bedroom is currently used as a study and also has an en-suite shower room. The flat further benefits from a separate WC in the entrance hallway.

The Roof Gardens are located equidistant from Barbican underground Station and Farringdon Station (0.3 miles) offering access to the Circle, Metropolitan and Hammersmith and City lines and National Rail services reaching Luton and Gatwick airport. It will also be home to the highly anticipated Elizabeth line providing speedy access to Heathrow Airport.

detailedDescription: Set within this quiet private development nestled neatly in the heart of Islington, this very well positioned 3/4 double bedroom freehold house benefits from a private patio garden & roof terrace. Lambs Mews occupies a central yet quiet position supremely close to Islington Green, moments from the hustle & bustle of Upper Street & Angel. It should be noted that the house has been lovingly refurbished & extended by the current owners with modern fittings & finishes throughout. Accommodation is arranged over 4 floors comprising 1 double bedroom with eaves storage on the top (3rd) floor. On the 2nd floor can be found the master bedroom with a range of built-in wardrobes to 1 wall, further double bedroom and main family bathroom. The 1st floor is home to the heart of the house a wonderful bright dual aspect open-plan kitchen/ dining/ reception/ family room with sliding patio door opening to the private terrace. The ground floor provides another good size double bedroom or as is currently being used as a 2nd reception room/ home office. Also on this is a further shower room ad separate utility room. To the rear and accessed via the ground floor reception/ bedroom is the private rear garden measuring 20ft by just under 15ft. Colebrooke Row affords superb access to an absolute wealth of local shops, bars and eateries, with particular note to those on Upper Street, Camden Passage and Exmouth Market. Angel Underground (Northern Line) provides convenient access to both the City and the transport hub that is Kings Cross/ St Pancras International with trains across London & to mainland Europe. Superb bus routes can be found on St John Street, Upper Street, Pentonville Road and City Road.

Beautiful Georgian house in the heart of the Angel Islington.

Location

Elia Street is in this sought after enclave of period properties around the Regents Canal. It's well placed for all the local amenities in Upper St and Camden Passage, including the many boutique shops and cafe's.

It is within close proximity of The Angel with excellent transport links into the City, West End and beyond.

Description

Set in a perfect Islington location this Georgian house is laid out over 4 storeys. On the 2 upper floors are the 3 double beds and single/cot room, shower room and very secluded South West facing terrace off the principal bedroom. On the half landing is the family bathroom. The double reception on the raised ground floor has original features of fireplace and marble surround plus window shutters to the front. There are the original dividing doors if you wish to use as two rooms. As you go down to the lower ground floor there is a wonderfully useful study and separate cloakroom on the half landing. The kitchen is to the front on the lower ground floor leading to the dining area and further sitting area/playroom to the rear. The rear garden is wonderfully secluded and peaceful with many mature plants and shrubs.

Square Footage: 1645 sq ft

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Accommodation comprises an entrance hall with inbuilt storage, access to fully insulated sound/storeroom, and wood flooring (evident through the majority of the property), leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing and entertaining. The separate kitchen, with space for small table and chairs, comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well-sized double bedrooms, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three-piece suite.

The property is very conveniently located in a popular residential road just off Caledonian Road, within a short walk of Caledonian Road & Barnsbury and Caledonian Road stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Highbury & Islington station is also within a short walk. Caledonian Road offers an array of amenities, with nearby Upper Street offering further stylish shops, bars and restaurants.

Comments from the owner:

Top three things we love about this flat…
• The location is ideal. We are both continually in and out of town for last minute jobs and meetings and the transport links from here are superb. We have the overground next door, plenty of buses at the end of the road. It's an 8-minute walk to Cale underground, and about 12/15 minutes to Highbury and Islington. Granary Square has been a revelation - such a beautiful area to enjoy. With the fantastic restaurants, boutique stores, and The Everyman Cinemas it's become a much frequented and special place for us. It's great for the kids, with the fountains running throughout the summer. We have the classy stores and bars of Upper Street just a stone's throw in the other direction and I can vouch for the quality of the nearby fantastic gastro pubs; The Albion, The Drapers and The Crown to name a few.

• The quiet! Yes! My home is my sanctuary. Being on the top floor obviously means no footsteps overhead. It is a very sociable flat, - and we've had some great evenings in our big kitchen/ dining/ living space but, I really wouldn't have lasted this long in a block if my peace had ever been lastingly disturbed. You can come anytime of the day or evening, and you'll hear no loud music in the building, no party people. As far as outside is concerned, the speedbumps rooted out any speed freaks along Wheelwright St, and, besides, the double glazing throughout the flat does a marvellous job closing off any traffic noise and makes our home a really cosy peaceful place. Yes, we have the prison view one side, but all our living is done in our front rooms that overlook the courtyard, and the view is long out of our huge window and lovely to look out on from our swing chair of a morning. When I walked in here in 2007, I never believed it would be thirteen years before I thought of leaving. I've shared the space with flatmates, and i've lived on my own here for several years, feeling entirely secure. And ultimately it has become our family home.

• The layout has been perfect for us. It is certainly not a pokey flat. The rooms are a good size, and it's very bright and spacious. Great for entertaining. I'm most proud of our beautiful new kitchen and I put a lot of thought into the planning of that space to ensure everything was at my fingertips. The storage is great in the cabinets, which are not too high! The little coffee bar is one of my favourite spots to perch, and it's useful having the extra bit of storage on that side of the kitchen. I also knocked through the bathroom and created a lovely internal private space away from the living area. And i've recorded plenty of professional voiceovers during lockdown from my little studio I created in what used to be a storage room - completely soundproofed and tranquil.

What we love about the area:
Right on our doorstep is the renowned café; Sunday, for which there is always a queue around the block on weekends. We love strolling over there and getting our little sunspot at the front on weekday mornings. Amazing food - People travel from far and wide for that place. And, if the queue is long, Southpaw is a great new addition on Roman Way - lovely people who also serve a proper coffee. Plus, a little sneaky Thai Corner in the fabulous Irish boozer, The Hemingford is not to be sniffed at.

Why are we selling?
We simply feel we've outgrown the place. We are a growing family and feel the time has come for a total change of scenery and we're heading out of town. It's a tough decision because we can honestly say we have been extremely happy here and will be very sad to leave.

What is the parking like?
There are parking bays available in The Close. My car is directly opposite the back gate. Very useful and not expensive. There are also two guest spots available, and you can get your free permit from Islington Council.

We're currently working from home; how does that work in the flat?
I'm a voiceover artist and have been professionally recording throughout lockdown.
Recording for TV requires a high-speed, very secure broadband and i've been able to keep a steady workload with no problems. We signed up for PlusNet and it's been great.

What's the boiler like?
We have a Valiant combi boiler that is two years old. We only ever switch on the heating in the winter, and then, only to wake up to, and at our children's bath time. The heating is fantastically efficient and the water pressure perfect. They pumped a whole lot of insulation into the building about five years ago, and it is always warm inside our flat.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This light-filled five-bedroom Victorian townhouse is positioned on Huntingdon Street, a quiet, tree-lined street in the Barnsbury Conservation Area. Extending to almost 2,600 sq ft internally and unfolding over five lovely storeys, the house is a wonderful combination of clean-lined contemporary spaces juxtaposed with lively, colourful interiors. The private garden has a gate that opens straight onto the hidden delights of Barnsbury Wood, while Huntingdon Street itself is just minutes from the manicured green space of Thornhill Square Gardens.

Setting the Scene

Built c.1850, this house sits in the middle of a handsome terrace that backs onto the leafy Barnsbury Wood; a nature reserve only open to the public for two hours each week, which brims with bluebells in the early spring. As a result, every room at the rear of the house has wonderful views over a canopy of trees. The house also has a lovely walled garden of its own, accessed via an expanse of folding glazing. Over the years, the current owners have filled the house with colour, from the hand-painted wallpaper in the living room to the incredible leaf-patterned walls in the study.

The Grand Tour

The house is set back from Huntingdon Street behind cast-iron railings, with external steps leading to the front entrance at raised ground level. The front door opens into a beautifully light hallway, where wooden floorboards run underfoot.

To the immediate right of the entrance hall is the double living room. High ceilings create a wonderful sense of space and volume, while large windows at each end invite a soft light in. One side of the room is green-and-white striped, with wonderful ornate bookcases and a decorative arch that curves over the windows at the end of the room. The other side is lined with hand-painted dark blue wallpaper, which lends it an intimate atmosphere. Both rooms have fireplaces as their focal points. There is also a guest WC on this floor.

Downstairs lies an open-plan kitchen and dining room. Here, a softer palette of colours and materials has been used to create a wonderfully calm aesthetic. In the kitchen, white cabinetry has been set against a grey-tiled splashback and a grey floor, while a wall of windows frames views of the garden.

An impressive Victorian staircase leads from the ground floor up to the main bedroom, a bright, airy space with two tall sash windows that bathe the room in light. Ornate cornicing crowns the room, which is clad in soft yellow wallpaper that has been hand-painted with branches and birds. A mirrored walk-in wardrobe leads through to an en suite bathroom, where French doors open onto a south-facing balcony that overlooks the woods. This is a real suntrap and a brilliantly peaceful spot for a morning coffee.

On the second floor is another generous double bedroom, plus a separate bedroom that is currently used as a study. It is a quiet room with the same green, leafy views. The top floor is home to two further double bedrooms, each with white-painted narrow wooden floorboards and a fireplace. A shower room lies between the bedrooms.

The Great Outdoors

The south-facing walled garden is the perfect spot for summer lunches. It has a water feature to one side and is framed by mature plants that provide shade and privacy. A hidden door leads straight into Barnsbury Wood, which is home to a range of wildlife including the long-tailed tit, the common toad and the 16 spot ladybird.

Out and About

The neighbourhood is renowned for its peaceful green squares and charming, tree-lined Georgian and Victorian terraces. Nearby Upper Street offers a wealth of retail, culinary and design amenities and restaurants including Ottolenghi, Gail’s, Le Creuset, Space nk and twentytwentyone, as well as a host of national and independent retailers such as apc and Le Labo. There are several weekend food markets within walking distance for fresh independent produce, and a number of excellent health food shops on Caledonian Road. Coal Drops Yard is also easily reached along the picturesque canal path, which is a five-minute walk away. There is a Montessori Nursery located in St Andrew’s church on Thornhill Crescent.

The Underground is available at Highbury & Islington (Victoria Line) and Caledonian Road (Piccadilly Line), and Overground services can be found at Caledonian Road & Barnsbury, providing quick access to the City and the West End. The Eurostar at Kings Cross is also easily accessible.

detailedDescription:
A spacious and bright top floor period conversion, located very close to Newington Green, N16. This split level property offers a well arranged open plan kitchen reception, good sized double bedroom, modern shower room and exclusive access and use of a loft storage space, not to mention the use of a charming communal roof terrace at the rear. The largest internal space of three residential flats in this building, not to mention the great storage space in the loft, makes this unit a very special find.

Green Lanes is located just moments from the vibrant shops, bars and restaurants of Stoke Newington and the local eateries of Newington Green, with beautiful Clissold Park on your doorstep. There are excellent transport links with Canonbury Station (National Rail) within walking distance and an abundance of buses servicing the city and central London.

What the seller says:
I have enjoyed living in my flat in Green Lanes. The flat itself is modern and bright. From the front windows you can see the city of London, which looks great at night and you can also see the beam of light from the arsenal stadium. Being on the third floor, it is private and quiet. My neighbours in the building are friendly. We have a group chat to resolve any problems. As part of the service charge, the shared stairs and landings are cleaned weekly.

The local area has a young and urban feel to it, being close to Islington and central London. The number 73 bus takes about 20 - 30 minutes to Oxford Street. Newington Green itself is lively with many interesting retail shops, restaurants, and pubs. There are also many wonderful Turkish takeaways and 24-hour shops for convivence. Clissold park and the local leisure centre are 5 minutes away, following onto Church Street with all its many attractions. I have really enjoyed living in the flat and the local area. I feel lucky to have been there.

A beautiful two bedroom upper maisonette with a terrace arranged over the first and second floors of an attractive early Victorian building on this popular residential street in the heart of central Islington.

Offering almost 1,100 sq ft of well presented accommodation, the property is light and airy throughout and features a superb first floor reception room with tall ceilings, two large sash windows which flood the room with natural light and ample room to sit and eat. To the rear and separated from the reception room by double doors is a smart contemporary kitchen.

There are two generous bedrooms on the top floor, the master with an en-suite shower room and both with fitted storage. There is a further, family bathroom at the top of the house.

To the rear of the property is a small terrace with wonderful views across neighbouring gardens.

St Peter's Street runs from Essex Road to Wharf Road where it meets the Regent's canal and is conveniently located for all the amenities of central Islington.

The nearest Underground station can be found at Angel (Northern line - 0.5 miles) which provides quick and easy access to the City via Bank and to King's Cross/St Pancras for high speed rail connections to Europe.

Both Upper Street and Essex Road provide excellent bus routes to the City, the West End and beyond.

detailedDescription:
A stylish and chic one double bedroom garden flat on sought-after Highbury Hill, in the heart of Highbury.

Located on the first floor of an imposing Victorian building on a sought after street a short distance from Highbury Barn. Comprising a very bright and spacious double bedroom, with high ceilings and period features overlooking the gardens.

An added bonus of an additional room, has worked perfectly as both a home office and guest bedroom for the vendors. Their keen eye for interior design is subtly promoted throughout the property and there is plenty of storage.

The bathroom is a sleek, tiled suite at the centre of the home. The living room is welcoming and bright with views to the front. The kitchen is separate and features white low level storage cupboards and is finished off by a black granite worktop, which perfectly compliment the wooden flooring. The garden is modern & landscaped, and in addition to the Astroturf grass, attractive herbaceous borders feature an array of exotic trees and shrubs.

The location in the heart of sought-after Highbury; an intimate environment nestled between Islington and Stoke Newington, is both well connected and discreet. Arsenal, Drayton Park, and Highbury and Islington stations, are within a short walking distance. Access to the City is straightforward; four stops from Moorgate and two stops from Kings Cross as well as the ease of using any of the wealth of bus and cycling routes in and out of town.

Clissold Park and Highbury Fields are also a stone’s throw from the property for those occupants who enjoy proximity to London’s vast green spaces to compliment a straightforward commute to work.

Highbury’s boutiques, greengrocers, restaurants and cafes are close by and its population help create stability in an environment which is well-loved by young and mature professional people alike, and a neighbourly atmosphere promotes a welcoming, warm, and safe part of London.

address: Horsell Road, Highbury, Islington, London N5
detailedDescription: A substantial bay fronted Victorian end of terrace house set within the popular enclave to the West of Highbury Fields, affording superb access to Highbury Corner along with the amenities of Upper Street & Holloway Road. The house provides an absolute wealth of flexible accommodation arranged predominantly over 3 floors with a useful cellar and a good size loft. Accommodation comprises through reception room encompassing the beautiful bay window, exposed floor boards and ornate ceiling cornice. Steps lead down from both the entrance hall & the reception room in to the spacious kitchen/ dining/ family room with a large walk-in pantry, guest WC and access out to the private patio garden. On the 1st floor can be found the beautiful & impressive master bedroom stretching the full width of the house incorporating the bay window and with an en-suite shower room. Also on the 1st floor are the main family bathroom, storage room and bedroom/ study with access out to the private roof terrace. The 2nd floor is home to 3 further double bedrooms with access to the loft. Extra space can be found in the cellar an ideal area for storage. Horsell Road is superbly placed for almost immediate access to the greenery of Highbury Fields whilst Highbury Corner and the transportation hub of Highbury and Islington (Victoria Line and North London Line) are also within close walking distance. The localised delights of Westerns Laundry & Le Peche Mignon offer superb dining & deli.

detailedDescription:
This exceptional four bedroom house has been beautifully renovated to a fantastic standard and sympathetically combines tasteful contemporary design alongside traditional Victorian features. The ground level offers a truly wonderful double reception room whilst a stunning contemporary kitchen is located to the rear. The dining area is flooded in natural light through a large south facing window and offers views over the sizable private garden through double doors. The garden has been perfectly designed to include an immediate decked area outside the kitchen and further terrace at the far end and has been thoughtfully planted to include apple tree, pear tree and grape vine.
Four bedrooms feature over the upper levels with master suite including walk in wardrobe and luxurious bathroom spanning across the entire first floor. A further bedroom alongside handy WC features on the half landing as well as access to a private roof terrace.
The upper level offers a further two double bedrooms and family sized contemporary bathroom.
Lots of storage is provided in the basement, second floor and attic space which provides further scope for extension subject to necessary planning consent.

Ambler Road is a tree-lined street in the Blackstock triangle which is renowned for its neighbourly feel whilst being located within the catchment area for a number of highly regarded local schools.
The house is perfectly situated for an array of local amenities including independent shops, restaurants and coffee shops as well as being in easy reach of three local parks and Gillespie Nature Reserve. Upper Street is only a short distance away and transport links are some of the best around with Arsenal station providing the Piccadilly line and Finsbury Park offering overground services (including the Thameslink network serving the City and Gatwick Airport) alongside direct links to Moorgate as well as underground services on the Victoria line. Numerous bus routes offer effortless transport to the City and West End whilst international links are facilitated from St Pancras.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
In a unique Georgian conversion, you’ll find this striking two double bedroom home with magical private garden and conservatory. Bursting with inspired design and bespoke character, in the heart of popular Stroud Green.

From the bright white facade to a driveway hosting space for two cars, you’re welcomed into this alluring two bedroom home. In the large hallway, tall ceilings and mirrored walls create the feeling of even more space.

Your kitchen greets you to the left, with marble worktops encasing all contemporary fixtures, deep Butler sink and a wealth of cream cabinetry lit by panelled windows providing views out to tree lined Tollington Park.

Adjacent sits the reception room with cornicing and a ceiling rose and space for a three piece suite. From here you’ll discover the bespoke, under heated marble floor conservatory, inspired by an award winning design with plenty of space for dining / entertaining and admiring the view.

Gorgeous green framed window panels beckon you out towards your private garden, flush with magical greenery. Here awaits a mix of tree lined patio, fresh lawn and beautiful flowers leading you through this magical space.

Back inside, marble panelling leads you towards the charming wooden staircase. Below the kitchen resides a utility room with sink, providing an abundance of extra storage options. A covetable marble wet room sits opposite, with WC, bidet, mirrored walls and chic blue lighting.

Once upstairs you’ll find each of the two double bedrooms boasting panelled windows, wooden flooring and tall ceilings with original cornicing. A converted bathroom / wet room sits between, with attractive stained glass window.

Upper Tollington Park is within walking distance of Finsbury Park station (Zone 2) and Crouch Hill Station, with excellent transport links into the city and East London on your doorstep. As for local amenities, you are enviably close to the foodie strip of Stroud Green Road.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Element Properties & Co are proud to present this stunning, ground floor apartment set in the heart of Islington. Boasting over 637 sq ft (59 sqm) of lateral space, the property is comprised of a large double bedroom with a walk in wardrobe, a separate kitchen, a large reception/dining area, a tidy bathroom and a private garden/terrace. Additional benefits include having access in to a wider communal garden directly from the properties private garden and also an abundance of storage spaces throughout.

Ideally situated, the apartment is set away in a gated, chic and quiet development. Located only 0.5 miles from Upper Holloway (London Overground), 0.8 miles from Holloway Road Station (Piccadilly Line) and 0.8 miles from Archway Station (Northern Line); three key transport lines with access all around London can be found within a 10-15 minute walk.

The apartment is offered as a leasehold with circa 106 years remaining. Service charge and ground rent are £2160 per annum and £450 per annum respectively - hot water is included within the service charge.

The owners note:

We have loved living in our home allowing us to host great dinner parties, summer BBQs with a sunny outdoor space.

The local area provides fantastic cafes, restaurants and bars we have regularly visited.

We also have 3 large supermarkets nearby to do our shopping easily.

Whittington park is also a 5 minute walk away offering a tranquil place to relax with the Royal Northern Gardens a stone's throw away.

The location is great and we can reach central London in under 30 minutes to explore all the city has to offer with a short commute to work.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A generous, one double bedroom, period conversion situated on the ground floor moment from the tube in Highbury, N5. Set across two levels and standing at 728 sqft, the property offers a unique layout with a huge amount of potential for any buyer to create their dream flat. Accommodation currently consists of a well-proportioned living room towards the front of the house, a large eat in kitchen with ample worktop space and storage, which then leads out into a stunning, east facing private garden. The good-sized double bedroom overlooks the peaceful garden, while a 249 sqft basement offers significant storage space at present.
This beautiful apartment is nearby to the ever-popular Highbury Barn, boasting an array of award-winning food shops and the ever-popular Highbury Barn gastro pub, but it is also superbly connected, with Arsenal Station (Piccadilly line), Holloway Road Station (Piccadilly line) and Drayton Park Station (Great Northern Trains to Moorgate) being a very short distance away. Highbury and Islington Station (Victoria Line and Overground) and the on-trend shops and restaurants on Upper Street are also nearby, as are the green open spaces of Highbury Fields.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: A bright and spacious 2 double bedroom flat set on the sixth floor of this popular and highly regarded modern development. The property provides good size accommodation with a master bedroom with en-suite bathroom and fitted wardrobes, double second bedroom, main shower room and a spacious open-plan kitchen/ reception room. The apartment benefits from a South facing balcony, with access via both bedrooms and affording superb views of the London skyline. The development comes with use of a communal gymnasium, a cinema room, saunas and a 24 hour concierge. Situated towards the Southern end of Southgate Road, moments from the canal and the greenery of Shoreditch Park & Rosemary Gardens, with the convenience of a Tesco's local on Southgate Road itself. Haggerston station along with the Underground at Old Street and the bus routes of New North Road provide superb transport links across London.

detailedDescription:
An amazing top floor, two bedroom apartment with a south facing outside area (not demised to the property) approx 730 sq.ft

This top floor duplex must be seen.

On entering the property there are two small cupboards housing the combi boiler and fuse box and space for storage.

The kitchen has a good selection of white cabinets, a black granite worktop, Neff four ring gas hob, fan oven, Bosch washing machine, small dishwasher and window overlooking Bridgewater Square. The reception room is light and bright with two windows overlooking the square and a large storage cupboard.

Stairs lead up to the bedrooms with a window at the top to let in light, the master bedroom has a large full height door which leads to the fire escape and a fitted cupboard, there is an en-suite shower room with fully tiled walls and flooring, wash basin, heated towel rail and wc.

Bedroom two has a fitted cupboard and shelving, with a window and door to the south aspect, a separate bathroom has a full sized bath, shower attachment with screen, wc, basin and fully tiled walls and flooring.

Residents benefit from many local amenities including a Waitrose Supermarket, a Virgin Active Gym, Fortune Street park and transport links from Barbican, Moorgate and Farringdon which will be open to the new Crossrail line in 2021.

An on-site concierge is available Monday to Friday.
A short walk away (0.3 miles) is Moorgate with a Marks and Spencer food and clothing store, the 5* Star South Place Hotel with its rooftop terrace and restaurants and a short walk (0.7) to Liverpool Street Station.

A good selection of bars and restaurants can be found in both Clerkenwell and Shoreditch which are a short walk away.<br /><br />

For the outdoor enthusiast there are a number of sporting options nearby with Finsbury Park, Clissold Park and Highbury Fields offering wonderful spaces for recreation, and Gillespie Nature reserve and the Parkland walk for a leisurely stroll. detailedDescription:
** viewings to commence Saturday 3rd July **

Appealing two/three bedroom Victorian terraced property with attractive part-walled south-east facing private garden, superbly situated in a sought after residential Islington location. The property would benefit from a programme of refurbishment, but offers bright and spacious accommodation with enormous character appeal and potential. Features include a double length dual aspect reception room with two fireplaces, further versatile lower level reception/third bedroom, well equipped eat-in kitchen/diner, sunny conservatory, top floor family bathroom, guest WC, gas central heating and original style sash windows.

Accommodation comprises entrance on the ground floor into a hallway leading into the bright and spacious double length reception room with attractive bay window to front and two feature fireplaces (including working gas fire). The ground floor further accommodates a useful rear aspect office/study which could also be converted into an additional bathroom. To the lower level, also accessible via a separate porch to the front, there is a versatile additional reception room/third bedroom with feature exposed brick fireplace and bay to front. A separate kitchen/diner, with space for table and chairs, comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances. An inner lobby provides access to a sunny conservatory and a guest WC. To the split upper floors, there are two well proportioned double bedrooms, plus a family bathroom with modern white three piece suite. Externally, the property enjoys a delightful part wall-enclosed garden, with raised beds, landscaped patio area and shed to rear.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of stations at Upper Holloway, Finsbury Park and Crouch Hill, as well as regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. Holloway Road is within a short walk, offering an array of shops, cafes and restaurants, with the open spaces of beautiful Finsbury Park itself also within easy reach.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Residing on a residential street and 0.7 miles from Finsbury Park Station, you’ll find a contemporary two double bedroom garden flat.

Bay fronted sash windows extend to the corniced ceiling of the bright white living room, providing this room with natural light. Engineered wooden flooring spans the entire room with built-in floating shelving, a fireplace and window shutters all add to the appeal. Smart monochromatic design and handleless cabinetry creates an uncluttered visual aesthetic in the kitchen area, accompanied by cleverly concealed utilities, expertly integrated appliances and an elegant undermount washbasin. Further features of brilliant white walls, engineered flooring and wood-framed sash windows can be found in the two double bedrooms. Exquisite marble effect tiles surround the entirety of the bathroom, which has been fitted with a heated towel rail, floating contemporary washbasin and a full-sized bathtub. Arguably the best feature of this property is the private rear garden, which has been well designed to offer a small lawn and sizeable patio for those summer BBQ's.

Located 0.2 miles from Stroud Green Road, there’s a tremendous amount of local gems sitting right at your doorstep. Pizzeria Pappagone might be one of the first places you spot, dishing up authentic Italian food (we’d recommend the Pizza San Danielle). In a cosy little turning down the street you’ll spy N4 Coffee Fruit, serving brilliant flat whites and breakfast brioche buns that are hard to beat. Towards Crouch Hill, The Old Dairy serves up a scrumptious Sunday roast under glass-vaulted ceilings and dairy-themed murals.

detailedDescription:
Full description This charming, light and airy apartment is offered with no onward chain, in the popular Brownswood conservation area of Finsbury Park. The property has undergone a full renovation to a high standard, which has just been completed. Arranged laterally, the private front door opens onto an entrance hall offering access to all rooms. There is a large, square reception room with fireplace and a good sized kitchen diner which has access to the garden at the rear of the property. Two double bedrooms and bathroom complete the accommodation which is practically laid out and beautifully presented.

Situation and tenure Queens Drive runs parallel to Blackstock Road, and offers fantastic access to a range of transport links and amenities whilst boasting peace and tranquillity. Finsbury Park transport hub is a short walk away, and has Victoria, Piccadilly and Overground lines on offer. The great thing about this precise location is that the shops, restaurants and amenities of Stoke Newington are all very easily accessible via beautiful Clissold Park, while Highbury Fields and the shops and restaurants in Highbury Barn are only a short walk away, equally jumping on the tube from Finsbury Park or Arsenal is also straightforward. The Woodberry wetlands and reservoirs offer a range of water sports and wild swimming, and nearby Blighty Coffee, Salvation in Noodles, Farang and many more are perennial favourites of the local residents.
This dwelling enjoys a Share of the Freehold, and the upkeep and maintenance costs are split between the flats.

Accommodation comprises of a bright open plan living space with kitchen, dining and lounge area opening directly onto a generous private garden creating the perfect entertaining space. Both bedrooms are generous doubles and benefit from floor to ceiling windows, while the bedroom includes an en-suite and built in storage. The property is completed with a family bathroom, an underground car parking space and a wonderful 35ft wide private garden.

Highbury Stadium Square is located moments from Arsenal station and (Piccadilly line) Finsbury Park station which offers overground and underground services (Piccadilly & Victoria lines). Drayton Park over ground is also close by offering easy access to the City. Highbury Barn offers fantastic local shops including Godfrey's butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bourne's fishmongers and Highbury Vintners, all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield.

Superb 20th floor apartment with parking.

Location

Located on City Road, Chronicle Tower is perfectly positioned for those who want to be within easy reach of the City.

The development is also within walking distance of the shops, bars and restaurants that can be found in Angel, Hoxton, the City, Brick Lane and Clerkenwell. Directly beside the development is City Road Basin which links to the Regent's Canal waterway.

Located approximately 780 yards from Angel Tube Station and 850yards Old Street Tube Station.

Description

Superb one bedroom apartment with parking on the 20th floor of Chronicle Tower (previously referred to as Lexicon).

This incredible development is one of the area's most desirable buildings with state of the art facilities and striking views across the City.

The apartment is immaculately presented throughout and was built with a high specification including; comfort cooling, underfloor heating, electric blinds, video entry, hyperoptic broadband and Siemens appliances.

detailedDescription:
Stunning and rare to the market three bedroom period flat located on the entire first floor in a detached house on a sought after residential road.

The current owners has carefully restored the property throughout to emphasise all the outstanding period features.

The bay fronted reception room is one of the main draws to the property flooding the room with light and offering a natural area for a dining table making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

The separate kitchen is fully integrated with all your everyday brand mod cons further adding to the enjoyment of living within the property.

The property offers two good size double bedrooms and a further third master bedroom further benefiting from built in wardrobes.

The family bathroom is well proportioned and offers a separate shower and a full length bath and similar to the rest of the property is in excellent condition.

In the hallway there is a separate storage cupboard for your larger personal items.

There is access to a really good size shared garden that can be used all year round to unwind.

Location:

Neighbouring Barnsbury and Highbury and Islington makes it a vibrant place to live.

Caledonian Road has an array of everyday amenities, including several supermarkets, a gym and coffee shops.

Quick routes to Upper Street for more boutique shops and award-winning bars and restaurants, as well as the Angel Shopping Area and cinema.

Granary Square and the newly opened Coal Drops Yard are a short walk away along the Regent’s Canal and provides a wide range of great places to shop and dine.

Transport:

Caledonian Road Underground Station, on the Piccadilly Line, is a 5-minute walk with quick routes to Kings Cross, Central London, The West End and beyond.

Caledonian and Barnsbury Overground Station is on the North London Line that will take you to Stratford, Clapham Junction, and Richmond.

Ideal for young families and those looking to upsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
You’ll love the contemporary decor and fittings found within this bright and cheerful one bedroom apartment. Located across the ground floor of a private purpose built block, moments from a whole host of independent shops, delis and TimeOut recommended restaurants of nearby Stroud Green.

A fresh and inviting hallway welcomes you inside, with pale grey walls that sing against rich wood flooring. From here you are welcomed into the reception room to the rear of the property, lit beautifully via two windows. A deep blue accent wall pulls the room together, awash with vibrant colours and natural furnishings with room to lounge, dine and study should you wish.

Next door awaits the attractive separate kitchen, boasting sunny yellow floor tiles and chunky wooden worktops encompassing modern appliances. Swathes of cream cabinetry and shelving provide storage options aplenty, lit via the window and spot lighting above.

The warm toned bathroom sits adjacent, hosting floor to ceiling heated towel rail, full sized bath tub and overhead shower. A nice sized mirror and mirrored cabinet sit above the WC and sink, providing extra storage within and space for humidity loving hanging plants.

Your bedroom lies to the front of the abode, with more dark wood flooring and clean white walls with a calming pale mint wall reflected by the double mirrored wardrobe space. Make the space your own with cosy cushions and indoor plants to soak up the sun from your window.

This apartment is ideal for couples and singles alike, boasting a communal rear garden. Located on Tollington Park, you are less than a mile to Finsbury Park Station (accessible by the Victoria, Piccadilly and Overground lines). The friendly neighbourhood grows increasingly popular with young professionals and families due to it’s green spaces, excellent transport links, attractive residential streets and community feeling.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description Arranged laterally over the ground floor of this period conversion, this two bedroom apartment is offered for sale with vacant possession and no onward chain. The reception/ dining room and one of the bedrooms are currently to the front of the property, and are roughly equal sizes of just over 280 sq ft. To the rear, the kitchen overlooks the communal rear garden, and the bathroom and separate w/c are in the middle with the second bedroom also to the rear.

The rear garden is shared between the flats in the building and is a great size, affording plenty of space for the residents to enjoy separately. Rented for quite a few years, this flat would benefit from some cosmetic improvement but offers an extremely spacious dwelling at a competitive price.

Situation and tenure Drayton Park is a residential street in the heart of Highbury. Traditionally this has been a busy road but since the traffic calming measures have been implemented, the local residents speak of a huge drop off in congestion and vehicles passing by. Drayton Park station gives great access to the City, with trains reaching Moorgate in 10 minutes.

A pleasant walk across Highbury Fields leads to Highbury & Islington station which also has access to Overground, as well as Victoria line. There is a Tesco Express close to this home for day to day shopping, and two branches of Waitrose slightly further afield. There is also a bewildering array of eateries nearby - firm favourite Westerns Laundry for English and Spanish small plates with natural wines is on Drayton Park for fine dining; Zia Lucia frequently sees queues for charcoal pizza on Holloway Road.

At the top of adjacent Highbury Hill is Highbury Barn - the weekend is never complete without a shopping trip to Godfrey's butchers, La Fromagerie and Bourne's fishmongers

This property is held on a Leasehold with 215 years remaining
The service charge is £704.91 per annum and includes £10 per annum service charge

The second floor gives way to two-double bedrooms and stylish shower room. The property further benefits from wood flooring, column radiators throughout and oversized sash windows.

Situated in a very vibrant area of North London close to an extensive range of amenities along Junction Road, including organic food shops, bakeries and independent coffee shops. There is a further selection of eateries, bars and ice cream parlour along the road in both Highgate and Tufnell Park.

detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire a rarely available, two bedroom flat, situated on the top floor of an imposing, end of terrace Victorian building fronting Highbury Fields and benefitting from an impressive private roof terrace. It should also be noted this property has access to a large communal garden to the rear. Highbury Crescent occupies a prominent position on the West side of the Fields, within the Highbury Fields Conservation Area, offering superb access to the community focal point of the shops at Highbury Barn which includes Godfreys Butchers, La Fromagerie, Da'Mario Italian Delicatessen and Bournes fishmongers, along with the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields (gym, tennis courts, etc). Very few properties provide such a tranquil offering with so many facilities so readily accessible, including of course the Fields themselves.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This delightful, yet elegant one-bed garden flat has been refurbished by the current owners to create such a stylish home. The reception has three meter high ceilings with original cornicing, huge bay window with wood panelled surround and attractive window seat. The adjacent bedroom also has a three meter high ceiling with rear aspect onto an attractive courtyard garden. The charming kitchen has great food preparation and storage space with wood worktops, red brick flooring with a dining area situated just opposite the garden door. The bathroom has plenty of natural light and ventilation with large walk in shower with crittall screen. The town garden has gravel base surrounded by original brick walls which offer great character and privacy but also has very handy direct access onto Sheringham Road, N7 which is used as the main entrance by the current owners.

Crossley Street, N7 is an idyllic tree lined residential street which was originally built in 1875 and within easy walking distance of Upper Street. There are a lot public parks nearby with Paradise Passage located just to the rear and St Mary Magdalen Garden located at the end of the street however Highbury Fields is only 7 mins walk providing 29 acres as well as open air tennis courts, football pitches, netball courts, pubic swimming pool and gym.

Fashionable Upper Street, N1 is within easy walking distance offering an unending choice of stylish bars, restaurants and cafes, as well as boutiques and theatre such as The Almeida and Kings Head theatre. Islington Square is a very welcome new addition to Upper Street offering the first-class gym Third Space as well as a new Lux Odeon Cinema.

The nearest underground station is Highbury and Islington (Victoria and Overground) at only eight minutes’ walk which also provides a direct route to Moorgate station in only 12 mins (three stops) on Great Northern Line where Holloway Road station (Piccadilly) is only an additional three minutes in the opposite direction. Numbers bus routes can be taken from Holloway Road, N7 towards The City, The West End and Kings Cross as well as many North bound destinations.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This gorgeous, three-bedroom Regency terraced freehold house, built circa 1825, lovingly and stylishly renovated and updated by current owners in one of Islington’s most sought-after locations, close to Gibson Square. Moon Street is a terrace of only seventeen houses, with a close-knit community vibe. Houses are rarely available in this street and as such we expect significant interest.
The ground floor offers a reception room (currently used as a home recording studio), bespoke fitted kitchen and a bright and airy lounge/diner extension with large roof windows, opening onto a very private walled garden. The upper floors boast two large and one smaller double bedroom (currently used as an office) and a family bathroom, with plenty of storage available in the double loft spaces. The natural light throughout the property is enviable and the sash windows are fully double glazed. This property offers an ideal opportunity for someone looking for a tranquil haven to relax, entertain and work from home, while nevertheless being in the heart of Angel’s bustling community.
Moon Street is just a few steps from Islington Green with the world-famous Screen on the Green cinema, as well as the newly re-opened Angel Recording Studios, the Almeida Theatre, and the seemingly endless stream of restaurants and boutiques that line Upper Street, yet it is shielded from all the hubbub by virtue of its tranquil mews location on the edge of leafy Barnsbury.
