detailedDescription:
This contemporary three-bedroom apartment occupies a quiet position on Barnsbury Terrace, which lies on the western side of Barnsbury Square. Nestled within the Islington Conservation Area, Islington’s largest conservation area, the apartment has generous living spaces and a west-facing balcony that overlooks a verdant central courtyard. It unfolds within a striking building designed by Mark Dziewulski in collaboration with Robert Barnes Architects, built in 2000, which is a sensitive modern addition to the Conservation Area.

The Architect

The office of architect Mark Dziewulski has garnered a significant reputation since it was established nearly 20 years ago. The practice carries out projects in the usa, Europe and Asia, and has received numerous awards, including three Excellence in Design awards from the American Institute of Architects for ‘Significant Works of Architecture’. Its work includes important cultural and institutional buildings as well as commercial and residential projects.

The Tour

Secure entrance to the building is gained via Barnsbury Terrace; the apartment is situated on the western side of the plan and overlooks the terrace, a peaceful no-through road. The apartment has an underground parking space, accessed via a car lift, and there is also a secure bike store at this level.

Entrance to the apartment is via a lift that rises up from the ground floor communal area and opens into the hallway, which lies at the north of the plan. Internal accommodation is arranged around a verdant central courtyard, with glass louvres that frame views and create privacy. The main bedroom, plus en suite, and a bathroom are situated just off the hall; a pared-back aesthetic reigns throughout.

To the south of the plan is the large, open living space where white walls, natural timber flooring and off-white kitchen units provide a neutral canvas for dashes of colour and texture, including a marble splashback and dark timber storage units. Adjacent to the living space is another bedroom; this is currently used as a playroom but would work equally well as a home office. A set of full-height pocket doors open from this room into the main living space, revealing a set of bookshelves in the process, and enabling views across the entire length of the apartment, from the Barnsbury Terrace side through to the central courtyard. High ceilings reinforce the sense of space and light, which in turn is emphasised by the neutral colour palette and floor-to-ceiling glazing.

Outdoor Space

The apartment has a west-facing balcony that spans the full width of the living area and most of the bedroom, which overlooks the central courtyard below. A further balcony off the second bedroom overlooks a quiet, cobbled section of Barnsbury Terrace.

The Area

Barnsbury Square lies at the heart of the Barnsbury Conservation Area. The beautifully maintained square is surrounded by Georgian houses and is a veritable oasis of calm in the heart of Islington. Larger areas of green space can also be easily found at Barnard Park and Highbury Fields. Barnsbury has some very good gastro-pubs, and the shops and restaurants of Upper Street are within walking distance. The Regent’s Canal is easily accessible and is a pathway to the rest of London. Granary Square at Kings Cross is a short walk to the south, home to a magnificent public square with choreographed fountains and restaurants including Caravan, Vinoteca, Dishoom, Granger & Co, plus shops A.P.C, cos and Wolf & Badger.

Nearby Highbury & Islington station provides access to the Underground (Victoria Line) and Overground services. Further Overground services can be found at Caledonian Road & Barnsbury, providing quick access to the City and the West End. The Eurostar at Kings Cross is also easily accessible.

Tenure: Leasehold with Share of Freehold

Lease Length: Approx. 996 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £7,148 per annum

detailedDescription:
Hidden behind lush green trees, a sizable four storey family home comprising 2500 sq. Ft. Of versatile internal living space. Externally, the ornate period detail immediately stimulates curiosity and sets the tone continued throughout this attractive property. The present owners have sympathetically restored and enhanced a perfect blend of Victorian character lavished with every modern convenience.

The unusual generous width of the building allows wonderful proportions throughout, one of our favourite aspects, a grand main reception boasting three large sash windows, ornate ceiling and a period fireplace filling the room with interest. Perfect for entertaining, accommodation flows naturally into a stylish kitchen/dining room, well-equipped with German fitted kitchen, central island, and ample space for a large dining table. Stripped French doors lead to a large terrace with elevated views over the landscaped rear garden. Stairs lead down to a beautifully designed multi-functional garden space, ideal for a secluded urban retreat or great fun for young children.

When it comes to bedroom and bathroom accommodation, the property does not disappoint. The upper levels provide five bedrooms, the main bedroom is complete with en-suite shower and large walk-in wardrobe. An additional family bathroom, separate wc and utility space ensures great family practicality.
The lower ground floor presents wonderful possibilities with two additional bedrooms, a further reception and utility space and shower room, perfect for visiting friends and family or perhaps an au-pair.

Rarely available in a location rapidly growing in popularity, much loved for its eclectic nature and community feel. Excellent transport links at Finsbury Park station (Piccadilly & Victoria lines), Crouch Hill Overground and a growing selection of local coffee shops, bars, and eateries can be found at both Stroud Green & Crouch End. The property is situated in the catchment area of Grafton Primary School (rated outstanding by Ofsted) and the green and open spaces at Finsbury Park, the Parkland Walk and Wray Crescent are also close by.

The first floor offers an additional L shaped lateral reception space complete with fire place, ornate cornicing and original sash windows framing the view over Gibson Square. The property is flooded with natural light throughout due to the unrestricted view and south facing rear aspect. The upper floors of the property contain the final two bedrooms and the two family bathrooms are located to the rear of the property via a double storey extension. address: Thornhill Crescent, Barnsbury, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription:
Outstanding three double bedroom garden apartment situated in the heart of Bansbury. Chain free with Share of freehold.

An immaculately finished and presented apartment within this end of terrace house located on Thornhill Crescent overlooking St Andrew’s Church and Barnsbury Woods.

Accessed through its own private entrance, bright and spacious accommodation comprises a double reception dining area with direct access to an attractive patio garden.

A newly fitted modern kitchen with space to dine and utility area.

Three double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes to the master, a family bathroom and a second wet room.

Additional features include a private paved front garden area and modern tasteful decor throughout.

The apartment has easy access to Caledonian Road station (Piccadilly Line), Highbury & Islington station (Victoria Line and London Overground), and Kings Cross St Pancras (Victoria, Piccadilly, Northern, Metropolitan and Hammersmith and City Lines and the Eurostar link).

George Thornhill initially planned to develop his Islington estate in 1808 but after a false start he appointed Joseph Kay as surveyor in 1813. When George died in 1827, his son inherited his father's bequest for improving land in Islington. Street names in the estate recall family connections. Thornhill Square was begun in c 1847 with a Mr gs Williams building 33 houses on the west, the central gardens having railings dating from c 1852. Thornhill Crescent was begun in c 1849.

Early residents of the square were well-to-do professional classes. In 1906 two of the houses in the north-west were demolished for the new Islington West Library designed in Art and Craft style by E Beresford Pite. As the C20th progressed, the area became run down like much of Islington and in 1955 the family interest died out with Captain Noel Thornhill. The central garden was only open to keyholders until 1946 when Captain Thornhill donated the gardens to the public and they were opened by the Mayor of Islington in 1947. They were newly laid out in 1953 under the Council's Open Spaces Scheme as part of Coronation Year improvements. Thornhill Square is a large ovoid ellipse square surrounded by railings and a great curiosity in plan. Surrounding buildings are largely intact. St Andrew's church, built in 1852-54, is to the north of the Square within Thornhill Crescent gardens<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Highbury Hill, Highbury, Islington, London N5
detailedDescription:
A beautiful Victorian Detached Freehold House standing alone on a level plot with a total footprint size of approximately 5306 sq ft (493SQM). Located in one of Highbury’s most sought after locations at the top of Highbury Hill, with substantial rear garden that backs on to the green open spaces of Highbury Fields, adjacent to the landmark clocktower and large variety of shops and boutiques of Highbury Barn.

Offered to the market as an entire Freehold property for the first time in 100 years, this is the only original detached house in the conservation area surrounding Highbury Fields. Boasting large oversized sash windows that engulf the property with natural light and wonderful high ceilings, this imposing Victorian building set over five elegant storeys offers approximately 5000 sqft of internal space and retains much of its original charm and character. It has been maintained to an exceptional standard.

The property is currently arranged as seven attractive, well equipped, one and two bedroom flats which offer vast lateral living space, currently all rented out on secure AST’s. To the rear of the building there is a beautiful garden which is accessed by all flats, with some properties having direct access. The garden is well looked after and offers a mature lawn laid to flower beds and brick planters which surround it in its entirety. Though the building is currently divided into flats, there is the possibility of transforming this exceptional dwelling into one family house once more, or opening up some floors whilst continuing to rent some of the units.

Highbury Hill is perfectly positioned minutes from an extensive range of amenities stretching along Highbury Barn including independent coffee shops, alternative supermarkets, fresh food outlets, bakeries, wine retailers and a gym. Highbury Fields provides local residents with 29 acres of well-maintained recreational area, tennis courts and Highbury Pool.

The area is serviced by a wide range of transport links with Arsenal being the closest Underground Station (Piccadilly Line), Highbury & Islington Station is also within easy reach with direct access to the Victoria Line, Overground and Great Northern Main Line. Drayton Park (First Capital Connect) is just 7 minutes’ walk.

The Tour

Flat 1
Entered on the lower ground floor through a private entrance, Flat 1 is the largest of seven measuring approximately 1173 sq ft (109 sq.m), neutrally decorated throughout and finished with wood flooring. Passing a cloakroom W.C, the expansive hallway opens up giving access to a spacious living room with living flame gas fire and direct access to the garden. Adjacent is a semi-open-plan kitchen / dining room which provides excellent entertainment space, also giving direct access to the garden. To the front of the property are two very well proportioned double bedrooms, family bathroom and additional utility room.

Flat 2
Refurbished to an exceptional standard throughout, this spacious and naturally bright property occupies the entire raised ground floor and offers approximately 936 sq ft (87.0 sq.m) of flexible living space. Comprising study area as you enter the property, large living room with three oversized south-facing windows that claw light into the room, a modern fitted kitchen offers a selection of wall and base units whilst leading onto a further utility room that provides direct access to the garden through glass French Doors. The main bedroom has fitted wardrobes and contemporary en-suite bathroom complete with walk in shower, whilst the second double bedroom offers ample room for free standing furniture as well as having built in cupboards. A further bathroom provides occupants with full bath tub, floating wash basin with wall mounted single lever mixer tap and floating W.C.

Flat 3
Situated on the first floor to the front of the building, this charming one double bedroom apartment measuring approximately 409 sq ft (38 sq.m) comprises a spacious living room with ample room for dining fitted kitchen with selection of wall and base units, double bedroom with fitted wardrobe and fully tiled three piece bathroom suite.

Flat 4
Bright and spacious Two-Double Bedroom Apartment set on the first floor at the rear of the building, offering far-reaching views over the garden and Highbury Fields. The apartment with large windows and high ceilings offers flexible living space of approximately 646 sq ft (60.0 Sq.m). Accessed from the entrance hall, the spacious living room complete with decorative fireplace provides wonderful social space whilst the adjacent fitted kitchen offers lots of preparation area. The apartment further comprises of two-double bedrooms, family bathroom and built in storage space.

Flat 5
Located on the second floor at the front and offering approximately 484 sq ft of internal living space, this unique one-double bedroom apartment offers the added benefit of a mezzanine floor above the bedroom creating space for a home office or further sleeping area. The property further benefits from a spacious living room with adjoining fitted kitchen and modern fully tiled bathroom suite.

Flat 6
Offering far reaching views across Highbury Fields, this beautiful Two-Double Bedroom Apartment set at the rear of the building on the second floor offers residents flexible living space of approximately 581 sq ft (54.0 sq.m). Neutrally decorated throughout, the hall leads off to a modern fitted eat-in-kitchen with glass tile splash-back, selection of wall and base units with some integrated appliances. The reception room complete with decorative fireplace provides space for dining and is saturated in natural light through an oversized sash window. Both bedrooms are sizable doubles with space for free-standing furniture whilst the adjacent fully tiled bathroom is fitted with bath tub, wash basin and low level W.C.

Flat 7
Occupying the third floor of the building, this spacious one-double bedroom apartment measuring approximately 538 sq ft (50.0 sq.m) comprises of large living room with direct access onto a private balcony, fitted kitchen, double bedroom and four piece bathroom suite complete with bath tub, walk in shower, wash basin and low level W.C. Amazing views over Highbury Fields.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:

Location:
St. Johns Villas is located off Holloway Road, nearest tube station being Archway (Northern line) and close to Upper Holloway overground station, good local bus services, shops and Whittington Park. Islington Upper Street & Highbury Corner in one direction and Highgate Village in the other are served by bus services from Holloway Road.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A truly sensational, four double bedroom, two bathroom family home situated on this popular road in Highbury, N5. Standing close to 1,800 sqft, the property has been cleverly remodelled and architecturally designed to make the best use of space throughout. The ground floor consists of a bespoke kitchen at the front of the house allowing for a phenomenal open plan dining area/living space featuring a glass side return, back extension with bifolding doors leading out to a mature 29ft garden and separate utility room. The first floor occupies the spacious master bedroom spanning the full width of the front of the house and ensuite, another good-sized double bedroom and family bathroom to the rear. The top floor includes two further double bedrooms, both with plentiful storage.
Riversdale Road is located moments away from Highbury Barn which offers a selection of sought-after local independents including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bourne's Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners - a magnet for locals, and also drawing those from further afield. The property is a short walk away from the green, open spaces of Highbury Fields and Clissold Park along with a yoga studio and renowned local pub on its doorstep. Easy access to the popular and vibrant Stoke Newington Church Street provides a further variety of great boutiques, restaurants and cafes.
Transport links are well serviced by a selection of excellent bus routes as well as Arsenal underground station (Piccadilly line) within short walking distance along with Highbury & Islington and Finsbury Park underground stations (Victoria line and over ground services) both nearby.
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This one bedroom apartment comprises of a large family bathroom, a separate bathroom, kitchen and spacious lounge.

This property is being offered to cash buyers only so is perfect for investors who will be looking to achieve a 5.5% yield.

The apartment further benefits from City skyline views, wood laminate flooring and plentiful storage. Peregrine House benefits from a long lease, CCTV, entrance phone, porterage and lift access.

The property is conveniently located for access into the City, close to City university and only 5 minutes from the bars and restaurants on Upper Street and Exmouth Market.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An 1850s Victorian home in the centre of sought after De Beauvoir Town. Totalling close to 2,000 sq ft across just three floors the property boosts a wealth of lateral space. The ground floor offers a double reception room with sash bay window with wooden shutters, restored coving, fireplace and wooden flooring. There is a projector with surround sound in this room, included in the sale. The rear of the property has been extended featuring a bespoke kitchen with stone tops, Range cooker and American style fridge freezer. The skylights and rear sliding doors flood the space with natural light, assisted by the east to west facing orientation. The garden is accessed from the kitchen and dining space and reaches near 50 ft. The upper floors contain five bedrooms and three bathrooms. The principal bedroom showcases some fantastic original features to include sash windows, fireplace, ceiling roses, coving and high skirting boards. The family bathroom has encaustic tiles, vintage French sink and corner shower while the principal has bamboo Fired Earth tiling and recessed lighting. detailedDescription:

The accommodation comprises of generous reception room and kitchen diner on the raised ground floor. The kitchen offers delightful views over the garden and is finished with grey units, marble worktops, butlers sink and white brick work tiled splashbacks.

The lower ground floor comprises of two well-proportioned double bedrooms with the master bedroom benefiting from having an en-suite bathroom and access to a private patio space to the front. There is also a separate modern shower room.

Richmond Avenue is one of Islington’s most sought-after streets, tree lined, peaceful and moments from various green open spaces including Thornhill Road Gardens, Barnard Park and Thornhill Square as well as being a short walk from Upper Street. King’s Cross, St Pancras is close by with a short walk to the end of Caledonian Road or via Granary square.

A unique, wonderfully bright and extremely spacious duplex level penthouse apartment set within the iconic Royle Building.

Measuring approximately 1,694 square feet, this beautifully presented apartment is the largest in the development and boasts a far reaching west facing view across the Wenlock basin, canal and beyond through floor to ceiling glass doors and windows.

Comprising a vast reception area leading to a private terrace, generous separate kitchen/dining area with double height ceilings and a tall southerly aspect window, study/third bedroom, downstairs bathroom, WC and a number of useful storage spaces.

Stairs lead up to two double bedrooms, both of which enjoy gallery views over the reception and can be cleverly divided off with glass sliding doors to enable privacy, a rarity for mezzanine level lofts. The master bedroom further benefits from a large walk-in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom.

Formerly a print works factory, the impressive Royle building enjoys a sought-after canal side location in the Wenlock Basin and benefits from a secure entrance system, on-site porter and lift access. A secure parking space is also available with this property.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful 6 bedroom freehold home which has been extended to offer wonderful family accommodation in the heart of Clerkenwell moments from Farringdon station. EPC: D

This deceptively spacious listed home spans approximately 3235 sq ft, and is spread over five floors offering versatile space. Located on possibly the most favoured turning in the heart Clerkenwell, this freehold home has superb family accommodation and situated on the cusp of St John's Gardens.

Believed to date back to 1723, the house retains some period charm which works extremely well in tandem with the contrast of a modern and contemporary rear extension which has created superb bright and open plan additional living space.

Situated on the lower floor, the house features a well-appointed one bedroom self-contained apartment, whilst the raised ground floor lends its self to a wonderful living space which incorporates a spacious open plan kitchen and dining area to the rear of the house, enjoying views over the park via a large floor to ceiling window.

A glass lift is situated in the centre of the house which ensures that the house is easily useable, connecting the lower floor to the first floor where an atrium opens out on to a large west-facing roof terrace.

There are six bedrooms in total and four bathrooms which complete the accommodation.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Situated at the southerly section of Britton Street, the location is unbeatable for quick access to Farringdon Station (0.1 miles) which offers National Rail, three underground lines and the eagerly awaited Cross Rail service which will provide swift access to Canary Wharf and Heathrow airport.

The area has transformed in recent years, offering Michelin starred restaurants, a choice of exceptional cafes, wine and cocktail bars and fine coffee shops. A large Waitrose is situated on St John Street, and a range of boutique shops are nestled within the postcode.

Please note all distances and times are approximate.

address: Loraine Mansions, Widdenham Road, London N7
detailedDescription:
This fantastic three-bedroom apartment is positioned on the third floor of Loraine Mansions, a beautiful Edwardian mansion block in Holloway. The apartment has been the subject of a sensitive modernisation by its current owners, who have carefully introduced a contemporary material palette throughout that makes wonderful use of the flow of natural light.

The Tour

Loraine Mansions sits on a peaceful, tree-lined street of elegant Edwardian mansion blocks, characterised by their beautiful red brick and white stucco façades, slim running balconies and bay windows. Access to the mansions is gained via a communal entrance, through charming front gardens that lead to a red brick porch.

The apartment is on the third floor. A long hallway runs along the spine of the plan, a feature that accentuates the flow of natural light across all rooms. Engineered oak boards run underfoot, leading to the beautiful kitchen, living and dining rooms which are arranged in an open plan at one end of the hallway. These rooms are bright, airy and bathed in natural light care of two sash windows to the northern aspect and a glazed door that leads to an elevated fire escape on the eastern aspect. The kitchen has birch plywood units with concrete worktops and integrated appliances. Bespoke cabinetry cleverly conceals the extraction fan while creating convenient high-level storage; further storage is built-in along one wall. The adjoining dining area and living room are oriented around an original fireplace and enjoy verdant treetop views.

A well-sized bathroom is positioned next to the living room. The hallway leads back along the length of the plan to two large double bedrooms and a third, slightly smaller bedroom. Each of these rooms has engineered oak floorboards, original restored fireplaces and beautiful sash windows.

The Area

Loraine Mansions is in a brilliant location, adjacent to the Hillmarton Conservation Area and within easy reach of central Islington, Upper Street and King’s Cross to the south, as well as Camden and Kentish Town to the west. Local amenities, including a large Waitrose, can be found on Holloway Road. There are many good pubs and restaurants in the area, including Westerns Laundry towards Highbury Fields, Tufnell Park Tavern to the north and numerous pubs such as The Drapers Arms and The Albion. Islington Indoor Tennis Centre and gym can be found at nearby Market Road. Freightliners City Farm by Paradise Park is also close by, while Hampstead Heath is a 15-minute cycle.

Both Caledonian Road and Holloway stations (Picadilly Line) are a short walk away, and there are numerous local bus routes into central London.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 86 year remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £1,020 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £10 per annum

detailedDescription:
Islington Square will offer a variety of premier residential accommodation incorporating communal gardens, optional secure underground car parking, access to memberships in various facilities such as London's fastest growing car club.

There will be coffee shops and café bars, innovative restaurants and stylish shops showcasing the latest fashions and design and a 50,000 sq ft premium family health club, with state of the art facilities including a 25m pool for adults and separate pool facilities for children plus a luxury cinema with 6 screens with no more than 25 seats each hosting films from blockbusters to art productions.

London is famously a city of squares. Wherever these squares appear they quickly become natural meeting points for the communities around them. Islington Square will be no different. Sheltered from the traffic on Upper Street, it will be a fresh and lively locality.

Linked to Upper Street by two covered retail arcades, Islington Square will be the centre of a community with everything on its doorstep. It will soon be hard to imagine Islington without it.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A delightful, two double bedroom period conversion situated moments from the tube. Located on the first floor of this handsome Victorian building, the property offers high ceilings and bright, well proportioned rooms throughout. Accommodation consists of a spacious living room opening out to a fully equipped kitchen with ample worktop and cupboard space. Both bedrooms are good sizes, the master featuring inbuilt wardrobes while the property is completed with a modern bathroom. The property also benefits from an abundance of storage and is offered to the market with a share of freehold.
The flat is set near to the ever-popular Highbury Barn which boasts an array of award-winning food shops and the Highbury Barn gastro pub. There are also superb transport links with Arsenal (Piccadilly line), Holloway Road (Piccadilly line) and Drayton Park (into Moorgate) being a very short distance away. Highbury and Islington Station (Victoria Line and Overground) and the high street shops and restaurants on Upper Street are located just across the green open space of Highbury Fields.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An wonderful one-bedroom apartment set on the fifth floor of this sought after 24-hour portered building which is built to a high specification. The roomy open-plan living is able to accommodate lounge seating and dining for up to four guests where the adjacent West-facing balcony is great for afternoon and evening sun. A stylish kitchen offers good preparation space and ample storage with a full-size fridge/freezer, microwave, oven and wine fridge. The bedroom is also a good size with built in wardrobes where all rooms offer West facing views.

Five Queensland Road, N7 is located near the end of a no-through road and also also has 24-hour concierge service located in an adjacent building but also offers a fitness suite and access to communal gardens. Transport links are excellent as Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly line) is only a 7 mins walk with Highbury and Islington Station underground station (Victoria Line) a further 7 mins walk. National Rail provide a 15 min direct service to Moorgate from Drayton Park which is only 5 mins away. Numerous bus routes towards Highbury and Islington, Angel, Old Street and Moorgate may also be taken from Lower Holloway Road. Kings Cross is within easy reach by underground or bus where national links can be taken via Thameslink to Blackfriars, Gatwick and Brighton as well as international links to Paris, Brussels and Amsterdam.

The fashionable bars, cafes, boutiques and restaurants of Upper Street are all within walking distance or a short bus journey whereas local amenities such as Waitrose can be found on Holloway Road, N7. Highbury Fields are nearby providing the largest open space in Islington with 29 acres of green space for Islington residents including tennis courts and a local swimming pool.

Orsman Road is only a few minutes from Haggerston overground station providing easy access into Dalston, Hoxton, Shoreditch, and Highbury and Islington. The nearby Regent’s Canal Towpath leads directly to Victoria Park going East and to Angel and Kings Cross to the West. The shops and cafes of De Beauvoir and the green spaces of Shoreditch Park are within easy walking distance.

detailedDescription:
Vanquish Real Estate is delighted to offer this well-presented modern one bedroom apartment located on the 6th floor of The Shoreline building of the Woodberry Down development, one of the biggest regeneration projects in the UK.

The apartment contains of one bedroom and one bathroom, an open-plan kitchen/living area and a large private balcony and it comes with allocated parking

A walking distance from Manor House Underground Station.

The Nature Collection invites residents to enjoy the harmony and calmness of uninterrupted nature and City views. Set on the banks of the Woodberry Wetlands, a tranquil, abundant nature reserve, animated by urban wildlife year-round. This is London living of an entirely different nature.
The four buildings that make up the Nature Collection – The Shoreline, Goldcrest, Sandpiper, and Skylark Point – vary in scale from five to 18 floors, offering an array of apartments to suit individual needs. An attractive Residents’ Garden is a prelude to the idyllic parks, and the open water of the Woodberry Wetlands. The beauty of nature is captured at every turn, kindling a remarkable sense of retreat from the City.
Residents will have access to a wealth of communal amenities including, a generous swimming pool and gym within the development. A concierge will connect residents to a wide range of services.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Set over the top two floors of a period building is this stunning two-bedroom duplex apartment in the heart of the Shoreditch triangle.

This fabulous and rare to the market property offers a mix of period charm with a contemporary finish. Features include exposed brickwork, open fireplace, solid wood flooring and sash windows. The property offers ample and sociable living/entertaining spaces. A bright dual-aspect reception flows through to a striking modern kitchen and private west facing roof terrace. A useful WC also makes up the lower level. Stairs lead up to two double bedrooms and a master bathroom. Both bedrooms boast exposed brick work and fitted wardrobes, whilst the master bedroom further benefits from an en-suite shower room. Completing the property is a versatile space which is perfect as a study and leads out to a large private roof terrace, ideal for entertaining.

Located just a stone’s throw from the extensive array of restaurants, exclusive fashion boutiques and fantastic bars Shoreditch and Hoxton has to offer. Columbia Road, Brick Lane and Spitalfields Market are all close by and the financial heart of the City is also easily accessible.

Transport links include Old Street (Northern Line and National Rail), Shoreditch (East London Line) and Liverpool Street (Central, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City and Circle lines and National Rail) Stations with the City just moments away.

Offered with no onward chain.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Highly sought after & rare this after barrel vaulted top floor (third) bright and airy one bedroom apartment. Highly favoured East Facing over tennis courts and pool. Being sold as a project, needs new bathroom & Kitchen which has been factored into the asking price.

Full details Highly sought after & rare this after barrel vaulted top floor (third) bright and airy one bedroom apartment. Highly favoured East Facing over tennis courts and pool. Being sold as a project, needs new bathroom & Kitchen which has been factored into the asking price as have the triple glazing likely to be installed in the next 5 year period ( estimated). The Grade II Listed Golden Lane Estate has a recently refurbished Public Leisure Centre located right in the middle which has tennis & squash courts and a brand new swimming pool. Built in 1962. The Golden Lane Estate was one of the finest achievement of the architects Chamberlain, Powell & Bon. Crescent House is actually Grade II* with a star as an award to show its elevated significance over the remained of the Estate. The architects drew inspiration from Le Corbusier, famous for being one of the pioneers of what now is called Modern architecture. Their vision has created a unique urban village community devoid of traffic with immediate amenities The estate was Grade ii-listed in 1997 in recognition of its extraordinary contribution to London's urban landscape. Barbican tube station (on the Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) is only a couple of minutes' walk away, with Moorgate (on the Northern line), St Paul's (on the Central line) and Mansion House (on the District line) tube stations each within a short walking distance. Moments walking distance the new Crossrail Station Farringdon Station. This entrance will provide access to the 'East Ticket Hall' linking directly with the existing London Underground platforms at Barbican & Farringdon Stations therefore providing access to the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines. On completion in 2021 Farringdon Station will be a vital interchange between the North-South Thameslink and the East-West Crossrail service. 140 trains per hour will travel through the station. Crossrail will give direct access to Canary Wharf in 9 minutes & Bond Street in 3 minutes. Waitrose is located nearby on Whitecross Street, which is also home to the weekday Whitecross Street food market. Next door to the Barbican is West Smithfield an area that has seen a huge regeneration, incoming occupiers are small food outlets, coffee shops bars & restaurants providing a buzzing mixed use location. Comprising of many media, digital and creative industries, but increasingly legal, professional and finance. The Museum of London will move to Smithfield Market in 2026 ( est). Smithfield Meat Market will be vacating by 2026 ( est) then it are will be transformed into a world beating food & gastro destination and will be part of the world beating Cultural Mile. Also within easy reach are the attractions of St. Pauls' Cathedral, New Change Shopping Complex. The River Thames, Tate Modern, Gabriel's Wharf and South Bank.

address: Britannia Building, 12 Ebenezer Street, London N1
detailedDescription:
This wonderfully bright two-bedroom duplex is set over the first and second floor of this former live/work building in the heart of rapidly growing Tech City. There is a generous hallway with guest WC which leads into an dual aspect open plan reception which attracts a lot of natural light and has 2.7 meter high ceilings as well wood flooring throughout. The galley kitchen is well equipped with plenty of storage and has its own window for natural ventilation. The master bedroom also has dual aspect as well as built in wardrobes and en suite where the adjacent second double bedroom is currently used as guest bedroom and home office by the current owners.

The Britannia Building is located on Ebenezer Street, N1 is a ‘close knit’ residential block where many of the existing residents still live in the building since the building was first converted ten years ago. Ebenezer Street has recently been blocked off to through traffic creating a more residential feel which is part of Hackney’s ‘greening’ policy to introduce more pedestrian and cycling areas in the local borough. Old Street Station is only a five minute walk where Shoreditch and Hoxton are within the immediate vicinity offering an array of bars, cafés and restaurants. The Regents Canal is also nearby providing a very popular pedestrian and cycling route towards Angel and Kings Cross as well as Broadway Market and Victoria Park to the East. The weekly flower market on Columbia Road, E2 is only 15 mins walk while the Barbican Centre and Exmouth food Market are eighteen and twenty four minutes respectively in the opposite direction.

The City is within easy walking distance where bus routes are plentiful, southbound towards Moorgate from City Road and northerly towards Kings Cross and St Pancras (12 mins) offering local national and international destinations.

detailedDescription:
Very well presented one bedroom ground floor flat with delightful south-facing private garden, enviably located in a quiet Islington location close to beautiful Rosemary Gardens and recreational facilities. The property offers bright and spacious accommodation with stylish interiors throughout, including a double length reception/dining room, well equipped high gloss fitted kitchen and modern bathroom. Features include gas central heating, double glazing, ample inbuilt storage, quality floor coverings and long lease.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage cupboards, leading into the bright, double length reception room with ample space for both relaxing and dining, and door to the rear leading out on to the low maintenance private garden. The separate kitchen, comprises a range of matching high gloss wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with quiet rear aspect, and a stylish bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling.

The property is superbly located within easy access of Essex Road, Haggerston and Angel stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing exceptional cross-London connections. The area is well served by an array of stylish shops, bars, restaurants and amenities, including those of fashionable Upper Street, as well as the attractive open spaces of Rosemary Gardens, also boasting tennis courts, and the nearby Regents Canal.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

detailedDescription:
A semi-detached Victorian family home located in sought after De Beauvoir and totalling over 2,000 sq ft. Set across four floors compete with three bedrooms, study, extended kitchen diner, double reception room and west facing rear garden. The raised ground floor highlights many of the beautiful period features to include parquet flooring, sash windows with shutters, coving and dual fire places. There is a study space on this floor overlooking the rear garden which can be separated via the original shutters. The lower ground floor is home to the extended kitchen and dining space which juxtaposes the classic period feel on the raised ground floor with contemporary style. The architecturally designed glass extension provides ample natural light, as well as being aesthetically pleasing, and creates a snug which leads you to a mature west facing garden with outdoor dining area. There is a convenient utility room and W.C. On this floor and the period features continue with another fireplace. The upper floors house the three double bedrooms and two bathrooms and the top floor extension boasts built in wardrobes and an en-suite. While fully extended the space internally remains interchangeable, the dining room and utility room on the lower ground could create a fourth bedroom and third bathroom and the dining area moved to the snug.

Situation
De Beauvoir Town is nestled between the boroughs of Hackney and Islington, ideally situated for local amenities including the popular De Beauvoir Deli. The area has a cosmopolitan feel, promoting a community atmosphere. Transport links are plentiful including Essex Road (0.25 miles) and Hagerstown (0.4 miles).

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located within a quiet cul-de-sac moments from Caledonian Road Underground Station and adjacent to Caledonian Park, is this large four bedroom Freehold house with further loft room and mature private garden.

Measuring approximately 1417 sq ft, this wonderful light filled modernistic house spanning four floors provides functionality and flexible living space. The ground floor comprises of modern open-plan kitchen and summer room which looks out onto the garden area, shower room and fourth bedroom or study. Occupying the first floor is a separate living room, bedroom and family bathroom, whilst on the second floor there are two double bedrooms, one of which benefits from a walk in shower, basin and W.C.

The loft room on the third floor benefits from two Velux windows and lots of storage space, ideal for a home office or additional sleeping space. Additional head height could be added in the loft by way of installing dormers (STPP). This spacious family home further benefits from built in storage on each floor, double glazed windows and a charming rear garden which includes a stone patio area laid to mature flower beds and imposing trees.

Manger Road is situated in a popular area of North London with the impact of Kings Cross/St Pancras International being seen the whole way along Caledonian Road. Popular Upper Street is within easy reach offering a range of boutique shops, restaurants and entertainment facilities.

Transport links moments from the property include Caledonian Road Underground Station which is just 5 minutes’ walk (Google), Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground Station and range of buses some of which operate 24hrs a day.<br /><br />

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A sensational, two double bedroom, period conversion set across the top two floors of this handsome, semidetached building on Wilberforce Road, N4. Standing at a very impressive 838 sqft, the property has been tastefully decorated throughout by the current owners with a perfect blend of modern and characterful features. The second floor consists of a wonderfully bright, east facing living room/kitchen spanning the full width of the front of the house creating the perfect space to entertain, while situated at the rear is a larger than average second bedroom with a fantastic view over neighbouring gardens. The top (third floor) occupies the spacious master bedroom featuring plentiful eaves storage while the property is completed with a modern, family bathroom.
Wilberforce Road is one of Finsbury Park's most desirable locations being a wide tree lined, quiet, no-through road, with ample on-street parking and is set just moments from the prestigious Highbury Barn and Clissold Park. The property is close to highly renowned local amenities, including Fink's café, Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bournes Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield. It is also moments from the ever-popular Blackstock Road, with its community feel, local cafés and shops, whilst the property is also close proximity to three great open spaces, namely Clissold Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields.
Transport links are well serviced by Finsbury Park (Victoria and Piccadilly lines, National Rail and Thames Link) and Arsenal (Piccadilly line) stations. There is also a selection of good bus routes taking you into the City and West End.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A unique opportunity to purchase a substantial, five double bedroom family home situated moments Highbury Fields in N5. Standing at 1732 sqft internally, the property would welcome full modernisation whilst be able to be extended in multiple places, STPP. Accommodation comprises of two good sized reception rooms on the ground floor, one including original cornicing and a feature fireplace, a spacious kitchen leading out to a mature, private garden which still retains the original outside toilet. The first floor occupies the bathroom with separate toilet and two bedrooms, one being the master stretching the full width of the house and benefitting from a bay window with a gorgeous view down Witherington Road itself. The top floor consists of a further three bedrooms, all of which are larger than average double bedrooms. The property is completed with a 65 sqft cellar and is offered to the market on a chain free basis.
Witherington Road is set close to the green spaces of Highbury Fields as well as local shopping at the prestigious Highbury Barn. The property is close to highly renowned local amenities, including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bourne Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield.
The property offers some fantastic transport links with Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and Overground) within a short distance, as is both Holloway Road underground (Piccadilly line) and Drayton Park taking you directly to Moorgate. There are a number of strong bus routes taking you into the West End and the City and international links are facilitated from St Pancras.
title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

address: St. Mary's Grove, Canonbury, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription: A truly outstanding Victorian semi-detached family home affording a wealth of accommodation over 5 floors set right within the very heart of Canonbury, only moments from the community focal point of Canonbury Place. The house retains much of the charm & character with ceiling roses, ornate cornicing and beautiful fireplaces. Accommodation comprises 2 double bedrooms on the top (3rd) floor both with access to superb eaves storage and a shower room. The 2nd floor is home to 2 very good size double bedrooms and the man family bathroom which has been recently re-fitted complete with large walk-in shower, freestanding bath and his & hers sinks. It should be noted that each of the rooms on this floor share beautiful views with an unobstructed aspect to the front & to the rear. On the 1st floor can be found the stunning master bedroom with a range of bespoke built-in wardrobes and separate en-suite shower room. Also on this floor can be found a further double bedroom (currently being used as a study) and a beautifully finished shower room. The wonderful reception room is located on the raised ground floor with 2 beautiful big sash windows providing uninterrupted views down Prior Bolton Street and encompassing many of the period features. To the rear on the raised ground floor is a beautiful study/ second reception room with views across the garden to the rear, a cloak room and guest WC. The lower ground floor is home to what is undoubtedly the heart of the house a beautiful L-shaped through kitchen/ dining/ family room with patio doors opening the stunning private rear garden. The kitchen is equipped with a combination of Wolfe & Miele appliances. Also on this level is a further guest WC, pantry, utility room and fantastic storage room. The mature garden has been beautifully landscaped and provides an oasis of peace & tranquillity. There is also the benefit of side access for easy maintenance and potential scope for extension subject to the usual consents. St Mary's Grove is an extremely desirable tree lined road situated in the heart of Canonbury, moments from the focal point of the localised community of the shops of Canonbury Place, very much regarded as Islington's most sought after area. The house affords superb peace and tranquillity whilst retaining superb access to the amenities of buzzy & vibrant Upper Street. Transport can be found at Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), Essex Road station and of course Angel Underground. The delights and the charm of the New River Walk are located at the bottom of Willowbridge Road. It should be noted that there is off-street parking to the front of the house.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented two bedroom apartment, with accommodation arranged over the upper two floors of an imposing Grade II listed Georgian building, set within the heart of Barnsbury. Accommodation is well balanced comprising; a spacious semi open plan kitchen/dining/reception space, bathed in light courtesy of the dual aspect, with the two double bedrooms and bathroom suite housed on the top floor. Occupying a prominent position on Liverpool Road the property affords supreme convenience for what central Islington & Angel has to offer. The gastro pubs of the Albion and the Drapers Arms can be found locally within Barnsbury, with the supermarkets of Waitrose and Sainsbury's located at the Southern end of Liverpool Road, close to Angel. Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line) and Angel Underground (Northern Line) offer superb transport links to the City and across London. The transport hub of Kings Cross/ St Pancras International is only 1 stop from Angel, with its array of vibrant amenities making it a destination location for so many.

detailedDescription:
This impressive contemporary mews house is set over three floors and offers a very private and quiet existence in the heartof Islington. The top floor has been recently added to create a simply exquisite master bedroom with vanity and lounge areas. It has wood flooring throughout, as well as plenty of wardrobe storage. The master bedroom has direct access onto the adjacent roof terrace via dual bi-folding doors which also open out to an adjoining study area and landing.

A bespoke glass balustrade descends into a vast open-plan reception and kitchen which extends to almost 45 feet. The dining area is able to seat six to eight guests comfortably, and there is generous lounge seating for the same size party. The superb kitchen has been recently fitted to include a quartz countertop with a breakfast bar for casual dining, creating a social hub for cooking and entertaining family or guests.

The second bedroom, located on the ground floor, is roomy with a luxurious en suite bathroom and ample built-in storage. The third bedroom is a smart double with a stylish bathroom accessible just across the hallway.

Coopers Yard, N1 is a secluded gated community accessed via a cobbled courtyard just off Upper Street, N1. Local residents
have an array of independent boutiques, cafes, restaurants and bars at their disposal. There are also internationally
renowned theatres, such as the Almeida, located only three minutes' walk away. Islington Square is a welcome new addition to the locale, offering first-class venues such as Third Space Gym and a luxury cinema experience at the Odeon Luxe & Dine. The property is also within the catchment area for William Tyndale Primary School, which is rated 'Outstanding' by Ofsted.

Highbury & Islington station (Victoria line, Overground and National Rail) is only five minutes' walk away, while Angel
Underground station (Northern line) is just twelve minutes' walk in the opposite direction.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming and newly refurbished New York Loft Style Duplex Apartment with private parking space, located within a grand Landmark building in one of North London’s most sought after locations.

Originally built between 1908-1911 with strong French Architectural influences this enchanting and very spacious one bedroom duplex apartment located within a former gpo Money Order Office has been designed for maximum entertaining space and modern living with interiors crafted by design engineers.

Entering on the second floor the reception with high ceilings opens up through the whole apartment flooded by light through the industrial sized Crittall windows. The original kitchen has been replaced with a modern design which offers a selection of wall and base units and some integrated appliances.

Ascending to the upper floor from the bespoke’ skeleton staircase with wooden risers, the mezzanine offers a very spacious bedroom area with additional space for a study or reading area and three piece bathroom suite. This charming apartment further benefits from parquet wood flooring, modern lighting and closet W.C on the entrance floor.

The Grade II landmark Beaux Arts Building affords its residents with a 24 concierge service evident upon entering the grand foyer, three beautiful landscaped gardens complete with water fountain, modern fitness centre, steam room, sauna and roof terrace that offer far reaching views across London’s changing skyline.

Manor Gardens is located within an area of culture that benefits from a wide range of amenities including supermarkets, eateries and coffee shops on both nearby Holloway Road & Stroud Green Road. The ever popular Upper Street is within easy reach by foot or short bus ride and offers further boutiques, restaurants and entertainment facilities.

The area is serviced by a number of transport links including the Underground Stations of Holloway Road (0.7 miles away), Finsbury Park (0.9 miles away), Archway (0.8 miles away) and Upper Holloway Overground Station (0.4 miles away) and direct buses into the City.<br /><br />

address: Ben Jonson House, Barbican, London EC2Y
detailedDescription:
This third floor one bedroom duplex is known as a Type M2B, with many original features still in place.

Entering at the third floor level there is space under the stairs for storage, the bathroom has the original deep bath, wc, inset wash basin, tiled walls and flooring.

The bedroom has a fitted cupboard and a full width window looking north.

Leading from the teak staircase is a south facing reception room with a double width balcony with views over the podium and flower beds.
The kitchen has the original Brooke Marine cupboards, four ring stainless steel hob, stainless steel wash basin inset to the worktop and the garchey waste disposal system.

There is a good sized dining area with space for additional storage or a table and chairs.

The property is well presented, and has a bright airy feel. Ben Jonson House is well located for access to Barbican Tube Station, the new Crossrail Station at Farringdon ( due to open at the end of 2021) and the wealth of entertainment and shopping facilities the City of London and Clerkenwell has to offer.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious Three Bedroom House with further loft room and private South-East facing garden, conveniently located within a quiet cul-de-sac within the Hillmarton Conservation Area moments from Caledonian Park, Caledonian Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line), and within easy reach of Kings Cross/St Pancras International.

Looking out across landscaped gardens, this naturally bright Freehold House boasts a wealth of natural light as well as offering flexible internal living accommodation of approximately 1131 SqFt. The entrance hall takes you past the cloakroom W.C. Into the newly fitted open-plan Kitchen / dining room where there is a range of wall and base units and large preparation area all finished with tile splashback. The adjacent reception room boasts lots of entertaining space and leads directly onto the private garden through double floor to ceiling glass paned doors where there is a combination of mature lawn, planters and hard slab for seating.

The first floor comprises of two large double bedrooms with well-proportioned third bedroom and recently installed three piece family bathroom finished with tile surround and floor. The loft room has been fully insulated and fitted with a velux window making it ideal for a home office or study whilst providing more built in storage in the eaves.

There are diverse local shopping facilities on Holloway Road including Waitrose, cafés and independent fresh food market at the Nags Head. Further shops and entertainment outlets in Upper Street, Camden Town, Highbury Barn and green parks at Hampstead Heath can be reached via a short bus ride or on bike from this prominent location.

The immediate area is serviced extensively by transport links including Caledonian Road Underground Station which is just 7 minutes’ walk, along with other stations including Holloway Road Underground Station and Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground Station. address: Carriage House, City North, Finsbury Park, London N4
detailedDescription:
*Virtual Tour Available!*

Looking for a bright 6th-floor apartment in a modern development – with a private south-facing balcony and a residents rooftop garden?

This one-bed with floor-to-ceiling windows and underfloor heating lies in the heart of the vibrant and cosmopolitan Finsbury Park community – perfectly placed within easy reach of the Tube, the National Rail, and the expansive green space of Finsbury Park itself.

As you step through onto the engineered timber flooring of your new entrance hall, youll find a contemporary bathroom on your left, with soft overhead spotlights, a Villeroy & Boch basin under a recessed vanity mirror, and a glazed-screen rain-style shower over an integrated bath – all beautifully finished with dark wooden panelling on bespoke cabinetry storage, contrasted against porcelain and ceramic tiling on the walls and floor.

Further down the entrance hall, youll come to a large storage and utility room on your left before entering the south-facing double bedroom, with a full-height integrated mirrored wardrobe and a floor-to-ceiling window for maximum natural light.

Across from the bedroom, youll step through into a deep and long open-plan living area. To your right, youll find a bright and contemporary kitchen, finished with stone worktops and glass splashbacks, and fitted with fully integrated Bosch appliances (including a touch-control induction hob, a combination oven, a full-height fridge-freezer, and an integrated dishwasher).

Opposite the kitchen area, youll be met with an abundance of natural light pouring in through the floor-to-ceiling glass of the south-facing private balcony. Its the perfect relaxing spot to admire the far-reaching views out to the horizon and the Central London skyline – or a quiet extra space when youre entertaining guests.

Beyond the walls of your stunning home, youll be a part of the City North residential development, with a range of exclusive facilities on your doorstep. As a resident, youll have access to:

* A 2,000-square-foot Landscaped Rooftop Garden at the nearby Pavilion
* A Residents Wi-fi Lounge
* A 24-hour Concierge Service
* On-site Bicycle Storage
* And a private Roof Terrace on the 10th floor of Carriage House.

Youll be just a 5-minute walk from Finsbury Park Station, giving you close access to two of the most convenient Tube lines in London – the Victoria Line, for a 9-minute trip to Oxford Street or a 4-minute trip to Kings Cross, and the Piccadilly Line, for a 14-minute trip to Covent Garden, Holborn, or Leicester Square.

Youll also be just 5 minutes from the National Rail service, for trains as far as Cambridge and Peterborough, as well as being just a 5-minute walk from the expansive green spaces of Finsbury Park, with 110 acres of open fields and natural beauty right on your doorstep.

This nearly new one-bed in the heart of Finsbury Park comes with its own private balcony, south-facing natural light, and an exclusive residents rooftop terrace.

And that means it wont be on the market for long.

So if youre looking for a fully equipped and untouched property with extensive transport links to take you all over the city, give us a call and well show you everything City North has to offer.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Stow Brothers are excited to present this new waterside one bedroom apartment within an exciting new development.

Boasting a spacious balcony with peaceful west facing views towards the reservoir and the internal courtyard. The development provides use of a modern gym, swimming pool, residents lounge & 24 hour concierge service for residence use only.

A sleek modern design with a great high quality finish. Offering comprehensive links to the city with a commute time of 15 minutes to Central London.

A landmark development transforming 64 acres of land into a picturesque, sustainable and award winning modern development.

At the forefront of this development is the integration of its vibrant surroundings of nature. Making a fluid design between the outdoor and indoor space, committing to preserving energy and protecting the environment. Working hand in hand with the London Wildlife Trust, maintaining a habitat for many species to co-exist with its local residence.

Explore your local area with great amenities & transport links on your doorstop. Within the development itself you have everything you need it couldn't be more convenient; gym, 24 hour concierge, schools, health centre, fruit & veg store, post office, Zer cafe and much more.

If that wasn't enough you have fantastic transport links within a short walking distance of the property. Taking you to Central London in a flash. A 4 minute walk to Manor house station, making it possible to be in Oxford Circus within 15 minutes. The line is part of the night tube service providing 24 hour service on Fridays and Saturdays to aid with any late nights out.

This bright and airy flat offers high ceilings throughout and over 780 sqft of internal living space comprising of two double bedrooms, a large reception room with bay windows and original features, a recently updated bathroom and a separate kitchen leading out to its own well maintained private south facing rear garden. The property also benefits from secure communal storage for bicycles located under the stairs at the entrance to the terrace.

Highbury Grange is nestled between Highbury Fields and the family friendly Clissold Park. The prestigious Highbury Barn is less than 2 minutes walk with its selection of amenities including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Meek & Wild Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield. The location has access to a wide selection of exceptional local school and also benefits from excellent transport links, including from Highbury & Islington, Arsenal, Drayton Park, Canonbury and Finsbury Park stations.

address: The Makers, Nile Street, London, Greater London N1
detailedDescription:
The Makers is a residential development of 175 new homes, including studios, two and three-bedroom apartments and family duplexes. Tucked away from City Road, between the vibrancy and dynamism of the Shoreditch area and the financial district of the City of London, the location provides a quiet retreat within the capital.

A generous provision of private communal facilities includes a screening room, two landscaped garden terraces, a gym, a treatment room and three lounges, perfect for ad-hoc meetings. The sensitive modern design conceived by Avanti Architects ensures the building responds to its environment by referencing the surrounding warehouse typology, but reinventing it for contemporary residents.

The co located school; New Regent-s College, will provide 150 pupil places, between the ages of 5 and 16, all housed within a state-of-the art facility. Additional facilities will include a multi-use games area, sports hall and community hall, all of which will be available for hire by the local community and new residents.

A breathtaking double-height entrance lobby hosts a 24/7 concierge, providing peace of mind, secure mail and delivery services, and access to bookable facilities. With interior design by Woods Bagot, the material palette takes inspiration from the 1920s – a stunning feature wall, terrazzo flooring, bespoke lighting, custom furniture, brass details and smoked oak chevron floors set the tone for what is to follow.

- Concierge

- Lobby & Library Lounge

- Screening Room

detailedDescription:
A substantial Grade II listed house overlooking Myddelton Square.

Location

Myddelton Square is the largest square in Clerkenwell and is widely considered as the most desirable. Dating back to around 1820, the square retains its historic appearance today, protected by Grade II listing and designated as a conservation area. Situated in the square is St Mark's Church with playground, trees and gardens.

The surrounding area is well served for transport and local amenities; Angel is a few minutes North, Clerkenwell to the South and King's Cross to the West.

Description

An imposing grade II listed house positioned on the South side of Myddelton Square.

The internal floor area exceeds 3,000 square feet, arranged over five floors which is currently configured as five bedrooms, three reception rooms and three bathrooms.

The rear of the house faces South and the far reaching views from the rear windows look directly at St Pauls Cathedral.

Square Footage: 3057 sq ft

address: Gate House, Southgate Grove, London N1
detailedDescription:
This wonderful two-bedroom apartment in Gate House has been the recent subject of a complete renovation by its current owners. A sensitive set of interventions have brought hardwood floors, a contemporary kitchen and striking green tiles to the bright, flowing set of internal spaces. The apartment has a private balcony at the rear and is located in the heart of De Beauvoir, a short walk from the restaurants, pubs and cafes of De Beauvoir village.

The Tour

Access is gained on the first floor of Gate House, a three storey apartment block set back from Southgate Grove behind communal lawns, which are lined with well-kept hedgerows.

The apartment’s traditional plan has been opened up to create a wonderful set of flowing spaces, centred around a bright, expansive living room with engineered oak floorboards underfoot and a new, tiled fireplace. A glazed door to the eastern aspect provides access to the balcony, which enjoys verdant views across the communal gardens and towards De Beauvoir.

A new kitchen adjoins the living room, with Corian worktops, a new induction hob and sleek, pale green units. This room has dual aspect windows, allowing natural light to pour through the plan. A dining area has been set up to one side. The current owners have installed a brand new boiler and have reengineered the central heating system throughout.

The main bedroom is generously sized, with dual aspect windows, a built-in wardrobe and a newly installed wrought-iron radiator. The second bedroom is currently configured as a home office with plenty of storage space. A new bathroom has been created by knocking through a separate bathroom and WC to create one larger space. Deep green tiles line the walls, while large format concrete tiles run underfoot. There is a large walk-in shower to one side with a heated towel rail, as well as a new basin and stand, with a built-in mirrored cabinet.

The apartment comes with its own storage unit on the ground floor.

The Area

Gate House is brilliantly positioned for the pubs, restaurants, shops and cafes of both Islington and Dalston. The De Beauvoir Deli Co is a firm favourite with locals, offering locally sourced produce, alongside seasonal fruit and vegetables, plus sandwiches and salads. The Scolt Head and De Beauvoir Arms are both excellent local pubs renowned for their food and atmosphere. Regent’s Canal is within easy reach and can be used as a pleasant footpath to the rest of east London, providing access to the excellent Towpath cafe, galleries such as Victoria Miro and Parasol Unit, and Broadway Market. The green spaces of London Fields, Stonebridge Gardens and Shoreditch Park are all close by.

Haggerston Station is less than five minutes’ walk away, where the Overground provides connections to Canary Wharf via Canada Water. Regular buses run to the City and beyond from Kingsland Road.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 95 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £1,000 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £9 per annum
Council Tax Band: C

A superb apartment set over the 1st floor of a converted period building with an amazing private roof terrace, minutes from Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland stations.

The internal accommodation consists of a large open-plan living-kitchen arrangement, a generous double bedroom with a sumptuous master ensuite, a second bedroom that could ideally be used as a guest room or home office and a full three-piece main bathroom suite.

The main living area provides direct access onto a one of a kind private roof terrace, which is circa. 550sqft. Providing significant entertaining space and gets bathed in natural sunlight when the weather allows.
Situated just minutes from both Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland, the property is well placed for those seeking a short commute into the City, while the many pubs, restaurants and cafes of nearby De Beauvoir and Dalston are within easy walking distance to the east.

To the west, the apartment is also within close proximity to Highbury Corner, all of the amenities available along Islington's ever-popular Upper Street, and both Highbury & Islington and Canonbury Stations. Providing Victoria Line and Overground Services to the West End and the wider area.

The flat is finished simply in white and has a tranquil, contemporary feel throughout. On the first level (third floor) there are two double bedrooms and two bathrooms (one en-suite) and built in storage. No need for commuting here, from Wakely Street, Islington's Upper Street is a short stroll to the North, while fashionable Clerkenwell and the City are around a fifteen minute walk South. address: Basterfield House, Golden Lane Estate, City Of London, London EC1Y
detailedDescription:
A top floor, two bedroom duplex in this Grade II listed estate. This lovely flat has a dual aspect and retains many of the original features.

Entrance hall with the original slate floor tiles lead to the kitchen which has a window with a north aspect, grey gloss cabinets, washing machine, and dishwasher to remain, integrated hob and oven, wooden worktop, open shelving and original glass divider to the reception room. A south facing reception room with the original parquet flooring leads to a lovely balcony large enough for a table and chairs.

On the top floor there are two double bedrooms, with the master bedroom benefitting from fitted wardrobes. Both have full width windows. The bathroom has a white suite and has been re-tiled, with a high ceiling there is space for a drying rack. The top floor benefits from a number of glass panels in the roof area which let in an abundance of light.

Residents benefit from preferential rates to use the swimming pool, tennis courts and on-site leisure centre.

Designed in the Le Corbusier style by Barbican architects Chamberlain, Powell and Bon, the Golden Lane Estate dates back to the early 1950's.

The location benefits from superb transport links, with Barbican, Old Street, Farringdon and St Paul’s stations all being close by, fast links to all London airports, and the arrival of Crossrail scheduled for 2022. The location itself offers a profusion of alternative eateries and nightlife for which Smithfield and Clerkenwell are well known, and the Barbican Centre which hosts music concerts, theatre performances, film screenings and art exhibitions.

Residents can rent underground parking and additional storage rooms on the estate.

Vendors comments:
"We really enjoy living on the Golden Lane Estate for the following reasons:
- there is a lovely community
- there is much to appreciate design wise (especially as an architect)
- the neighbourhood is great
- and the location is fantastically well connected

The strong sense of community was evident from before I even bought the flat. On the day of my first viewing I got chatting to a neighbour, who was very welcoming and told me how great living on the estate was, he helped me make my mind up to put in an offer.

We have an allotment box (one of fifty), and enjoy being a member of the active allotment community: The Golden Lane Baggers.
When our son was born, we got cards and gifts from many people on our gallery: People we had never met before!

The estate and the blocks are both beautiful and practical.

The flat type we have is relatively unique. Most people know the maisonette type with the cantilever stair and the huge sash window to the balcony. The upper maisonette, has a different stair, heading up straight from the entrance, rather than you needing to enter the living room (this is much more flexible), and whilst not as photogenic, still has an attractive design, with bookshelves integrated into the underside. What the type really enjoys is a roof light across the full width of the flat at the upper level: Bringing in light, allowing space for a drying rack to the bathroom and providing good ventilation.

The whole estate is well thought out, simple things like refuse work well: A chute on each gallery, regular food waste and recycling collection from your door, and large item waste collection points within the estate.

We love the neighbourhood: Whilst busy during the week, it’s very quiet on the weekends. We regularly go the the Barbican, and can walk to Tate Modern in 15 minutes. The sports centre within the estate is very convenient. There are many great places to eat and drink: St John is a favourite.

The flat is really well connecting: This is particularly good for a respective commutes across London (to Paddington & Canary Wharf), keeping them both to 30 minutes. This will be significantly improved with the arrival of Crossrail.<br /><br />

Victorian family house with garden studio flat

Location

Gillespie Road is an attractive Highbury road and a short walk to Blackstock Road and the Barn with a wonderful array of independent shops. Located close to Arsenal tube station on the Piccadilly Line which is only three stops to Kings Cross. There are also numerous bus routes nearby giving access to the City and West End. Across the road is the hidden gem of Gillespie Park and Highbury Park is a short walk away.

Description

This Victorian home offers wonderful accommodation throughout. The current owners have extended into the loft and have a studio flat at the rear of the garden - perfect for those working from home or for guests. The house mixes period features with beautiful modern elements. On the ground floor are the double reception room with classic features such as period fireplace and surround. The kitchen/dining room to the rear has been extended to the side and has a stunning and massive modern door leading out to the rear garden. At the end of garden is a very stylish studio with shower room and kitchenette.

On the first floor are three double bedrooms and family bathroom and the principal bedroom is on the upper floor with en suite shower room and dressing room.

The light throughout the house is wonderful - very bright and airy.

The rear garden is South facing and offers two areas of real grass and astro turf - perfect for families with young children.

Description
Recently coming to prominence as Midtown, the area linking Fitzrovia, Clerkenwell, Bloomsbury, Covent Garden & High Holborn provides an exciting range of residential property from character period houses and conversions to iconic modern blocks.
With your Central London home close to Holborn and with easy access to Theatreland, Kingsway & Lincoln's Inn, you will be ideally placed to get around the area. Whether for work or leisure, this is the perfect location from which to reach an outstanding range of shopping, entertainment and eateries, including World-Renowned shopping areas such as Oxford Street and Bond Street, Cinema, Theatre and Opera around Leicester Square, Drury Lane and Shaftsbury Avenue and the famous eateries of Covent Garden, Soho and Chinatown, whilst Bloomsbury to the North has been a fashionable part of London for over 250 years, and contains some of London's finest parks as well as being well known for numerous Health-Care institutions, including the bma, gosh, ucl and the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery, this sought-after residential area is also home to the British Museum, British Library and the University of London's central bodies and departments.
Easy access is afforded across London with the superb network of buses.The Piccadilly & Central Line Underground are both available from Holborn Station, whilst Kings Cross, St Pancras and Charing Cross Stations are less than a mile away and provide links to the rest of the UK and Europe
