detailedDescription:
FastMove are proud to present this well presented and generous sized three bedroom maisonette which is split over two floors.

Situated in this popular residential location, the property is close to a number of local amenities including a comprehensive range of shops, stylish pop-up boutiques, food outlets and bars.

The property is incredibly well served with transport links as the immediate area is serviced by a number of transport links including the Underground stations of Holloway Road, Finsbury Park, and Archway as well as the Holloway Road station on the Overground. There are also a number of bus routes within close proximity which give access to a number of destinations including the West End, Kings Cross and the City.

Through a doorway leads into the
Entrance hallway


The property benefits from a warm and welcoming Hallway, the perfect place for coats and shoes. An internal door leads to the Kitchen and
Lounge


The property benefits from a bright and airy reception room with space for a number of pieces of furniture, the perfect place to sit back and relax. To the front aspect of the room is a large D/G window allowing excellent levels of natural light. There is also a wall mounted gas fire with surround and hearth giving the room a focal point and cosy feel.
Breakfast kitchen


The Kitchen has an array of wall and base units fitted with complimentary worksurfaces. The Kitchen benefits from a single sink and drainer, gas cooker with overhead extractor, space for Fridge, Freezer and plumbing for a Washing Machine. The Kitchen also benefits from a useful storage cupboard, D/G window and is decorated with tiles to the walls and stylish flooring. There is also enough space for a Dining Table and chairs in the centre of the room, perfect to entertain family and friends.

From the Hallway a staircase leads to the first floor landing

The property boasts a rare and spacious landing which is complimented by a useful storage cupboard and has internal doors to all three Bedrooms and the House Bathroom.
Principal bedroom


This lovely property benefits from a spacious principal Bedroom which has plenty of space for a double bed and free standing furniture. Benefiting from built in wardrobes and a D/G window.
Bedroom two


Another spacious Bedroom with plenty of room for a bed and free standing furniture. Benefiting from a D/G window.
Bedroom three


A generous sized third Bedroom with useful storage cupboard. The room has plenty of space for a bed and free standing furniture.
Bathroom


A spacious family Bathroom which comprises of a three piece suite including a walk-in shower cubicle with wall mounted rainfall head, low flush W/C and wash hand basin built onto a useful vanity unit. The room is decorated with tiles to the walls and stylish flooring and benefits from a chrome towel rail and frosted D/G window.

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Litchfields are pleased to offer a very stylish 3 bed mews house set in a peaceful, gated, cobbled mews. This charming house, converted from Victorian workshops, offers versatile living and entertaining space over 3 floors. Very well presented throughout the house features a very spacious, open plan living-dining and kitchen area on the first floor with solid maple flooring and access to a balcony. There is also a separate study on this level. The three double bedrooms (master with en-suite bathroom) are arranged on the ground floor along with a family bathroom and the top floor provides a lovely conservatory opening on to a spacious decked roof terrace, perfect for Summer parties. Further benefits include, ample built-in storage, newly replaced (2019) double glazed wood framed windows and allocated parking.
The front exterior of the house was repainted and new rainwater guttering was fitted in 2020.
This quiet and secluded mews is a stone’s throw from local shops, amenities and green spaces and is within easy walking distance of Archway underground station (zone 2) and Upper Holloway over ground station. EPC - D

detailedDescription:
This upper floors flat is one of two of which we have to offer in this imposing Georgian building. Set over three floors and across over 1000sq.ft. With a reception room bathed in natural light thanks to the large sash windows front facing. This room is justly sized with more than enough room to accommodate dining facilities. The kitchen is also present on this floor. Heading upstairs there are three munificently sized double bedrooms as well as a modern bathroom crowned with a generously sized bathtub

Offord Road is positioned in the village themed Barnsbury Conservation Area which falls a stone’s throw away from Islington’s main attraction Upper Street. Transport links to the City and the West End are available at Highbury & Islington, Caledonian Road & Barnsbury and Angel. Barnsbury itself offers a wonderful selection of famous gastro pubs such as The Drapers Arms and The Albion, the green open spaces of Highbury Fields are also within easy reach.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Filled with light and bursting with character, this eclectic five-bedroom townhouse has been lovingly looked after and cleverly re-jigged into the perfect space for modern family living.

Brickworks Says

Opening the door of this handsome house, you walk through the traditional hallway to be greeted by the most wonderful open plan living room, flowing seamlessly through to the modern kitchen extension and idyllic garden. From there, it's a hop and a skip down the garden path to the versatile garden room, currently being used as a studio.

The sense of light and space is abundant, and it's easy to see why the owners have called this home for nearly 30 years now.

The first and second floors mirror each other with two spacious double bedrooms and adjacent bathrooms on each, avoiding the need for any family disputes! The traditional sash windows have been carefully updated with reinforced double glazing to keep out the winter chills, and bespoke storage has been cleverly woven into the layout to keep clutter at bay.

Then it's onwards and upwards to the top floor where a loft extension has created a fifth bedroom, while still maintaining ample eves storage to house the stuff of life.

A subtle palette of soft, muted tones throughout lets the period details sing and offers the opportunity for personalisation at every turn.

The Owners Say

There are so many things to love! Our family has been able to grow up on a quiet, friendly street with everything they could need or want just around the corner. The close proximity to the primary school avoids the worry of catchment areas, and the local sports centre and cinema are both under ten minutes walk away.

Beautiful Hampstead Heath is just a short car ride and there’s always a resident parking space available on your return. And if you’d rather just hunker down at home we’ve always found our sunny garden to be an oasis of calm.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current energy efficiency rating of D.

Part of the Borough of Islington, the property falls into the Council Tax Band F (£2,280 in 2021/22).

Currently monthly utility cost run at Gas £70, Electricity £60 & Water £53.

The house sits in Parking Zone F. Permit costs depend on vehicle type and emissions.

Holloway Road tube is just 10 minutes walk away.

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

detailedDescription:
Final remaining apartments!

These homes boast fantastic travel links being in Zone 2 and just a short stroll away from both Finsbury Park and Arsenal Stations with connections all across the City. Not forgetting the open spaces of Finsbury Park, trendy Upper Street and Camden Town just moments away, everything you need is right on your doorstep.

Life is a patchwork and we’ve got it all sewn up!

What is Shared Ownership?

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 25% - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

About Patchworks So

A stunning collection of 1,2 & 3 bedroom Shared Ownership apartments set in Finsbury Park.

Opening Hours

Mon-Fri 9am-5pm

Modern and bright 2 bedroom 2nd floor flat in a modern low rise development with host of benefits including one allocated parking, 24 hours concierge, resident gym, sauna and steam room and a courtyard communal garden situated right next to a local park in a quiet location yet close to local shops and buses. 10 mins walk from Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Train Station and only 15 mins from King Cross Station and all amenities there.

This comfortable accommodation features a good size living room with juliet balcony over looking the courtyard garden, compact modern open plan kitchen with appliances, 2 bedrooms with fitted wardrobes to master, nice bathroom with shower, heating, double glazing, wooden floorings, security entry phone, 24 hours concierge.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A split-level duplex apartment with a fantastic roof terrace a mere stone’s throw away from Angel station and a short five minute stroll from Islington’s highly fashionable and trendy Upper Street. This particular apartment is one of two situated in this 18th century Georgian terraced property. Moderately altered to keep up with the demands of upscale modern living with its high finish and quality fixtures and fittings, whilst keeping its historical integrity and those features that give its charm and quintessential Georgian look. Exposed brick feature walls adds an element of character to an already modern and contemporary property. Double-glazed sash windows and engineered wood floors are complemented by a fitted kitchen (comprised of Samsung appliances), en suite bathroom, and video entry system. Both floors are east-west dual aspect and the apartment has been skillfully designed to exploit the wonderful levels of natural light.

The main living area on the second level gives direct access to the apartment's large terrace towards the rear of the property. The terrace is peaceful and has a triple aspect, it benefits from all-day sun for the majority of the year. The top-floor stairwell and half-landing provide additional storage, while the huge top-floor bedroom boasts high ceilings and spectacular views.

With the famed Chapel Market nearby, Penton Street is surrounded by a charming mix of local independent stores and eateries. Islington and Clerkenwell are home to a diverse range of boutiques, high-end fashion and décor retailers, as well as various bars and restaurants. Many garden squares and small parks are close, and the Regent's Canal towpath provides a convenient pedestrian and cycling route to Regent's Park.

The apartment is less than a mile from King's Cross and has good access to the City and West End by foot, bike, or public transportation.
features: ['Outside Space', 'Brand New Refurbishment', 'Roof Terrace', 'Exposed Brickwork in Bedroom', 'Upper Street Close By', 'Chain Free', 'Balcony', 'Double Bedrooms']
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
In the heart of Hoxton is this smart, one-bedroom flat with its own south-facing balcony. Crisply redecorated to make the most of the space and its unique proportions, this flat is a quiet haven perched above the buzz all around.

Brickworks Says

Clean lines, an airy aspect and sweeping views define this one-bedroom flat with private balcony on the third floor of a venerable block built in 1950. There’s a remarkable sense of quiet self-containment to this space—quite a feat, considering it looks down on one of the liveliest stretches of the East End. The living room, nestled into the Deco-esque curve of the building and opening onto the south-facing balcony, is a whitewashed suntrap, perfect for entertaining, inside and out. The peaceful bedroom has plenty of storage, including original built-ins. The subway-tiled bath and kitchen feel somewhat Scandi-fresh, and there’s even a separate WC - a rare (and handy) reminder of the building’s post-war roots.

East London’s greatest hits are on the doorstep. Shoreditch Park and the meandering towpath along Regent’s Canal, all the way to Victoria Park. Columbia Road and Broadway Markets. Recently opened Curzon cinema right around the corner. The shops, pubs, restaurants, museums and nightlife from Hackney to Shoreditch to Bethnal Green. There are transport links aplenty, but the City is walkable in about 20 minutes, making the morning commute a stress-free hoof.

The Owners Say

We have loved our time on Fanshaw Street—near the water and the City, with giddy London on either side. Whilst it is predominantly a small residential street, it feels like the crossroads of Hoxton, with two lively main streets, Hoxton and Pitfield, at either end, both packed full of bars, restaurants and cafes, and frequented by the brash, outrageous and free.

Our favourite Hoxton haunts: Rapsa@100 Hoxton, an Asian/Euro crossover great for indulgent weekends as well as special day events in an intimate, industrial-chic space; The Lion & Lamb, an arty audiophile gastropub serving up a smorgasbord of deluxe sandwiches, Brazilian jazz, craft beer and everything in between; Friends of Ours, an independent, Antipodean-style cafe, which does great food but mainly mind-blowing coffee from exceedingly knowledgeable baristas; The George & Vulture, London’s tallest pub, but also a great place for pizza and some brilliant weekly quizzes.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current Energy Efficiency Rating of C.

In the Borough of Hackney, the flat falls into Council Tax Band B (£1,175.76 in 2020/21).

One of 59 in the building, the flat is leasehold with 92 years remaining and a monthly service charge of £93.21, including ground rent.

The property is being sold chain-free.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

detailedDescription: Chain free! A very well presented terraced house situated within a highly sought after gated Victorian cobbled mews. The accommodation seamlessly blends character and charm with contemporary living to include: Two bedrooms and bathroom on the ground floor, stunning open plan reception leading to dining area and kitchen at first floor level and further bedroom/additional reception leading directly to roof terrace at second floor level. Benefits include: No onward chain, allocated off street parking space, attractive roof terrace at second floor level, high ceilings at first and second floor levels and in main bedroom. The property is within close proximity of the popular Landseer Arms gastro pub, the green space of Whittington Park together with transport facilities including Archway underground (Northern Line) station and Upper Holloway overground station and the ever popular Yerbury primary school. We believe the only way to fully appreciate this stunning property is by arranging an early appointment to view. Sole agent.

detailedDescription: A well-presented incredibly spacious split level one-bedroom apartment located on the top floor of this Victorian conversion, with plenty of natural light and high ceilings throughout. The property is in good condition throughout with 838sqft/77.9sqm of living space. Comprising of a bright reception room, separate modernised kitchen, bathroom & a very generous double bedroom with plenty of storage space. Due to the size there is potential for reconfiguration and to create a second bedroom (subject to planning permission). Digby Crescent is a desirable and peaceful Road, well located in close proximity to shops, cafes, and minutes’ walk to Stoke Newington, as well as local parks (Clissold Park, Gillespie Nature Reserve and Woodberry Wetlands) are all on your doorstep. The location is served by unparalleled access to Zone Two Victoria/Piccadilly lines, Overground and National Rail, and regular local bus routes.

detailedDescription:
Available to view 7 days A week

Victorstone are delighted to market this expansive 4 double bedroom top floor apartment with separate kitchen to reception and large private balcony in Highbury, N5.

A short stroll away from Arsenal, Finsbury Park and Drayton Park stations, this enviably located property allows for quick and easy access across the City. Local amenities include Clissold Park, Highbury Fields, the Emirates Stadium and the plethora of bars, pubs and restaurants that Highbury and Islington have to offer.

The apartment itself briefly comprises of 4 spacious bedrooms, a large reception room with direct access to the generously proportioned private balcony overlooking the green communal gardens, separate kitchen sit in kitchen (also with access to the balcony), built-in storage throughout and bathroom with separate WC.

Other benefits include: Communal gardens, gas central heating throughout, double glazing and the ability to obtain permit parking.

Offered to market with vacant possession, early viewings are highly recommended.

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Impressive and spacious upper maisonette with two double bedrooms within easy reach of Kings Cross and Angel.

Location

This property is within easy walking distance to Kings Cross which has undergone a spectacular regeneration over recent times and is now London's most exciting new social hubs.

Kings Cross station is the best connected station in London, with six Underground lines (Circle, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City, Northern, Piccadilly, Victoria). Other parts of London and the UK can be reached by its comprehensive National Rail links, and Europe reached directly via the Eurostar. Both stations have benefited from extensive refurbishment making the station concourses destinations in themselves with various shops, restaurants and bars.

Description

This large maisonette is arranged over the upper two floors of this gorgeous Victorian stucco fronted terraced house. It has a shared entrance hallway leading to the private entrance on the ground floor. The reception is on the first floor, with large windows, working fireplace, high ceilings and a beautiful Victorian fireplace. Behind there is a well-sized kitchen with stylish white units and plenty of space for a dining table to seat 6-8 people. On the second floor there are two large bedrooms, one of the bedrooms has plenty of built-in storage. The bathroom is well-appointed and stands between the bedrooms. The property is very quiet and is double glazed throughout.

This upper maisonette is offered to the market chain free and offers fabulous space in this prime central Islington location.

Square Footage: 1018 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 177 years remaining

address: Riverside Apartments, Goodchild Road, London N4
detailedDescription:
A stunning three bedroom penthouse apartment in an award-winning development.

Location

Located at Woodberry Down development, spanning over 67 acres of open water and landscaped parkland, you are part of superb community which is extremely well-connected. By foot, you can enjoy a riverside walk within the unique waterside community surrounded by nature. The reservoirs offer a variety of activities which are very popular with families and individuals of all ages. Woodberry Down lies 8 minutes by Tube to King's Cross and only 20 minutes to The City. Just to the west is Finsbury Park, while to the south lies Stoke Newington, with lots of independent shops and cafés, pubs, bars, arts spaces and picturesque parkland to explore

Description

This stunning modern three bedroom penthouse apartment in award-winning waterside development. Riverside Apartments is a beautifully designed residential development within the Woodberry Down development and is positioned by the famous reservoirs of Woodberry Wetlands, offering breath-taking views across the water and London. This highly sought after home with floor to ceiling double glazed windows and underfloor heating throughout, offers far-stretching views, and excellent natural light. Spacious in size, over a lateral floor plan, the layout of the home offers perfect separation from the living space and sleeping area. The living room and open-plan kitchen is finished with premium standard engineered wooden floors consisting of a large high-specification kitchen, with built-in appliances. Open plan to a generously sized living room area, which leads on to your large private balcony with panoramic views. To the front of the apartment there are 3 large double bedrooms, with a high graded tile flooring en-suite bathroom and dressing area to the primary bedroom and fantastic storage space throughout.

Square Footage: 1022 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 990 years remaining

detailedDescription:
An exceptional three bedroom house on Frome Street

Location

Frome Street is an attractive residential street located just off St. Peter's Street and close to the Regent's Canal in the heart of central Islington. Angel Underground Station is 05 miles approximately (northern line). Islington's vibrant Upper Street with its fashionable shops, bars and restaurants are also within easy reach.

Description

A charming Victorian house moments from Upper Street and Regents Canal. The property has been subject to major refurbishment over recent years providing flexible accommodation and offers two or three bedrooms, utility room and a wonderful open plan kitchen dining room with bi-folding doors to the garden connecting the two spaces very stylishly. An attractive westerly facing roof terrace accessed via the reception room.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful Two Double Bedroom Edwardian Conversion with private rear garden, located within the Hillmarton Conservation Area, near to Highbury, Central Islington, Tufnell Park and moments from Holloway Road & Caledonian Road Underground Stations.

Originally Built circa 1901, a typical style of the Edwardian Period, this red brick conversion occupying the entire ground floor provides wonderful lateral living space extending to nearly 800 SqFt. Entering through a private front door, the hallway opens up to a large reception room complete with oversized bay window, high ceilings with beautiful mouldings and decorative fireplace with tiled hearth. The main bedroom and second bedroom both overlook the garden and bathe in natural light entered from the sash windows, whilst the main bedroom features an original decorative fireplace and bespoke fitted wardrobes.

The bathroom has been finished in contemporary style with full bath tub, wall mounted shower and controls, floating wash basin and low level W.C, finished with tile surround. Following on down the expansive hall way, the spacious open-plan kitchen / dining room with range of wall and base units has been finished in a classical style complete with solid wood worktops. Accessed from the kitchen, the private rear garden provides further entertainment space with stone patio area and wooden decking laid to mature flower beds.

Widdenham Road is a quiet leafy side avenue moments from a number of amenities including a range of independent coffee shops, eateries and gastro pubs. Larger shops close by include Waitrose, James Selby department store and Boots. Popular Granary Square at Kings Cross and Upper Street provide a broader range of boutique shops, restaurants and entertainment facilities.

Holloway Road Underground Station is located just 5 minutes’ walk (Google) giving direct access to the Piccadilly Line. Caledonian Road Underground Station and Drayton Park Station are also within easy walking distance whilst bus routes including 17,91 and 259 (some 24hr services) provide quick and direct access to the West End, City and Kings Cross/St Pancras International.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Within a grand Late Victorian semi-detached Villa, this bright and airy converted studio apartment is set to the rear of the building, enjoying sumptuous verdant views of the rear garden of Tufnell Park and towards Highgate Hill. The most prominent features are the high ceilings, cast iron inset fireplace, sash windows and dedicated storage. The accommodation includes a large studio room, separate kitchen with space for a breakfast bar, and bathroom.

External side access leads to one of the most exceptional gardens in Tufnell Park - over 80ft in length, with both lawn and seating areas, secluded by trees shrubs & mature borders, and shared with the other three residents of the building.

Carleton Road runs off Brecknock Road, which runs along the western end of Tufnell Park, and backs on to the popular Montpelier Gardens. The area offers superb local schools, and is conveniently located for the ever-changing High Streets of Kentish Town, Tufnell Park and Fortess Road. A wide selection of restaurants, bars, independent organic food shops, bakeries & butchers are all within a few minutes walk.

The attractive green vistas of Parliament Hill Fields and Hampstead Heath are also nearby, offering leisurely walks and sporting activities. Tufnell Park and Kentish Town underground and Thameslink stations are both within 10 minutes walk.

detailedDescription:
Recently refurbished, this imposing period house boasts plenty of bedrooms and bathrooms. A separate kitchen can be found to the rear of the building which overlooks the private garden.

With a little imagination this could be an impressive family home…

The ground floor could be reconfigured to create a generous reception to the front of the house. A side return (subject to the usual consents) would open up the kitchen/ diner, allowing for more natural light and increasing the overall footprint (adding to the entertaining space and value).

The first floor could be reconfigured to accommodate a large double bedroom and generous en-suite, a spare WC and a study to the rear (quiet and ideal for studying or working from home).

A slight modification to the second floor could be made to the bathroom, allowing for it to be used by the occupants of either of the two bedrooms.

A spare bedroom can be found on the top floor and benefits from an en-suite bathroom, ample storage and magnificent views over London.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully finished three bedroom flat, arranged across the top floor of a purpose built block located on Highbury New Park, N5. After undergoing a complete transformation including a new boiler, bathroom and kitchen, not to mention refurbishment throughout, this home is in exceptional condition and leaves very little to be desired.

Set on a quiet residential street, the property is moments from Canonbury station and offers excellent access to the independent village like high street of Newington Green, which plays host to a wealth of quaint and independent cafes, bars, restaurants and shops. The property is also within easy reach of the social hotspots of Islington's Upper Street, and Hackney's Dalston and Stoke Newington Church Street. Highbury and Islington is the nearest tube station, and the area is served by a number of bus routes that connect well with The City and Westend.

What the owner says;
We have loved living here and it has fulfilled all of our needs enormously. Being on the top floor we look out to the tree tops that line the quiet street to the front, and communal gardens to the back (where in the distance you can often spot The Shard!) We are right on top of Canonbury station which takes you into Shoreditch in less than 10 minutes or you can walk to the city in 45 minutes. In fact - we've been so central that most of the time our friends and family all end up meeting in this area - plus we have some of the best pubs (with beers gardens!) Our favourite probably being the Alwyne Castle. The New London Cafe which is just opposite does an excellent (and very reasonably priced) brunch. It's great to have the green spaces of Clissold Park and Highbury fields so close.

Full details Flooded with early afternoon sun, the sought after type 32 ( identical to a type 31) apartment located on the Fifth Floor with West facing views. The reception room has a treble width full height glass elevations with one sliding door/window, a well proportioned room with dining/study area. The large double bedroom is quietly located off an internal hallway with separate w/c and full family bathroom. Large new style kitchen opening into the dining area.Underfloor heating throughout included in the service charge. Lift. Built in 1971, the Barbican Estate is the finest achievement of the architects Chamberlin, Powell & Bon. The architects drew inspiration from Le Corbusier, famous for being one of the pioneers of what now is called Modern architecture. Their vision has created a unique urban village community devoid of traffic with immediate amenities including the Barbican Arts Centre, a church, school, library and shops. The estate was Grade ii-listed in 2001 in recognition of its extraordinary contribution to London's urban landscape. Barbican tube station (on the Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) is only a couple of minutes' walk away, with Moorgate (on the Northern line), St Paul's (on the Central line) and Mansion House (on the District line) tube stations each within a short walking distance. Moments walking distance the new Crossrail Station Farringdon Station. This entrance will provide access to the 'East Ticket Hall' linking directly with the existing London Underground platforms at Barbican & Farringdon Stations therefore providing access to the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines. On completion in December 2021 Farringdon Station will be a vital interchange between the North-South Thameslink and the East-West Crossrail service. 140 trains per hour will travel through the station. Crossrail will give direct access to Canary Wharf in 9 minutes & Bond Street in 3 minutes.Waitrose is located nearby on Whitecross Street, which is also home to the weekday Whitecross Street food market. Next door to the Barbican is West Smithfield an area that has seen a huge regeneration, incoming occupiers are small food outlets, coffee shops bars & restaurants providing a buzzing mixed use location. Comprising of many media, digital and creative industries, but increasingly legal, professional and finance. The Museum of London will move to Smithfield Market in 2021. Smithfield Meat Market will be vacating by 2026 ( est) then it are will be transformed into a world beating food & gastro destination and will be part of the world beating Cultural Mile. Also within easy reach are the attractions of St. Pauls' Cathedral, New Change Shopping Complex. The River Thames, Tate Modern, Gabriel's Wharf and South Bank.

address: Grange Street, Bridport Place, London N1
detailedDescription:
This unique two-bedroom house is located on Hoxton Street, a short walk from the shops, bars and restaurants of Shoreditch. Configured across four storeys, it was designed by Leonard Manasseh for the lcc in the 1970s as the street-facing focal point of the Arden Estate. The house, which has two large balconies, has been the subject of an ingenious extension in recent years care of Lynch Architects, who used the penthouse floor as their design studio for a number of years.

The Building

The aesthetic of the building, particularly the prefabricated penthouse addition, was developed against the trend of British high-tech architecture, which favoured layers of glazing and steel cross-bracing. Instead, a largely natural palette of materials has been used; timber frames and birch plywood ceilings not only create a sense of warmth but also serve as structural alternatives to heavily manufactured materials. The result is a series of flowing spaces that reflect the honesty and integrity of their materials.

The Tour

Entry is on the ground floor, where a staircase ascends to the first-floor communal areas. The L-shaped plan has been exploited on this level to allow for two large balconies; the west-facing balcony has the house’s defining external feature, a conservatory with a large vertical section of glazing above that extends to the second floor. The steep pitch of this glazed section not only allows wonderful levels of natural light to stream into the first and second floors, but also echoes the linear sections of glazing on the penthouse level. The conservatory is currently used as a winter garden and is a wonderful spot for breakfast year-round.

The kitchen adjoins the conservatory; this is a calm, considered space with birch plywood cabinetry and space for a dining area. Linoleum floors run across this level and beautiful exposed copper pipes run along sections of the wall. The balcony at the rear faces north towards the Arden Estate; it is accessed via a set of glazed doors which open from the living room.

The second floor contains two bedrooms and a family bathroom. The larger bedroom has plenty of built-in storage space, while the smaller has a large section of sloped glazing with wonderful views.

The penthouse makes up the third floor. Currently configured as a second living room, it also has a WC and a second kitchen. As per Lynch Architects’ instruction, it was constructed offsite and craned onto the existing structure, along with the many glass panes that run around its edge. Oak mullions frame each section of glazing, as well as breathtaking panoramic views of the city beyond. The windows and roof light open to create natural ventilation, while the rooftop lantern acts as a solar chimney.

The Area

The house is positioned on Hoxton Street, which was the centre of the Shoreditch furniture and carpentry trade in the 19th century. Today, Hoxton is renowned for its exciting mix of restaurants, bars and galleries, including Lyle’s, Rochelle Canteen, Shoreditch House, the Blue Mountain School and Victoria Miro gallery. The boutiques and cafes of Redchurch Street and Spitalfields are also nearby.

There are plenty of transport links within walking distance. Hoxton Station runs London Overground services; Liverpool Street Station provides access to the Central, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines, as well as nationwide National Rail services. Old Street Underground station is a short walk away, running Northern Line services across the city.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 91 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £750 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £9 per annum
Freeholder: Hackney Council
Council Tax Band: C

North London's Woodberry Down is an innovative Regeneration Project which, once complete, will feature over 5,500 new homes set in 64 acres adjacent to the spectacular natural surroundings of two existing reservoirs and Finsbury Park, all within a short distance of Central London and the City. It is a sustainable development committed to the natural environment and energy conservation, enhancing the area's abundant wildlife. Master planning for Woodberry Down has focused on creating a sustainable community, with large and improved public open spaces as well as impressive new community facilities.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: A four storey, four bedroom, two bathroom, mid terrace Victorian freehold, situated moments from the greenery of Arlington Square, set within the Arlington Conservation area. Accommodation is generously proportioned comprising; a bright double reception space (currently arranged as bedrooms), bathed in natural45 light courtesy of the dual aspect and benefitting from ornate period details. The lower level houses the spacious kitchen/dining room, which provides access to the secluded garden to the rear. It should be noted that this level features a W.C, with a study positioned on the lower half landing between the raised and lower levels. Two double bedrooms and a bathroom suite occupy the first floor, with a further two double bedrooms and shower room on the top floor. Linton Street is one of the Arlington conservation areas quieter and most sought after roads as there is no access via New North road, moments from the greenery of Arlington Square. The many amenities of Islington Green, Upper Street, Angel and Broadway Market are a short walk away, with the canal providing a wonderful tranquil passage. A plethora of transportation links encompassing' many bus routes to the City and West End van be found at New North Road and Essex Road, with Essex Road station providing National Rail trains to Moorgate. The trendy bars, restaurants, galleries and boutique shops of Hoxton, Shoreditch, London Fields & Old Street are all easily accessible.

address: Melody Lane, Highbury, Islington, London N5
detailedDescription: A stunning and contemporary 3/4 double bedroom, mid-terrace townhouse, set only moments from the community focal point of Highbury Barn. The property is an outstanding example of modern architecture maximising the use of light and space and includes underfloor heating, fitted with both 'Futronix' & 'Erco'' lighting systems, walnut flooring and secure entry phone system. Set within this small, highly regarded, gated mews development just off Highbury Grove, close to the shops of Highbury Barn and the greenery of Highbury Fields. The finish is exemplary and offers a wealth of living and entertaining space over 3 floors. The ground floor is home to a part triple height reception room/ kitchen/ dining/ family room spanning the full length of the property with bi-folding patio doors leading to the private patio garden, guest WC. On the 1st floor can be found a good size double bedroom to the front, with a further bedroom/ home office open to the dining area below, utility room and family bathroom. The top (2nd) floor is home to the master bedroom suite with en suite bathroom and access to a private roof terrace along with a further double bedroom with en-suite shower room. To the rear is a secluded patio garden superb for entertaining, also fitted with 'Erco' lighting. The development won the 2007 riba Housing Design Award. There is also a secure off-street parking space. Melody Lane is supremely well placed for the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields (tennis courts, gym, etc), the shops of Highbury Barn including the renowned Godfreys butchers, fishmongers and Da Marios delicatessen. Transport can be found via a short walk to Canonbury Station (London Overground), with a number of bus routes running along Highbury Park. The property sits between Highbury & Islington station (National Rail, London Overground & Victoria Line), along with Arsenal Underground (Piccadilly Line). The renowned Westerns Laundry & Michelin listed Farang are both superb local eateries.

detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire a 3 double bedroom, 2 bathroom, Grade II listed, Georgian freehold, situated in the heart of Canonbury, moments from Upper Street and the gardens of Canonbury Square. Accommodation is bathed in light and generously proportioned comprising; a fabulous entrance hallway, leading to the double reception space that benefits from a dual aspect and ornate period details including original cornicing and fireplace. The spacious kitchen/dining room is housed at the rear of the ground floor and provides direct access to the manicured and secluded rear garden. The principal bedroom is located on the first floor, which benefits from an en-suite shower room. The family bathroom is also on this floor, with a further 2 double bedrooms positioned on the top floor. It should be noted that there is granted planning permission to convert the basement into habitable space. This is an impressive family home which must be viewed to be truly appreciated. Canonbury Road is positioned behind Upper Street and off of Canonbury Square, moments from the peace and tranquillity of the New River Walk, whilst retaining convenient access to the community focal point of the local shops on Canonbury Place, and within close proximity of the shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street. Transport can be found at Highbury & Islington station (Victoria Line, London Overground and National Rail) with fabulous connections to the City and West End.

detailedDescription:
This attractive one bedroom flat is set within a well maintained purpose built block on one of Islington's most prestigious roads.
The flat is offered in fantastic condition throughout and offers well-proportioned accommodation across 437sqft of internal space. detailedDescription:
Positioned over four floors and totalling close to 1,800 sq ft this four-bedroom townhouse in Barnbsury is located within 0.2 miles of Upper Street. The ground floor boasts an open plan kitchen and reception area with partial double height ceilings leading onto an east facing garden which flows seamlessly with the indoor space. The interiors are minimalist with pops of colour and ample natural light. The kitchen is contemporary with stone work surfaces and built in appliances, the flooring is tiled and complete with under floor heating. The first floor houses a double bedroom with en suite and mezzanine study area overlooking the living space and garden below. The second floor is home to another double bedroom with en suite and finally the top floor is entirely occupied by the principal suite with en suite and terrace.

Situation

Located on the second floor of this converted Victorian residence, this spacious two bedroom apartment has been finished to a high standard having been renovated in recent years.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Rare to the market three bedroom maisonette split over the ground and first floor.

The generous semi-open plan reception room is one of the main features of the property being dual aspect flooding the space with natural light.

There is more than ample space for a dining area making it great to both relax and entertain.

The kitchen is a great size and flows really well with both the dining area and the reception room. It is also fully integrated with all your everyday mod cons.

Access to the private garden is off the reception room again offering plenty of space to relax and to have guests.

Also on the ground floor you will find two large double bedrooms with the second bedroom have huge almost floor to ceiling windows making it bright and further giving you a sense of space.

The family bathroom is also on this floor and is well proportioned and has a full length bath.

There is also a separate WC that is also used as a utility room.

Access to the cellar is off the hallway and is very versatile to your own requirements.

On the first floor you will find the master bedroom that used to be two rooms that indicates the size and potential. The exposed brickwork is a stunning feature and further benefits from a built in wardrobe.

Access to the balcony is off this room and is another great sun trap and adds to the enjoyment of living within the property.

The property is a must see to get a sense of the size of the property and beautiful features that run throughout.

Location:

Alexandra Grove is a quiet tree-lined residential road located between Finsbury Park and Clissold Park.

Also, conveniently located between Stroud Green and Highbury Park with several award-winning bars and restaurants.

For other activities, there is Rowans Ten Pin Bowling and The Park Theatre.

Blackstock Road and Seven Sisters Road are closest for your everyday amenities and supermarkets.

The soon to be finished City North development will further benefit the area with a GymBox, Cineworld and Marks & Spencer.

Transport:

Finsbury Park Underground on the Victoria and Piccadilly Lines and National Rail Station offers quick routes to Central London, the West End and beyond.

Ideal for young families and those looking to upsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended​.

A sensational, two double bedroom period conversion benefitting from it's own private, south-east facing garden in Highbury, N5. Standing close to 650 sqft, the property has been tastefully decorated by the current owners and would make an ideal first time purchase or investment. The bright, open plan living room/kitchen featuring built in appliances opens out through bifolding doors into a stunning, 22ft rear garden creating the perfect entertaining space. Both bedrooms are good sized doubles and are cleverly designed for maximum storage, while the property is completed with a modern family bathroom and built in cupboards throughout.
Grosvenor Avenue is perfectly located for local, shops, cafes and restaurants situated nearby on Newington Green which is well known for its village atmosphere.
Upper Street is close by and provides a selection of boutique shops and bars as well as theatres and a vibrant nightlife. detailedDescription:
A sizeable, two-bedroom, top floor period conversion set on this sought-after tree lined street in Highbury, N5. Standing at almost 850 sqft, the property has been cleverly converted and stretches the full width of the top floor of this handsome Victorian building. Entering on the second floor, you are welcomed into a wonderfully bright, open plan living room/kitchen leading directly out onto a private balcony overlooking the neighbouring gardens. The double master bedroom includes built in storage while the second bedroom would make an ideal office, child's room, or single bedroom. The property is completed with a modern bathroom and benefits from ample eaves storage throughout.
Highbury New Park is set just moments from the prestigious Highbury Barn. The property is seconds away from the highly renowned local amenities, including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bournes Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield. Aside from its prestigious location the property is close to three neighbouring schools all of which have Outstanding Ofsted. The green open spaces of both Highbury Fields and Clissold Park are both within a short walk, as is the vibrant and ever popular Stoke Newington Church Street & Newington Green known for its independent boutiques, restaurants, and bars.
Transport links are well serviced by a selection of good bus routes as well Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and East London lines) along with Arsenal underground station (Piccadilly line) both within a short distance. Canonbury Overground is also moment away taking you directly into the City.

detailedDescription:
Eleventh floor two bedroom apartment in this stunning waterside development which overlooks the West Reservoir. Moments from zone 2 Piccadilly Line tube, with the added benefit of 24 hour concierge service, residents gym, a private balcony as well as a large, south facing terrace with views towards the water and the city skyline.

This apartment has wood flooring throughout the entrance and living areas, carpeted bedrooms, a master bathroom suite as well as an en-suite in the master bedroom. It also benefits from under-floor heating throughout, built in speakers in all of the main rooms and has beautiful floor to ceiling windows to allow as much natural light as possible into the apartment giving it a bright and open feel. The reception room leads to a south facing balcony and the large terrace.

Located 0.5miles from Manor House tube station (Zone 2/3) and only 1.2miles to Finsbury Park station (Zone 2) which have fantastic links to the City and Central London. There is currently a licenced caf‚ on the development as well as a small supermarket, dry cleaners, post office, newsagent and beautician.

The Development overlooks two reservoirs, the East Reservoir being part of the London Wildlife Trust whilst the West Reservoir is a popular Water Sports Centre, furthermore there are lovely parkland areas close by such as Finsbury Park (0.4miles) and Clissold Park (0.7miles)

address: Esther Anne Place, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription:
Islington Square will offer a variety of premier residential accommodation incorporating communal gardens, optional secure underground car parking, access to memberships in various facilities such as London's fastest growing car club.

There will be coffee shops and café bars, innovative restaurants and stylish shops showcasing the latest fashions and design and a 50,000 sq ft premium family health club, with state of the art facilities including a 25m pool for adults and separate pool facilities for children plus a luxury cinema with 6 screens with no more than 25 seats each hosting films from blockbusters to art productions.

London is famously a city of squares. Wherever these squares appear they quickly become natural meeting points for the communities around them. Islington Square will be no different. Sheltered from the traffic on Upper Street, it will be a fresh and lively locality.

Linked to Upper Street by two covered retail arcades, Islington Square will be the centre of a community with everything on its doorstep. It will soon be hard to imagine Islington without it.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Your sun filled, two bedroom abode with private garden and even your own cellar awaits. All within 0.5 miles of the ever popular, excellently linked Finsbury Park Station.

This sumptuous lower ground floor flat is alive with natural daylight and neutral tones throughout. Discover rich wood flooring and cream walls, providing a spacious and cosy Hygge feel.

Upon entry via the leafy porch you are welcomed through a green door into a large hallway. Here you’ll find room to place your bookcase / storage unit / bench, lit beautifully by overhead light fittings.

To the left resides your master bedroom, with bay window providing green views out to the front garden. An alcove hosts space for bookshelves here, with room for a large double bed and reclining furniture.

Next door sits the farmhouse style kitchen in all natural shades. Rich wood flooring, fresh cream subway tiling and granite effect worktops reside proudly, enveloping modern appliances ready for a feast.

Effortlessly switch between living, dining and working areas in the reception room, with floor to ceiling patio doors providing an abundance of light. Stepping outside, enjoy al fresco dining across a two level patio garden, surrounded by lush greenery and high trellis fencing for extra privacy.

Back inside, the second bedroom can be found adjacent to your reception room. An ideal space for a home office, with views out to the garden. Next door lies the shower room and WC, hosting storage beneath the sink in fresh white. For more storage options you’ll love the covetable cellar room, which lives next to the front door.

Tollington Park resides a moment’s walk from the Parkland Walk, running from Finsbury Park up to Highgate Woods along a disused railway line. For the Victoria, Picadilly and overground lines, you are less than a ten minute walk to Finsbury Park tube. For our insider’s guide to the area, head to
eighbourhoods.

What happens after I register my interest?

After registering your interest for a Peabody home, you will receive an email confirmation from us. The email will confirm what you need to do next to secure a property viewing which includes completing a financial assessment with a mortgage advisor and completing the Shared Ownership Application Form.

If you don’t receive this email within an hour of your registration, please check your spam or junk folders and set your spam filter to allow incoming emails from Peabody. If you still haven’t received the email after checking here, please contact and our team will be able to help you.

detailedDescription: A beautifully finished, five bedroom, (plus study), two bathroom end of terrace Victorian freehold, benefitting from a patio garden and roof terrace, enviably situated only moments from Highbury Barn. Accommodation is light filled and generously proportioned comprising; a double reception space on the ground floor, leading to the Harvey Jones kitchen (which features granite worktops, a filtered water tap and underfloor heating) and leads to the paved rear courtyard garden, via bi-folding doors. The first floor houses the principal bedroom suite, a further double bedroom, study and the family bathroom suite featuring cp Hart fittings. There are two further double bedrooms on the second floor, as well as access to the spacious roof terrace, with a further double bedroom and en-suite on the top floor. The property is supremely well placed for the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields, the shops of Highbury Barn including the renowned Godfreys butchers, fishmongers and Da Marios delicatessen. Transport can be found via a short walk to Highbury & Islington station (National Rail, Victoria Line & London Overground), along with Arsenal Underground (Piccadilly Line). The renowned restaurants of Farang, Westerns Laundry & Primeur restaurant can be found locally within Highbury, all of which are must trys.

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Superbly refurbished to a very high standard, this beautiful five bedroom split level maisonette - 3 double beds & 2 single beds - with private roof terrace, share of freehold and no onward chain. Enviably located in a sought after central location, the property enjoys bright and spacious accommodation arranged over three floors, boasting a wealth of character appeal and elegance, beautifully upgraded with stylish interiors throughout. Features include a stunning front aspect reception room and well equipped high quality fitted kitchen, stylish family bathroom with underfloor heating, ample inbuilt storage, attractive wood flooring, gas central heating, high ceilings and original style windows.

Accommodation comprises entrance via the ground floor with stairs rising to the first floor landing with access to useful single bedroom/study room with rear aspect. A doorway leads into the bright and spacious reception room, flooded with light from tall front aspect sash windows, and enjoying feature cast iron fireplace and ample space for both relaxing and dining. An opening leads through to the separate kitchen with wood burning stove and quiet rear aspect. The kitchen comprises a quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. To the second floor, there are two well sized double bedrooms, each with inbuilt storage, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite. The third floor accommodates a further large double bedroom with sliding doors opening onto an impressive decked roof terrace. Another single additional bedroom, or ideal nursery or study room with sky roof, can also be accessed via the top floor bedroom.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is enviably located close to Holloway Road, Arsenal, Drayton Park and Highbury & Islington stations, all providing excellent underground and overground links into Central London and the City. There are an array of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants within a short walk, including Islington's Upper Street and Highbury Barn, as well as beautiful Highbury Fields and Finsbury Park, and the iconic site of the Emirates Stadium literally on the doorstep. A large Waitrose is less than 3 minutes walk and a high standard family tea-room / coffee-shop is around the corner.

detailedDescription: This bright and spacious three bedroom house with private parking is discretely tucked away on a peaceful residential close on the banks of the New River. Accommodation includes an extremely spacious 17ft reception room, separate kitchen, three well proportioned bedrooms and well kept private garden. There is a gate leading from the private garden to a very large communal garden which is bordered by the New River. The river leads around to the Woodberry Wetlands nature reserve which was opened by Sir David Attenborough in 2016, the reservoir is home to many water birds not found anywhere else in London including Kingfishers and Cetti Warblers. Adjacent to the nature reserve is the West Reservoir used by the locals for boating and other activities including open water swimming. There are wonderful walks to be had in the area around these two bodies of water. New River Way is a quiet residential close located in the corner of the Woodberry Park redevelopment area. The project has brought fantastic new amenities to the area including a Sainsbury's, cafes overlooking the water and independent delis and restaurants. Stoke Newington is nearby, with a great many well-loved independent boutiques, cafes, bars and restaurants. Two other fantastic green spaces in the area are Finsbury Park and Clissold Park. Transport links are excellent with Manor House underground and Stamford Hill overground station both within easy walking distance. There are many bus routes into various parts of central London less than 200m from the property.

Located in the heart of zone 1 and within easy reach of Old Street, the City and Shoreditch, 250 City Road is a landmark development designed by world renowned architects Foster + Partners. With apartments finished to a superb specification alongside 5* facilities and wifi-enabled landscaped gardens you have everything on your doorstep to enjoy a living experience like no other.
The area around 250 City Road has always been a leading technology and financial services centre. Every hour, a new tech business is established in London. In fact, over the last decade and outside of the United States, the Capital has become the focus of the tech and digital world. Right now, it is also fast becoming an elite global hub of fintechs and the world's number one destination for investment in fintech firms.

Aptly named Silicon Roundabout, its close proximity to 250 City Road, the Capital's financial Square Mile and tech giants like Facebook, Google, Amazon and YouTube, make this one of the most sought after and attractive global Capital locations for a new generation of influencers and inspirers.

address: Barts Square, 56 West Smithfield, Smithfield Market, City Of London EC1A
detailedDescription:
Barts Square is a vibrant new Residential Quarter in the heart of historic Smithfield. The development houses a mix of contemporary architecture and characterful restoration.

Location

On the doorstep of The City, St Pauls, Crossrail's Farringdon Station and the ever popular Clerkenwell, the scheme offers the perfect balance of new and old, village life and city living, exclusivity and accessibility.

The development is the only residential offering of its kind in the square mile and is perfectly positioned for all that life in the City has to offer; St Paul's, the Barbican and Museum of London are all moments away. The neighbourhood offers a wealth of restaurants and bars, from the street food of Exmouth Market and Whitecross Street to the fine dining of Club Gascon, Hix and St John's, every taste is catered for.

Description

The final phase at Barts Square will bring a range of contemporary new residences whilst respectfully maintaining the areas historic streetscape with careful design.

Set across 3 buildings, each with its own distinct design and personality, Phase 2 arguably offers the best views within the scheme. With apartments looking towards the domes of St Paul's and Old Bailey, the historic courtyards of St Bartholomew Church or the beautiful Grade II listed St Barts Hospital, there is something for everyone. The three buildings comprise of 92 new residential residences with a mix of studios, one, two, three bedroom and Penthouse apartments available.

Residents will benefit from a range of intimate and elegant amenities including a residents' lounge, residents' bar, private dining and meeting rooms and a private cinema room.

Square Footage: 910 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 996 years remaining

detailedDescription:
One of only 2 Victorian Freehold townhouses on Haberdasher Street, this 5 storey home spanning over 2,115 sqft (approx) provides a unique, blank canvas opportunity for any incoming purchaser.

Retaining many all-important original features such as timber flooring, large light bearing sash windows, high ceilings and fireplaces - the house has been restored over time to provide versatile use between floors.

The ground floor leads to a large dual aspect kitchen/living space filled with light plus access to a private, south facing patio garden to the rear via full length, floor to ceiling sliding doors. Moving up through the house, the first floor is currently configured as a second living space and main bathroom (complete with clawfoot bathtub). The top two floors comprising three further bedrooms (built in storage throughout), WC and shower room with the top floor also having access to a small private terrace.

With self-contained access from the front of the house the lower ground floor can also be accessed from the ground floor. This floor has significant potential to be utilised as a further bedroom, studio, gym space or even a cinema room.

£827 per sqft (approx) in Shoreditch for a Freehold House presents a great opportunity.

Haberdasher Street is located between the much sought after Hoxton Square, Shoreditch and Islington, an area home to a vast array of bars, pubs, award winning restaurants, boutiques and amenities. Old Street Station is a short walk away as is the City with the area undergoing huge investment with the formation of Tech City around Old Street Roundabout.

address: York House, 14 Highbury Crescent, London N5
detailedDescription: A spacious and immaculately presented 3 double bedroom apartment set on the 1st floor of this highly regarded Victorian mansion building occupying a prominent position on Highbury Crescent. The property affords well proportioned accommodation with superb room dimensions, lots of natural light and high ceilings in an enviable position with views across the communal gardens. Accommodation comprises good size master bedroom with built-in wardrobes, 2 further double bedrooms both with built-in wardrobes, beautifully appointed main bathroom, large reception room featuring an impressive square bay window and dual aspect kitchen with ample space for dining. York House sits within its own grounds, surrounded by charming well kept communal gardens. It should be noted that the common areas of the building underwent extensive redecoration and there is communal bike storage. One of the delights of this apartment is that it is located to the rear of the building, away from the noise of the Fields, with views of the communal gardens providing a wonderful feeling of peace and tranquillity in such a central location and with so many amenities on your doorstep. York House occupies a prominent position on the West side of the Fields, within the Highbury Fields Conservation Area, offering superb access to the community focal point of the shops at Highbury Barn which includes Godfreys Butchers, La Fromagerie, Da'Mario Italian Delicatessen and Bournes fishmongers, along with the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields (gym, tennis courts, etc). Transport can be found locally at Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), along with Arsenal Underground (Piccadilly Line) Canonbury Station (London Overground), with a number of bus routes running along Highbury Grove. title: 1 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
This superb three-bedroom maisonette on Offord Road has been thoughtfully extended and refurbished to create a light-filled sanctuary that unfolds behind a classical façade. Arranged over three floors and with a private courtyard garden, the original architectural features of the Georgian frontage belie the contemporary nature of the home within, which has been carefully designed and curated for modern living. Offord Road is situated in the Barnsbury Conservation Area within easy walking distance of Upper Street and all that Islington has to offer.

The Tour

A handsome building constructed in the Georgian vernacular, the house is formed of white stucco at its lower levels, while brick has been used for the upper. An arched fanlight over the timber front door is echoed by the adjacent timber-framed, curved sash window, and a decorative wrought-iron balcony spans the width of the first-floor fenestration, completing the classical frontage.

Stairs lead from the raised ground floor hallway to the first floor, which contains a modern kitchen, dining room and living space. The front and rear rooms have been opened to one another; the full-height, timber-framed sash windows to the front, and almost full-height sash windows at the rear, ensure that natural light abounds. Materials, colours and textures have been carefully chosen, from the dark marble of the kitchen island and worktops to the light wash on the timber floorboards; the owner worked with an interior designer to ensure a sense of harmony throughout. There is a stone fire surround, plus cast-iron radiators and brass sanitary ware.

The second floor has been reconfigured to contain a double bedroom at the rear and a dressing room/office space at the front. A large bathroom with a walk-in shower inhabits the remainder of the plan on this level. The floor could alternatively be laid out as two double bedrooms (plus the current bathroom). A set of stairs ascends to the loft, which has been converted to create a further double bedroom plus an en suite shower and WC.

Outdoor Space

The care and attention to detail found throughout the interior continues in the courtyard garden, which has been comprehensively landscaped and planted to provide the perfect urban retreat, replete with raised timber seating, a mature palm tree, and a brick-built barbeque.

The Area

Offord Road is situated in the Barnsbury Conservation Area, which is the largest conservation area in Islington. The area is defined by its elegant late Georgian and early Victorian terraces and is home to some of London’s most attractive squares. Nearby Upper Street offers a wealth of retail, culinary and design amenities, including Ottolenghi, Gail’s, Le Creuset, Space nk and twentytwentyone, as well as a host of national and independent retailers and restaurants.

The Underground and rail network is within easy walking distance at Highbury & Islington station (Victoria Line), which is one stop from King’s Cross/St Pancras International Station. Further transport can be found at Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground, and access to the Piccadilly Line is provided at Caledonian Road, a short walk to the west.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 92 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. N/A
Ground Rent: Approx. £130 per annum
Council Tax Band: A

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful three-bedroom apartment is located on the second floor of a Grade ii-listed Victorian warehouse in the heart of Clerkenwell. It has been updated in recent years to a design by dsp Architecture and offers almost 2,000 sq ft of mostly lateral, open-plan living space with direct entry via a coded lift.

The Tour

Set over a ground-floor commercial space on a prominent Clerkenwell street, the front aspect is an elegant blend of intricate Flemish brickwork and pointed arch windows. The building’s three apartments share a ground-level lobby, accessed through a façade of ashlar stone, with high ceilings and space for bike storage. Stone stairs lead up to the communal staircase or left to the shared coded lift, which opens directly into each flat.

Entry is via a glazed Crittall atrium and through a full-height oak doorway, revealing a dramatic open-plan reception with double-height ceilings and a kitchen in the south-westerly corner. A quartet of towering casement windows floods the space with light, amplifying the warmth of the American-oak floors that extend throughout.

A short staircase ascends to the mezzanine-level bedroom where oak louvres offer gallery views over the kitchen and living space or close for privacy when needed. Beneath the mezzanine is a wall of storage and a bathroom. There are two bedrooms to the north of the plan, with a compact shower room in the corridor en-route. The main bedroom is lit by a wall of glazing with a door to the balcony, which can also be accessed from the entrance atrium.

The Area

Clerkenwell is renowned for the quality and variety of its bars, pubs and restaurants. Nearby Exmouth Market, Covent Garden and Soho are all within walking distance. The Barbican Centre, with its world-class cultural programme of cinema, music, theatre, talks and exhibitions, is a few minutes walk from the house. Smithfield is moments away and under proposals by Studio Egret West, plans are afoot to convert the Smithfield East and West Market buildings into a food education centre and a cultural and entertainment space respectively, and a site for the relocation of the London Museum.

Kings Cross is easily reached and has become London’s regeneration success story, welcoming the likes of Google, Louis Vuitton, Universal Music and Havas, alongside existing outposts of Caravan, Waitrose, Dishoom, and audiophile bar Spiritland. The Thomas Heatherwick-designed Coal Drops Yard brings Margaret Howell, Tom Dixon and Aesop stores to the canal, along with a fine selection of bars, restaurants and cafes.

Nearby Farringdon station (Circle, Metropolitan and Hammersmith & City Lines and National Rail) provides quick access to the West End and London’s major airports. Farringdon Station will also benefit from the opening of Crossrail and its direct route to Heathrow Airport. The Eurostar is only one stop away at Kings Cross / St Pancras.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 999 years

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Light and spacious one bedroom top floor flat with bonus office/study space, conveniently located in a popular purpose-built development close to excellent transport links and amenities. The property is on a wide, well-lit road directly off Camden Road and there are only four flats inside the building.

The flat offers bright, well-proportioned accommodation with excellent inbuilt storage, as well as modern interiors. Features include a generous reception room semi-open plan to a renovated kitchen, modern bathroom, gas central heating, double glazing, and inside access to attractive, well-maintained communal gardens. Large storage/bike sheds are available for leasing separately on the ground and first floors.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with window and split-level staircase rising to a generous landing area with inbuilt storage cupboards and doorway into an office/study/store room. There is a bright and spacious reception room with wide double-glazed windows and ample space for relaxing and dining, with opening through to the semi-open plan kitchen area. The kitchen itself comprises up-to-date wall and base units with stone/resin-composite work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas range cooker with overhead extractor and electric oven, built-in fridge-freezer and further space for appliances. Additionally, there is a spacious double bedroom and a modern bathroom with white three piece suite and power-shower.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is conveniently located with easy access to the rail and tube stations at Kentish Town, Tufnell Park and Caledonian Road, and with numerous regular bus routes within a 4-minute walk connecting to Archway/Highgate, Camden, the City, King's Cross/St Pancras and West End/Trafalgar Square/Oxford Street/Victoria. An array of artisan and vegan shops, cafes, bars and restaurants are nearby at Brecknock Road, Tufnell Park, Kentish Town and Camden, and King's Cross is within 25 mins on foot offering a further eclectic variety of boutique shops, markets, bars and nightlife.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is circa 114 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is circa £92 per month. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

address: Eaststand Apartments, Highbury Stadium Square, London N5
detailedDescription:
North londons famous development: Highbury Square formerly home to Arsenal Football club. Contemporary style meets a Prime N5 Location. Bringing in a charming style with clean modern finishes is this two double bedroom New Build Apartment which includes two glorious bathrooms, an onsite gym, concierge, and secure underground parking! Arsenal Underground Station (Piccadilly Line- Zone 2) is only a minute walk away.

The apartment is found on the East Stand which still has the art deco façades of Highbury’s old Grade ii-Listed East Stand.

The property is being sold chain free with a Share of the Freehold and a secure parking space underground.
The property


Found on the first floor the property is a corner apartment so larger than your average in the development and provides dual aspect views. The apartment comprises; a large reception, kitchen & dining room with floor to ceiling windows which provides an abundance of natural light, complimenting the stunning views that few apartments in the complex possess.

The property benefits with an en-suite bathroom found in the Master Bedroom, a fully integrated modern kitchen, fitted wardrobes and the original crittall windows, a new build with character!
Location and amenities


After 93 years as a football stadium, Highbury has been converted into over 650 high specification one, two and three bedroom apartments and penthouses, with the development being named ‘Highbury Square’.

The Fitness First Gym is found in the development is a state-of-the-art gym with a wide range of facilities including a spin studio, cardio theatre, gym floor and a full-length swimming pool.

The Eaststand is found along Avenell Road which is located moments from a good range of local amenities on Blackstock Road and Highbury Barn while the fashionable shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street and the green open spaces of Finsbury Park are also close at hand.

Please contact us to arrange a viewing.

Think…Property Inc!

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An imposing Grade II Listed Georgian end of terrace house, built in the late 1700s and located on one of Angel’s premier roads. This house is a brilliant example of sympathetic restoration and renovation with ample period features. Standing at close to 2,300 sq ft across five floors there is ample space for a growing family. The ground floor reception space offers ornate cornicing, sash window with shutters, fireplace and wooden flooring. The rear of the ground floor offers an equally impressive reception space leading to a terrace which overlooks, and leads down to, the rear garden, facing south east. The lower ground floor boasts a sitting room/bedroom to the front, vault space and an extended kitchen and dining space. This area benefits from ample natural light due to a favourable orientation, sky light, and floor to ceiling bi folding glass doors leading to the 65ft rear garden. The garage is at the back of the garden with dual access. The kitchen is handmade by Plain English with stone tops, built in Miele appliances and fully electric Aga. The upper floors house four double bedrooms, two bathrooms and ample bespoke cabinetry and storage. The main family bathroom is decadent and has been interior designed with free standing tub, separate shower, grand period features, double sash windows and underfloor heating. The house has a unique aspect, an unobstructed view down Charlton Place.

Situation
Colebrooke Row is one of Islington’s most sought after addresses within the Colebrooke Row and Duncan Terrace Conservation Area. You are positioned moments from Camden Passage and the hustle and bustle of Islington yet enough removed to benefit from the tranquillity the Conservation Area provides. Angel Station is within 0.2 miles providing easy access across town and Upper Street provides a wealth of amenities. The Regents Canal is at hand offering pleasant tow path walks into East London and you are local to Ofsted preferred schools.
