address: Northchurch Road, De Beauvoir, London N1
detailedDescription:
Located moments away from away from De Beauvoir Rose Gardens, is this Grade II listed Stucco fronted Victorian semi-detached house. Enjoying a corner plot, which provides the property with a wealth of natural light. The property is in the heart of De Beauvoir and benefits from having large front and rear gardens that wrap around the property.

Rich in character, the property offers flexible living accommodation and also offers potential to extend (subject to permissions). The property comprises of an inviting hallway, where you are immediately greeted with an ornate swooping staircase with the original balustrade. Set to the rear of the ground floor is a beautiful kitchen which leads to the family bathroom complete with a rolltop bath and ornate coloured glass window. To the front of the ground floor is a generous double bedroom which enjoys views over the front garden.

The first floor of this elegant home offers great ceiling height and houses two fabulous reception rooms that offer an abundance of light due to the floor to ceiling sash windows. Both rooms benefit from having bespoke built-in oak cabinetry as well as an array of fine period features. The second floor houses two further bedrooms and a shower room. Additionally, there is a handy attic which consists of two parts with the rear providing ample storage space and the front housing a study / office space.

Undoubtedly the eastern end of Northchurch Road is widely considered to be the best location across De Beauvoir Town; a peaceful no through road which is a designated cycle route, tree-lined, with the picturesque St Peters De Beauvoir church at its centre and De Beauvoir Rose Gardens moments away.

The property is conveniently located for an array of amenities and transport links and a brisk walk into the city.

detailedDescription:
Vincent Terrace is one of Islington and Angel’s most premier streets. Built in the mid-1800s and so Victorian, despite the Georgian exterior, and sat in the Colebrooke Row and Duncan Terrace Conservation Area on a tree lined street and overlooking the Regent’s Canal. The house is Grade II Listed. The vista provides for unobstructed views over the water and ample natural light throughout the property. Period features throughout include wide wooden floorboards, sash windows with wooden shutters, and fireplaces. The raised ground floor boasts two grand sash windows overlooking the Canal with high ceilings, this space is used as a double reception room but throughout the home the space remains flexible. The lower ground floor offers an open plan kitchen and dining space which leads to a south facing rear garden reaching almost 40 ft. The floor is complete with vault storage, utility space and a bathroom. The second floor is home to an impressive reception room, which could be adapted into an additional bedroom if required. The top floor completes the house with two double bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Situation
Vincent Terrace is a much sought after quiet residential street in Angel. The nearest underground station is Angel (Northern line), within 0.2 miles, providing excellent transport connections to the City, West End, Canary Wharf and King's Cross/St Pancras. The property is within easy reach of all the amenities of Upper Street with its superb array of shops, bars and restaurants. Hanover Primary, Ofsted rated Good, is located on Noel Road.

detailedDescription:
An elegant two bedroom upper maisonette set on Southgate Road.

Location

Southgate Road is an attractive residential street of Victorian houses in De Beauvoir Town. The nearest station can be found at Essex Road (0.6 miles - Overground) and Haggerston (0.8 miles - Overground). Highbury & Islington (1.1 miles) is also a short distance which provides easy access to the West End & City. A variety of local amenities including an excellent deli can be found on Southgate Road and Islington's fashionable Upper Street is easily accessible by bus. (Please note that all distances are approximate).

Description

A stunning two bedroom apartment arranged on the first and second floors and set in semi-detached Georgian conversion. The property has been refurbished to a high standard and is offered chain free. On the first floor there is a fantastic 16' reception room with a wood-burning stove and two large sash windows letting in lots of natural light, a separate eat in kitchen. The property benefits from a demised south/west facing balcony area accessed via the kitchen and a purchaser could potentially create an even larger home by extending STPP. On the second floor there are two large double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and family bathroom.

Square Footage: 887 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 93 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Full details A charming 1158 square foot three bedroom house situated on a quiet street within 0.3 miles of Crouch Hill station (Overground) and 0.6 miles of Archway underground station (Northern Line).

The ground floor provides two reception rooms, leading to a kitchen with bespoke storage, a window seat and space to dine and doors leading to a private and secluded rear garden. The upper level provides a family bathroom and two well-proportioned bedrooms. On the top floor, the main bedroom features an en-suite shower room, and French doors to a Juliette balcony flooding the space with natural light.

The house is a short walk from Stroud Green Road, known for its pubs, organic shops such as Urban Native, and Butler's, an independent wine shop and delicatessen. Crouch End is within easy reach with its excellent selection of boutique shops, restaurants, pubs, cinemas and independent coffee shops. Archway is also close by with access to the Northern Line, and in the other direction, Finsbury Park (Victoria & Piccadilly Lines and mainline trains). Crouch Hill overground station is just a five-minute walk away.

detailedDescription:

The property is set over two floors comprising of a bright an airy living room with two large storage cupboards and wood floors, a separate fitted kitchen with white gloss units and a bathroom suite. Upstairs you have a very spacious and bright double bedroom featuring a custom floating effect bed, white concrete floors and custom white built in wardrobes and chests along the far wall. The property enjoys lots of storage including a small loft hatch, utility cupboard under the stairs and delightful views through the south east facing windows over the communal gardens. The building boasts security intercom system and a delightful internal courtyard oustide the front door to enjoy those summer months. The apartment also has a fitted bicycle stand.

Upper Gulland Walk is located in close proximity to both Upper Street and Essex Road situated alongside the recently upgraded New River Walk offering a peaceful, waterside location in the center of Islington. It is well located for both Highbury & Islington station (Victoria, Mainline, and Overground services) and Angel (Northern line). Essex Road station (First Capital Connect services) is also within extremely reach and offers connections to Moorgate and the City. It is also on the doorstep of a number of convenient bus routes into the city and west end.

*The property is ideal for a First Time Buyer or Investor looking to expand their portfolio with respectable estimated yields from 5%.*

detailedDescription:
*** This property is EWS1 compliant. A certificate can be provided upon request.

A stunning, two double bedroom, warehouse conversion situated on the first floor of this iconic former Royle Print Works development between Old Street and Angel.

With over 700 square feet of internal space, the property is presented in good condition throughout and is offered to the market on a chain free basis. Full of natural light from the large windows, the east facing reception room and open plan kitchen including a breakfast bar, make a fantastic entertaining space. Two double bedrooms, with the master benefitting from built in wardrobes, and a separate master bathroom which serves both bedrooms complete the property. The property also includes a secure private car parking space and large communal canal side area for the residents.

Along with the building’s trademark solid concrete ceilings, this impressive five-storey, brick building was converted in 1997 and the communal areas maintain the original terrazzo flooring, large terrazzo stairs and a passenger lift to all floors. There is also a porter and the residents have use of secure underground bike storage.

Royle Building, situated on Wenlock Road, is a stone’s throw away from Regents Canal offering beautiful walks right the way through East London then back into the City. The property is also perfectly located close to Upper Street, for those keen shoppers and restaurant goers and Shoreditch Park for the outdoor enthusiasts. There are a number of transport links nearby providing easy access to the City including the buses from both New North Road and Essex Road, the tube from Angel and Old Street (Northern Line), Essex Road Rail Station taking you straight into Moorgate (First Capital Connect) and Hoxton overground Station.

detailedDescription:
Rare to the market one bedroom flat split over 777 square foot located on the first floor within a sought after purpose built block moments from Old Street Station.

The reception room is one of many draws to the property, the large windows flood the room with natural light and with further attributes that include wooden floors that run throughout and a fire place.

It is currently split to allow for a second bedroom or could be used as an office and could easily be converted back to allow for a huge reception room.

The separate kitchen is also a great size, with all your everyday mod cons and offers ample space for a dinning table making it ideal to entertain and makes it a very sociable space.

The bedroom is good size and similar to the reception room has large windows and built in wardrobes.

The bathroom is well proportioned for the size of the property and benefits from a full sized bath.

There are two additional storage cupboards in the hallway for your everyday items and an additional external cupboard for your larger items.

Location;

Neighboring four highly desirable districts of London that include Islington, Shoreditch, Clerkenwell, and the City offers something for everyone.

Also within the ever-growing Tech City / Tech Roundabout located around Old Street City.

Old Street, 5 minutes away, Moorgate, 8 minutes, Barbican, 9 minutes, tube stations on the Northern, Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines.

Within 10 minutes walking distance in the mainline Terminus of Liverpool Street with access to Stratford, Stanstead Airport, Cambridge, Essex, Suffolk, Norfolk, and Harwich Harbour

Farringdon has access to Gatwick Airport and Luton Airport on the Brighton - Bedford Line, within a 15-minute walk.

Shoreditch and Hoxton are across the Old Street roundabout to all the trendy cafes and galleries.

Also within easy reach are the attractions of The Barbican, The City, St. Pauls’ Cathedral, The River, South Bank, Tate Modern, Gabriel’s Wharf, Bank Of England and a 250,000 Sq. Ft New Change Shopping Complex.

The local areas have an abundance of other amenities for day to day life, with award-winning bars and restaurants.

Ideal for first time buyers or a Pied a Terre.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Full description Situated in a charming terrace of converted Victorian houses, this second floor apartment offers bright, well proportioned accommodation with a Share of the Freehold.

The accommodation briefly comprises two double bedrooms, a reception room with plenty of space for a dining table, a kitchen breakfast room, and bathroom. Notable features in this flat are a very practical layout, unusual for many period apartments. With a square entrance lobby, all of the rooms lead off it so the bulk of the square footage is actual living accommodation rather than corridors. This flat is straight through front to back with an E/W orientation, so for the bulk of the day sunshine brightens the home.

The property has served the current owners well enough to comfortably start a family here. The benefits that set it apart from others are a full eat-in kitchen, and great storage. There is large storage next to the bathroom housing the utility white goods with plenty of space also for bulkier items.

The bedrooms are both good doubles and fairly equally sized, rather than one huge room and one large single. This apartment also enjoys shared use of the front garden.

Situation and tenure This section of Highbury New Park offers quick and direct access to Clissold Park, and the wide array of shops, boutiques and eateries of Stoke Newington, as well as Islington's trendy Upper St and Highbury Barn and shops.

Canonbury station offers quick and direct access to the City, the bus routes are many and varied, Piccadilly and Victoria Lines are both within walking distance

The property is held on a long lease with a Share of the Freehold

Any charges and costs are shared between the flats in the building through a sinking fund

37 Duo Tower is a superb 1 bedroom apartment located on the 6th floor of Mono Tower at our Hoxton Press development. This stylish home is spread across approximately 613 sq ft of bright open-plan living space with floor to ceiling windows and features a large private balcony with impressive West facing views across the city towards the London Eye and BT Tower. Additionally, this home boasts an ultra-modern fitted kitchen with ample space to entertain guests and underfloor heating.

Designed by renowned architects Karakusevic Carson Architects and David Chipperfield Architects, Anthology Hoxton Press is made of two unique hexagonal towers, sat between Shoreditch Park and Regent's Canal. Inside there are one, two and three bedroom apartments, as well as penthouse suites, boasting balconies and roof terraces. Supporting it all is a dramatically designed ground floor café and welcoming communal spaces.

Hoxton Press has excellent links to the rest of London. Angel and Old Street Underground Stations are close by, as well as Cross Rail from Farringdon and Whitechapel*, and Overground services from Hoxton and Essex Road.

Home to an incredible number of artist' studios, design and tech businesses and world-class galleries, Hoxton is a stimulating place to live and work.

The development benefits from a 24-hour concierge service, cycle storage and a 250 year lease.

*All images shown are indicative and for illustrative purposes only.

detailedDescription:
Stunning two bedroom flat located on the second floor within a low rise purpose built block moments from both Newington Green and Dalston.

As you enter the flat there is ample space for shoes and jackets and perfectly leads to both the kitchen, reception room and private balcony.

The large south facing reception room is one of the main draws to the property offering plenty of space for a dinning table too making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

Off the reception room leads to both good size double bedrooms and the well propotioned family bathroom.

The sepoerate kitchen is ideal for families and those sharing alike make the property very versatile depnding on your personal requirements.

The private balcony offers plenty of space for a table outside to take advantage of the good weather.

The property is in excellent condition throughout.

Location;

Newington Green has an array of everyday amenities alongside boutique shops and award-winning bars and restaurants.

Church Street and Stoke Newington High Street, leading to Dalston, are both within walking distance from either side of Queen Margarets Grove and offer a great contrast of two very different vibes.

Clissold Park is also a short walk away, with tennis courts, swimming pools, and has several events throughout the year.

Transport;

Newington Green has excellent bus links to the City, King's Cross, Euston, the West End and beyond.

Canonbury and Dalston Kingsland Overground Station are less than a 10-minute walk away providing access to Highbury & Islington Station (Victoria Line), to Canary Wharf via Canada Water (Jubilee Line) and direct to Shoreditch High Street too.

Ideal for first-time buyers and those looking to upsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A well-proportioned, two-bedroom, second floor flat, situated within a short walk to Finsbury Park Station, offering quick and easy access into the Capital from under 10 minutes. The home is also conveniently located within easy reach to a number of local amenities as well as key bus links via both Stroud Green and Seven Sisters Road.

This apartment offers two generously sized double bedrooms, in addition to ample storage space throughout. A spacious family bathroom is also available, which is fitted with chrome fixtures, as well as a well-maintained kitchen that has the added luxury of an extension which can be used for multiple purposes, including a utility room.

The windows are double glazed throughout, improving the home's general security and insulation, coupled with gas central heating flowing through the property.

Location Ronaldshay is situated in a prime location, being a short walk to both Manor house and Finsbury Park Station, with Finsbury Park being the preferred option, as it provides access to the Victoria line, Piccadilly Line and National Rail Services, with access to central London less than 10 minutes.

Finsbury Park is an intermodal interchange station in north London. It serves a number of National Rail, London Underground and bus services. The station is the third busiest Underground station outside Zone 1, with over 33 million passengers using the station in 2019.

Finsbury Park and Clissold Park are also nearby, with Finsbury being the most convenient option as you can enjoy many luxuries and family activities there such as a Café, an Athletics Track and Gym, a boating lake and access to a Parkland Walk.

Finsbury Park is a public park in the London neighbourhood of Harringay. It is in the area formerly covered by the historic parish of Hornsey, succeeded by the Municipal Borough of Hornsey. It was one of the first of the great London parks laid out in the Victorian era. The park borders the neighbourhoods of Harringay, Finsbury Park, Stroud Green, and Manor House. The park has hosted several live music performances and music festivals including: Fleadh Festival (1990-2003), Great Xpectations Festival (1993), Rise Festival (2006–2010) and Wireless Festival (2014 - 2019).

Education in Finsbury Park is also a huge factor in its popularity. Stroud Green, Ambler, Pools and Duncombe Primary Schools are nearby, as well as being within easy reach to St Aloysius' rc College, Channing school for girls and all of City and Islington's respective four major education centres.

Please contact one of our property consultants to organise an accompanied viewing at your earliest convenience to avoid potential disappointment.

Lease remaining: 117 Years
Service charge & Ground rent: £1700

On entering the property there is a small inner hall area with space for coats and shoes.

The open-plan kitchen has shaker-style cabinets, Italian marble worktops, an integrated Zanussi washing machine, Bosch dishwasher, four ring ceramic hob with an extractor fan.

An island has been built for the fridge and separate freezer along with additional cupboard space.

A good sized bedroom is adjacent to the reception room with the fabulous original teak framed full width window with a southerly aspect over the podium and a large wardrobe/ storage cupboard .

The flat has oak flooring throughout and has been upgraded in a traditional style. The bathroom benefits from a shower cubicle, a hand wash basin with a marble surround and storage below the basin; tiled floor and walls, and a lowered ceiling with down lighters.

With a lift at the end of the corridor which leads directly to street level, there is a Waitrose supermarket on Whitecross street and a Marks and Spencer clothing and food store at Moorgate.

A number of five star hotels close by include the South Place Hotel and The Montcalm with roof terraces and restaurants.

Residents have access to their own private gardens along with the facility to rent a storage cage or parking space below the building which also benefits from a 24 hour car park attendant.<br /><br />

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderfully individual maisonette lies behind a wooden-framed glazed shop front on Mortimer Road, a stone’s throw from De Beauvoir Square. It has been the subject of a beautiful and inventive renovation by the current owners.

Setting the Scene

At the front of the building, set behind ornate iron railings, is a small courtyard garden with space for a bench on which to sit and enjoy the morning sunshine. Behind this lies a charming maisonette filled with natural materials, considered touches and a calm, inviting atmosphere.

The Grand Tour

The house opens to a raised living area which is bathed in light from the east-facing floor-to-ceiling windows. These have been lined with custom-made linen, inspired by Japanese Shoji Screens, to provide privacy without losing any natural light. White-painted wooden slats run the length of the ceiling and down to clad the kitchen wall. On one side of the central oven is a stone worktop and on the other, a stone double sink. Glass bricks from the original shop have been revealed and restored, laid into the floor of the dining area to allow light to penetrate the accommodation below. To the right of the kitchen are two glazed stable doors which lead onto a gated alleyway.

Downstairs, the master bedroom is illuminated by light from the shop front windows which dip beneath the raised floor of the upper level. Fitted cupboards, with bespoke cast-iron doorknobs, line one side of the room. The second double bedroom is currently used as a dressing room/study and is lit from above by the glass-brick section of the ceiling and a high ribbon window. Parquet flooring runs throughout the sleeping accommodation. At the end of the corridor is a bathroom with decorative tiles on the floor and an elegant unlacquered brass splash-back that lines the perimeter of the bath. Hand-painted Delft tiles, commissioned by the owners, sit above the sink. The room echoes the aesthetic of the kitchen with white-painted cladding along the walls and bath.

Out and About

Mortimer Road is situated within the eponymous conservation area and is a short walk from London Fields and Broadway Market, with its weekly organic farmers’ market, gastropubs, restaurants and shops. There are a number of excellent pubs and restaurants in the area, notably the De Beauvoir Arms, and the popular De Beauvoir Deli is close by. The Towpath Café on Regent’s Canal is a short walk away. N1 Garden Centre is around the corner and Columbia Road, known for its flower market on Sundays and its independent shops and cafes, is within easy reach to the south. Both Shoreditch and Spitalfields are close by.

Haggerston Station and London Fields Station (both London Overground) provide convenient access to the City, the West End and Canary Wharf. Dalston Junction has been proposed as a station on the new Crossrail II route.

Further Reading

London Fields by Martin Amis

Hackney by Night by Hoxton Mini Press

detailedDescription:
Set on the corner of Mayton street and Pakeman street is this imposing spacious five double bedroom period end terrace house arranged over four floors with a private patio and off street parking affording just over 1643 sq. Ft of living space in arguably a most desirable road within the Holloway vicinity.

This superb family home is set behind Hornsey road and features high ceilings, large windows, plenty of original period detail and boasts a kitchen dining room leading to a cosy private se facing garden and hugely benefits from having a demised double garage to the side of the property.
There is the opportunity for updating and modernisation, which will transform an already beautiful house into an incredible home.

Accommodation comprises a large reception room, a dining area, a tiled shower room and a modern kitchen opening on to a private patio area on the ground floor.
The first floor contains two large double bedroom and a full size bathroom.
Furthermore the second and third floors have two further well apportioned double bedrooms.

Mayton street is conveniently located and easy reach of the excellent local amenities of Holloway Road, Finsbury Park, Arsenal & Highbury & Islington, easy access to Camden, Angel, The City & West End and is also well serviced by many bus routes.

detailedDescription:
This 2 bedroom apartment has a contemporary specification of the highest quality, featuring wood effect laminate flooring in the kitchen, living room and hall, carpet in the bedrooms, a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances. The flat's layout is a conventional living space, with a separate kitchen/dining room and living room. Another welcome feature is the benefit of 2 large balconies, opening off the living room and master bedroom. This gives a large and welcome outdoor space. The flat overlooks a park.

This is a shared ownership property. The minimum share is 25% from £173,750 requiring a deposit from £17,375. If you wish to purchase the whole flat this is possible.

Kitchen

• Contemporary fully fitted kitchen with under unit lighting

• Laminate worktop and upstand

• Stainless steel 1½ bowl sink with mixer tap

• Wood effect laminate flooring to hall, living room and dining area

Heating & electrical

• Smoke and heat detectors

The area

Central Street is a central location in close proximity to The Square Mile and an ideal location for commuters who use this area for business. It offers excellent transport links with the closest tube stations being Old Street and Barbican. Old Street on the Northern Line is your starting point to reach Bank, Canary Wharf and the West End. Barbican on the Circle Line allows for travel all around the city centre. During leisure time, The Barbican Arts Centre provides entertainment on your doorstep in the form of family activities, cinema, theatre and concerts. The new cultural mile is on your doorstep. Close by, Islington and Hoxton offer a wide variety of places to eat, drink and socialise, with a cultural and vibrant atmosphere. Clerkenwell and Smithfield are home to some of London’s most popular up and coming bars and restaurants, as well as being home to London’s historic Smithfield Market.

detailedDescription:
Full description Bought by the current owners many years ago, this house has been beautifully extended and imporved to create a magnificent family home.

The ground floor accommodation is comprised of a double through reception room with bay window to front, leading through to the kitchen diner to the rear. Spanning the full width of the house, the kitchen diner is fully open to the South facing rear garden, and also has a skylight over the former side return. With an island in the centre and bi-folding doors, this is a true year-round family room.

The first floor boasts three double bedrooms as well as family bathroom with double walk-in shower. A stunning staircase leads up under skylight to the master suite on the top floor, with walk in dressing room and en suite bathrooms, as well as far reaching views South to the City skyline.

To the rear of the house, a good sized South facing garden enjoys sun all day long, and end of terrace positioning leads to more uninterrupted sunshine.

A standout feature of this house is the 13'2x8'11 home office built in the garden. With en suite shower and w/c, this could easily be purposed as a full time home office, or accommodation for teenagers or visitors.

Situation This house enjoys great access to transport links and amenities, on the now quiet Gillespie Road. Piccadilly Line is moments away at Arsenal tube, Victoria and Overground are also a walk away at Highbury & Islington station. The house is opposite Gillespie Nature Park and Ecology centre, Highbury Fields are 0.7 miles away.

There are plentiful shopping options nearby with a large Waitrose for the weekly shop, and an ever increasing array of shops and eateries. Islington's trendy Upper Street is within walking distance. Highbury Barn offers perennial favourites, La Fromagerie, Godfreys Butchers, Bournes fishmongers and some little local shops.

What the owner said;
We’ve loved living here. The flat is lovely and spacious and tucked away in a small serene block with friendly neighbours and a pretty communal garden. The real selling point for us has been the location. Nestled behind Newington Green, seconds away from buses and night-buses, a five-minute walk from Canonbury station and with an amazing choice of absurdly good restaurants and cafes on our doorstep. Plus, this flat has top tier Deliveroo game. We’ll really miss it!

detailedDescription:
This stunning and trendy two bedroom warehouse conversion epitomises the best Shoreditch and Clerkenwell have to offer.

Providing in excess of 1000 square feet, this characterful flat boasts exposed brickwork, high ceilings, Crittal windows, solid wood flooring and so much more! The building originally served as a 19th century coffee and tea warehouse and the conversion of the property has done remarkably well to retain that history. With spacious communal areas, paired with a stylish Paternoster lift, and huge private basement storage space demised to the flat this building is highly sought-after.

The flat itself comprises two large double bedrooms with large wardrobes built into each room maximising storage, a stylish art-deco themed en-suite bathroom and practical guest shower/bathroom, ample hallway storage, and a substantial open-plan kitchen/reception space.

Dingley Place is located 0.4 miles from Old Street Station offering access to the Northern Line and Overground services whilst Farringdon is 0.8 miles away offering access to the Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City, Circle, and National Rail services in addition to the highly anticipated Cross Rail line. The numerous bars, restaurants, cafés and clubs scattered throughout the Shoreditch, Clerkenwell and Angel areas are all within easy walking distance.

This property is offered chain free.

detailedDescription:
Light and airy 3 storey house in private mews.

Location

Robinswood Mews is a residential location just off Highbury Fields and is located within the Highbury Fields Conservation area. It is well placed for all the amenities on the Fields and is a short walk to Highbury Corner with its many transport links including buses, underground, London Overground, local, national and international links to the City, West End, countryside and beyond.

Description

This is a most attractive 3 storey house that is approximately 14 years old in a quiet mews just off Highbury Fields. The accommodation is both light and airy and well-proportioned throughout.

The current owners use the large first floor front room as a second reception room but it could easily be utilised as a fourth bedroom. The house has been maintained to a high standard with care and attention to fixtures and fittings. Throughout the house there is lots of storage including the understairs cupboard, fully boarded loft with loft access and deep cupboards on the landing and en suite bathroom.

Of particular note is the large rear garden and off street parking for 1 car.

detailedDescription:
This elegant, two-bedroom apartment is positioned on the fourth floor of 350 Goswell Road, a striking, purpose-built apartment building designed by Mackay and Partners. The interiors have been entirely re-designed in recent years by Brendan Woods, promoting the flow of light and life through large sections of glazing across the plan and out onto the apartment’s private balcony.

The Tour

The street-facing facade presents an arresting pair of angular profiles; the material palette of concrete and steel-grates is immediately established and carries through to the building’s internal courtyard, where it is peacefully countered by mature trees and a rockery.

The interiors seek to mirror this industrial aesthetic, for which the neighbourhood of Clerkenwell has become famous in recent years. High concrete ceilings, oak floorboards, polished-concrete flooring and large sections of glazing define the open-plan communal living spaces.

The kitchen is split across two white Corian work surfaces, orientated around the dining area. Beyond is a spacious living room and entire wall of sliding glazed doors behind, opening out directly onto a private balcony. Part of this space can be partitioned to create a third bedroom for guests and is regularly used by the current owners as a study.

Two further bedrooms are positioned at the rear of the plan, overlooking the rooftops of Clerkenwell below and the receding concrete facade of Goswell Road, towards the Regent’s Canal. Each bedroom has built-in wardrobes, floor-to-ceiling glazing and one has an en-suite bathroom. There is a family bathroom to one side and a large storage cupboard.

The Area

Goswell Road runs south from Angel, through Clerkenwell, towards to the Barbican. It runs parallel to St John street outlining an area renowned as a hub for the creative industries and for the quality and variety of its bars and restaurants.

Angel and Upper Street are a short walk away, as is Exmouth Market with its wide range of restaurants and bars including firm local favourite Moro. St Paul’s, Smithfields and the City are within easy reach to the south. Running parallel, St. John Street has a convenient Waitrose, as well as the infamous St John restaurant.

The Barbican Centre, with its world-class cultural programme of cinema, music, theatre, talks and exhibitions, is a few minutes’ walk from the apartment.

Angel is the closest station, less than five minutes’ walk away; and runs Northern line services citywide. St Paul’s and the City are within easy reach to the south. Nearby Farringdon station (Circle, Metropolitan and Hammersmith & City lines and National Rail) provides quick access to the West End and London’s major airports.

Tenure: Leasehold with Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 981 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £4,000 per annum
Council Tax Band: F

detailedDescription:
Full description Every now and then you come across a flat that feels like a little house and this is one of them. Occupying part of a former public house, this charming dwelling offers privacy and tranquillity in a fantastic Zone 2 location.

The door to the conversion accesses a lobby with front door to this property. The entrance lobby has access to living room and bathroom, with stairs to the first floor. The living/ dining room is high ceilinged, bright and airy, and French doors lead out to the garden. A couple of steps down to the rear of the living room lead to the fully equipped kitchen which also has a door to the garden.

On the first floor, two bedrooms are well presented, one currently used as a study and both light and airy.

This home really does feel like a house, with the privacy and layout one would expect in a conversion listed as a 'building of local importance' and the neighbours are a mix of young professionals typical of the area. This lovely apartment has been the happy home of the current owners for 15 years.

Situation and tenure Bryantwood Rd enjoys a peaceful location, on a no-through road. There are an increasingly diverse array of local attractions. For the foodie, Westerns Laundry and Zia Lucia are among the independent local restaurants that people travel from all over London to visit. You'll have to get up early to avoid the queue at Peche Mignon nearby for morning coffee and croissants.

There are two branches of Waitrose within walking distance, and Islington's trendy Upper Street is also an easy stroll away.

Drayton Park station is located 0.2 miles away, and goes to Moorgate station in 10 minutes. Victoria Line is 0.5 miles away at Highbury & Islington station. Piccadilly Line is 0.3 miles away at Holloway Road station.

The property is held on a long leasehold. Service charges are £600 per annum, ground rent is £250pa

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented 3/4 double bedroom detached townhouse set within this highly sought after private mews development accessed via Highbury Crescent and only moments from the greenery of Highbury Fields. The house occupies a prominent position within the development, as it features the largest garden within it. Accommodation is arranged over 3 floors, with a spacious open-plan kitchen/ reception room on the ground floor providing access to the well-proportioned, wrap around garden, there is also a utility room on the ground floor that includes a W.C, washing machine and tumble dryer. On the first floor is the principal bedroom with an en-suite shower room and a balcony, accessed via double doors, along with a further large double bedroom that could be enjoyed as another reception space, featuring tranquil views of Highbury Fields. On the top floor are a further two good sized double bedrooms, one of which also provides green views across Highbury Fields through an impressive glass wall, as well as a generous family bathroom. The house further benefits from excellent storage throughout (under stairs cupboards, first floor landing cupboards, a fully boarded loft as well as two large cupboards in the family bathroom). There is also as an off-street parking space to the front. Robinswood Mews is supremely well placed for the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields (gym, tennis courts, etc), the shops of Highbury Barn including the renowned Godfreys butchers, fishmongers and Da Marios delicatessen. Transport can be found locally at Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), along with Arsenal Underground (Piccadilly Line) Canonbury Station (London Overground), with a number of bus routes running along Highbury Grove. The delights of Trullo & Prawn On The Lawn, by Highbury Corner, offer superb local dining.

detailedDescription:
Located within the highly desirable East Canonbury conservation area. We are pleased to present this stunning Grade II listed Victorian family home. Boasting over 2900 sqft of internal living space & arranged over 5 floors the property is oozing with character and charm throughout. Lovingly cared for by the current homeowners, this impressive family home is beautifully presented with a variety of lovingly restored period features. High ceilings, ornate ceiling cornice, sash windows, original fireplaces and original floorboards are just some of the features that the current homeowners have renovated and restored. As you approach Hollyview, you are greeted by a stunning front garden with an array of plants, flowers, & 2 holly trees as well as your very own gated driveway.

The raised ground floor area comprises of a welcoming entrance through the portico into the hallway, leading onto a wonderful, bright, double reception room, full of features such as the original fireplace, ornate ceiling cornice and high ceilings. To the rear is breakfast room with double doors opening to a wonderful private roof terrace overlooking the garden, the perfect seating area to have an alfresco lunch or dinner, just in time for spring & summer! The galley kitchen is situated just off the breakfast room with access into the garden.
On the first floor, is the beautifully finished master bedroom showing off everything piece of elegance that you would expect from a Victorian home. From double sash windows, exposed floorboards, high ceilings and an open fireplace! The master room has access onto its very own en suite which has been finished to a high standard with a walk-in shower, Jack & Jill sink, and a walk-in wardrobe. Across the landing is the main family bathroom.

The 2nd floor consists of two large bedrooms, one which has an en suite and on the top floor (3rd) is a further double bedroom with a further en suite. The lower ground floor basement benefits from its very own private entrance and tucked away inside is its own 1-bedroom apartment, comprising of a living, dining, and kitchen area with access into the garden. A shower room and a very good-sized double bedroom. Depending on the future homeowner’s plan, you could possibly rent out the basement apartment or separate the basement flat from the freehold to sell in the near future.
To the rear is a beautifully, well maintained garden with a variety of mature trees and shrubs, stocked with plants and flowers.
Situated on a tree lined residential street, the location is sought after, desirable and convenient for local amenities offering an array of bars, restaurants, and shops which include the independent De-Beauvoir deli, and De- Beauvoir pub.

You are spoilt for choice with the transport links by the overground services from Essex Road, Angel, Highbury and Islington, Canonbury, and Essex Road.

detailedDescription:
If you are unable to buy a property outright on the open market, then Shared Ownership could be the ideal solution for you. It is a part-buy, part-rent scheme, which enables purchasers to buy an initial share of usually between 25% and 75% the value of the property and pay a subsidised rent on the remainder. A service charge may also be payable to cover the cost of communal maintenance. Shared Ownership properties are designed as a stepping stone to completely owning your own home, allowing you to buy as much as you can afford when you can afford it.

A resale is a Shared Ownership property that the current owner bought new from us or as a resale. Buying a resale property makes you an owner-occupier because you are buying at least the current owner's share on the existing lease. The great thing about choosing to buy a re-sale shared ownership property is that it gives you the opportunity to speak to the previous owner and to find out more about the area.

detailedDescription:
This superb first floor apartment comprises over 679 sq. Ft. Accommodation and comes complete with a private balcony and private entrance too.

It is brightly appointed and presented for sale in immaculate decorative condition (the flat was actually built in 2016) with four years remaining on the building warranty.

Location:
Highgate and The Hill - London's "Green Lung "- The words are those of the world-famous violinist and humanist Yehudi Menuhin's and he used them as a slogan to prevent the overdevelopment of Witanhurst's wooded acres encroaching on Hampstead Heath back in the 1980s - itself a bit of history which sums up living in Highgate. It reminds us that Highgate Hill is within easy reach of the centre of town by tube and bus but, with Hampstead Heath, Waterlow Park and its necklace of smaller parks, the healthy, windswept hill on which it stands is really the first area of green space you come to North outside London. The area has a distinct character which has historically attracted artists from contemporary musicians to Dickens and Betjeman, as well as a whole host of other people who now, as in previous centuries, make it a socially and culturally interesting place to be without the pretence of some other areas, and one whose character they want to preserve and enjoy. It is perfectly positioned for easily accessing everything useful including and transport connections by bus or tube at Archway.

For culture and leisure pursuits, Highgate Hill and the Village are hard to beat. We have Upstairs at the Gatehouse, a consistently award-winning theatre with possibly the finest off-West End programme anywhere in London; not to mention Highgate's own Literary and Scientific Institution, the Highgate Society (Yehudi was its Patron), world-famous Highgate Cemetery, Jackson's Lane, a clutch of cinemas, nearby Alexandra Palace, gastro-pubs, places of worship to suit almost everyone, good shops on site or within easy reach.

And if you need exercise, the area is well-provided with sports facilities, pools, fitness gyms. Pilates centres, cricket and rugby clubs, or just plain, good jogging routes.

Directions:
Gordon Close is a quiet cul-de-sac off Highgate Hill, opposite Despard Road. It is conveniently positioned for easy access to a variety of local amenities including Archway tube Station, Highgate Village, Waterlow Park and local shops too.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Measuring over 3,200 sq ft across three floors & showcasing enviable design, styling & lateral space. The pristine exterior correlates with an exacting standard internally. The ground floor offers open plan living with a regal reception room boasting oak flooring, marble fireplaces, ornate restored cornicing, double glazed bay sash windows with electronic wooden shutters, industrial period radiators, & high ceilings. The reception flows seamlessly through to the kitchen space which is flooded with natural light assisted by a skylight and bi folding floor to ceiling glass doors leading onto a landscaped rear garden complete with shoffice. The bespoke kitchen has stone worktops, built in Gaggenau appliances, Tom Dixon lighting & polished concrete tiles. The boot room & utility spaces are accessed from the kitchen. The first floor principal suite echoes the interiors and period features on the ground floor with a green vista. The bathrooms are courtesy of Lefroy Brooks, Hans Grohe, Cross water & Phillipe Strack. The en-suite offers a double sink, marble composite shower & stone tub. There is a walk in wardrobe to finish the suite. The second floor is complete with a mezzanine bedroom with access to a flat roof. The top floor concludes the house with two double bedrooms and bathroom. The property has been featured in livingetc, a nod to the impeccable interior. There is potential to excavate and create a basement subject to the usual consents. Finally there is side access & off street parking for three cars.

Situation
Located between Hampstead, Highgate and Islington in Crouch Hill on a tree lined, no through road opposite cricket pitches. Turlewray Close is well positioned for Crouch Hill and Upper Holloway Stations. Local bakeries and eateries include Big Jo, Season Kitchen, La Boulangerie, Osteria Truffo and Dotori.

Additional Information
3,462 sq ft including studio/office in garden

detailedDescription:
A fabulous home with newly renovated, flexible space.

Location

Calabria Road is one of the most sought after roads in the area, situated moments from the idyllic Highbury Fields as well as Highbury and Islington Underground and Overground stations. The fantastic restaurants and shops of both Upper Street and Highbury Barn are a short walk away.

Description

This Victorian home has recently been comprehensively renovated and extended by the current owner, to offer flexible use of the space. Arranged over four floors and benefitting from a blend of period and modern features, including original cornicing, fireplaces and stained glass. Every detail has been considered and is offered to the market in excellent internal order.

Of note is the newly refurbished garden level, with a light and modern full front to back family living space, kitchen and dining area with full width bi-fold doors leading out to the private South facing, paved and walled garden. The German designed, Hacker kitchen is fitted with high end Gaggenau appliances. This large living space also features configurable, moveable walls to offer the flexibility of being set up as an additional bedroom for a guest, a home office or additional lounge area. The garden level is accessed from the main house or its own front door, and could be used as a self-contained nanny or granny flat if required.

On the raised ground floor is a bright, bay fronted reception room, with a further reception room to the rear.

Over the top two floors are four spacious double bedrooms. There is a family bathroom with shower temple and cast iron bath. The top floor is currently arranged as the principle room with ensuite shower and spacious lounge/media room/home office.

The house benefits from air conditioning and cat 6 high speed internet throughout, with ultra high speed fibre broadband and wireless Google Home Router, security, video, smoke alarm and other integrated smart devices installed.

Square Footage: 2220 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This beautiful three bedroom house is set on one of Highbury's favoured roads and offers modern interiors alongside a wonderful Victorian facade. The ground floor provides a light and spacious living room to the front alongside a generous dining kitchen to the rear which provides access to a low maintenance east-facing garden, whilst there is also a handy wc and hallway storage. The kitchen boasts quartz worktops, ample storage space and integrated high quality appliances throughout.
Two generous double bedrooms are found on the first floor, both of which benefit from ensuite bathrooms and the Master offers built in storage. A grand suite is located on the top floor and provides high ceilings alongside a luxurious contemporary shower room with large oversized shower and modern styling.
Highbury Hill is located moments from Highbury Fields and is perfectly set for the independent shops at Highbury Barn. The high street shops, bars and restaurants on Upper Street are within easy reach as are the design shops and cafes on Church Street. A selection of wonderful parks offer a variety of outdoor activities whilst Gillespie nature reserve offers a serene oasis at the end of the road.
Transport links are some of the best around creating effortless access across London. Arsenal offers the closest underground links on the Piccadilly line whilst Highbury and Islington and Finsbury Park provide Victoria line and Overground services. The weekday service from Drayton Park goes to Moorgate and an array of bus routes are on hand which provide routes to Angel, The City and West End.

detailedDescription:
While apartments are plentiful here in the City of London, large, well-proportioned houses are certainly more of a rarity. Here at aw Childs, we're pleased to offer to the market a rather unique proposition: A spacious, four-bedroom mews house right in the heart of the City of London. Based in Sidney Grove (EC1V 7LP), this unique, modern family-sized home offers all the space you could need in an ideal location for city workers and their families.

Importantly, this home's location is ideal for city commuters - Angel Tube - Northern Line - is only a 5-minute walk and, once opened, the property will also be a short walk away from Crossrail services at Farringdon Station - offering direct connections across the capital, to Heathrow Airport and further afield to towns such as Reading in the West and Shenfield in the East. There are also several bus services available on the A501 City Road, which is only a very short walk. There is also on-street parking available for those who drive.

The location also has a vast number of amenities to suit all the family - there's a Virgin Active gym within a 2-minute walk and a number of schools, a university, numerous shops, some fantastic outdoor spaces and many fabulous eateries all within a very short walk. The property is also a short walk from the fabulous Regent's Canal, the eateries, bars and boutique shops of Hoxton and Shoreditch and also the fantastic Exmouth Market.

The Property

We've covered the unbelievable location but what about the property itself? Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the City Road, Sidney Grove has a rather unique feel. A private street with no through road, Sidney Grove comprises a small number of uniquely styled, attractive family-sized mews homes. Sidney Grove is remarkably peaceful and ideally suited to those who enjoy city life but also enjoy some peace.

As you enter the property from street level, you come into the hallway. To the left, we find the spacious dining room and kitchen area. The room is incredibly light and spacious, featuring an ultra-modern, fully fitted white kitchen that has complementing white floor tiles. The kitchen leads into a formal dining area, which is ideal for entertaining or even just family dinner time. On this floor, there is also a W/C and a utility room - which is ideal for additional appliances.

Moving up to the first floor, we find a family-sized reception room with Juliet balcony access - this room will undoubtedly serve as the living area of the home, a 3.5 x 2.2m bedroom and a smaller (2.26 x 2.03m) bedroom/study. The smaller of the two bedrooms on this floor would be an ideal home office, perfect for those who now have the option of working from home. All of the rooms are finished in neutral tones and feature wooden flooring.

Now we move to the second floor. On this floor, we find two larger (4.47 x 3m and 3.58 x 3.53m) bedrooms and a fully fitted family bathroom, complete with a shower over bath, a basin and W/C. The rooms are again neutrally decorated and feature wood floors in the bedrooms and a fully tiled bathroom.

Finally, we move to the loft. On this floor, we find a large master bedroom (5.44 x 2.92m) that features a tiled floor, a wonderful glass-fronted walk-in wardrobe, a beautiful ensuite bathroom and direct access to the large (8.79 x 2.03m - estimated) terrace. The terrace offers wonderful opportunities for those with a creative touch to create a fantastic green space, and there's enough room to house a full patio set to make the most of the outdoor space

Amenities

As we've alluded to, this property offers the best that London has to offer: Fantastic amenities, a plethora of travel options and world-class entertainment facilities. For those who love London, there are few better options than Sidney Grove and this area of the City of London.

On The Market

On the market now for £1.25m, this unique, spacious property is going to be extremely popular. If you would like to find out more or would like to arrange a viewing, please call aw Childs estate agents today on or email us at .

detailedDescription:
Full description En suite to one of the bedrooms, a separate kitchen breakfast room in addition to the lounge diner and a bright, airy feeling are the stand out features of this charming, Victorian built upper maisonette.

Steps up from the pavement to the front of this beautiful 19th century conversion offer access to the entrance hall and front door to this tranquil dwelling which has been the happy home of the current owner for 15 years. The accommodation - spread over two floors - offers good living space throughout. On the lower level, the front room overlooks the quiet residential street, via two bright sash windows. The period fireplace on the flank wall and high ceilings make this room a lovely place to relax and unwind without the kitchen area intruding as is common with so many converted apartments.

Just behind is one of the bedrooms, and to the rear of this apartment is the kitchen diner, a skylight bathing the room in sunshine along with the windows to the side. The family bathroom is at the very back.

On the top floor is a good sized double bedroom with en suite shower room. Other similar properties on the street have added roof terrace, and a buyer may want to investigate this possibility, stp

situation and tenure Poets Road is one of the more popular streets forming the ladder of roads between Newington Green and Canonbury. For the City worker, Canonbury station is moments away offering a quick jump Liverpool St/ via Shoreditch High St station. The Victoria Line is also within walking distance at Highbury & Islington station. Many of the local residents make use of the 141 bus to get down to Moorgate, or enjoy walking and cycling.

Newington Green offers many eateries with Jolene bakery, Perilla restaurant for casual dining with continental twist, plenty of local pubs and of course access to 55 acres of greenery in Clissold Park.

One of the core benefits of this particular street is its great access to Stoke Newington, Dalston and Kingsland Road, as well as Islington's trendy Upper Street and Highbury. Something for everyone.

The property is held on a long 106 year lease, and the service charges are estimated at £617.95 next year, including ground rent of £10.

detailedDescription:
A slice of peace in a bustling corner of the city, you can peer out on Emirates stadium from the communal roof terrace of this contemporary two-bedroom, third floor flat.

Brickworks Says

Tucked down a quiet cul-de-sac moments from Holloway Road, the modern layout of this flat gives it a feeling of spaciousness. The open plan kitchen/living room is a well-designed, light-filled space, and the kitchen is generous enough to keep pesky clutter at bay. Two near-equal size double bedrooms make for harmonious family life, flat-share or a luxuriously proportioned home office for one. Decorated simply and freshly, this is a place to create a relaxing bubble close to one of London's most loved neighbourhoods.

The communal fifth floor roof terrace and ground floor garden are great spots for a mid-afternoon head-clearing moment on 'work from home' days, with the latter also providing bike storage and a children's play area. Meanwhile, Paradise Park and Highbury Fields are within strolling distance when you want to stretch your legs a little further.

And what a great spot! Take advantage of the emerging restaurant scene on Holloway Road, or zip down to Upper Street in minutes on two wheels. Plus, with Holloway Road and Drayton Park stations a quick walk away, you're also well-connected for the Underground and trains straight into the City.

The Owners Say

Our tranquil island is in the heart of one of the most fun and connected areas of the city. It’s been a brilliant home, surrounded by parks, open spaces and easy transport links to anywhere within London and beyond (hello, Paris!). We’ve also seen nearby Holloway Road grow into an extension of Upper Street as a destination for celebrated restaurants and new bars, but our home is a safe, secure and peaceful step away from the buzz, with comfortable and spacious living areas and modern design.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current energy efficiency rating of B.

In the Borough of Islington, the property falls into the Council Tax Band E (£2004 in 2021).

One of a block of 33 flats, the property is leasehold with 92 years remaining.

There is a monthly service charge of £196, and yearly ground rent of £190.

The service charge includes, but not exclusively: Concierge service, secure space for parcels and postage, refuse management, keeping lifts working with rapid response times if there are issues. It also covers building maintenance, cleaning, insurance, gardening and so on.

Budgets are very closely managed and have only increased once (by £20 per month) in the last eight years. Any significant changes in contractor costs have to go through a consultation process with the residents, so there is good oversight.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

The Legal Bit

While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

detailedDescription:
Situated on a quiet tree lined street close to the green open spaces of Finsbury Park and within short walking distance to both Victoria and Piccadilly Lines at Finsbury Park Underground Station, is this imposing Five Bedroom Stucco Fronted Victorian Terraced House in need of renovation.

Retaining some of its original features, this wonderful family home originally built circa 1890 boasts bright and spacious living accommodation of approximately 1861 SqFt, arranged over three main floors with further attic room. Accessed through a small front garden, the ground floor comprises of two large reception rooms, dining room, kitchen and W.C. Ascending to the first floor there is three double bedrooms and family bathroom with two further double bedrooms on second floor and addition of loft room at the top of the house. To the rear of this charming house the garden stretches to approximately 68ft in length and is made up of a mature lawn laid to flower beds and paved patio area with a storage area at the end.

Axminster Road is near to a range of amenities stretching along Holloway Road including Waitrose, Morrisons, the food market at Nags Head, odeon Luxe, independent coffee shops and eateries. Further shops and bakeries can be found on the ever popular Stroud Green Road, reached on foot in just 15 minutes’ (Google). The area is spoilt with a range of leisure centres including the Sobell Centre, Pure Gym and 110 acres of green open recreational space at Finsbury Park.

Transport links close by including the Underground Stations of Finsbury Park (0.7 miles away), Archway (0.8 miles away) and Upper Holloway Overground Station (0.6 miles away Google). The house is also in a prime location for all the major bus routes on Hornsey Road, Seven Sisters Road and Holloway Road taking you directly into the City, Hampstead Heath, Highbury and Crouch End.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A Grade II listed Georgian family home located on one of Angel’s most premier roads by the Regent’s Canal. Totalling near 2,000 sq ft across four floors with four bedrooms and two bathrooms. The raised ground floor offers a kitchen and dining space, open plan, with period features to include original fireplace, coving and sash windows with shutters. The bespoke kitchen is finished in white gloss with wooden tops. Between landings there is a family bathroom and access to the rear garden. The lower ground floor is presented as a guest area and could be used in part as a separate dwelling with its own kitchen and reception areas, bedroom and bathroom, ideal for a nanny, the flooring here is light oak. There is access to the vault storage and a utility area to the front of the property. The first floor front room has been retained as a grand reception room with high ceilings, impressive dual sash windows, fireplace and coving. Another bedroom and family bathroom complete this floor. The top floor is home to the final two double bedrooms, one with built in wardrobes.

Situation
Noel Road is a much sought after quiet residential street situated within the Duncan Terrace/ Colebrooke Row Conservation area. The nearest underground station is Angel (Northern line), within 0.2 miles, providing excellent transport connections to the City, West End, Canary Wharf and King's Cross/St Pancras. The property is within easy reach of all the amenities of Upper Street with its superb array of shops, bars and restaurants. Hanover Primary, Ofsted rated Good, is located on Noel Road.

detailedDescription: A rare opportunity to acquire an exceptional 10,620sq ft freehold site in an incredible position nestled between the Barbican and Smithfield Market. The property features 6.505sq ft recently renovated building set in a charming private garden and has a 1,076sq ft roof terrace. It is currently configured with a spacious one-bedroom apartment on the first floor and commercial offices occupying the remaining floors. This building has been renovated to an exceptional standard by internationally renowned designer Jan Wilson (bcfa Lifetime Achievement Award, 2016). It has a broad appeal, and will be of especial interest to buyers wishing to run their business from home, continue to use it as a commercial building or apply for a change of use to wholly residential. The property is extremely secure with the private front courtyard providing off-street parking for a number of cars. The first-floor apartment is spacious, well-appointed and in excellent decorative condition and benefits from a wonderful roof terrace, as well as a charming rear garden accessed by stairs or via the ground floor. The property occupies a strategic but secluded position behind Charterhouse Square and is accessed from Aldersgate Street. Barbican underground station and the new Elizabeth Line at Farringdon are a seven-minute walk away. The building is within easy walking distance to the excellent shops, restaurants, bars and entertainment of the City, Clerkenwell and Farringdon.

address: Peckett Square, Highbury Grange, London N5
detailedDescription:
A superb top floor, one bedroom apartment set in an attractive red brick mansion block on Highbury Grange. The flat has been beautifully finished throughout and offers a vast amount of natural light and well-proportioned rooms with views from each over peaceful communal gardens. The living room and kitchen offers a semi open plan layout providing a wonderfully social entertaining space whilst the double bedroom is of a generous size as is the family sized bathroom. The property has been tastefully decorated and benefits from wooden floors and stripped wooden sash windows and good hallway storage.
The block is well maintained and benefits from secure bike storage alongside a raised bed allotment for residents.
Peckett Square is set just moments from the entrance to the green spaces of Highbury Fields and the prestigious Highbury Barn. The property is close to highly renowned local amenities, including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bournes Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield.
Transport links are well serviced by Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and East London lines and Overground direct to the City) along with Arsenal underground station (Piccadilly line) both of which are only a short distance away. A wide selection of fantastic bus routes are also on hand for effortless access across London.

Offered on a chain free basis

detailedDescription:
A sensational, two double bedroom period conversion set across the second floor of this handsome Georgian building in Angel, Islington. Standing at an impressive 713 sqft, the property has been well maintained and is offered to the market on a chain free basis. Accommodation comprises a wonderfully bright, dual aspect reception room featuring inbuilt storage, a spacious west facing kitchen allowing ample space for dining, two genuine double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The property also has access to an exceptionally large communal roof terrace which can only be used by residents of the neighbouring buildings.
Liverpool Road is perfectly located in the heart of Angel and is just moments from the restaurants, bars and shops on Upper Street as well as being within easy reach of the fashionable Granary Square at Kings Cross. A selection of fantastic transport links are at hand with Angel station providing the closest underground links on the Northern line whilst an array of bus routes provide effortless access across London. Further underground links can be easily accessed from Kings Cross whilst international links are facilitated from St Pancras.

The property is exceptionally well placed for so much of what the area has to offer, with the buzz of Newington Green with its vibrant bars, cafés and restaurants offering international cuisine only a short walk away, a plethora of cafes, restaurants and trendy bars found at Dalston and Kingsland Road to the East and Stoke Newington to the North, with the delightful greenery of Clissold Park just a short stroll. detailedDescription:
A third floor loft, with a newly fitted Bulthaup kitchen and completely renovated bathrooms, there are two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a secure parking space.

This fabulous and authentic loft must be seen, a newly fitted Bulthaup kitchen is stocked with premium Miele and Gaggenau appliances, Nest heating, Smart sytem and voice activated lighting, heating and water control, mahogany flooring and a south facing reception room.

The expansive reception room has a wall of windows facing south and is open plan to the kitchen making entertaining a treat.
There is also a wall of storage cabinets with walnut interiors.

The kitchen has an extensive range of matt white finish cabinets with walnut interior, white granite worktops, a Miele washing machine and oven, and top of the range Gaggenau fridge and freezer, hob and all-important wine fridge.

The main bathroom has been fitted with a skylight, a white suite with Dornbracht/Vola/Axor and Bess fittings, a circular soft closure bin and hand towels, whole 3m porcelain tiles shipped from Sicily, Toto wc and bidet, and Duravit mirror.

The master and second bedroom are at the rear of the building away from the road, with fitted wardrobes, walnut and backlit interiors, the en-suite shower room also has high ceilings and 3m high tiles.

Clerkenwell offers an iconic wide range of bars and restaurants within a short walk of Berry Street.

The location benefits from superb transport links with Farringdon, Barbican and St. Paul’s stations all close by. The arrival of Crossrail in 2022 will provide easy access to Bond Street (4 minutes), Canary Wharf (8 minutes) and Heathrow (30 minutes). Supermarkets are a short walk away, with a large Waitrose on Whitecross Street.

The common parts of this building are due for renovation with decorating throughout, a light sensor system and sanding of the wooden floors.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description Rarely available, the garden level of this beautiful Victorian villa on the coveted mid-section of Highbury Hill is available for sale.

A grand set of steps lead from behind the wrought iron gates to the deep blue double front door of this imposing flat fronted period townhouse. One of the more desirable buildings on this street with three windows across, more lateral space is on offer than the narrower buildings giving a more spacious feel.

To the front of the property are two double bedrooms. There is an en suite to the master bedroom, both this and the family bathroom have been recently fitted to a very high standard, including underfloor heating in both. Bespoke Thomas Sanderson shutters were fitted by the current owners to the bedroom windows.

Behind the family bathroom is a full width living room, with French doors and windows overlooking the back garden, bathing the room with light. The kitchen boasts full white goods, is presented beautifully, and slightly recessed from the main dining area. The spacious hallway has two double door full-length cupboards, offering plenty of storage. The hallway and open-plan living/kitchen/dining area have just been freshly painted.

Possibly the stand out feature of this stunning dwelling is the rear garden. Directly out of the French doors there is a split level patio area with garden furniture and then steps up to the garden. High quality, natural-looking artificial grass covers the lawn and mature bedding plants border either side. At a total length of 34ft and 28ft wide, the garden is far larger than most houses in the area. Also note that the garden in its entirety is almost twice as long, so the rear space is not overlooked, sunny for most of the day and the envy of the neighbours.

This beautiful home has been cherished by the owners and is presented impeccably throughout.

Situation and tenure The preferred section of Highbury Hill is the quiet stretch between Martineau Road and Aubert Park, and this flat is nestled in the midst of it. Almost all anyone would need is within easy walking distance. For the City worker, Drayton Park station goes directly to Moorgate - the station is less than a 5 minute walk from the flat and the journey 10 minutes. Victoria and Overground are accessible from Highbury and Islington station, a lovely walk up to the Clock Tower and through the Fields. Piccadilly line is conveniently located from Arsenal tube. For the more hardy, many local residents walk to work in central London.

There is a Tesco Express moments away on Drayton Park, and two branches of Waitrose only slightly further afield. Highbury Barn boasts perennial favourites La Fromagerie, Godfrey's butchers, Bournes' fishmongers and other convenience stores. There are many local restaurants of note - Westerns Laundry, Farang, Zia Lucia pizza and many more. There is a top tier Fitness First gym half a mile away, a swimming pool on Highbury Fields which also offers 29 acres of green space.

The property owns a Share of the Freehold, and the maintenance costs are shared between the flats in the building

detailedDescription:
A bright, two double bedroom, ground floor apartment situated in the Northstand of the ever-popular Highbury Stadium Square. Standing close to 900 sqft, the property has been tastefully decorated by the current owners and features an upgraded kitchen & Bosch appliances. The spacious, dual aspect, open plan living room/kitchen faces directly east allowing for an abundance to natural light to filter through. Both bedrooms are very good-sized doubles, the master benefitting from inbuilt storage while the property is completed with a modern family bathroom and ample storage throughout.
Highbury Stadium Square is set in a quiet part of Highbury, away from the hustle and bustle of main roads, yet provides convenient access to the shops of Blackstock Road and Highbury Park, most notably the renowned Godfreys butchers, the Fromagerie and the fishmongers. Arsenal Underground station is only moments away and sits on the Piccadilly Line with links through to the West End. Trains can also be found at both Drayton Park and Finsbury Park stations with links to the city and Kings Cross/St Pancras International, and access to the Victoria Line. On-site access to a premium Fitness First gym with swimming pool (through separate paid member ship) and an impressive 2 acre manicured communal garden.

This phenomenal apartment is only a short distance from the ever popular Highbury Barn, boasting an array of award winning food shops and the recently renovated Highbury Barn gastro pub, but it is also superbly connected, with Arsenal (Piccadilly line), Holloway Road (Piccadilly line) and Drayton Park Station (First Capital Connect to Moorgate) all close by. detailedDescription:
A bright, three double bedrooms, two-bathroom, freehold house set on one of Highbury's most desirable roads. Standing close to 1,100 sqft, the property is presented in good condition throughout and offered to the market on a chain free basis. After entering through your own front door, the ground floor consists of a good-sized kitchen with ample worktop and storage space, a well-proportioned reception leading out to a south-west facing private patio and downstairs wc. The first floor occupies two double bedrooms, the master at present being used as an additional living room by the current occupiers and two bathrooms to the rear. The third bedroom can be found on the half landing and presents superb views over the neighbourhood.
Plimsoll Road is a tree-lined street in the Blackstock triangle which is renowned for its neighbourly feel. Furthermore, the property falls within the catchment area of a number of local schools rated "Outstanding" by Ofsted including the very popular Gillespie and Ambler Schools. The property is perfectly situated for an array of local amenities including independent shops, restaurants and coffee shops as well as being in easy reach of three local parks and Gillespie nature reserve. Upper Street is only a short distance away and transport links are some of the best around with Arsenal station providing the Piccadilly line and Finsbury Park offering overground services (including the Thameslink network serving the City and Gatwick Airport) and underground services on the Victoria line. Drayton park further provides direct links to Moorgate whilst numerous bus routes offer effortless transport to the City and West End.

detailedDescription:
Offering plentiful scope to accommodate a large growing family as well as a home office, this five storey house is situated on a quiet street adjacent to Highbury Barn. To the front, there is a traditional Victorian stoop with stairs to the front door and also down to separate access to the lower floor of the house. The South facing rear garden is accessed from bi-fold doors from the kitchen diner and family room. With central island, the kitchen lends itself well to accommodating the young family and as an entertaining space. To the front of the house, there is a separate room utilised currently as a home treatment studio but would suit very well as home office, with an adjacent cloak. The stairs to the rear of the house access a shower room on the way up to the raised ground floor level. The raised ground floor is home to a double through reception room. To the front of the house is a huge bay window with views out to the street. Behind is a further reception room, with doors overlooking a small roof terrace. The entrance hall leads up to a Study/Dressing Room on the half landing, then up to the first floor. A breathtaking master bathroom is to the rear of the house, with stand alone Victorian style bathtub, exposed brickwork and walk-in rainfall shower. The front bedroom boasts high ceilings and double windows overlooking the street, a feature fireplace and gorgeous handmade wooden shutters on the windows. On the second floor are two further double bedrooms, and the final staircase leads to the suite on the top floor. There are floor to ceiling windows in this room with stunning views over the Juliet balcony South towards the City. With an en suite shower room, this floor is ideal for visitors, nannies or even lucky teenagers. With an increased inclination to working from home for at least part of the week, or for the home based professional with family, this beautiful dwelling is sure to make a happy family home for decades to come. The home has full CCTV and adt house alarm.
Kelvin Road is set just moments from the green spaces of Highbury Fields and the prestigious Highbury Barn. The property is seconds away from the highly renowned local amenities, including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bourne's Fishmongers and Wine Rack Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield. Transport links are well serviced by a selection of good bus routes as well Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and East London lines) and Arsenal Station (Piccadilly Line) both a short distance.
