detailedDescription:
Set back from the road in this secure development is this 3 bedroom factory conversion house spanning over 1,200sq ft.
On entering the property (through a large shared courtyard), you will find on the ground floor three generous double bedrooms. The master bedroom has a large en-suite bathroom (and wetroom) and leads out onto a private patio area (the second bedroom also leads out on to the private patio). There is a second wetroom on this floor. As you come up the stairs it opens up onto a magnificent open plan living-dining-kitchen space, with double height ceiling, exposed beams and floor to ceiling windows overlooking the courtyard. There is also a WC on this floor. The property is presented in excellent condition throughout and has ample storage.
Blackstock Road is just a couple of minutes from the prestigious Highbury Barn. The property is seconds away from the highly renowned local amenities, including Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bournes Fishmongers and HighburyVintners . It is also walking distance from Clissold Park and Highbury Fields.
The property is fantastically placed for local transport links - with a selection of excellent bus routes, and Finsbury Park (Victoria line) and Arsenal a short distance away. Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and London Overground lines) is also within close proximity.

detailedDescription:
A spacious, two double bedroom period conversion set across the first floor of this handsome, end of terrace Victorian House in Highbury, N5. Standing close to 570 sqft, the property is presented in good condition throughout while retaining plentiful charm and character. Accommodation comprises of a wonderfully bright, open plan living room/kitchen featuring large sash windows allowing for an abundance of natural light to pour through. Both bedrooms are well proportioned and overlook the neighbouring gardens, the master benefiting from a small bay window creating a perfect work from home space. The property is completed with a modern family bathroom and a share of the freehold.

detailedDescription: A fabulous 2 double bedroom, 2 bathroom penthouse apartment, converted from a former commercial building and benefitting from 3 private roof terraces and offering impressive city views that must be viewed to be truly appreciated. This apartment offers excellent access to Old Street & The Barbican. Accommodation is both bright, spacious and well-presented and comprises; 2 double bedrooms, both of which benefit from an en suite bathroom and access to 2 of the 3 of the apartments roof terraces, further W.C, as well as a spectacular, semi open plan kitchen/reception room, offering impressive city views, as well as providing access to a further terrace. The property is ideally located for access to the financial hub of the City, the technology centre of Old Street (Silicon Roundabout). The nightlife, bars restaurants, boutique shops and galleries of Hoxton, Shoreditch and Clerkenwell as well as the Barbican are all close by, giving a vast array of choice within a small geographical area. It should be noted that with work well under way on the construction in Farringdon, which is a future Crossrail hub, the property is suitably positioned to benefit from its completion, both in terms of additional transport links and the potential for future growth and investment.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional penthouse apartment in Hoxton.

Location

Coronet Street is a small, cobbled turning of mostly warehouse style buildings, linking Old Street, Hoxton Square and Pitfield Street.

Exceptionally well placed for the enjoyment of London's most vibrant and booming creative hubs. There are a wealth of bars, restaurants and boutique retailers in the surrounding locale. The area is also bordered by The City, Spitalfields and Clerkenwell with Bloomsbury and Covent Garden only a short distance away

Located approximately 450 yards from Old Street Station and approximately 730 yards from both Shoreditch high Street Station and Hoxton Station (source: ).

Description

An exceptional penthouse apartment in the heart of Hoxton.

This incredible one bedroom apartment has been completely overhauled by Coffey architects. The ingenious design puts the kitchen 'island' as the centre of the apartment with a glass screen separating the bedroom area. With the flick of a switch the glass can be turned translucent or opaque.

Natural light is plentiful with a number of windows on either side of the main living area. To the rear, a private roof terrace leads directly from the living room.

Square Footage: 685 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 104 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,000,000 to £1,050,000

This house was converted from a factory in the ‘loft style’ by the award-winning Julian Cowie Architects, and retains its original 1890 bay window.

It has all the benefits of a terraced house, including its own front door, while offering all of the benefits of the Monsell Court development.

There is a reason why these properties rarely come to market: The last one was sold over ten years ago.

The ingenious design maximises the space and light throughout the house, with 3m ceilings on the ground floor and a vaulted living area above, giving a huge space to entertain.

The mezzanine gallery at the top of the house could be used as a third bedroom, but is currently set up as a library and study for two people, making it the ideal place to work from home.

There is a private garden in the south-facing courtyard at the back of a house, and a Juliette balcony which looks out over the palm trees.

Monsell Road is a tree-lined street in Highbury West that connects to the ‘Blackstock Village’, with its traditional butcher, greengrocer, bookshop and vintner, along with cafés and restaurants including Fink’s, Beam and Top Cuvée.

Gillespie School is around the corner. Clissold Park, Gillespie Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields are all nearby, and the whole of London is within easy reach on the Victoria and Piccadilly lines.

Ideal for young families, those looking for something unusual and professionals too.

An early viewing is highly recommend.

There are many great coffee shops, restaurants, and bars only a step or two away including Salt the Raddish, Yard Sale Pizza, Top Cuvee, and Finks.
Any football fans with being impressed with the proximity to Arsenal Stadium.

Newly refurbished Three Bedroom, Three Bathroom duplex apartment, located on a popular High Street moments from Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line) and easy reach of both Upper Street and Kings Cross/St Pancras International.

Occupying the first and second floors of a grand period building elevated above Holloway Road, and benefitting from a full schedule of refurbishments works all finished to an exceptional standard, this naturally bright property offers approximately 1047 SqFt of flexible living and still retains some of its period features including decorative fireplaces, wood flooring and high ceilings. Entered through a private front door, the first floor comprises of two spacious living rooms, closet bathroom with walk in shower and brand new fully fitted kitchen finished with brick tile surround and solid wood counter top.

The second floor consists of two-double bedrooms both fitted with bespoke wardrobes and en-suite to the main bedroom. The contemporary bathroom suite is fitted with full bath tub and also benefits from a wall-mounted waterfall shower, finished with brick tile splashback. The undemised loft area can be accessed from the landing providing further storage space.

Holloway Road Underground Station is just '7 minutes’ walk (Google), providing direct access to the Piccadilly Line which reaches Kings Cross/St Pancras International in 7 minutes’ and Leicester Square Underground Station in 11 minutes’. Drayton Park Station and Finsbury Park Station (Victoria & Piccadilly Line) are also within walking distance along with a number of bus routes, some running 24hr services.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Superbly located in Bryer Court stunning Views over the Award Winning Beech Gardens, flooded with light, facing West facing New style Kitchen. Bathroom. Triple width and full height glass sliding door to balcony. Barbican Type F1D named after John Bryer, a former watchmaker. Extended 178 year lease

Full details Flooded with natural light this stunning studio apartment has gorgeous views overlooking Beech Gardens designed by Nigel Dunnett The flat is known as a Barbican type F1D and is located on the first floor. The studio room has triple full height windows with the centre one fully sliding. Extended 178 Year Lease. Underfloor heating throughout included in the service charge. Lift. Parking available by separate negotiation. The property also has the added benefit of an extended lease.Built in 1971, the Barbican Estate is the finest achievement of the architects Chamberlain, Powell & Bon. The architects drew inspiration from Le Corbusier, famous for being one of the pioneers of what now is called Modern architecture. Their vision has created a unique urban village community devoid of traffic with immediate amenities including the Barbican Arts Centre, a church, school, library and shops. The estate was Grade ii-listed in 2001 in recognition of its extraordinary contribution to London's urban landscape. Barbican tube station (on the Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) is only a couple of minutes' walk away, with Moorgate (on the Northern line), St Paul's (on the Central line) and Mansion House (on the District line) tube stations each within a short walking distance. Moments walking distance the new Crossrail Station Farringdon Station. This entrance will provide access to the 'East Ticket Hall' linking directly with the existing London Underground platforms at Barbican & Farringdon Stations therefore providing access to the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines. On completion in 2021( December) Farringdon Station will be a vital interchange between the North-South Thameslink and the East-West Crossrail service. 140 trains per hour will travel through the station. Crossrail will give direct access to Canary Wharf in 9 minutes & Bond Street in 3 minutes.Waitrose is located nearby on Whitecross Street, which is also home to the weekday Whitecross Street food market. Next door to the Barbican is West Smithfield an area that has seen a huge regeneration, incoming occupiers are small food outlets, coffee shops bars & restaurants providing a buzzing mixed use location. Comprising of many media, digital and creative industries, but increasingly legal, professional and finance. The Museum of London will move to Smithfield Market in 2025 ( est). Smithfield Meat Market will be vacating by 2025 ( est) then it are will be transformed into a world beating food & gastro destination and will be part of the world beating Cultural Mile. Also within easy reach are the attractions of St. Paul's' Cathedral, New Change Shopping Complex. The River Thames, Tate Modern, Gabriel's Wharf and South Bank.

detailedDescription:
Full description This smart one bedroom garden flat is presented in great condition throughout, and set at the rear of the building, giving peace and quiet also.

The front door, painted a lovely dark blue, opens onto a communal corridor leading to the apartment which is located at the rear of this terrace, behind commercial units which are unoccupied in the evenings and across most of the weekend affording the occupant tranquillity. The entrance hall gives access to a shower room and the large double bedroom.

To the rear of the flat, the open plan living room and kitchen is bathed in light and brightly decorated, with access to a courtyard garden in which to enjoy the Summer sun.

This city pad is presented in excellent decorative order throughout and would suit the first time buyer very well indeed - a low maintenance, larger than average one bedroom apartment with excellent transport links and no work required.

Situation and tenure The owner of this apartment will benefit from excellent transport links to an array of train and bus services. Victoria Line is within walking distance via either Highbury & Islington or Finsbury Park. Piccadilly Line is a short walk away at Arsenal tube. Or, just step onto the 19 bus at the stop a few metres from the front door - and then back off securely at any time of the day or night!

There is a great array of local amenities, delis and boutiques on this bustling section of the street, with Highbury Barn a few minutes away offering Godfreys Butchers., La Fromagerie, as well as a selection of boutiques and eateries.

Stoke Newington and Clissold Park are also a pleasant walk away, offering an eclectic array of amenities, shops and restaurants as well as 55 acres of green space, a paddling pool and even a butterfly dome!

The property is held of a long leasehold and pays a proportion of the maintenance of the building along with the other apartments

detailedDescription:
Moments from Elthorne Park and the Northern Line at Archway Underground Station is this very unique development of three and four bedroom luxury Freehold Town Houses, architecturally designed to incorporate sleek modern living and innovative renewable energy resources.

This very spacious and naturally bright Three Bedroom, Two Bathroom townhouse accessed through a secure resident’s only courtyard affords its owners with a wealth of flexible living accommodation of circa 917 Sq.Ft. The ground floor opens up giving way too two large double bedrooms and fully tiled contemporary three-piece bathroom suite, complete with wall mounted shower. The first floor comprises of double bedroom to rear aspect, fully tiled second bathroom with walk in shower and floating W.C, fitted open-plan kitchen / reception room with integrated appliances making excellent entertaining space, this currently incorporates a floating wall (easily removed) that divides the rooms to make a temporary fourth bedroom complete with Juliet balcony and private balcony.

The private garden accessed to the rear of the property has been finished with stone slabs laid to featheredge fencing and brickwork making a perfect sun trap and lounge area.

Fitted with Green Energy technology these rare homes incorporate roof-top solar panels (that can actually earn residents money), low u-value double glazed windows and doors, underfloor heating and individual thermostats, code 4 heat insulation and heat-recovery system. The property further benefits from engineered wood flooring, fire rated wood doors, low energy spot lights throughout and CCTV on entry to the development.

Lotus Mews, off Sussex Way is located in one of North London’s most vibrant locations with easy access to a range of Farmers Markets, eateries, independent coffee shops, art retail outlets, supermarkets, and leisure facilities stretching across Tufnell Park, Archway, Crouch End and Finsbury Park. The area is serviced by a number of transport links with Archway Underground Station Northern Line (0.6 miles - Google) and Upper Holloway Overground Station (0.3 miles - Google). Kings Cross/ St Pancras International is easily accessible from this location, providing national mainline trains and international travel via the Eurostar link.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to acquire a freehold comprising of two residential units and one commercial unit in Islington which has undergone extensive refurbishment.

Please note this is not a full residential property - please read the full description

The commercial unit on the ground floor totals 576 sqft and benefits from a small rear courtyard. There is also a large crawl space under the ground floor which would work well for storage. It is currently in shell and core condition and would suit a variety of occupiers from a coffee shop to a designer showroom.

On the first floor of the building is a one bed apartment totaling 424 sqft which has just undergone full refurbishment which retains much of the historic charm and original features alongside the comforts and conveniences of modern living. Exposed brick walls, double-glazed sash windows and engineered wood floors are complemented by a contemporary fitted kitchen, en suite bathroom, and video entry system. The main living space gives access to a large private terrace.

On the second and third floor is a split level one bedroom apartment which has also undergone a full refurbishment to match the character and charm of the neighboring apartment. The second-floor main living space has direct access to a vast terrace at the rear of the apartment. The terrace is quiet and triple aspect so benefits from all day sun for much of the year. The stairs and half landing to the top floor offer additional storage space, whilst the large top floor bedroom has high ceilings and great views.

Penton Street is set amidst a charming mix of local independent shops and cafes, with the popular Chapel Market nearby. There are many garden squares and small parks nearby, and the Regent’s Canal towpath provides an easy pedestrian and cycle route to Regent’s Park, a green oasis with numerous facilities and attractions. Less than a mile from King’s Cross, the apartment is perfectly located to offer excellent access to the City and West End on foot, by bike or via public transport.

agency_name: Hurford Salvi Carr - Clerkenwell & City Sales
detailedDescription:
Exemplary school conversion with A prime clerkenwell address

A truly iconic building in the heart of Clerkenwell, this exemplary school conversion apartment has an elevated corner location with a double height dual aspect and great views of the Clerkenwell skyline.

One of the most recognised buildings in Clerkenwell, and Grade II Listed, this dignified Victorian school was sympathetically converted into luxury apartments in 1999, paying attention to the building's character and features.

The building impressively retains a sense of grandiosity with elegant turrets, terrazzo tiled communal hallways, impeccable Victorian glazed tiling, tall windows, well-tended communal gardens and a day porter.

The apartment offers versatile and flexible accommodation with a superb double height open plan reception room with recessed kitchen, a further reception room which could be used as a study, bedroom or library, an ensuite shower room and a guest bathroom.

On the top floor, which galleries over the living space there is a master bedroom with ensuite shower room and a further sleeping/home office space. It also has a secure allocated off-street parking space in the newly refurbished car park, which will also shortly have electric car charging points.

Quietly nestled in the Clerkenwell Green conservation area between the green open spaces of Spa Fields and St James’s Gardens, its location is admirable with Farringdon Station (Mainline, Thameslink, Underground and soon to open Crossrail) and Chancery Lane (Underground) a short walk away, giving quick and easy access to the City’s financial district or London’s West End. Kings Cross/ St Pancras with its Eurostar links, excellent national services and six Underground lines, is within walking distance.

The apartment is also a short stroll to Exmouth Market which has a wonderful selection of independent shops, restaurants and bars as well as one of the best street food markets in London.

Clerkenwell remains London’s Avant Garde design district with Internationally recognised furniture and architectural practises, media agencies, tech start-ups as well as globally recognised brands such as Linked-in, Google, Bloomberg, Deloitte and Goldman Sachs, all which have headquarters close by. The 'House of Detention’ in the underground vaults of Kingsway Place usually hosts part of the annual Clerkenwell Design Festival.

detailedDescription:
Appointed Sole Agents tba Property have to offer for sale, the largest penthouse loft apartment spanning circa 3,182 sqft in The Factory, an original Victorian warehouse building converted in 1997 by The Manhattan Loft Corporation.

Configured over two floors, this dual aspect 3rd & 4th (top) floor apartment comprises of two large double bedrooms, an open-plan kitchen/living space, a main bathroom and an additional shower room. The large private roof terrace on the upper floor benefits from artificial grass, two access points and an irrigation system.

This former Victorian textiles building is a classic example of industrial to residential conversions near Shoreditch and having been sold as shell and core space, all the loft apartments within are individually different. The building also benefits from lift access, onsite porter and a private/secure underground carpark - 2 designated spaces are included.

This area is becoming known as the much sought after Shepherdess Walk Quarter and is a part of East London between Shoreditch and Islington that contains some of the largest apartments this history rich district of London has to offer. With numerous restaurants, coffee houses and amenities nearby it’s an area that’s a short walk from all the action without the hustle and bustle.

The property is set back on the Caledonian Road, by the Regents Canal and only minutes to the urban development of Regent Quarter bringing a dynamic mix of living, working and leisure space. Kings Cross has a history of bustling businesses that thrived on Britain's great rail networks. Railways still play a big part in King's Cross and St Pancras, as it is one of London's busiest links between the National Rail network, with no fewer than six Underground lines and nine bus routes, with of course a direct link to mainland Europe. The regeneration is being built upon by the continued investment attracting blue chip employers such as Google and Central St Martins College.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Designed by Buckley Gray Architects and winner of Best Completed Development at the Housing Design Awards this smart home was described by the Architects Journal as “ingenious three dimensional design”. The property amasses over 2,000 sq ft of space across just three floors and is gated with off street parking to the front. The architectural design throughout focuses on light and the ground floor entertaining space has floor to ceiling glass doors at either end offering the potential to open the entire space in the warmer months. The living, dining and entertaining space showcase American walnut wooden flooring and effortless flow through to a rear planted patio garden. The kitchen boasts black granite tops and Miele appliances. The lower ground floor is home to three bedrooms, two with built in wardrobes, a further patio area and two bathrooms, one en suite with shower. The third bedroom has been configured as a study with fitted shelving and desk space. Bathrooms are courtesy of Philippe Starck and the family bathroom has both a shower and bath. The first floor offers a principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes, air conditioning, en suite bathroom and terrace. There are only four properties within Haven Mews so the opportunity to purchase one of these sought after homes is rare. The property is available chain free.

Situation
Nestled conveniently between Barnsbury Street, College Cross and Liverpool Road the property is secure gated. It is set back from the road to alleviate any concerns of road noise and within easy reach of Upper Street. Transport links are plentiful too with Angel and Highbury & Islington easily accessible

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located in a highly sought after area of Islington this superb, two-bedroom property is an attractive Victorian conversion. Set over two floors, the property benefits from an abundance of space and character throughout, making it feel like a true London home. Boasting its own front door, two generous double bedrooms with high ceilings, two bathrooms, an open plan living and dining space, and a beautiful private garden perfect for entertaining. This stunning London flat is a must see. This property has been very well maintained by the current vendors and offers a ready to move into home.

Westbourne road is moments from a variety of transport links providing easy access across London. The property is just a short walk from Caledonian Road station (Piccadilly line) and Highbury and Islington station which offers underground (Victoria line) and overground services and a 10 minute trip to Kings Cross St Pancras opening up easy access to international destinations. Upper Street is close by and provides an assortment of coffee shops, bars and restaurants alongside an array of boutique shops. Just a short walk from the property is the stunning Highbury fields which offers a beautiful green space.

The Owner Says
"I have lived in this flat for the last 10 years and I absolutely love it. It's a really generous living space which has been brilliant for entertaining family and friends.

The local area is fantastic, plenty of local parks, amazing coffee and great pubs (and anything you could want on deliveroo)."

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A stunning two bedroom apartment, as part of this 1940's built block in Islington N1. This property is situated in a very quiet part of town, with beautiful views of the private gardens below, and a city skyline. This beautifully bright and well presented two bedroom flat, located between Essex Road and Angel Islington train stations. The property has been refurbished to a modern style and offers great space. The main area is made up of a spacious reception, which boasts a bay window overlooking the green of the compound, hardwood parquet flooring and access to the modern fitted kitchen area. The bedrooms are both doubles, one of which is generous in size, both also with the added luxury of fitted storage. The bathroom is designed to a contemporary style, with metro tiles and classical fixtures.

Isleden House is a 1940's build, which has retained a lot of the charm of this style of construction. The property has a communal balcony for access to the flats, which overlooks an exquisitely maintained green on the ground floor.

The property is offered chain free, viewings for this property are highly recommended.

agency_name: Hurford Salvi Carr - Clerkenwell & City Sales
detailedDescription:
Impressive three bedroom lateral apartment in former gin distillery

A very special apartment in the former site of the J. & W. Nicholson Gin Distillery which was founded by John Nicholson. The original façade of the building dates to the early 18th century and remains one of the most recognised buildings on St John Street. Converted into apartments in the late 1990’s the apartment benefits from a secure parking space, access to communal gardens and a day porter.

The apartment still retains its original arched Victorian windows and comprises a double reception room, three double bedrooms, bathroom and modern kitchen.

Located on St John Street close to the junction of Clerkenwell Road the apartment is a short walk to Farringdon Station offering both Underground (Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) and Mainline services and will benefit from the opening of Crossrail in 2022 making it one of the most accessible locations in the Capital.

Clerkenwell remains one of London's most dynamic destinations, with fashion designers, architectural practices and high-end bespoke furniture companies having based their headquarters in the area.

Close to Barbican, Old Street, Bloomsbury and Shoreditch, the location has become one of the most "trendy" and "super cool" in London with the area now home to reportedly over 5,000 tech companies and start-ups, in fact cnn European Network, hbo, Time Warner, Goldman Sachs, Deloitte and Linked-in have headquarter offices close by.

The area offers the very best fine dining and eclectic street food markets, bespoke shops, art galleries and designer furniture shops. It is a short walk to London's Legal and Financial districts.

The Barbican centre which is a few minutes’ walk away is part of the Global Cultural Districts Network and is the largest performing Art Centre in Europe, hosting music concerts, art exhibitions and film screenings.

detailedDescription:
Warehouse style apartment! This exceptionally bright 829 sqft 2-bed, 2-bath apartment with full height crittall-style windows and a balcony forms part of Eagle Wharf Road - a stylish collection of thirty-six - 1,2 and 3 bedroom warehouse style apartments on Eagle Wharf Road, situated in the heart of Hoxton.

Eagle Wharf Road offers modern, easy living in one of London's most vibrant neighbourhoods. The surrounding streets and canals are packed with galleries and museums, pubs and eccentric cocktail joints, Michelin-star restaurants and food markets, Victorian music halls and experimental art spaces. There's no place quite like it. Inspired by the area's rich industrial and artisanal past, Eagle Wharf Road celebrates Hoxton's age-old authenticity and raw energy with this stylish collection of 36 warehouse style apartments.

Located just off New North Road, these homes have excellent transport links, with Angel and Old Street tube stations a short walk away. Combining quality and craft, these bright and spacious homes are at the heart of the city's most creative neighbourhood. Each apartment features living rooms with integrated Sonos ceiling speakers, dimmable lighting, spacious balconies and full height double doors.. Fitted kitchens have a Silestone worktop and splash-back and Nobilia cabinetry.

Adolphus Road is a wide tree lined residential turning, nestled neatly between Seven Sisters Road and Green Lanes, providing superb access to the transport hub at Finsbury Park station, with national rail trains and two Underground lines (Victoria & Piccadilly). detailedDescription:
Guide Price £625,000 to £650,000

Stunning three bedroom maisonette split over the second and third floors within a small low rise purpose built block.

The reception room is one of the main draws to the property being flooded with natural light over looking the award winning garden in Arlington Square.

There is ample space making it ideal to both relax and entertain in.

The separate kitchen is perfect for young families, with plenty of work surfaces including a dishwasher.

Also on the second floor there is a separate WC and two large storage cupboards for your everyday items.

On the third floor, the large master bedroom is located again over looking the square and with built in wardrobes.

In addition to this there is a further good size double bedroom, third bedroom and recently renovated family bathroom.

The property is in good condition throughout.

Location;

Arbon Court is opposite one of the most highly sought after squares in Islington making it a great and peaceful place to live.

Arbon Court is in the catchment area of an Ofsted rated outstanding primary school and there are several good local nurseries.

Also, neighbouring Islington and De Beauvoir Town make it a vibrant place to live with an array of award-winning bars and restaurants.

Upper Street has an array of boutique shops and independent coffee shops.

For entertainment, the Angel Central has a cinema and the 02 Academy, The Everyman Screen on the Green and Almeida Theatre offer more intimate nights out.

Regents Canal and Shoreditch Park are both within five minutes and make for a great walk and have various activities all year round.

Transport;

Angel Underground Station on the Northern Line is within walking distance and is a quick route to other Central London locations, The West End and beyond.

Essex Road National Road station goes both in the direction towards Highbury and Islington or Old Street giving an alternative route to several important transport hubs in London.

Ideal for those looking to upsize and families alike.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful bespoke Two-Double Bedroom duplex apartment with share-of-freehold and generous private rear garden, situated in one of the area’s most desirable locations on a quiet tree lined street within the Hillmarton Conservation Area and moments from amenities and transport links.

Arranged over the second floor of this charming Victorian building originally built circa 1890, the property has been meticulously refurbished throughout to retain the authenticity whilst creating more functional living space. Entered on the first floor, the main bedroom on the half landing opens up into a wonderful sized room with vaulted ceilings and fitted wardrobes on the back wall, soaked in natural light from the south-facing refurbished sash window.

The solid oak flooring continues upwards where there is a bright and spacious landing which offers potential to create a work space or reading area, in addition there is access to a large insulated loft area ideal for further storage or potential to extend (STPP, costs and approval). Leading off the landing, the open-plan reception / dining room provides wonderful entertaining space and views over the immediate area from two oversized refurbished sash windows whilst the adjacent second double bedroom offers lots of space for freestanding furniture.

The contemporary hand crafted kitchen is located at the rear of the property and offers integrated appliances and built in cupboard space, finished with a full height and width splashback wall. A bespoke bathroom suite comprises of bathtub and wall mounted shower with wall-mounted controls, floating W.C encased in a solid wood vanity unit with top mounted wash basin and single lever mixer tap. The property further benefits from a private garden, where the owners have created a beautiful space for entertaining complete with stone slabs laid to mature flower beds and pebbled seating area.

This popular area in one of Islington's fastest changing areas benefits from being within close proximity of a range of amenities along Holloway Road including organic supermarkets, coffee shops, eateries and leisure centres. Further amenities on Upper Street and a range of parks including Highbury Fields, Caledonian Park and Paradise Park are all within walking distance of Freegrove Road.

Caledonian Road and Holloway Road are the closest underground stations with direct access to the Piccadilly Line with Drayton Park Mainline Station also near-by. There are several bus routes nearby providing easy access to The West End, The City, King's Cross/St Pancras International and Hampstead Heath recreational ground.<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

Top 3 things you love about your home
1. The south-facing garden is an incredible sun-trap that transports you to a warm, tranquil place far away from the hustle-bustle of London. Feeling the sun on your face while watching goldfinches and blue tits as you drink a coffee is an incredible way to start a weekend. A small shed is a perfect place to store the charcoal you will want to have on hand for impromptu bbqing with family and friends. The double doors that lead outside welcome sunlight throughout the flat, making it feel bright, airy and warm. In the summer, a curtain of wisteria makes the space feel even more magical.
2. The bathroom was designed with the help of an Islington firm to create a sanctuary with the feel of a sauna. The use of bespoke tile, wood and mirrors creates a room that feels both rustic and modern at the same time. Reading lights over the bath allow you to relax with a book and forget about the stresses of the day. The heated floor keeps the room cosy, even in the winter, and a heated mirror over the sink means you can easily have a shave after a shower. A pocket door hides a washing machine, tumble dryer and loads of storage shelves. A water softener protects your skin and hair as well as your appliances from London's hard water. There is also a massive amount of storage under the sink and countertop so you can keep everything tucked away.
3. High ceilings and original features provide a unique, spacious and welcoming feel to the property. White-oiled oak floors from Ecora bring a fresh, modern look to the flat. With spacious gardens to the back and a quiet road to the front, it is a peaceful place to live. When sitting in the lounge, you hear birds instead of traffic. You will feel miles away from London even though you're a three-minute walk from the Canonbury overground and a ten-minute stroll from the Highbury & Islington tube stop.

Three things we love about the area.
1. There are many green spaces just a short walk away. From Highbury Fields to Newington Green to Clissold Park, it's so easy to have a weekend amble.
2. Running errands feels so much more managable when the clerk at the Post Office asks about your day, the owner of the corner shop waves every morning and the owner of Vins knows exactly what wines you will love. It's easy to pick up provisions for a picnic in the park near Newington Green (cheese from Jumi, charcuterie from Yield N16 and pastries from Jolene or Belle Epoque) or Highbury Barn (cheese from La Fromagerie, Italian snacks from Da Mario and fruit from Mrs Lovell's Greengrocers).
3. The Canonbury overground stop offers two lines, making it easy to get to places like Hampstead Heath, Stratford and Canada Water, while the Victoria Lina and trains from Highbury & Islington provide even more opportunities. The area offers supurb public transport connections while still feeling quiet and calm.
Q&A


1. Why are you selling? After 11 years in London, I have decided to move to be closer to my parents and sisters. It's a tough decision because it's hard to say goodbye to the flat.
2. What's the area like? There's a true community feel to the area. I know many of my neighbours quite well and we even share keys to each other's homes so that we can look after pets and plants when someone is on holiday. During the first lockdown, I discovered one of my upstairs neighbours is a chef when his wife let me know via a WhatsApp text that he had made too much Thai curry. Minutes later, she had left a pot of incredible food at my doorstep.
3. What is parking like? Parking is very easy. I've never struggled to find a space.
4. How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? The road is generally quiet, especially at night.
I'm currently working from home, how does that work in this property? The second bedroom is big enough to serve as an office/gym combination. It has been so nice to literally shut the door on work at the end of the day.
5. What's the internet like? I have Virgin Media and it has been okay.
6. What's the boiler like? I've never had any issues with my Worcester boiler and have it serviced regularly serviced by Joanna, the local plumber who seems to look after most of the properties on Grosvenor Ave. She is incredible!
7. Are we able to do any work/extensions? I have never looked into this. The Islington Council portal should be able to provide more information about this.

detailedDescription:

Comprises a large well-lit living space, separate kitchen area, a larger than average double bedroom and a family bathroom with separate WC. Wells Court is located on Queen Margaret’s Grove, a residential tree-lined street enviably located within striking distance of the eclectic array of bars, restaurants and independently owned shops that both Canonbury & Newington Green have to offer. Church Street and London Fields are within walking distance as well as the expansive green spaces of Clissold Park which offers the perfect opportunity for a summer picnic. Transport options are plentiful with both Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations being close by in addition to numerous and frequent bus routes, enabling residents to access Shoreditch, Islington, West End and The City.

detailedDescription:
Stamp duty holiday extension - Continue your search for the perfect property with JLL and benefit from the same incredible stamp duty savings previously offered by the government, up to £15,000.

The Makers is a residential development of 175 new homes, including studios, two and three-bedroom apartments and family duplexes. Tucked away from City Road, between the vibrancy and dynamism of the Shoreditch area and the financial district of the City of London, the location provides a quiet retreat within the capital. Residents will benefit from a generous provision of private communal facilities including a screening room, two landscaped garden terraces, a gym, a treatment room and three lounges, perfect for ad-hoc meetings.

A breathtaking double-height entrance lobby hosts a 24/7 concierge, providing peace of mind, secure mail and delivery services, and access to bookable facilities. With interior design by Woods Bagot, the material palette takes inspiration from the 1920s – a stunning feature wall, terrazzo flooring, bespoke lighting, custom furniture, brass details and smoked oak chevron floors set the tone for what is to follow.

The apartments have been designed for modern living, making the most of the architectural merits of the building. Smoked oak front doors with unlacquered brass door handles open into the spacious apartments. Those in the tower part of the building feature floor-to-ceiling picture windows to maximise magnificent views of the city, while south-facing windows in the Nile Street podium apartments bathe them in natural light. The majority of the Nile Street apartments have open balconies accessed directly from the living areas, while the top floor family duplexes have large private landscaped roof gardens offering an enviable inside-outside connection that is rare in the heart
of the city.

The interior finish is achieved through a combination of high quality materials and distinctive design details. Generous open-plan living rooms make clever use of the space, while the material palette shows it off at its best. Features include engineered oak plank flooring and two-tone kitchen cabinets that blend seamlessly into the living area, with contrasting composite stone worktops, integrated appliances by Siemens and Bosch, and contemporary black fittings. The tower apartments will also have comfort cooling in the living area and master bedrooms to ensure the perfect ambient temperature all year round.

Regsiter your interest today

address: Wakelin House, Sebbon Street, London N1
detailedDescription:
A bright and beautifully presented, larger than average, one double bedroom flat located in one of the original local authority mansion blocks dating back to 1934 in Islington, complete with communal gated garden and lift access. Accommodation comprises a fully fitted eat-in kitchen leading through to a wonderfully bright reception room with sash windows, a good size double bedroom with ample storage space and a modern family bathroom.
Wakelin House is only a short distance from a variety of transport options - the Victoria Line and Overground via Highbury & Islington (0.4 mi), the Northern Line via Angel (0.6 mi), National Rail services from Essex Road (0.2 mi), and a variety of busses departing from Upper Street (0.1 mi). Also on your doorstep is Upper Street which is perfectly positioned for the many bars, boutiques and restaurants alike.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A 1775 Georgian family home on Highbury Place overlooking Highbury Fields. The property boasts close to 4,400 sq ft across five floors with a wealth of lateral space. Period features have been retained throughout to include ornate cornicing and ceiling roses, multiple working fire places, renovated sash windows with shutters and period wooden flooring. This is evidenced beautifully in the ground floor reception and dining space which benefits from an abundance of natural light due to the unobstructed vista on both sides, and the favourable east to west orientation. The impressive curved bay window extension to the rear offers an enviable view to the landscaped garden, courtesy of world renowned designer Diana Armstrong Bell. Reaching over 65ft, it is a haven for birds with its mature shrubs, lawn and water feature. The lower ground floor is ideal as a nanny flat or guest area with street entrance, kitchenette, reception room, bedroom, bathroom, and access to the garden. There is also a wine cellar and vault storage on this level, and the potential to extend subject to the usual consents. The first floor has been retained as a grand reception area with triple windows and ample width. The view across the Fields is simply spectacular from this level. The period features continue in the same vein as the main ground floor reception, the principle bedroom and en-suite bathroom complete this floor. The upper floors house the remaining bedrooms, studies, and bathrooms, with the jewel in the crown an outstanding roof terrace with magnificent views of gardens, and highlighting the London skyline - from the Union Chapel to the City of London, the Shard and beyond. The space throughout this family home remains interchangeable and its bones are strong. With a long line of notable residents along the terrace and described in the nineteenth century 'History of Islington’ by Samuel Lewis J as, “a fine row of houses embracing a beautiful view on both sides, and remarkable for its healthy situation”, the rarity of such an opportunity should not be understated.

Situation
Highbury Place is ideally situated on Highbury Fields with a weekly running club, tennis courts, swimming pool and gym. There is also an excellent playground located within the fields. Upper Street is within 0.2 miles as well as Highbury & Islington Station on Victoria line, Overground and Great Northern main line. Islington Central library is across the Fields and heading north takes you to Highbury Barn with its more independent village like offerings. You are within catchment, subject to changing guidelines, for Ofsted Good and Outstanding schools and North Bridge House Senior Canonbury is within 0.3 miles.

Description

Across the garden level is a large open plan kitchen and dining room with a south facing conservatory with Bifold doors leading to the paved garden. There are three large double bedrooms and family bathroom over the top two floors, of note is the principal bedroom on the first floor with floor to ceiling windows, shutters and Juliet balconies.

This house is in immaculate condition and would make a wonderful home for the next owners. Importantly the property is offered chain-free and is ready for immediate occupation.

detailedDescription:
Fabulous one bedroom apartment set in an award winning school conversion peacefully located in the heart of Barnsbury.

Location

Pissarro House sits in an award winning private school conversion between Offord Road and Barnsbury Park in the Barnsbury Conservation Area. The apartment is well placed for both Underground and Overland train services at Highbury & Islington (Victoria line and overground services) as well as the excellent bus services and amenities along Upper Street.

Description

This wonderful apartment is situated on the east side of Pissarro House, which is one of the smaller Victorian school buildings within this award winning development. Pissarro House has smart and well-maintained communal areas and has access to multiple communal gardens across the development. On the upper floor is the large double bedroom with plenty of built-in storage and a beautifully appointed en suite bathroom. The bedroom is arranged as a mezzanine level with views out to the east through the double height windows and also down over the reception room. The bathroom is stylishly designed, features a bath and separate walk-in shower and plenty of bathroom storage. On the lower level is a semi open-plan kitchen and reception space with a beautifully arranged and finished kitchen, high end appliances and dark wood floors which create a stylish and contemporary feel to the space. The accommodation is well laid out with plenty of room for soft seating and dining for 4-6 people. The windows in this apartment are spectacular and there are no tall buildings giving a lovely calming view and bathing the property in natural light.

The apartment is discreetly located on the side of the development and is not close to any of the local streets giving a feeling of peaceful tranquility.

Square Footage: 681 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 239 years remaining

Beautifully appointed by the current owner, this wonderful property boasts a wealth of original features including exposed brickwork, shuttered windows and ceiling detailing, sympathetically enhanced with stylish interiors and high quality finish throughout. Features include an impressive double length open plan reception/quality fitted kitchen with sliding doors onto the garden, elegant family bathroom and further stylish en-suite WC, gas central heating, double glazing, quality floor coverings and private entrance.

Accommodation comprises entrance via the lower ground level with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with ample space for both relaxing and dining, feature exposed brickwork and sliding doors to the rear onto the charming all-weather surface garden. The kitchen area, with overhead skylight, comprises a high quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and central island, incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances. A useful guest bedroom enjoys en-suite facilities and front aspect window.

To the upper floor, there are two further bedrooms, with feature shuttered windows to front and rear respectively, plus a stylish family bathroom with period style free-standing bath suite and elegant tiling.

The property is available to purchase fully or part furnished.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Essex Road, Haggerston and Dalston stations, all providing excellent fast and frequent cross-London services. There are a variety of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants within a short distance, including the well known De Beauvoir Deli Co., the attractive open spaces of Rosemary Gardens, boasting tennis courts and Shoreditch Park within a short walk. The Regents Canal is also very close-by with a number of fashionable cafe's and eateries.

Lease Information

We understand the property is offered to the market with share of the freehold. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

To be confirmed. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

address: Atlas Building, City Road, Shoreditch EC1V
detailedDescription:
Looking for a smart and stylish 1-bed with a private 8th-floor balcony in a sky-high development with a huge range of world-class facilities on-site – just a 2-minute walk from the Tube, and within easy reach of the lively restaurants and bars of Hoxton Square and Shoreditch?

This bright and contemporary apartment with spectacular cityscape views comes with comfort cooling and overhead spotlights, a dual-aspect balcony overlooking the Old Street skyline, and a carefully rotated alignment that's been designed to capture maximum natural light throughout the day.

As you step through onto the engineered-timber flooring of the entrance, you'll find a fully designed fitted kitchen to your left, with real timber veneer cabinetry over concealed under-cabinet lighting, a composite stone worktop with a feature-glazed ceramic splashback, and a full range of integrated Siemens appliances (including an electric four-ring induction hob, an integrated multi-function oven, a combined washer-dryer, a fridge-freezer, and a dishwasher).

To your right, you'll find multiple spacious integrated storage areas behind 3 sets of closing doors, before you step through into the modern, designer bathroom, complete with underfloor heating, a feature-lit mirrored wall cabinet over a glazed-ceramic washbasin and composite-stone vanity top, a heated towel ladder, and a rain-style shower over an enamelled steel bath – all of it beautifully finished with full-body porcelain tiles, and a designer wall-sconce light feature.

Around the corner from the bathroom, you'll come to the southwest-facing double bedroom, with full-height fitted wardrobes finished with real timber veneer, and a floor-to-ceiling window perfectly placed to capture the relaxing evening sunsets from the west.

Across from the bedroom, you'll pass through the bright and spacious dual-aspect living area, with full-height windows facing southwest for the afternoon sun, and an extra-wide full-height sliding glass door that takes you out into the fresh air and natural light of the corner balcony – with a southwest and southeast-facing dual aspect for maximum natural light.

It's the perfect secluded spot to soak in the morning eastern light, or to relax in the evenings with the setting afternoon sun – and it's a welcome extra space for when you're entertaining guests.

The Atlas Building is one of Old Street's newest and most impressive residential developments, with a unique glass-fronted form that creates an iconic presence in the local skyline.

And this modern development comes with a wealth of on-site conveniences and facilities. As a resident of The Atlas Building, you'll have exclusive access to:

* A fully equipped modern Gym and Fitness Centre
* A Mezzanine Spa with a steam room and luxury swimming pool
* A Residents' Cinema Room, where you can book private screenings to entertain your guests
* A Residents-only Business Lounge
* And a 24-hour Concierge Service.

Beyond the magnificent walls of the building itself, you couldn't ask for an apartment in a better location:

You'll be just a 2-minute walk from Old Street station and the lively shops and restaurants surrounding the Silicon Roundabout – and just 11 minutes from the exciting nightlife of the bars and clubs of Hoxton Square and Great Eastern Street.

So if you're looking for luxury living in the heart of one of East London's most lively and fashionable areas, give us a call today – and we'll show you everything The Atlas Building has to offer.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description Standing on the street, looking up at the magnificent white portico entrance of this Georgian Regency townhouse, it is clear that this is something special. Stepping through the front door confirms the notion, with a wide entrance hallway, staircase sweeping up and around on the right hand side and part-stained glass window flooding the entrance hall with light from the side.

The raised ground floor of this house boasts a front to back grand reception room with breathtaking large windows front and back, all with glorious white wooden shutters, and deep red velvet curtains in keeping with the period. The two windows to the rear overlook the West facing rear garden, down to the swings and treehouse, and bathed in sunlight all afternoon. Two of the many feature fireplaces in the house - well used by the current owner - are in this room. A cloakroom off the entrance hall is conveniently situated at the top of the staircase to the lower ground floor.

The heart of the house is probably this level, with doors opening out onto the rear garden, and underfloor heating for the seasons when that is not appropriate.. To the front of the house is a fully fitted kitchen with island; a great space for friends and family to gather. Double eye level Miele ovens and all white goods are included. At the side is another cloakroom, great storage and the communications cabinet, controlling the fully wired sound system and cat 5 cabling - the lighting for the house can be universally controlled from an app on your mobile phone.

The well worn rear garden has been a joy for the current owners; as the trappings of happy childhoods, basketball hoop and aspect can attest. With mature greenery, olive trees and an abundance of plant life, the budding horticulturalist will have plenty to get their green fingers into. There is secure access down the side of the house to carry the compost and bikes through if required.

The first floor comprises two master suites, with walk in rainfall shower rooms both with underfloor tiled heating, as well as the household laundry room with washer, drier as well as charming hoisted drying rack; a throwback to the character of an 1830s house. The top floor has four well and similarly proportioned double bedrooms and family bathroom.

The loft remains untouched, planning was sought and granted but now lapsed for a conversion to add even more space. A really keen owner might also investigate adding a 'glass box' or similar across the back - at 65ft the garden can certainly take it - again, planning was acquired, but has now lapsed

To complete the package, the house also owns a garage around the side.

Situation and tenure The property is held on a Freehold title

Hamilton Park West is one of the most sought after roads in the borough of Islington. It is comprised of grand laterally spaced Victorian and Georgian houses, some 1950s semis and some more contemporary builds. Highbury Fields are nearby, as are the eclectic amenities of Highbury Barn - Godfrey's butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's deli as well as amenity stores and a few restaurants.

Access is easily walkable to Overground (Drayton Park to Moorgate in 10 minutes), Victoria and Piccadilly Lines.

address: Pear Tree Court, Clerkenwell, London EC1R
detailedDescription:
A magnificent interior designed two double bedroom, two bathroom loft style, warehouse apartment. Built in 1887 and converted from a former Victorian Ice Factory, the attention to detail inside this property truly is the next level.

Offering space, light and style in abundance, the current vendor has refurbished this sleek warehouse conversion throughout. The accommodation consists of an inviting curved entrance hall with unique recess lighting and original solid wood floorboards that run throughout the property.
Immediately upon entry, the hallway alone sets the tone for this stunning property. Leading into a sublime open plan kitchen / dining / reception room, this vast space enjoys a dual aspect plot that is flooded with light from the five large windows. Offering great ceiling height, this room is further enhanced with the addition of a soundproofed wall to the adjoining property. Rich in character, there is ample entertaining space in this truly exceptional room. The fully integrated kitchen is finished in matt grey, complemented with stone worktops and antique mirrored splash-backs. Additionally, there is a polished concrete topped island which provides ample surface space and storage. Both double bedrooms offer a wealth of light and, in keeping with the property, are rich in character with arched windows and cast iron radiators. The principal bedroom further benefits from a stunning en-suite bathroom. There is an additional bathroom which is tiled floor to ceiling and complemented
with brass fittings.

Pear Tree Court is a quaint street running between Farringdon Lane and Clerkenwell Close, moments from the Clerkenwell Green conservation area. detailedDescription:
A sensational, three-bedroom, purpose-built apartment set on a quiet residential street in N1. Standing at an impressive 811 sqft, the property has been maintained to a high standard by the current owner and is presented in immaculate condition. The south-east facing living room is well-proportioned and offers generous living space. The kitchen has been cleverly designed with plentiful worktop space and storage while benefitting from space for a dining area. The master bedroom and second bedroom are genuine doubles and feature ample storage space while the third bedroom would make a perfect study or single bedroom. The property is completed with a modern family bathroom.

The flat is perfectly located for a fantastic selection of independent shops, cafes and restaurants on Newington Green including the well renowned Perila, Jolene bakery and La Belle Epoque. Dalston Kingsland and Canonbury station provide the closest overground links for easy access to Shoreditch and the City whilst a variety of bus routes offer effortless access to Highbury and Islington, Upper Street and the West End.
title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market chain free, a luxury One-Double-Bedroom Apartment with private terrace located within a contemporary new build development in a vibrant part of Islington, close to amenities and just 10 minutes’ walk to Holloway Road Underground Station.

Elevated at the top of an exclusive red brick development originally constructed in 1894 with the new development of apartments finished in 2019. Accessed via a grand entrance hall and impressive staircase, this spacious apartment has been cleverly designed to offer space and functionality whilst incorporating a high specification finish throughout.

The reception area flooded with natural light from two large south-facing windows and double French doors leading out to a private terrace, provides wonderful entertaining space and room for dining. Adjacent is an open-plan aran kitchen which includes a range of bosch integrated appliances, hot water tap and wine cooler, all finished with a stone worktop. Both living room and kitchen have vaulted ceilings, which give an added feeling of space and light.

The bedroom with both window and skylight complete with remote blackout blind, offers ample space for freestanding furniture and storage, whilst the fully tiled bathroom suite complete with Kolo and Hansgrohe fittings consists of full bath tub and wall mounted waterfall shower, wash basin with single lever mixer tap and floating low level W.C. This sleek and stylish apartment also benefits from wiring for media and sound systems, underfloor heating throughout with remote access and thermostat pad with remote access and solid wood flooring throughout.

This exclusive development is located in one of Islington's fastest changing areas, with easy access to Tufnell Park, Highbury, Upper Street, Camden and Hampstead Heath. There is a vast range of local amenities, including supermarkets, pubs and restaurants, along with a number of green open spaces nearby.

Transport links close by include Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line) 0.5 miles, which gives direct access to Kings Cross/ St Pancras in just 7 minutes’ and Leicester Square in 13 minutes’. Tufnell Park Underground Station (Northern Line) 0.9 miles, Finsbury Park Station 0.8 miles and Upper Holloway Overground Station 0.6 miles are also within easy walking distance with a multitude of bus routes running close to the immediate area.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented, light and spacious two bedroom split level upper maisonette with share of the freehold, conveniently situated in a sought after Islington location. The property provides bright accommodation arranged over two floors, including superb open plan style living space with enormous period appeal, with stylish interiors and modern design.

Features include an inviting reception area, well equipped eat-in kitchen/diner, upstairs bathroom, double glazed sash windows, and stripped wood flooring.

The accommodation comprises an entrance hall with stairs rising to the upper level, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with dual front aspect windows and ample space for both relaxing and entertaining. A wide opening leads through to the kitchen area with quiet rear aspect and space for a large table and chairs, comprising a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and further space for appliances.

Stairs to the upper floor lead to two well sized double bedrooms, including an exceptionally large master bedroom with dual windows, plus a modern family bathroom with white three piece suite.

This chain free property is enviably located close to Caledonian Road underground station, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Caledonian Road itself offers an array of shops, bars, cafes, restaurants, including a yoga studio and an organic shop. Highbury & Islington station is also a short distance away in this fantastic central location.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Lease Information

We understand the property is offered to the market with share of the freehold. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

There are no service charges or ground rent. The 50% freehold is shared with the downstairs neighbour and all repairs are agreed and shared. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Chain-free, modern two double bedroom apartment with long lease, set within a popular "eco-excellent" recognised development, enviably located close to Archway and Upper Holloway Road. The kitchen area features a modern range of matching units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and integrated white goods. There are two well-sized double bedrooms, each with inbuilt wardrobes, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of stations at Archway and Upper Holloway, with Finsbury Park station just slightly further afield, and numerous regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. There is an array of shops, cafes. Bars and restaurants nearby on Holloway Road, with the lovely open spaces of Waterlow Park and Hampstead Heath within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
A stunning 3 bedroom apartment with spectacular uninterrupted views of the West Reservoir and city skyline, a 24 hour concierge service and within a short walk of a zone 2 underground station served by the Piccadilly line. Set in a development with 42 acres of open water and 15 acres of landscaped parkland

Situated on the 6th floor, this spacious property benefits from two balconies which offer views of the East and West Reservoirs and the City of London skyline as well as having a dual aspect living room with floor to ceiling windows which allows a large amount of natural light into the property, ensuring it is well light throughout the day. The living area is very spacious, and the kitchen is fully integrated to a high specification. The property features a seperate utilities cupboard with washer/dryer and storage.

The three double bedrooms also have floor to ceiling windows with the master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom and dressing area. There is also a private south facing balcony from the master bedroom. The property has a large amount of storage space throughout the flat.

This flat is situated in the Woodberry Down development which has a Sainsbury's local, a Co-Op, a café and bar, an Italian restaurant and Gastro pub within the development. Both Finsbury Park and Stoke Newington are within a mile of the property which offer a wider choice of bars and restaurants. Manor House Underground Station is located 0.3 miles from the property which is served by the Piccadilly line. This property also comes with allocated parking space in a secure underground car park.

Riverside Apartments benefits from a long lease of 988 years remaining.

Early viewing is recommended.

detailedDescription: A superb opportunity to create a substantial (currently 2,800 sqft), end of terrace, Victorian family home, benefitting from a side entrance, off street parking and south facing garden, situated within the Hillmarton Conservation area. Accommodation is generously proportioned, currently comprising; two reception rooms, access to the garden, a utility room and kitchen on the lower level, three bedrooms, bathroom and separate W.C on the raised ground floor, three bedrooms on the first floor, two on the second floor and a further bedroom and bathroom on the top floor. This house still retains a wealth of period features and can be extended and upgraded subject to necessary planning permissions. Hartham Road sits within the Hillmarton conservation area, affording superb access to the Underground at Caledonian Road (Piccadilly Line) with trains through the West End and only 1 stop from Kings Cross with the hugely popular and recently regenerated Granary Square that can also be found locally. detailedDescription:
This Victorian end of terrace family home is immaculately presented after a complete refurbishment and totals over 2,500 sq ft over four floors. Period features have been retained, enhanced, and blended brilliantly with unique interior design. The kerb appeal to the exterior of the property is faultless after this too underwent complete renovation including new double glazed sash windows. The ground floor reception and reading area benefits from ornate cornicing, fire place, high ceilings and Strathearm engineered oak flooring which continues throughout. The kitchen has a poured concrete floor, is finished with custom stainless steel, and boasts appliances to include a Wolf range cooker and Amana French door steel fridge. This leads to a landscaped rear garden facing west which is decked and laid to lawn. The WC is also on this floor complete with Tom Dixon lighting and the entire floor, as well us bathrooms upstairs, have under floor heating. Conveniently the lower ground floor has been completely fitted as an independent utility area. The upper floors, via the original staircase and past the beautiful stained glass window, contain four bedrooms and two bathrooms complete with principal suite, walk in wardrobe and en-suite. Bathrooms have been finished using Perrin and Rowe accessories and Fired Earth tiling. The property is for sale chain free.

Situation
Digby Crescent is a residential period tree lined street accessed via Queens Drive and is perfectly situated between the green open spaces of Clissold and Finsbury Park.

detailedDescription:
Spread over 900 sq. Ft., this huge maisonette occupies the top two floors of a handsome mid-terraced home on Beresford Road. Offering beautiful views throughout, this share of freehold home comes complete with a large terrace - the perfect sun-trap all year round.

Offering exceptional proportions, this charming home comprises; two good-sized double bedrooms across the top floor, with a contemporary bathroom room suite, bespoke storage and uninterrupted views of the City. The kitchen offers an excellent space to cook, dine and entertain, boasting high ceilings and a large south-facing sash window overlooking the rear gardens. The reception room is full-width with large windows that frame the views perfectly, and the roof terrace offers a tranquil and secluded space to capture the sunshine!

Beresford Road is a premium, tree-lined residential street and is within easy reach of the excellent mix of independent shops, bars, deli's and restaurants surrounding Newington Green (Primeur and Perilla being two of our many favourites). Connections into the City and Central London couldn't be simpler, with Canonbury station (Overground) only a short walk away. You can also pick up the 73 bus route at the bottom of the road, which offers direct links onto Tottenham Court Road and Oxford Circus.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Named after Andy Warhol's notorious New York loft studio - The Factory converted in 1999 by The Manhattan Loft Corporation...

Set on the second floor of this former 19th century print-works, this superb bright airy space, a little over 1500 sq ft, is a fine example of lateral loft living.

Featuring a stunning open-plan reception, with a fully fitted kitchen, complete with integrated appliances. One large double bedroom, with en-suite bathroom and great study to work from home or an un-official second bedroom. The space has exposed brickwork, solid wood floors throughout, industrial crittal windows and the added benefit of secure garage car parking.

Straddling the borders of Shoreditch, Clerkenwell and Islington, this superbly located building is perfectly connected for live, work and play and only a few minutes walk to Old Street station.

Quote from Space Station director and former resident.

"You can only truly appreciate what a great building this is, when you've lived in The Factory. Apart from it being one of best warehouse conversions, what's really unique is the close knit community, who care about the building and lookout for each other, which only adds to the special atmosphere"

detailedDescription: A very well presented and spacious split level first floor apartment forming part of an end of terrace Victorian property situated in a highly sought after location that is within close proximity to local shops, Tufnell Park (Northern Line) underground station, Tufnell Park Tavern (gastro pub), various outdoor spaces and the ever popular Yerbury primary school. The well proportioned accommodation (approximately 748 Sq Ft / 70 Sq M) comprises: Reception, separate modern kitchen/breakfast room, two double bedrooms, modern bathroom and en-suite shower room to one of the bedrooms. Benefits include: Own section of rear garden which enjoys a sunny aspect. We believe the only way to fully appreciate this fine property is by arranging an immediate appointment to view. Sole agent.

detailedDescription:
This bright and lofty apartment has been renovated by the current owner to create a truly unique home with three-meter high ceilings and exposed wood beams. This inspiring flat is located on the top floor of this two storey building with three large sash windows in the reception providing attractive aspects onto Richmond Avenue, N1. The kitchen is set back against the back of the reception maximising the space for dining and lounge seating. The bedroom is located on a mezzanine level with built in wardrobes and majestic full length wood beams creating a lot of charm yet still flooded with natural light.

This property is located on the corner of Thornhill Road, N1 and Richmond Avenue adjacent to Thornhill Road Garden as well as The Albion Pub which is just about the best local you can have in Islington. Fashionable Upper Street, N1 is within easy walking distance offering an unending choice of stylish bars, restaurants and cafes, as well as boutiques and theatre such as The Almeida and Kings Head theatre. Islington Square is a very welcome new addition to Upper Street offering the first-class gym Third Space as well as a new Lux Odeon Cinema.

The nearest underground station is Angel station (Northern Line) at 12 mins walk where Highbury and Islington (Victoria and Overground) is only a further three minute’ walk which also provides a direct route to Moorgate station in only 12 mins (three stops) on Great Northern Line. Numbers bus routes can be taken from Upper Street, N1 toward The City, The West End and Kings Cross as well as many North bound destinations.
