address: Riverside Apartments, Goodchild Road, London N4
detailedDescription:
Stunning modern Three-bedroom Penthouse apartment in award-winning waterside development by Berkeley Group.

Riverside Apartments is a beautifully designed residential development within the Woodberry Down development and is positioned by the famous reservoirs of Woodberry Wetlands, offering breathtaking views across the water and London.

This highly sought after home with floor to ceiling double glazed windows and underfloor heating throughout, offers far-stretching views, and excellent natural light. Spacious in size, over a lateral floor plan, the layout of the home offers perfect separation from the living space and sleeping area.

The living room and open-plan kitchen is finished with premium standard engineered wooden floors consisting of a large high-specification kitchen, with built-in appliances. Open plan to a generously sized living room area, which leads on to your large private balcony with panoramic views across the reservoirs and City.

To the front of the apartment, the sleeping area benefits from 3 large double bedrooms, with a high graded tile flooring en-suite bathroom and dressing area to the primary bedroom and fantastic storage space throughout.

As a resident of Riverside Apartments, you have exclusive access to:

A Private Residents Gym

Secure Underground Parking Space

Secure Cycle Storage

24-Hour Concierge Service

Located at Woodberry Down development, spanning over 67 acres of open water and landscaped parkland, you are part of superb community which is extremely well-connected. By foot, you can enjoy a riverside walk within the unique waterside community surrounded by nature. The reservoirs offer a variety of activities which are very popular with families and individuals of all ages. These can include; Sailing Club, Climbing Centre, Castle Gardens, Nature Reserve. Not to forget a variety of regular events held, which include the Hidden River Festival and Outdoor Cinema to name a couple.

Residents benefit from a lovely community, with many shops, restaurants, and amenities on your doorstep; including a Sainsburys and local independent supermarket, organic coffee shops, restaurants, beauty salon and dry cleaners. Many of the local businesses and independent, and family run, reflecting on the community you will be part of.

Families can benefit from outstanding primary and secondary schools within the area.

Moments away from Manor House Tube Station, giving you fast links to Kings Cross, Covent Garden, and Leicester Square on the Piccadilly Line. A little further and you have Haringey Green overground.

detailedDescription:
Element Properties & Co are proud to present this immaculate one-bedroom apartment set on the 12th floor of Canaletto Tower. Exquisitely designed and furnished throughout, the space boasts tasteful touches and décor elevating an already stunning development. Boasting over 715 sq ft of lateral space, the property is comprised of a South West facing balcony, an enormous kitchen/reception, large double bedroom, exceptional bathroom and a walk in wardrobe. In addition to already providing high spec appliances, this particular apartment supplies a secret TV cupboard, a hot tap and a variety of other tidy upgrades. Bright and beautiful views across the city can be seen elegantly from the balcony and so too out of the floor to ceiling windows.

Additional installations include; Sonos speakers throughout, Wine cooler, Breakfast Bar, Bespoke TV cabinet and an Ottoman bed to name a few. Moreover, a parking space can also be purchased separately should it be required.

The development provides an urban yet tranquil feel, all whilst encompassing the London lifestyle. Located on City Road with Clerkenwell, Shoreditch, Angel, Hoxton and the City all within walking distance. There is an abundance of bars, restaurants, shops, coffee shops and gastro pubs on the doorstep of the development.

Transport links include Old street, Angel, Farringdon, Shoreditch located on the National Rail and Northern Lines, numerous bus routes are also provided for easy access around the city.

The lease currently has over 987 years remaining and the service charge and ground rent are £6,354.12 per anuum and £450 per annum respectively.

detailedDescription:
This wonderful one-bed loft apartment is located on the fourth floor of this former chocolate factory with high-ceilings and large south-facing windows. The kitchen and reception is 25’ allowing for plenty of space for dining and lounge seating. The bedroom is also roomy with recessed wardrobe space and equally large window which attract a lot of natural light. There is wood flooring throughout with original steel beams and exposed red brickwork on south-facing walls.

The Chocolate Studios are located on Shepherdess Walk which in equidistant to Angel, Shoreditch, Hoxton as well as Old Street or what is becoming known as ‘East London Tech City’. Old Street station is only 6 mins walk where Angel is a further 9 mins walk in the opposite direction where The City is within easy walking distance. Bus routes are plentiful, southbound towards Moorgate (14 minutes) and northerly towards Kings Cross and St Pancras (10 mins) offering local national and international destinations.

This popular area has many attractions within walking distance including Upper Street, Exmouth Market and Whitecross Market offering a daily vibrant street food scene. The internationally renowned Barbican Centre, Saddlers Wells and The Almeida Theatre are also close by where a variety of restaurants, bars, cafés and boutiques can be found in nearby Islington High Street, Upper Street, N1 and Shoreditch. The Regents Canal is also very near providing a very popular pedestrian and cycling route towards Angel and Kings Cross as well as Broadway Market and Victoria Park to the East.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stylish one-bedroom flat is set on the first floor of a handsome period house with majestic 3.16 meter high ceilings and large sash windows which flood this property with natural light. The reception is spacious at almost 17’ with space for generous lounge seating as well as dining. The smart graphite kitchen is located separately yet semi-open to the reception offering good storage and food preparation on a stylish counter top and backsplash. European oak herringbone flooring is laid throughout the entire flat which contrasts well with the matt black cast iron radiators and a central classic period fireplace in the reception. The bedroom has a wonderful East facing aspect onto neighbouring gardens and also has floor to ceiling built in wardrobes maximising storage. The wet room has a large walk-in shower with Carrara marble herringbone tiling and has the comfort of underfloor heating. This flat is a mix of period charm with a contemporary feel.

Aberdeen Road, N5 is a sought-after address due to its obvious charm and appeal and is located between Highbury Grange and Aberdeen Park. It is a quiet residential street with no through traffic. Highbury Barn is a few minutes’ walk, offering an impressive variety of independent stores such as La Fromagerie, Godfreys, Bourne’s Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners. The nearest underground stations are Highbury and Islington and Arsenal (Piccadilly). Drayton Park station also provides a direct route to Moorgate in The City, which is only a 12 minute commute in four stops. A number of bus routes may also be taken south from Highbury Barn towards Highbury & Islington Station, Upper Street and Angel or northwards towards Arsenal station and Finsbury Park station.

Highbury Fields is a short pleasant walk through the Aberdeen Park conservation area and is the closest open space at 29 acres. It offers a vast array of local leisure facilities such as tennis courts, netball courts, an artificial football pitch, public swimming pool and gym. Clissold Park is also nearby with 56 acres of mature trees, lakes and tennis courts as well as Clissold House offering a popular cafe. The West Reservoir Centre, a stunning 1930s red brick building, is home to various water sports activities including canoeing, sailing and kayaking. New River Walk is just at your doorstep offering a welcome destination for walking or running and enjoying terrific views of local parks and reservoirs.

Beautifully presented and boasting a wealth of period charm and appeal, this first floor two bedroom flat, conveniently located close to transport links, shops and amenities. Features include an inviting open plan reception/kitchen, elegant shower room, ample bespoke inbuilt storage, gas central heating, sash windows and quality floor coverings.

Accommodation comprises entrance with stairs rising to the first floor, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen, flooded with natural light from tall feature arched windows, and offering ample bespoke inbuilt shelving and storage, and inviting space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. The property is enviably located within easy reach of Arsenal and Finsbury Park stations, each providing excellent links into Central London and the City. detailedDescription:
Stunning one bedroom purpose-built flat located on the top floor within a sought-after low rise block within minutes of Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations.

As you enter, there is plenty of space for coats and shoes, as well as a built-in storage cupboard.

The hallway leads to one of the main attractions of the property, the living room, with fantastic views of Central London, and stunning sunsets, as the large, south-facing, windows allow the room to flood with natural light.

The dual-aspect separate kitchen is well-proportioned with room for a dining table, making it a very sociable space.

The bedroom can accommodate a double bed, wardrobe, and chest of drawers.

The bathroom has a full-sized bath with a shower.

Location:

Kingsland Road is very vibrant and offers everyday amenities and award-winning bars and restaurants.

Roseberry Gardens is within five minutes' walk, with football pitches and tennis courts.

Upper Street is close by with boutique shops and independent coffee shops.

For entertainment, the Angel Central has a cinema, and the 02 Academy, The Everyman Screen on the Green, and Almedia Theatre offer cosy nights out.

Transport:

Dalston Kingsland Overground Station is 100 meters away and several bus routes provide quick access to Central London, the West End, and beyond.

Old Street and Angel Stations are also within walking distance or a short bus ride.

Perfect for both first-time buyers or as a Pied-à-Terre.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

internal:

Reception/Kitchen - Open plan living space offering generous space for furniture for both living and dining, with a fitted kitchen and a front aspect window. The kitchen features a range of modern wall and base units with wood worktops over and an island unit. Bedroom Two - Double size room with a skylight window and a storage cupboard.
Bedroom Three - Double size room with a front aspect window.
Bathroom - Comprising a vanity unit fitted with the WC and wash hand basin, and a panelled bath with an overhead shower enclosure.

External:
Allocated parking space.

address: Residence Tower, Woodberry Grove, London N4
detailedDescription:
*Click the link for a Virtual Tour!*

Looking for a pristine balcony apartment with a west and north-facing dual aspect – set in a unique waterside development with access to a residents' gym, on-site retail outlets, and the entirety of the Woodberry Wetlands Nature Reserve and reservoirs on your doorstep?

This bright and sunny 2-bed on the 2nd floor of the eye-catching Residence Tower comes with underfloor heating and overhead spotlights, wooden flooring and floor-to-ceiling windows throughout – and a private, west-facing balcony with views out towards the West Reservoir.

As you step through onto the wooden floor of your new entrance hall, you'll find a generous storage area tucked away on your left, neatly hidden behind a double set of closing doors.

To your right, you'll find the first of two immaculate, modern bathrooms, complete with a recessed vanity mirror over a square basin, a heated towel rail, and a frameless glass screen shower over a white bath – all of it finished beautifully with dark wooden panelling against large-format, soft-coloured tiling on the walls.

Around the corner to your right, you'll come to the apartment's two north-facing bedrooms, each with their own views over the courtyard below through their floor-to-ceiling windows. The larger master bedroom also comes with a triple set of integrated, sliding-door wardrobes, as well as its own private en-suite bathroom – with similar specifications to the family bathroom (with an extra-wide rain-style, walk-in shower enclosure in place of the bath).

Across from the apartment's sleeping areas, you'll find a bright and sunny open-plan living, dining, and kitchen area. And the first thing you'll notice is the abundance of natural light from the floor-to-ceiling, wrap-around corner windows that lead to your own private, wooden-decked balcony.

It's the perfect sunny spot to admire the views of the gardens and courtyard below, with a west-facing aspect that's carefully positioned to capture the best of the afternoon light and the evening sunsets in the open skies over the nearby West Reservoir.

Back in the living room, you'll find a fully equipped kitchen area, with feature-lit cabinetry over a soft-coloured worktop with a gloss-effect splashback, a touch-control hob over an integrated oven, and an additional countertop and cabinets in a separate unit off to the side.

Beyond the walls of your pristine new home, you couldn't ask for a better location:

You'll be just a 7-minute walk away from Manor House Tube Station, giving you fast links to King's Cross (in 8 minutes), or Covent Garden and Oxford Circus (in 16 minutes) – as well as a 7-minute walk from the vast open spaces of Finsbury Park, with over a hundred acres of natural beauty to explore.

You'll also be just moments from the Woodberry Wetlands, an urban oasis covering 17 acres of nature reserve (including two expansive reservoirs just a 2-minute walk from your home) – as well as the historic New River waterway for charming waterside walking routes.

This immaculate balcony 2-bed on the 2nd floor of a highly coveted waterside development comes with a west and north-facing dual aspect, a range of on-site facilities and amenities, and west-facing views from its own private, wooden-decked balcony.

And that means a property like this won't be around for long.

So if you're looking for a beautifully presented new home with wrap-around natural light – just minutes from the Tube, and surrounded by natural beauty – give us a call and we'll show you everything life at Residence Tower has to offer.

detailedDescription:
Superby refurbished and significantly extended three bedroom, three storey property with private paved garden with no onward chain, enviably located just off Caledonian Road, close to excellent transport links and fashionable amenities. The property offers bright and spacious accommodation, beautifully appointed, with stylish interiors throughout. Features include an inviting rear aspect reception room, sizeable kitchen/diner, first floor family bathroom and further en-suite shower room, gas central heating, double glazing, attractive wood flooring and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance lobby with hanging and storage space, leading into the front aspect kitchen/diner with plenty of space for dining and attractive wood flooring which runs through the entire ground floor. The kitchen area itself comprises a full range of matching wall, base and drawer units with quartz work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, 'Whirlpool' wall mounted electric oven, and further space for appliances. Stairs rise up to the first floor, and an opening leads through into the bright and spacious reception room with sliding doors to the rear onto the garden. To the first floor, there is a generous master bedroom with adjacent luxury bathroom comprising a contemporary style corner bath suite with elegant tiling. To the second floor, there are a further two bedrooms, with modern en-suite shower to the rear room.

Viewings of this beautiful property are highly recommended. To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is very conveniently located in a popular residential road just off Caledonian Road, within a short walk of Caledonian Road underground station and numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Highbury & Islington station is also within a 10 minute walk. Caledonian Road offers an array of amenities, with nearby Upper Street offering further stylish shops, bars and restaurants.

detailedDescription: A spacious 4 bedroom Neo-Georgian mid terraced house set on one of Canonbury's most secluded garden squares right in the heart of the Canonbury conservation area. The house benefits from a beautiful 37ft private rear garden and garage to the rear. Accommodation comprises 2 well proportioned double bedrooms, single 3rd bedroom/ study and bathroom all on the top floor. The 1st floor is home to a wonderful 18ft wide reception room with 3 windows providing views across the square. Also on this floor is a another well-proportioned double bedroom to the rear along with a shower room. On the ground floor can be found a spacious kitchen, guest WC and a beautiful dining/ 2nd reception room to the rear with 2 sets of patio doors opening to the garden. The garden is absolutely delightful with the benefit of a garage accessed to the rear. The house affords a wealth of potential/ scope for extension with the possibility of extending in to the loft and across the rear, subject to the relevant approvals & planning. Alwyne Square is an extremely desirable tree lined garden square situated in the heart of Canonbury, moments from the focal point of the localised community of the shops of Canonbury Place and is still regarded as Islington's most sought after area. Transport can be found at Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), Essex Road station and of course Angel Underground. The delights and the charm of the New River Walk are located at the bottom of Willowbridge Road.

detailedDescription:
Top floor (9th) barrel vaulted one bedroom apartment located in Frobisher Crescent right in the Centre of the Grade II Listed Barbican Estate. Superb City facing views over towards The Shard, The Gherkin Heron Tower, Walkie Talkie, and various City landmarks.

Full details Top floor (9th) barrel vaulted one bedroom apartment located in Frobisher Crescent right in the Centre of the Grade II Listed Barbican Estate. Superb City facing views over towards The Shard, The Gherkin Heron Tower, Walkie Talkie, and various City landmarks. Full height and double width sliding door leading to a private balcony with room for table and chairs with views over and towards the Sculpture Court below and St Giles Church. Extremely quiet, use of residents gardens and all other benefits residents enjoy. Oak wood flooring throughout the lower level. There are 3 lifts for access across the Crescent. Double height reception room. Downstairs cloakroom. Superb shower room with remote control showers. The apartments boasts an array of 21 Century features including, state of the art surround sound iPod speaker system, burnt oak wooden flooring, entrance hall, modernist kitchens, cat 5e cabling, fully wired for Sky HD. Built in 1971, the Barbican Estate is the finest achievement of the architects Chamberlin, Powell & Bon. The architects drew inspiration from Le Corbusier, famous for being one of the pioneers of what now is called Modern architecture. Their vision has created a unique urban village community devoid of traffic with immediate amenities including the Barbican Arts Centre, a church, school, library and shops. The estate was Grade ii-listed in 2001 in recognition of its extraordinary contribution to London's urban landscape.Barbican tube station (on the Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) is only a couple of minutes' walk away, with Moorgate (on the Northern line), St Paul's (on the Central line) and Mansion House (on the District line) tube stations each within a short walking distance. Moments walking distance the new Crossrail Station Farringdon Station. This entrance will provide access to the 'East Ticket Hall' linking directly with the existing London Underground platforms at Barbican & Farringdon Stations therefore providing access to the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines. On completion in 2021 Farringdon Station will be a vital interchange between the North-South Thameslink and the East-West Crossrail service. Crossrail ( Elizebeth Line) will give direct access to Canary Wharf in 9 minutes & Bond Street in 3 minutes. Waitrose is located nearby on Whitecross Street, which is also home to the weekday Whitecross Street food market. Next door to the Barbican is West Smithfield an area that has seen a huge regeneration, incoming occupiers are small food outlets, coffee shops bars & restaurants providing a buzzing mixed use location. Comprising of many media, digital and ccreative industries, but increasingly legal, professional and ffinance. The Museum of London will move to Smithfield Market in 2026 ( estimated). Smithfield Meat Market will be vacating then it are will be transformed into a world beating food & gastro destination and will be part of the world beating Cultural Mile. Also within easy reach are the attractions of St. Pauls' Cathedral, New Change Shopping Complex. The River Thames, Tate Modern, Gabriel's Wharf and South Bank.

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Well presented one bedroom first floor flat with a share of the freehold and set within an attractive period property just a short distance from Finsbury Park station and the shops and amenities of Holloway Road. The property provides light and spacious accommodation with modern interiors and a number of original period features including an impressive feature fireplace and surround to the reception room, and high ceilings throughout. Features include gas central heating, sash windows, ample inbuilt storage and separate storage communal cupboard outside the flat.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall leading into the inviting reception room with tall front aspect sash window, beautiful fireplace with ornate surround, and ample space for relaxing and dining. An opening leads through to the separate kitchen comprising a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a well sized bedroom with useful inbuilt wardrobe, and a stylish bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of stations at Archway, Upper Holloway and Finsbury Park stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. There is an array of shops, cafes. Bars and restaurants nearby on both Holloway Road and Seven Sisters Road, with the lovely open spaces of Whittington Park and Finsbury Park also within easy reach.

address: Mortimer Road, De Beauvoir, Hackney, London N1
detailedDescription: An absolutely charming 3/4 bedroom early Victorian end of terrace house set on this delightful no-through traffic road located right in the heart of De Beauvoir, moments from the greenery and open space of De Beauvoir Square. Set back from the road behind a beautifully kept gated front garden the house has a very welcoming homely feel, awash with much of the original charm & character. Accommodation comprises 2 very well proportioned double bedrooms, along with a further single bedroom/ study and the main family bathroom on the top (1st) floor. The raised ground floor is home to a wonderful dual aspect through reception room complete with many of the original features including 2 wonderful fireplaces, working shutters and ornate ceiling cornice. Also on this level is a guest WC. On the lower ground floor can be found a very good size double bedroom and utility room both positioned to the front of the house with a charming family kitchen/ dining room to the rear with doors out to the wonderful private rear garden. The garden wraps around the side of the house with a gate providing the side access. Of notable benefit is the storage space that exists within the attic. The house occupies a prominent position on this delightful no-through road just South of the greenery of De Beauvoir Square and around the corner form the delights of the locally renowned De Beauvoir deli. The Regents Canal provides some wonderful walks along towards both Angel & London Fields. The closest station is Haggerston forming part of the London Overground network, whilst a plethora of shops, bars and restaurants can be found locally. For those wishing to travel by bus, Kingsland Road and Southgate Road provide a number of good routes, with the delights of vibrant, trendy Hoxton and Shoreditch just a short journey away as are London Fields and Broadway Market.

detailedDescription:
For sale by Unconditional Auction

A freehold building 0.9 miles to King's Cross. Permission for three residential and one retail unit, one with garden and one with terrace. Total 2,745 sq ft

The property comprises a mid-terrace building arranged over basement, ground and two upper floors. The ground and basement provide self-contained retail whilst the first and second floors are arranged as 2 x one bedroom self-contained flats.

Planning Details:

The property benefits from permission for 1 commercial unit with basement, 2 x two bedroom maisonettes (one with terrace and one with garden) and 1 x one bedroom flat (totalling 2,745 sq ft).

Change of use of the rear part of existing ground and basement level from existing retail (A1 use) unit to allow for the creation 1 no. Self-contained dwelling (2-bed) (C3 use) including internal reconfiguration. Demolition of existing single storey rear extension at ground floor level and lowering of ground level to reinstate rear garden at basement level. Excavation at
existing basement level to allow for the lowering of existing floor level. Alterations to shop front and to rear elevation including juliet
balcony at ground floor level.
Issue Date: 08 January 2021
Application No: P2020/1528/ful

Section 73 application to vary Condition 2 of planning permission ref P2018/2615/ful dated 10/10/2018 for 'Erection of a mansard roof extension and associated alterations.' Amendments include alterations to the design of the mansard roof extension, including setting the extension back from the rear roof parapet to create a roof terrace and replacement of a dormer window with a door.
Issue Date: 28 July 2020
Application No: P2020/1433/S73
Islington Council

Location:

Centrally located, the property is less than 1 mile from King's Cross / St. Pancras International (Eurostar) where Google are building their London HQ. Central London is located 2.5 miles to the south.
More specifically, the property is situated on the west side of Caledonian Road, opposite Huntingdon Street and flanked between Lyon Street to the north and Kember Street to the south. The property lies within the N1 postal district of Islington.
By train, Caledonian Road & Barnsbury overground station is 0.1 mile away and Caledonian Road underground station is 0.5 miles (Piccadilly Line). By road, Caledonian Road runs north to south, connecting with Kings Cross from where Central London is easily accessible.

The principal bedroom and family bathroom suite occupy the first floor, with a further two double bedrooms on the top floor. The property is superbly located for so much of what the area has to offer, with the buzz of Upper Street with its vibrant bars, cafés and restaurants offering international cuisine only a short walk away, a plethora of cafes, restaurants and trendy bars found at Dalston and Kingsland Road to the East, Stoke Newington to the North and Newington Green around the corner, with the delightful greenery of Clissold Park, Highbury Fields and Rosemary Gardens just a short stroll. detailedDescription: A beautifully presented and extremely elegant 5 double bedroom, triple bay fronted, Victorian red brick end of terrace family home, benefitting from a garage and situated within the Sotheby Road conservation area, only moments from the shops of Highbury Barn and greenery of Clissold Park. Accommodation is both well balanced and immaculately presented, whilst retaining a wealth of ornate original features, including fabulous cornicing, original fireplace(s), Victorian tiles and stained glass, comprising; a vast double reception space positioned on the raised ground floor, providing direct access via all 3 beautiful original doors to a private terrace, leading to the manicured rear garden, offering direct access to the private garage, complete with electric car charging point, with vehicular access from Sotheby Road. The lower level houses the spacious kitchen/family room, separate dining space, W.C and a utility room, whilst also providing further access to the garden. The master bedroom, further double bedroom and bathroom suite are located on the first floor, with 2 generous double bedrooms and a further bathroom suite on the second floor, leading to another bedroom cleverly located on the top floor offering plenty of storage space, which could easily be used as a playroom. This is a special house which must be viewed to be truly appreciated, and is positioned on a sought after residential street. Aberdeen Road sits right in the very heart of Highbury, supremely well placed for the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields, Clissold Park and the shops of Highbury Barn including the renowned Godfreys butchers, Bournes fishmongers and Da Marios delicatessen. Transport can be found locally at Arsenal (Piccadilly line), Highbury & Islington (National Rail and Victoria line) as well as Canonbury (London Overground), with a number of bus routes running along Highbury Park.

address: St. Paul Street, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription: A beautifully designed, contemporary 2 double bedroom, 2 bathroom house with accommodation arranged over the raised & lower ground floors and benefitting from a cleverly designed internal patio along with a further private patio accessed via the second bedroom. The house has been beautifully designed to maximise the use of light & space, with a painstaking attention to detail and quality of finish, affording well proportioned lateral accommodation which is unusual for the area. Accommodation comprises bright vast dual aspect through kitchen/ dining/ reception room with a charming internal patio complete with green wall, guest WC and plant room on the raised ground floor. A wide feature spiral staircase leads down to the lower ground floor which is home to 2 good size double bedrooms, the master with a lavish en-suite bathroom complete with freestanding bath and beautifully fitted walk-in wardrobe. The second double bedroom also benefits from a beautifully fitted walk-in wardrobe and access out to a private patio. Also on the lower ground floor can be found the main family shower room. St Paul Street sits on a quiet no through road within the Arlington conservation area, moments from the greenery of Arlington Square itself. Despite its quiet situation, the trendy bars, restaurants, galleries and boutique shops of Upper Street, Hoxton, Shoreditch, London Fields & Old Street are all easily accessible. Within a stone's throw of the house there are many good eateries, cafes and pubs; Pophams Bakery, The Rosemary Branch and minutes along the canal is the Towpath Cafe. The Regents Canal also provides a beautiful calming escape from the city and a lovely walk to Broadgate Market and Victoria Park. Within walking distance are Angel station (Northern Line) and Highbury & Islington (National Rail & Victoria Line) which both provide a wealth of transport links to get around London. International travel is made easy from Kings Cross St Pancras. A plethora of transportation links encompassing many bus routes to the City and West End can also be found at New North Road and Essex Road, with Essex Road station providing National Rail trains to Moorgate.

detailedDescription:
Stunning five bedroom family home situated in prime Tufnell Park boasting a full-width roof terrace offering panoramic views of London.

Formerly a Victorian shop, this property has been transformed into a quintessential family residence offering flexible, light-filled accommodation over four storeys. Standing at 2,267 sqft (approx) and entered via external steps, the raised ground floor offers a large entrance hall with hanging space for coats, alongside a formal reception room boasting excellent natural light and sumptuous parquet flooring.

The lower ground floor contains an open-plan living/dining area which is partly double-height to maximise the natural light, alongside an additional kitchen area. New insulation has been added to the walls, the frontage has been entirely replaced with new double glazing, and there is underfloor heating beneath the porcelain floor. The kitchen leads on to a courtyard garden at the rear, which gets the afternoon sun. There is also a utility room, WC, storage cupboard and option for a bedroom on this level.

The first floor is home to the main kitchen area which is modern with integrated appliances, family dining space offering excellent integrated storage, master bedroom which is positioned in the curved frontage of the building with two sash windows and en-suite facilities benefiting from electric underfloor heating. Upstairs offers a further three bedrooms one of which is currently being used a study, walk-in-wardrobe, family bathroom and access to the newly developed roof terrace.

Cardwell Terrace is located within walking distance of the underground stations at Caledonian Road, Tufnell Park and Holloway Road. There are diverse local shopping facilities on the doorstep, including Waitrose on the Holloway Road, the farmers market at the Tufnell Park Tavern, and the many cafes and restaurants on Fortress Road. Islington is easily accessible to the south, while Highgate and the open spaces of Hampstead Heath are to the north.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful two-bed lateral conversion, which could be easily converted into a three bed, is located on the top floor of an elegant Grade II Georgian terrace, which directly overlooks Northampton Square, EC1 originally built in 1832. The flat has a well-balanced layout with dual aspect attracting a lot of natural light with beautiful north views from the living room and master bedroom onto Northampton Square and the famous bandstand located in the centre. The location is considered quiet as there is no through traffic which helps create a pleasant environment with well-maintained central gardens alongside adjacent University of London buildings. However, the flat also has its own private section of garden which is accessed via the well-kept communal stairwell at ground level.

Northampton Square, EC1, is conveniently located within walking distance to renowned destinations such as Amwell Street, which offers a variety of independent shops, and Exmouth Market, which offers a daily vibrant food street market scene as well as a concentrated variety of restaurants, bars, cafes and boutique shops in a pedestrianised area. The internationally renowned Sadler’s Wells theatre, Smithfield Market and Chapel Market are also in the vicinity, adding to the many cultural venues and landmarks within easy walking distance.

There is also an important 12-acre development site under construction at the Mount Pleasant sorting office which will create 681 new homes designed by Conrad and Partners whilst also creating a new commercial, office and retail hub with new public spaces. The beautiful art deco post office building will be retained as a post office for the local Clerkenwell community which is good news for all concerned.

The nearest station is Angel Underground Station (Northern Line) which is 8 minutes’ walk away. The Cross-Rail project or what will be known as the Elizabeth Line will be an increasingly important transport hub also connecting eastbound towards Canary Wharf and westbound towards Paddington and Heathrow from Farrington Station with is only a 14 minutes’ walk. Also nearby is Kings Cross Underground Station and St Pancras International Station, a 22 minutes’ walk. Both these stations also host National Rail & Thameslink Service offering direct links southbound towards Blackfriars, London Bridge, Gatwick Airport and Brighton as well as northbound towards Luton Airport amongst other destinations. Bus routes are plentiful from St John Street, Kings Cross Road or Pentonville Road towards all aforementioned underground stations as well routes to The City. Bus routes towards The West End may be taken from Roseberry Avenue, EC1.

*Please note furniture is CGI

detailedDescription:

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This elegant two bedroom two bathroom apartment is set on the first floor of an imposing Victorian building on Hornsey Rise, directly opposite the much admired Elthorne Park. The design celebrates the building’s expansive proportions and original details combined with modern conveniences.

The building is set back from the road with the entrance on Ashley Road with security audio entry system. The original house, of which this is a part, was built in the 1890s and as such has wonderful period proportions and high ceilings.

The hallway is typically wide and provides access to a bright and spacious living room with views overlooking Elthorne Park. Leading into a separate contemporary kitchen with exposed brick wall. The design is stylish and light with two double bedroom and 2 full size bathrooms, one being en-suite to the main bedroom. Both bedrooms are at the rear and enjoying garden views.

The property is located at the foot of Hornsey Rise, a short walk from Stroud Green Road, known for The Old Dairy, an ornate Victorian dairy gastro pub, organic shops such as Urban Native, and Butler’s, an independent wine shop and delicatessen. Crouch End is within easy reach with its excellent selection of shops, restaurants, pubs and cinemas. Alongside Arthouse, a local arts centre and independent cinema.

There are many excellent parks within easy reach in this part of north London. The Parkland walk is much-loved trail on a disused railway line that connects Finsbury Park up to Highgate. To the west is Waterlow Park and Hampstead Heath, and beyond Crouch End to the north is Alexandra Palace.

Archway Underground station is within 13 minutes’ walk, for the Northern Line, while Finsbury Park is a little further and easily accessible by bus for the Victoria & Piccadilly Lines and mainline trains. Crouch Hill Overground station is just a five-minute walk away.

agency_name: Hurford Salvi Carr - Clerkenwell & City Sales
detailedDescription:
Rarely available florin court apartment facing onto charterhouse square gardens.

This delightful apartment is in one of the most iconic Art Deco Mansion blocks in Central London.

Built in 1936 by Guy Morgan and Partners, this stunning Grade II Listed building with its elegant, curved facade is situated on the Eastern side of Charterhouse Square and was refurbished by Regalian Properties in the 1980s to the designs of Hildebrand and Cricker.

The Building became known as Whitehaven Mansions, the fictional residence of Hercule Poirot in the 1990s filming of the TV series based on Agatha Christie's mystery stories.

This front facing, enchanting apartment is one of only a few to have such an outstanding view. It has been upgraded and tastefully refurbished by the current owners making superb use of the space.

The apartment comprises a gloriously sunny reception room with concave bay window, separate kitchen, double bedroom and shower room.

Residents of Florin Court benefit from a porter, outstanding landscaped communal roof terrace with breath-taking views of the City and London Skyline, a swimming pool, sauna and gymnasium.

Florin Court is located on Charterhouse Square, with the Square believed to date back to 1371 when a Carthusian monastery was founded by Walter de Manny on the Northside of the Square and which in July 2011, English Heritage granted Grade II listed status to the "setted" road surface in the Square, which was laid down in the 1860s.

Both Farringdon and Barbican Stations are within close proximity and with the opening of Cross rail in 2022 will benefit from fast rail links to four of London's International Airports.

Currently both stations offer easy and convenient access to both The City and West End and the area is abundant with wonderful restaurants.

A truly special and unique apartment, viewing is most highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A Beautiful, Bright & Spacious 3 Bed 2 Bath apartment set within this sought after Canal-side development.

The accommodation is contemporary throughout and boasts a wonderful open plan reception/dining area with wooden flooring, modern kitchen with integrated Bosch appliances. The living space and master bedroom offers access out to a balcony spanning the length of the apartment. There are two double bedrooms and a smaller double bedroom, master bedroom with en-suite bathroom with power shower, a main family size bathroom with bath and shower and a separate utility/storage area.

Reliance Wharf is considered to be one of the most sought after developments along the Regents Canal. Located less than a five minute walk from Haggerston Overground Station offering routes to Highbury and Islington and Canary Wharf, it's surrounded by some of East London's best independent waterside cafes, shops, bars, galleries and creative work spaces.

And directly above a new coffee shop/cafe and creative co-working space.

Also within a short walking distance of Broadway Market, London Fields, Columbia Flower Market, Victoria Park and Angel.

The apartment is less than a five minute walk from Haggerston Overground Station offering routes to Highbury and Islington and Canary Wharf and there is a tfl "Boris Bike" station directly next to the development.

Close proximity to the City, Hoxton, Shoreditch and Islington and easy access to the Olympic Park, make Reliance Wharf a location which offers the best of both worlds, where waterside cafes, shops, bars and offices sit alongside converted warehouses and relics of London's industrial past to create a cool and relaxed atmosphere for living amidst the buzz of London's most exciting places to work and play.

10 minutes to Highbury & Islington
18 minutes to Liverpool Street

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An utterly charming two double bedroom apartment of 893 sq. Ft (83 sq. M) set on the first floor and running laterally across two fine Georgian town houses. This rare and special grade II listed property features high ceilings, a wealth of period features and southerly views from the reception room and master bedroom over the gardens of Canonbury Square. The apartment was extensively refurbished by the current owner in 2015, with particular attention being paid to restoring the period elements, such as the fireplaces (in the reception room and the master bedroom), ceiling cornices, sash windows and the original working shutters. Of further note are the kitchen and the shower room both of which are stylishly presented in a modern neutral style. The sum of the parts is an elegant apartment which successfully blends period charm with contemporary living, making it the quintessentially perfect London pied-a-terre. It is believed that the property was once the home of Duncan Grant and Vanessa Bell, members of the renowned Bloomsbury set, who lived in this apartment during the 1950’s. Artistic and literary provenance does not stop there, George Orwell lived next door at no 27 Canonbury Square (his novella Animal Farm was published in 1945 while living there) and Evelyn Waugh lived at no 17 (his first two novels Decline and Fall and Vile Bodies were published while living at the property between 1928 and 1930).

Canonbury Square is a quiet residential street within a short walk of the shops and restaurants on Upper Street. It has outstanding transport links: Highbury & Islington provides quick access to the West End via the Victoria Line and citywide via London Overground. Essex Road station is two stops from the City at Moorgate, and Canonbury station offers direct services to Canada Water. Near to the apartment is the New River, a tranquil man-made waterway with mature trees that provides lovely walks. Highbury Fields nearby has large areas of open space, as well as tennis courts, a playground, and a swimming pool.

Accommodation comprises:

Reception room (with two ceiling height sash windows and corresponding ornamental wrought iron balconies, original wooden shutters, a working fireplace (gas) with marble mantel surround and slate hearth); Kitchen (bespoke fitted with range of white base and wall units, white metro tile splash-back, integrated fridge, integrated dishwasher. Utility cupboard housing a washing machine and a separate dryer. Sash window with lovely view over rear communal garden. Master bedroom (with two ceiling height sash windows and corresponding ornamental wrought iron balconies, original wooden shutters, a working fireplace (gas) with marble mantel surround and slate hearth). Bedroom 2 (a medium sized double bedroom with sash window and rear views over communal gardens); Shower room (a white suite which features a shower cubicle with chrome Lefroy Brooks fittings, WC, wash hand basin and mirrored medicine cabinet. Views over rear communal gardens).



Service charge: Approx. £1917.38 per annum

Ground rent £300 per annum

Tenure: Long leasehold (circa 119 years remaining)

Asking price: Guide price £1,150,000 subject to contract

Agent's note on the provenance of the apartment:

From the mid-1940s until 1952 the flat two flights of stairs up from rear garden entrance level at 26 Canonbury Square (then called 26a Canonbury Square and variously termed as being on the first or second floors*) was lived in by Anne Olivier Popham (later Bell; 1916-2018), who was working at the time first as the only female member of the so-called Monuments Men in post-war Germany (commemorated in George Clooney’s 2014 film) and later for the Arts Council. In 1945 she received - and rejected - an unexpected proposal of marriage from her neighbour George Orwell, recently widowed and then living with his young son Richard at 27b Canonbury Square. (Olivier described Orwell’s flat to James Beechey, a contributing author of 'The art of Bloomsbury' as being on the floor directly below hers.)

In 1952 Olivier married the art historian and writer Quentin Bell, the younger son of Clive and Vanessa Bell, and moved with him to Newcastle, where he was then teaching. (Quentin would later write the authorised biography of his aunt, Virginia Woolf, and Olivier subsequently edited the five volumes of Woolf’s diary.) Her mother-in-law Vanessa and Duncan Grant moved into 26a Canonbury Square in October 1952 and it remained their London address until the summer of 1955. Grant, in particular, made a number of paintings there (including several nudes of his friend Paul Roche) and occasional meetings of the Bloomsbury group’s Memoir Club were also held in Canonbury Square.

The 2016 article in The Guardian on Olivier Bell, mentions the Canonbury Square flat.



*26 Canonbury Square is accessed from a gate entrance on Alwyne Villas. Access to the apartment is from the garden level at the back of the building. From this point there are two flights of stairs, which takes you to what is the corresponding first floor when viewing the property from the front.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful two bedroom apartment set across the second floor of two adjoining period houses on Cloudesley Square. This lateral apartment boasts not only a prime position on one of Islington’s most prestigious squares, but flexible, light, well laid out accommodation. Set on the top floor the property offers a Westerly aspect over the square and church. Upon entering the apartment on the first floor you are led up via a staircase to the second floor where you are met by two bedrooms. The open plan reception room is flooded with natural light due to overhead panelled glass and two attractive front facing sash windows. From here there is access through to a semi open plan modern kitchen which has a window overlooking the rear. The uniqueness of this apartment is the spiral staircase that leads up to a stunning roof terrace. Although un-demised to the apartment, the lease has granted full use and enjoyment of the terrace as well as sole access. Additionally there is a family bathroom off the hallway and a storage cupboard accessed via the spiral staircase.

Situation
Cloudesley Square is arguably Islington’s most sought after location. Not only period, picturesque and classic Georgian but also within easy reach of Upper Street. Angel, Highbury & Islington and Kings Cross St Pancras are close by as well as numerous bus links in to The City and West End.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A larger than average Grade II listed four bedroom townhouse on Batchelor Street, a popular one way street in the heart of central Islington.

One of the largest houses in the terrace, the property is beautifully presented throughout and offers flexible accommodation over four floors.

Of particular note is the 23' reception room on the raised ground floor opening on to a dining area and kitchen to the rear with an attractive aspect over the communal gardens.

There are three bedrooms on the upper floors including a superb master suite on the first floor with a walk-in wardrobe and generous en-suite bathroom. There is also a fully fitted home office on the top floor together with a further family bathroom.

The lower ground floor of the house is incredibly flexible and is currently arranged to provide a further reception room, a utility room, guest bedroom and shower room.

To the rear is a private patio garden with gated access to extensive secure communal gardens.

Batchelor Street is an attractive tree lined street situated within the Barnsbury Conservation Area and conveniently located for all the amenities of Upper Street. Angel station (0.3 miles - Northern line) is within very easy reach and gives access to the City, the West End and beyond. (Please note all times and distances are approximate).

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription: A generously proportioned and beautifully presented Victorian freehold with accommodation arranged over five levels, situated within the Duncan Terrace/Colebrooke Row conservation area. Accommodation is well balanced comprising; a spacious entrance hallway leading to the impressive double reception space, benefitting from a sunny dual aspect and ornate period details, as well as a separate study space and W.C to the rear on the ground floor, semi open plan kitchen/dining area providing access to the light well and vault from the front and utility room and garden to the rear. The first floor houses the principal bedroom and bathroom, with a further two double bedrooms on the top floor and a further bathroom on the upper half landing, benefitting from far reaching city views. Grantbridge Street affords superb access to an absolute wealth of local shops, bars and eateries, with particular note to those on Camden Passage, Upper Street and Exmouth Market. Angel Underground (Northern Line) provides convenient access to the City, with the transport hub that is Kings Cross/ St Pancras International just 1 stop on the Underground, providing superb links to travel around London and to mainland Europe. The bus routes on St John Street, Upper Street, Pentonville Road and City Road are all close by, as are the scenic walks of the canal. The 'Square Mile' of the City is within easy reach by bike or by foot.

detailedDescription:
On the leafy streets of Canonbury and set within a handsome and well maintained Neo-Georgian block is this fabulous ground floor two bedroom apartment. This bright and airy laterally arranged flat has been lovingly maintained by its current owners and enjoys direct access to the building’s wonderful communal gardens which are always beautifully maintained. The accommodation comprises of a spacious reception room with a door leading out to the garden, a separate contemporary kitchen complete with modern appliances, a huge 16’8 x 13’7 double bedroom and a second 12’3 x 10’7 double bedroom (both with built-in wardrobe space) and a natural light filled bathroom which has both a roll top bathtub and walk-in shower. This property is available with no onward chain.

Situation
John Spencer Square is located in the picturesque Canonbury Conservation Area, just off Canonbury Place and Canonbury Square and within very easy reach of Upper Street. The nearest transport links can be found at Highbury & Islington station (Victoria and London Overground lines) with fantastic connections to the West End, City and Canary Wharf. Angel underground station (Northern Line) can also be found for access to the City and West End.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented period house in very quiet cul de sac with stunning and extensive rear garden.

Location

Holmcote Gardens is a very quiet residential cul de sac just off Highbury New Park but also benefits from excellent amenities and transport links. Highbury & Islington tube plus Canonbury Overground are both a short walk away. There are numerous buses on Highbury Grove giving access to the West End and City. Highbury Fields and Highbury Barn are close by and it's a short walk to Upper Street.

Description

Set within one of the quietest locations in Highbury this immaculate period house offers wonderful lateral accommodation throughout. The house has been extended to the rear on the ground floor, has a stunning loft conversion and has been refurbished throughout. On the ground floor is a separate reception room to the front and extensive and very modern kitchen with Miele appliances, dining room and family room to the rear. Plus there is a utility room and guest cloakroom on this floor. Bi fold doors lead you out to a beautifully tranquil and extensive garden which, along with the front garden, have been professionally designed and landscaped. The rear garden has various areas - several seating areas including a patio section next to the house, a grass area, a vegetable patch and very useful garden shed. There is a side access into the rear garden.

The first floor offers three bedrooms and a family bathroom. The master bedroom is in the loft conversion together with the en suite shower and extensive eaves storage hidden neatly behind the ample wardrobes. This room has a bank of windows giving stunning light and very open views over the distant and neighbouring rear gardens.

Square Footage: 1904 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A lovely bright, top floor, two bedroom apartment within a modern development, benefitting from a Share of Freehold.

On entering the property there is a small hallway, and a separate w.c. The reception room is open plan to the kitchen with a full height window.

The kitchen has a good range of white cabinets, black granite worktops, a four ring gas hob, an integrated washer/dryer, fridge/freezer, fan oven and dishwasher, with an area for dining.

At the top of the stairs is space for a desk, with a skylight above, a bathroom with a full sized bath, shower screen and attachment, wash hand basin, heated towel rail and wc, the walls and floors are tiled.

The master bedroom has a window overlooking the quiet residents courtyard, a large fitted wardrobe and ample space for additional furniture and a king size bed.

Bedroom two is a really good size with a fitted wardrobe and a beautifully shaped eaved ceiling.

Some items of furniture are available by separate negotiation.

Located within close proximity to the City and only moments from excellent transport links including Old Street, Farringdon & Barbican Tube & overground, with the added benefit of Crossrail arriving to the area in 2022. detailedDescription:
Please quote asp id: 37833

A brilliant two bedroom apartment in Carrara Tower within 250 City Road.

The apartment boasts fully integrated kitchen appliances and built in wardrobe for the bedroom and a modern bathroom finish.

250 City Road is a dynamic development comprising of an exclusive selection of studio, one, two and three bedroom apartments and is set to become a vibrant urban hub within London.

The striking tower buildings which have been designed by critically acclaimed Foster and Partners will be surrounded by two acres of gorgeous landscaped gardens and courtyards which are positioned around a Central Plaza offering a wide variety of cafes, restaurants, retail outlets and creative workspaces. State of the art gymnasium, pool, spa, business lounge and rooftop terraces can be found within the development for residents to enjoy, each combining to create a luxurious lifestyle for the user.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Enjoy picturesque views across leafy North London from your rooftop apartment in the heart of popular Stroud Green. Your charming one bedroom abode also benefits from swathes of natural light across each room, through double glazed windows that provide such attractive views.

Cleverly concealed storage is tucked away in almost every corner of your home, not least in the hallway entrance. Ascending a few small steps, you’re greeted by wall-to-wall south facing windows in the reception room.

Clean white walls permeate each room, adding to the feeling of space and light throughout. A home office alcove can be found in the living room with kitchen to your right.

Your kitchen features nifty space saving solutions, from the wall-mounted utensil hooks and floating shelf to the statement decorative worktop installed above the washing machine. A walk-in shower calls for you in the bathroom, placed beside a mirrored wall cabinet, frosted window and charcoal-effect slab floor tiling.

Finally the double bedroom boasts two built in cupboards, a velux window and views over the rooftops to the rear.

Situated a mere 0.5 miles from Finsbury Park Station and surrounded by a glorious array of amenities, you’re seriously spoilt for choice with both transport and food/drink options. Lockdown allowing, you can look forward to exhibitions at Furtherfield Gallery and even a spot of ten-pin bowling or karaoke at Rowans Tenpin Bowl, all within 0.4 miles of your humble abode.

Beautiful mid terrace house in a quiet but central location.

A lovely example of a central Islington town house.

detailedDescription: A spacious and light filled two double bedroom apartment converted over the second and third floor(s) of a sought after, secure school conversion, situated moments from Angel Underground & Upper Street. Accommodation is generously proportioned and well-arranged comprising; a spacious entrance hallway leading to the spacious, open plan kitchen/reception room that benefits from double height space that must be viewed to be truly appreciated. There is also the principal bedroom and bathroom suite on this floor, with the mezzanine second bedroom housed on the upper level that features an en-suite shower room. Wollaton House offers the character of an historic building but with the convenience of a modern conversion and a lift. Set within a gated development, it has the benefit of a secluded and quiet communal garden and a bike store. Batchelor Street is a quiet enclave within the leafy Barnsbury Conservation Area with its parks and squares, yet with easy access to Angel station (Northern Line); Highbury & Islington station (National Rail and Victoria Line) and the new Cycleway on Liverpool Road. The eateries and shops of Upper Street, Angel and Camden Passage are a short walk away, as are gastro pubs such as the Albion and the Drapers Arms. Waitrose, Sainsburys and M&S are also conveniently located nearby at the southern end of Liverpool Road. There is an excellent choice of cinemas and theatres on the doorstep. A stroll along the Regents Park Canal or one stop on the underground, takes you to Granary Square and Coal Drops Yard for more eating, shopping and entertainment opportunities as well as the Kings Cross/ St Pancras International transport hub for getting around London or travelling to Europe.

detailedDescription:
This 27/F, 760Sqft2 Bed 1 Bath apartment within 250 City Road, one of Berkeleys fine development, offers stunning view towards Canary Wharf.

Situated in the heart of Zone 1,250 City Road is within walking distance of Tech City and the Square Mile. Every room has a view with residences on the upper floors offering a spectacular, uninterrupted panorama of the Capital. Outside, a little under two acres of beautifully landscaped green spaces and secluded courtyards create a sense of calm, connected and contemporary living.

Foster+Partners′ design for 250 City Road is for a new quarter that incorporates the mix of uses you would expect in any thriving community. Unique places to live and work combine effortlessly through well considered landscape with new retail premises, while the two elegant residential towers fit perfectly into the architectural surroundings.

Offering stunning views in every direction, 250 City Road rises above its surroundings to bring the Capital to your door. Workplaces in the City and central London are just a short walk away, and beyond the tenth floors of the two towers an uninterrupted panorama of London opens up before you.

The development features:
- concierge


-residents′gym

- spa & pool

-residents′lounge

- Courtyard and Rooftop Garden areas

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A surprisingly lateral Victorian family home located in Newington Green and totalling nearly 2,700 sq ft across just four floors. The property has been renovated sympathetically throughout. The raised ground floor is home to the L shaped kitchen, dining and reception space with high ceilings, oak flooring, ornate cornicing and ceiling rose, marble fireplaces and newly fitted double glazed sash windows with wooden shutters. The kitchen is bespoke with fitted appliances and Lacanche range cooker. There is a WC and boot room to complete this floor. The first floor boasts two double bedrooms with equally impressive features to include wooden flooring, sash windows and intricate coving. The top floor completes the main house bedroom set up with impressive principal bedroom showcasing vaulted ceilings, window seat and en-suite bathroom with cast iron bath and ceramic tiling. There is a single bedroom on this floor too. The lower ground floor is currently used as a separate unit due to the dual access and has a galley kitchen, bathroom, reception room and double bedroom leading to the east facing rear garden reaching over 60 ft. The garden can also be accessed from the raised ground. It is mature, boats a 22 ft width, and has a summer house at the back which was built using reclaimed windows from the original house. There is off street parking at the front of the property and the sale is chain free.

Situation
Newington Green is an ideal location positioned between Highbury, Stoke Newington, Hackney and Islington. Lizzie’s on the Green is a local coffee favourite along with the award winning Alma public house for something stronger. Access across town is effortless with ample bus routes including the 73 which goes to Kings Cross, Euston and Victoria. The green open space of Clissold Park is just over a mile away.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented, five storey, Grade II listed, Georgian freehold benefitting from a spectacular roof terrace that enjoys jaw dropping views across the London skyline, situated within the Duncan Terrace/Colebrooke Row conservation area. Accommodation comprises; a wider than average entrance hallway leading to the light filled double reception space on the ground floor, featuring a dual aspect and ornate period details. There is also a W.C on this level as well as access to the manicured, circa 34 ft rear garden. The lower level houses the dining room and kitchen, which leads to the conservatory that provides a further access point to the garden. There is also a utility room on this level. The principal bedroom suite is located on the first floor, with two further double bedrooms and another bathroom on the second floor. There is a further reception space on the top floor, which leads to the impressive roof terrace via bi-folding doors, that provides jaw dropping city views in the background with the recently renovated church opposite in the foreground, that simply must be viewed to be appreciated. St. Peter's Street affords superb access to an absolute wealth of local shops, bars and eateries, with particular note to those on Camden Passage, Upper Street and Exmouth Market. Angel Underground (Northern Line) provides convenient access to the City, with the transport hub that is Kings Cross/ St Pancras International just 1 stop on the Underground, providing superb links to travel around London and to mainland Europe. Accommodation is generously proportioned and well balanced comprising; a large entrance hallway which leads to the two double bedrooms, family bathroom suite and a large, semi open plan kitchen/reception space, bathed in natural light courtesy of the dual aspect and providing access to the large, private roof terrace that benefits from jaw dropping city views. It should be noted that the apartment benefits from a secure underground car parking space as well as dedicated bicycle storage. Located moments from a wealth of shops and amenities on Essex Road Newington Green and Upper Street. Transport can be found at Canonbury station (London Overground), Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), Essex Road station, with trains to the City and of course Angel Underground (Northern Line) as well as a range of buses on Essex Road giving easy access to the City and West End. The greenery of both New River Walk & St Paul's Shrubbery are close by.

detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire a unique, Grade II listed, mid terrace Georgian freehold, benefitting from an impressive living space and roof terrace, situated within the Duncan Terrace/Colebrooke Row conservation area. Accommodation is generously proportioned and light filled comprising; a reception space and study on the ground floor, principal bedroom suite on the lower level with a conservatory accessed via the lower half landing which provides access to the secluded rear garden. The first floor houses the impressive, semi open plan kitchen/reception room, with a further mezzanine reception space on the top floor, providing access to the roof terrace. Sudeley Street affords superb access to an absolute wealth of local shops, bars and eateries, with particular note to those on Camden Passage, Upper Street and Exmouth Market. Angel Underground (Northern Line) provides convenient access to the City, with the transport hub that is Kings Cross/ St Pancras International just 1 stop on the Underground, providing superb links to travel around London and to mainland Europe. The bus routes on St John Street, Upper Street, Pentonville Road and City Road are all close by, as are the scenic walks of the canal

detailedDescription:
A wonderful newly refurbished Three Double Bedroom Maisonette, located in a prominent part of Caledonian Road a short distance from Kings Cross/St Pancras International, 9 minutes’ walk from Caledonian Road Underground Station and just 4 minutes’ walk from Caledonian Road & Barnsbury Overground Station (Google).

Spanning two floors of a charming Victorian building, this naturally bright and spacious property offers approximately 893 SqFt of internal living space. The first floor comprises of newly fitted kitchen, separate reception room with ample room for dining and family bathroom. The second floor consists of three double bedrooms and additional W.C and wash basin.

The area is one of North London's most vibrant areas now with the changes and redevelopment of King's Cross impacting on the shops and restaurants throughout its entirety. Further amenities can be found a short walk away in popular Upper Street with a range of boutique shops, restaurants and entertainment facilities whilst nearby Camden Town offers live music events, bustling markets and scenic canals routes.<br /><br />

agency_name: Hurford Salvi Carr - Clerkenwell & City Sales
detailedDescription:
A grade II listed clerkenwell apartment with three bedrooms and large private garden.

This charming top floor duplex apartment is located in one of the oldest surviving terrace of house in Clerkenwell, dating to the mid 1700’s, within the Clerkenwell Green Conservation area, marking the neighbourhood of historic and architectural interest.

The apartment has the most romantic history, formerly the home of a local carpenter, then in a side addition, an auction room and later a school. For a number of years’, the terrace was the home to workers connected to the Middlesex House of Detention and Hugh Myddelton School now the site of Kingsway Place and it has been home to the current owners for over 40 years.

This property is a real piece of Clerkenwell history which dates back 250 years and currently offers extremely comfortable accommodation, with a formal reception room, kitchen, three bedrooms and family bathroom. The apartment has a large storage cupboard on the top floor as well as excellent demised storage in the cellar.

An exceptional and notable feature of the apartment is its own private garden, believed to be one of the largest in Clerkenwell and access to communal gardens, landlocked and only accessed from properties on Skinner Street, Woodbridge Street and Sekforde Street.

Skinner Street runs off St John Street, moments from Exmouth Market and the green open spaces of Spa fields. Transport links are superb with Farringdon Underground and Mainline Station a few minutes’ walk and with Crossrail opening in 2022 the area will become one of the best linked in London.

A very rare opportunity to buy a piece of Clerkenwell history.

Summary

description
Located to the east of Highgate & south of Crouch End, between Archway (Northern Line) and Crouch Hill (Overground), with a great variety of surrounding shops and restaurants, the apartment occupies the ground floor of an attractive character end-of-terrace house.

Situated just to the east of the A1, Archway Road, with its excellent road links in and out of London, the property is easily accessible from both Crouch End Broadway and the historic Highgate Village. It is also just 15 minutes from access to the Parkland Walk, popular with walkers and cyclists, which provides a green link to Muswell Hill and Finsbury Park. Archway station (Zone 2) is just 10 minutes from Euston and there are multiple bus routes providing access across London. In addition to the Parkland Walk, the area is spoilt for choice when it comes to outdoor spaces, with Alexandra Palace and Park, Highgate and Queens Woods, Waterlow park and Hampstead Heath all being close by, whilst local landmarks include the Arsenal Emirates Stadium, Whittington Hospital & Highgate Cemetery with its impressive architecture and final resting place of George Michael & Karl Marx.

detailedDescription:
If you are looking for a spacious apartment in the heart of the City of London with a real wow factor, our newest instruction within London's famous Barbican Estate is one to view. Offering outstanding transport links, excellent local amenities and a world-class view of some of London's most iconic landmarks, this extremely rare type P2A penthouse really is the pinnacle of city living.

As well as its fantastic Brutalist architecture, famous dolphin fountain and inspired landscapes, one of the Barbican Estate's best features is how well connected it is to the rest of London. This fantastic central location makes it ideal for those who need to commute across the capital. The estate is a short walking distance to some of the stations below:

Farringdon station - currently servicing the Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines (0.1 mile) is due to be connected to the Queen Elizabeth Line (widely known as the Crossrail project) once it opens. This new line will extend the reach of many within the city, offering quick connections to Heathrow Airport, Reading and Uxbridge.

Barbican - Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan underground lines (7 mins walk - 0.3 miles)

Moorgate - Circle, Hammersmith & City, Metropolitan and Northern Line (5 mins walk - 0.2 miles)

Liverpool Street - Central, Circle, Hammersmith & City, Metropolitan lines and National Rail (13 mins - 0.6 miles)

There are also a vast number of bus routes that are available from various stops that are all within a short walk of the estate.

The Property

One of the most striking aspects of the property is the sheer amount of space on offer. The open-plan living area offers a huge amount of space with an equally large bedroom on the floor above. The space on offer allows the property to be uniquely configured to meet individual needs, and could even facilitate a home office with one of London's most desirable views.

As you enter the property, you first come across the open-plan living area. The room offers a large living area and a sumptuous dark wood and black marble effect fully-fitted kitchen that is complemented by the room's stunning dark wood flooring. The feeling of space in the living area is enhanced by being able to open the patio doors onto a unique 25 ft wrap-around balcony that offers a fantastic view of the city around you. While many properties on the estate have access to balconies, few offer such an expanse of space and an unbeatable view.

Moving upstairs via the gorgeous spiral staircase, you come across the sizeable, carpeted bedroom, with its roomy, double-height ceilings. Decorated in neutral tones and benefitting from huge swathes of natural light via the stylised barrel-vaulted window, the room is large and light and offers plenty of room to cater for a variety of needs.

The bedroom leads out onto one of the property's most unique selling points: The roof garden - which offers a view of some of London's most iconic landmarks, such as Tower 42, the towers of St. Bartholomew's Church, Centrepoint and even the BT Tower!

On this floor, there is also a modern fully fitted bathroom with a shower enclosure, basin and WC.

The Area

As you may have guessed, the Barbican Estate is ideal for those who want to make the most of the City of London. With world-class cultural, entertainment and historical venues, restaurants and a Waitrose - all on your doorstep, the location offers all a city dweller could wish for. As far as city living is concerned, there cannot be anywhere better in the whole of London for those who want to commute and also enjoy the benefits of living in a unique and exciting property.

Viewing Available Now.

Offered chain free.
Annual service charge £4745.
Lease length 125 years from July 1981.

detailedDescription:
A truly stunning three bedroom, two bathroom apartment in this incredibly well sought after Grade II Listed purpose built residential block. On the fringes of Bloomsbury and Clerkenwell this spacious flat has recently been refurbished to exacting standards throughout.

The property provides a generous living area with plenty of natural light from two attractive sash windows. There is a separate fully fitted modern kitchen with dark granite work surfaces. The master bedroom is a generous size with custom built shelving and wraps around to an impressive large family size en-suite bathroom. There are two further double bedrooms with built in storage that shares a very tastefully finished tiled shower-room/WC.

The Bourne Estate is perfectly located to access the theatres of the West End, the vibrant food market on Leather Lane and the internationally renowned restaurants of Exmouth Market. Once an area nicknamed 'little Italy' there is an abundance of fine cafes and boutique delicatessens on its doorstep.

The closest stations are Chancery Lane and Farringdon Stations. Farringdon station and the surrounding area will undoubtedly benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail and retail development. With already existing fantastic transport links, Farringdon station will be the only station in London with direct lines to all London based airports making it arguably London's most sought-after transport hub.

Description

A great opportunity to acquire this attractive end of terrace Victorian house offering flexible use of the accommodation to suit a number of requirements. Located in East Canonbury Conservation area, its currently arranged as a three bedroom home, with two double bedrooms and a bathroom over the top floor, one of which has stairs up to the large loft conversion which has space for an office and ample storage. Over the raised ground floor is a reception room and a further bedroom, which could also be used as a further reception or office. Across the lower ground floor is a further bathroom and one large open space with high ceilings, the dining/sitting room to the front and the kitchen to the rear with double doors leading out to the 50' rear garden that is predominantly South facing. There is the possibility to extend at the rear subject to the usual consents. Importantly, there is off street parking to this home, ideal also for charging an electric car and a side entrance to the garden, so bikes, buggies etc. Can be brought through.
