detailedDescription:
Owners comments:

Top 3 things we love about our home
1. The light in the lounge upstairs coming through the glass apex roof fills the whole room with wonderfully bright light during the day and at night you can lay on the sofa and count the stars
2. We put in bi-fold doors and built a courtyard area outside which my wife filled with flowers. We loved having breakfast out there.
3. We fitted the built in bookcases in the study and filled the room with books making this room a cosy, quiet and a great space to get lost in

3 things we love about the area.
1. The area is spoilt for choice with fantastic restaurants on your doorstep like Zia Lucia, Sambal Shiok Malaysian Laksa bar, Trullo and the amazing French cafe "Le Peche Mignon" a few doors down
2. Highbury Fields is at the top of the road and is a great park with all the play and sports facilities you might need including tennis courts, a swimming pool and a gym
3. Fantastic travel connections - less than 10 minutes to Kings Cross or only 15 minutes to Oxford Circus on the tube (from Highbury and Islington). And 12 minutes to Moorgate on the train from Drayton Park
Q&A


Why are you selling? We decided to sell as we have baby #3 on the way and need more space for a growing family

What's the area like? We have loved it - full of families and with people who have lived in Islington for years giving the area a real sense of community

What is parking like? Easy - just need a parking permit from the council

How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? It's quiet plus the house is a renovated car seat factory with thick walls making it a super peaceful house

i'm currently working from home, how does that work in this property? We converted one of the bedrooms into a study that can easily accommodate a couple of desks

What's the internet like? Virgin cable up to 200mbps

What's the boiler like? New Wocester Bosch (1 year old)

*Please note that the property has been digitally staged with furniture to help you visualise the rooms.

Ref: Isl

detailedDescription:
A delightful Georgian townhouse

Location

Wharton Street is ideally located for all the amenities of Upper Street and Clerkenwell whilst also in close proximity are the trendy restaurants and bars in Exmouth Market. Sadlers Wells theatre is also close by.

The City is within walking distance and there is a wealth of transport links to choose from including King's Cross (Eurostar), Farringdon (impending Crossrail) and Angel (Northern Line) stations as well as many bus routes leading to many notable central London destinations including the West End.

Description

A delightful Grade II Listed Georgian townhouse situated on one of Finsbury's most sought after streets. This family home has been refurbished to exacting standards and to a sophisticated style that is reflective of the buildings period.

Set over four floors and totaling approximately 1,810 sqft the accommodation includes a spacious open plan kitchen and dining room leading onto an extended family reception room on the lower ground floor. The reception room opens directly out onto a well maintained and secluded South facing garden. There is also the added benefit of separate utility room and WC on this floor.

The raised ground floor comprises of two versatile rooms that are currently used as a large study at the front, and guest bedroom at the rear. The master bedroom suite occupies the whole of the first floor and is made up of a rear facing bedroom, walk in wardrobe/dressing area at the front that leads onto a glorious marble finished en-suite bathroom. The upper floor comprises of a large bedroom and a separate family bathroom.

Square Footage: 1810 sq ft

Location

Description

A wonderful garden maisonette set over the raised ground and lower ground floors of this Grade II listed Georgian townhouse. From a communal hallway, the front door leads into a wide central hallway with a bespoke fitted study to the rear and master bedroom to the front. There is an abundance of charm and character with high corniced ceilings and a wealth of fitted shelving and storage. Stairs lead down to the light filled lower ground floor and spacious reception room. To the front is a further bedroom with a new en suite bathroom and steam shower.

To the rear is a newly refurbished kitchen with fitted appliances including a Lacanche range cooker and the dining room area. Double doors open from the kitchen and reception rooms out to the wonderful south facing private garden. The peaceful walled garden is mature and well stocked with espaliered apple and pear trees. This is a well-presented property with great storage and the exclusive use of the landscaped garden. The communal hall leads through to allocated storage areas for each flat owner.

agency_name: Urban Spaces Loft Living & Unique Properties
detailedDescription:
An incredible opportunity to purchase 3115 sq/ft lateral loft in Kings Cross' iconic Art Deco factory conversion of the former Poppy Foundation Building.

This beautiful building, dating back to 1925 has been many things, from the manufacturing place of the Remembrance Day poppies to a toy importer’s warehouse before being converted, in 1996, to oversized lofts. They were originally sold as shells and so each is fitted out in a unique way suitable to each resident.

This particular apartment was designed by Brookes Stacy Randall who has won numerous awards through the years. The space was also featured in numerous publications and used as a location for film and music shoots. However, this loft was designed to be a permanent home for the current owners with an emphasis to flow, light and space whilst sympathetically preserving original features and structure of the factory. The curved opaqued glass walls guide you through the entrance hall towards the spectacular living space with an open plan kitchen cleverly positioned in the centre allowing this triple aspect room to be zoned out into a pre-defined living areas, without a need for walls allowing this home to be filled with light any time of the day.

This stunning warehouse apartment comes with one of the most magnificent roof terraces spanning to apprx 1800 sq feet, which is particularly rare to find. The apartment also retains many of the original warehouse features including exposed brickwork, large factory windows, 2.94 meter hight ceilings and solid timber floors. Two, very good sized bedrooms and bathrooms, have been positioned on the left of the property to allow the living space to take centre stage and absorb most architectural features.

York Central is located in the heart of Kings Cross, moments from Kings Cross and St Pancras International stations, as well the N1C regeneration zone, which includes enormously popular public spaces such as Granary Square, a great array of shops and restaurants at Coal Drop Yard, as well as the convenience of a large Waitrose supermarket.

Further benefits include a share of freehold, a chain free vendor and secure underground parking.

address: The Merchant Building, 38 Wharf Road, London N1
detailedDescription:
Stunning 3 Bedroom Penthouse Apartment on Wharf Road.

Location

Wharf Road is situated just off City Road in close proximity to the fabulous selection of shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street and within easy reach of the City. Central London and the West End is within easy reach from Angel Underground Station (0.4 miles) and Old Street Underground Station (0.5 miles).

Description

This stunning sub-penthouse apartment is set within the highly sought after Merchant Building, a bespoke canal side development of premium apartments just moments from Islington and Shoreditch. Set on the 8th floor of this modern gated development this three bedroom apartment is beautifully presented. The property offers a generous open-plan living space with double aspect and floor to ceiling windows, sleek modern kitchen with integrated appliances, large balconies with canal views, a large master bedroom suite with built in wardrobes, high quality en-suite shower room and access to a second private balcony, two further double bedrooms (one with fitted wardrobes), a family bathroom and a separate large utility room and services cupboard. There is substantial built-in storage throughout and a built-in air filtration system, remote smart control system for heating and lighting.

The property also comes with secure underground parking accessed via lifts, concierge service and separate communal roof terrace with stunning 360 degree views of central London.

Square Footage: 1197 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 991 years remaining

detailedDescription:
A charming and newly refurbished New York Loft Style Duplex Apartment, located within a grand Landmark building in one of North London’s most sought after locations.

Originally built between 1908-1911 with strong French Architectural influences this enchanting and very spacious one bedroom apartment located within a former gpo Money Order Office has been designed for maximum entertaining space and modern living with interiors crafted by design engineers and will be sold with share-of-freehold.

At ground level the reception with high ceilings opens up through the whole apartment flooded by light through the industrial sized Crittall windows. The original kitchen has been replaced with a new contemporary design that incorporates some integrated appliances, ample work space and selection of wall & base units.

Ascending to the first floor from the bespoke’ cast iron staircase and wooden risers, the mezzanine offers a very spacious bedroom area and stylish bathroom suite. This charming apartment has been finished with reclaimed parquet wood flooring, zonal lighting and cleverly designed storage ideas.

The Grade II landmark Beaux Arts Building affords its residents with a 24 concierge service evident upon entering the grand foyer, three beautiful landscaped gardens complete with water fountain, modern fitness centre, steam room, sauna and two roof terraces that offer far reaching views across London’s changing skyline. Street Parking parking can be obtained subject to availability and further charges.

Manor Gardens is located within an area of culture that benefits from a wide range of amenities including supermarkets, eateries and coffee shops. The ever popular Upper Street is within easy reach and offers further boutiques, restaurants and entertainment facilities. The area is serviced by a number of transport links including the Underground Stations of Holloway Road (0.8 miles away), Finsbury Park (0.9 miles away), Archway (0.8 miles away) and Upper Holloway Overground Station (0.6 miles away) and direct buses into the City.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:

Postmark will create a bustling new neighbourhood in the heart of Central London, offering an exciting mix of stylish designed apartments. Leading the last major regeneration project.

Sitting across two postcodes, WC1 and EC1, and surrounded by Farringdon, Clerkenwell, King's Cross and Chancery Lane, Postmark is at the epicentre of the leading creative, technology and knowledge industries and will be a symbol of connectivity.

In honour of Postmark’s double postcode heritage, the collection of apartments at West Central 1 offer the opportunity to embrace either the west or east characteristics of this unique location. Conran and Partners has created two distinctive choices of interior palette, drawing on the celebrated features of each area.

Only Postmark residents can honestly say they live in the true centre of London. In all directions, the best of this great city waits to delight you on your doorstep.

Residents of the development benefit from a host of exceptional amenities at Postmark London including:

Residents' gym. Wellness centre and spa. Cinema. Lounge. Courtyard. 24-hour concierge.

detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom, two bathroom apartment with South-East facing balcony and allocated parking space within in a secure gated development, located in a prominent Islington location, moments from both Underground and Overground Stations as well a number of well-maintained green open spaces including the adjacent Royal Northern Gardens of which the property overlooks, and close by Whittington Park.

This unique apartment set on the second floor has been designed for lateral space and functionality offering approximately 670 Square Feet of flexible living space, comprising large reception room with private balcony which offers far reaching views over the surrounding area, separate modern fully-fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms with en-suite and built in wardrobe to the principle bedroom and tiled family bathroom. This wonderful apartment further benefits from large utility cupboard off the hall, wood flooring, central heating and secure entry system.

Sherard Court is a modern development set back from Holloway Road and affords its residents with wonderfully maintained gardens and outside seating areas. Manor Gardens itself is perfectly positioned between three of North London’s most favourable outdoor locations including Finsbury Park, Highgate Woods and Hampstead Heath.

There are a wide range of amenities within walking distance including supermarkets, eateries, fresh food markets, independent coffee shops and two of the area’s best known pubs, The Landseer and Swimmer at Grafton Arms.

The area is serviced by a number of transport links including Archway Underground Station (Northern Line), Upper Holloway Overground Station and Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line).<br /><br />

detailedDescription:

Comprising two double bedrooms with en-suite to master, reception with an open plan and fully integrated kitchen with dishwasher and fridge/freezer and two private balconies. This apartment has wood flooring throughout with carpeting in the bedroom. The bathroom suite is of a very high standard and comprises; bath with integral shower and screen, heated towel rail, mirrored vanity unit and a tiled floor.

The apartment also benefits from under-floor heating throughout and has beautiful floor to ceiling windows to allow as much natural light as possible into the apartment giving it a bright and open feel. There is a 24 hour concierge service on-site as well as resident's only gym, swimming pool and spa facilities. There is also underground cycle storage.

Woodberry Down is ideally located 0.3 miles from Manor House tube on the Piccadilly line offering excellent links into Central London, the City and Greater London.

Full description:
shared ownership (Advertised price represents 25% share. Full market value £530,000). Fable Apartments is part of a recently-constructed development alongside City Road Basin, only a short walk from Angel and Old Street and within easy reach of the heart of The City. This particular apartment is the fourth-floor corner unit so benefits from a reception room with an additional side window. The kitchen is open-plan with pale units, contrasting worktop and integrated appliances. There is a built-in wardrobe in the bedroom, useful additional storage space in the hallway and an attractive, modern bathroom. Well insulated walls, high performance glazing and a communal heating and hot water system have resulted in a very good energy-efficiency rating and an excellent environmental-impact rating. A large cycle store is available for residents' use.

agency_name: Hurford Salvi Carr - Clerkenwell & City Sales
detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom authentic clerkenwell loft apartment

This spectacular lateral loft apartment is located on St John's Lane, possibly one of the most sought after addresses in Clerkenwell.

This extremely elegant and almost symmetrical former warehouse was erected in the 1860's by Fenner, Appleton and Co. As a manufacturing stationer and a timber Yard, partially re-constructed in 1918-19 and converted into apartments at the turn of the century by the Architects Herber-Percy and Parker.

Defining the very best in Clerkenwell loft living the apartment has high ceilings, huge windows and the ability to adapt a living environment that is both personal and social, eliminating the defined spaces most commonly found in a traditional house.

The accommodation comprises a wonderful reception/dining room with recessed fully integrated kitchen, master bedroom with ample storage and en suite bathroom, second double bedroom and guest shower room.

Prior Docwra’s Gate or what we now know as St John’s Gate, completed in 1504 was the entrance to the walled precinct of the Priory of St John and is visible from the apartment, regarded as the most important historic landmarks in Clerkenwell.

The area is superbly serviced with Farringdon Underground (Circle, Metropolitan and Hammersmith & City) as well as mainline station moments away with Cross rail expected to be fully operational in 2022. Not to mention the superb selection of restaurants, shops and bars on Exmouth market and Cowcross Street.

Whether you are working in the City’s financial district, the Inns of Court, Clerkenwell’s creative industries or the world of tech you can be sure that it will be a short walk away to your office.

This is an extremely special apartment in a very esteemed Clerkenwell building.

This stylish apartment is quietly located to the rear of this much sought-after residential development with a 24-hour concierge.

The accommodation comprises entrance hall with storage cupboard leading to a bright reception room with recessed open plan kitchen and direct access onto a private balcony. The bedroom is a good double and there is an ample bathroom with walk in storage cupboard.

Brewhouse Yard is the former site of the Cannon Brewery which dates to 1670s. The current Brewhouse Yard was designed by the architects Hamilton Associates with elevations in copper, zinc and glass. It was completed in 2002 and consists of 198 apartments overlooking a landscaped cobbled courtyard.

This very sought-after residential development is located between St John Street and Dallington Street moments from Farringdon Underground (Circle, Hammersmith and City and Metropolitan Lines) and Mainline Station offering superb connections to the financial district in The City and London's West End.

Farringdon Station is currently undergoing an expansion programme and with the opening of Crossrail in 2022 will offer direct access to four of London's International Airports.

An excellent rental investment opportunity.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A mid 1800s Victorian property located on Huntingdon Street in Barnsbury. The property spans five floors and totals near to 2,500 sq ft. The space has been impeccably interior designed throughout and is presented as turnkey. The raised ground floor is home to an impressive custom hand built kitchen with a Lilac Milas marble worktop. This is open plan with the reception area where period features have been retained or restored to include sash windows fireplace, ceiling rose, coving and wooden flooring. Crittall windows to the rear flood the property with natural light and frame the view of the rear garden which nears 40 ft. The lower ground floor, which has been damp proofed throughout, offers a bedroom, additional kitchen, bathroom, utility room, vault storage and the second access to the rear garden via Crittall doors. There is potential to extend here, the client has approved planning and architectural drawings. This floor boasts a separate entrance making it an ideal option for a Nanny flat or guest area. The first floor is home to an impressive reception room and study, space remains interchangeable, with striking period features including ornate cornicing which was painstakingly preserved and dual fireplaces. A convenient office can be found to the rear between landings. The second floor is where you will find the principal suite, beautifully open plan with wooden flooring, bespoke cabinetry and en-suite bathroom with cast iron tub and double sink, Stylised with antiques, Serge Mouille lighting, Pierre Paulin furniture and Pierre Frey fabrics. The top floor has been architecturally designed by Tom Benton and offers an additional bedroom and bathroom with roof terrace. The bones of the house, electrics and plumbing, were completely overhauled in 2017. We expect high interest in such a beautifully designed family home, currently presented as a three bedroom house, the space is flexible and can easily offer 4/5 bedrooms should any buyer want to alter the volume of reception space.

Situation
Huntingdon Street is a popular residential street in the Barnsbury Conservation area with real sense of community. It is within easy reach of all the facilities of Islington and Upper Street and has excellent transport links at Angel, Kings Cross, Barnsbury and Caledonian Road.

address: Highbury New Park, Highbury, London N5
detailedDescription:
A beautifully proportioned family home.

Location

On the corner of Stradbrooke Road and Highbury New Park this is an end of terrace freehold house built approx 1875. Well placed for access to local amenities at Highbury Barn with good transport links into the City and West End. Both Highbury Fields and Clissold Park are easily accessible for exercising children and dogs.

Description

This is a mid Victorian villa that enjoys the most beautiful and well proportioned accommodation arranged over five floors. At the end of the terrace the house has the benefit of an open access to the south side, including a most attractive balcony at the second floor level.

This is a beautiful family sized house that enjoys both light and well proportioned accommodation over five floors. The house has been restored with care and attention to detail with wonderful ceiling heights, and very attractive ceiling mouldings and fireplaces throughout. The upper floors provide attractive rooms that are flexible to provide up to 6 bedrooms if required. Of particular note is the terrific reception/studio at the top of the house that has a sliding glazed roof - this room also has masses of eaves storage.

The first and second floors accommodate generous bedrooms and bathrooms, a study on the side and a most attractive balcony at the second floor level. The ground floor has generous living space with an elegant drawing room with high ceilings and large bay window, the entrance hall is both light and airy. There is a terrific fully fitted kitchen/day room at the rear that has two sets of doors that lead out to the rear garden. The garden floor is arranged as a self contained flat with it's own side access. The main bedroom has an en-suite shower room. There is a fully fitted kitchen and a really useful utility and store room. The well proportioned reception room has appealing views over the front garden. Subject to the usuaul approvals, this level of the house could be reincorporated back into the main house. The house is approached from a well designed and landscaped front garden, with steps up to the raised ground floor. The rear garden is also landscaped, and has the option to provide off street parking for one car with the side double doors.

This is a most attractive family home that is well placed for all amenities

Square Footage: 4543 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Description

Contemporary one bedroom flat in the heart of Haggerston, next to Regent's Canal.

Located on the fifth floor, you enter into a wide hallway. To your right is an open plan reception that has a great outlook and a tonne of natural light, creating a lovely space to relax and entertain in.

The kitchen has fully-integrated appliances and plenty of preparation space.
Adjacent to the reception, is the family bathroom, with shower, w/c & wash basin.

At the far end of the apartment, a double bedroom with great proportions, has a similar outlook to the reception, overlooking the interior courtyard and surrounding urban area.

Storage is at a premium with a large wardrobe in the bedroom, and a decent hallway boiler cupboard.

Around 10 minutes walk from both Haggerston Park & London Fields, the former is famous for its City Farm, the latter popular for its heated lido. All your principle amenities are situated on Kingsland Road with a fabulous mix of restaurants, bars, bakeries and coffee shops less than 5 minutes walk. The Duke of York is your firm favourite local pub five minutes away, and By The Bridge Cafe is your local coffee shop just over the canal.

For transport, Haggerston station is a 3 minute walk and has a direct link into Shoreditch High Street & further South. Alternatively Old Street underground & rail is a 20 minute walk away or under 5 minutes by bus from Kingsland Road.

The hallway provides access to a large and chic family bathroom, two generously proportioned bedrooms, one of which boasts an en-suite shower room, and the bright and spacious open-plan lounge/kitchen/dining room. Clerkenwell is ideally situated for those looking to be within walking distance of the City for work, the West End for its shopping and theatrical delights on offer, and Shoreditch for its exciting nightlife paired with a plethora of restaurants and bars.

address: Newstead House, 57A Liverpool Road, London N1
detailedDescription:
‘This apartment is ideally suited for those looking for generous entertaining space and who want to be located close to Angel and Upper Street, N1. The first floor apartment has a roomy master bedroom with en suite and an adjacent second bedroom, both with fitted wardrobes and both with sash window aspect directly onto a relatively quiet residential street. The lounge is vast at 29’ with duel sash windows at opposing ends providing good natural light and wood flooring throughout. There is a generous fitted kitchen providing plenty of storage and preparation space which looks onto a dining area which can comfortable seat six tp eight dinner guests with a south aspect onto a communal garden at the back of this development.

Newstead House, N1 is popular modern development located on Liverpool Road, N1 however this particular apartment has rooms with aspects onto Batchelor Street, N1. This street mainly consists of handsome period houses and a beautiful Victorian School building all of which are complimented with classic street lighting in keeping with being within the Barnsbury Conservation area. The nearest open open space is Barnard Park, N1 only a few mins walk where other green space can be found at Gibson Square and Islington Green, N1. The Regents Canal is a very popular pedestrian and cycling route by local residents West towards Kings Cross, Granary Square and Coal Drops Yard as well as East towards Wenlock Basin, Shoreditch Park, Broadway Market and Victoria Park.

Barnsbury, N1 is such a popular location due to its tranquil environment surrounded by wonderful architecture, local gastro pubs and historic streets whilst being very close to transport links. The closest underground station to Newstead House, N1 is Angel underground station (Northern Line) at 4 mins walk where Kings Cross (Underground, National and international Rail) at 20 mins walk has a direct routes on to south towards Brighton and Gatwick as well as links to many European cities on Eurostar. Buses are plentiful from Upper Street Northbound towards Highbury and Islington and Southbound towards The City.

Vibrant Upper Street, N1 is very close offering residents an array of independent boutiques, cafés, restaurants and bars on their doorstep as well as theatres such as the King’s Head and the internationally renowned Almeida Theatre. Islington Square is a welcome new addition also just off Upper Street, offering first class shopping and venues such as Third Space Gym and a luxury cinema experience at the Odeon Luxe and Dine.’

detailedDescription:
A stunning modern two bedroom apartment arranged over the first floor of this popular development just off Rosebery Avenue.

Beautifully presented throughout, the property has a bright and airy living space with a smart modern open plan kitchen and full height french doors opening to a juliet balcony.

There is a generous principal bedroom with built-in storage and an en-suite bathroom together with a second double bedroom which by way of a sliding partition can be opened up to the adjacent reception room enlarging the living space. There is also a further shower room.

Residents of the Hydra Building enjoy the use of a communal garden to the rear of the building and more extensive gardens adjacent to the Nautilus Building.

Located on the corner of Hardwick Street and Amwell Street the Hydra Building sits within the heart of the New River developments and is well placed for all the local amenities in Clerkenwell, including Exmouth Market with its popular restaurants, bars and shops. Islington's Upper Street is also a short walk away, offering further amenities and the Underground station at Angel (Northern Line - 0.5 miles). Please note that all distances are approximate.

detailedDescription:
Offers In Excess Of £650,000
A beautifully presented, light filled two-double bedroom period conversion with exceptional private rear garden, located on a quiet tree lined turning near a number of parks, transport links including access to the Victoria & Piccadilly Lines and amenities of both Stroud Green Road & Blackstock Road.

Occupying the entire ground floor of an imposing semi-detached Victorian conversion, this wonderfully presented property boasting vast natural light beamed through the large sash windows offers lateral internal living space of approximately 922 SqFt.

Entered through your own private front door, the property opens up from the large hallway to a separate open-plan reception / dining room at the far end, with oversized bay window and deep alcoves making them ideal for storage or fitted shelving. A bright separate fitted kitchen which gives direct access to the rear garden provides a range of high gloss wall and base units with integrated oven, four-ring gas hob and up and over extractor fan.

Both bedrooms are of a similar size and offer direct views over the garden area from full height sash windows, whilst offering exceptional space for freestanding furniture. The bathroom comprises of an L-shaped tub with overhead shower attachment, wash basin and vanity unit with single lever mixer tap and heated rail. The adjacent separate W.C also includes a wash basin with mixer tap and window.

Measuring approximately 40’8 x 36’1, the private garden accessed from the kitchen provides wonderful entertainment space with mature lawn laid to beautifully maintained flower-beds, panelled fencing and stone patio area.

Thane Villas is situated within one of North London's most vibrant locations with an extensive range of recreational facilities close by including the 110 acres of green open space at Finsbury Park, leisure centres, The Castle Climbing Centre, Park Theatre and Rowans Ten Pin Bowling. Nearby Stroud Green Road offers a range of amenities including supermarkets, eateries, independent coffee shops, wine bars and bakeries. In addition the new City North Landmark development adjacent to Finsbury Park Station will see residents benefit from a new cinema, shops, fitness centre and supermarket.

The Victoria Line, Piccadilly Line and main line train services at Finsbury Park Station are within 11 minutes’ walk (Google), with Arsenal Underground Station also within walking distance. Bus routes, some running 24hr services include 259,91,210,4,253,254 and 43.<br /><br />

Accommodation is architecturally designed, retaining ornate period features throughout and comprises, a grand double reception space on the raised ground floor, bathed in light courtesy of the large sash windows and dual aspect. The lower level houses the kitchen, dining room and a further reception space, thoughtfully created within the rear extension, and provides access to the tranquil rear garden. Gibson Square sits right in the heart of Barnsbury, affording superb access to Angel Underground station (Northern Line), along with Highbury & Islington station (National Rail and Victoria Line trains). detailedDescription:
Full description This stunning lateral garden flat occupies the ground floor of this imposing Victorian building, located moments from Highbury Fields. Boasting its own front door, to the front of the property is a grand bedroom with window overlooking the garden. Also accessed from the central corridor is the kitchen diner in the middle, and the main bathroom just behind.

The rear of this charming home houses the remaining bedroom with en suite, and a terrific reception room. French doors from the bay window open out onto the rear private terrace, leading on to the main garden. The current owners have lovingly worked with the gardener on this in the 14 years they have enjoyed living here.

The rear garden is a wonderful space, with part given over to communal use, and drinks are often enjoyed on a Summer's evening with the other residents of the building. It is difficult to believe that you are in Zone 2 London, with such tranquillity afforded to the occupants.

Situation and tenure This apartment is located just North of Canonbury, in the heart of Highbury yet also with easy access to Upper Street, Highbury Fields, the City and beyond. Canonbury station is 0.4 miles away, Highbury & Islington tube also 0.4 miles away with access to Victoria and Overground. Highbury Barn and Upper Street are both a pleasant stroll - and both offering a bewildering array of eateries, delis and boutiques

The property is offered with a long leasehold of 976 years, with no ground rent
The service charge is £3,432 per annum, this includes a gardener, buildings insurance and a significant contribution to a healthy sinking fund, the building is in excellent condition with no major works scheduled

detailedDescription:
Light, airy two-bedroom flat in a quiet street with share of freehold, offered free of chain.

Available for remote or in-person viewings.

Set above a converted former pub, this property has large south- and west-facing windows – always full of light and sun but not overlooked by neighbouring properties. The large dual aspect reception room and connected kitchen particularly benefit from this.

Two similarly sized double bedrooms (one currently used as a study but fits a double bed), one south-facing and the other not above a road, both quiet and peaceful.

Set on a quiet street, but on-street parking is always available and electric vehicle charging points directly opposite. The street-level entrance is shared with two other flats and includes an area for secure bike storage. There is also a shared cellar with ample storage space.

Share of freehold with four other properties in the same building, no external management company or fees so all you will pay is a contribution to actual maintenance costs. EPC rated C.

The current owners have lived here for 15 years and love this residential area in De Beauvoir Town with great local amenities:

· Literally a minute away from leafy Rosemary Gardens and five from Shoreditch Park.

· Walk, jog or cycle down the canal towpath to Broadway Market and Victoria Park

· Popular local pubs and beer gardens like the Rosemary Branch pub & theatre, the Scolt Head and the De Beauvoir Arms

· Great food from the like of De Beauvoir Deli and Popham’s, plus the convenience of a Tesco moments away

· And a short walk from all the amenities of Upper Street, Old Street, Shoreditch and Dalston.

Well connected, in particular with very frequent buses to Angel and then on to the West End or King’s Cross, and to Old Street and then to Bank, London Bridge or Waterloo, as well as the Overground, Northern and Victoria lines.

address: Wenlock Basin, Wharf Road, London N1
detailedDescription:
Property number 46590. Click the"Email Agent" button, submit the form and we'll text & email you within minutes, day or night.

Narrowboat - built 2007 - saloon & open plan galley; double cabin, bathroom (shower, WC washbasin). Solid fuel stove.

Braywick is a charming trad-stern narrowboat - fully operational if desired, with Isuzu diesel engine able to cruise the extensive canal system on the doorstep.

The marina at Wenlock Basin is privately owned and Braywick has a rental agreement to moor; It is a fully residential mooring recognised by the local authority and council tax is payable. There are various communal seating and BBQ areas on the marina, and a resident marina manager, refuse/recycling, pump-out, and secure bike storage .

Metered mains electricity is provided, as is water & waste pump-out. A BT landline is optional; Various wifi options available on site.

A no-subletting rule makes the marina a secure haven in the city; a no pets rule is in place to safeguard the many waterfowl & garden birds.

Angel Islington & Old Street underground stations are approximately 10 minutes walk away

If you're interested in this property please click the "Email Agent" button above

detailedDescription: A wonderfully bright, architecturally designed, four-bedroom, three-bathroom house with four terraces, situated in a gated mews, securely and peacefully tucked away moments from Myddelton Square and the sought after amenities of Amwell Street. Accommodation is light filled and well-arranged comprising; a wide entrance hallway on the ground floor, providing access to the vast kitchen/dining space which opens onto one of the four terraces. There is also a double bedroom and guest W.C on this level. There are two further double bedrooms, one of which features an en-suite, both of which benefit from access to a further terrace, as well as a utility room and family bathroom on the lower level. The top floor houses the principal bedroom suite and the fabulous reception space, flooded in natural light courtesy of the floor to ceiling, retracting doors which open on to another terrace. The floating staircase on this level leads to the jaw dropping, largest roof terrace, which spans the whole top floor of the house and provides uninterrupted city views, that must be viewed to be truly enjoyed. River Street Mews is a wonderful tranquil setting in amongst more vibrant surroundings, supremely well positioned for access to a plethora of amenities of Amwell Street, as well as Sadlers Wells Theatre, the gardens of Myddelton Square, the renowned eateries and bars of Exmouth Market, Upper Street and Camden Passage. The City & the West End are both within walking distance. The nearest public transport links are Angel (Northern Line), Farringdon Station (London Underground Circle Line, Hammersmith & City Line and Metropolitan Line and National Rail services). Kings Cross/ St Pancras International is just 1 stop from Angel, with the Eurostar Terminus offering trains to mainland Europe.

detailedDescription: A bright, spacious and light filled three double bedroom maisonette, benefitting from a fabulous circa 42.5 ft private, south facing rear garden, situated moments from the sought after Gillespie primary school, and Arsenal Underground. Accommodation is well proportioned comprising; a private entrance leading to the double reception space housed on the raised ground floor, flooded in natural light courtesy of the dual aspect and large sash windows, whilst retaining ornate original features. The kitchen/dining room benefits from underfloor heating and is situated in the extension at the rear of this level, providing access to the vast, south facing private garden. The first floor houses two double bedrooms, one of which benefits from a cleverly designed mezzanine space as well as the family bathroom, also featuring underfloor heating. The third bedroom is located on the upper half landing within the rear extension, which provides excellent views into the garden through the large window. The property affords convenient access to Arsenal Underground station which sits on the Piccadilly Line linking through to the West End and North to Finsbury Park, along with the greenery of Highbury Fields and the renowned shops of Highbury Barn, such as the Fromagerie, butchers & fishmongers.

Description

This is a beautiful freehold house in a preferred spot in central Islington that has been refurbished to the highest of standards by the current owners. The high quality fixtures and fittings and many period features such as shutters, fire surrounds and ceiling mouldings throughout the house make for a super home. detailedDescription:
We are pleased to present new to the market this beautiful 2 double bedroom flat within a Grade II listed Georgian terrace, the property offers over 700 sq ft of well presented accommodation together with a private section of the rear garden.

With steps up from the street to its own front door and laterally converted, the property features a bright, south west facing reception room with a feature fireplace and large sash window, two double bedrooms, both with extensive built-in storage, a separate kitchen and smart modern shower room with a glass enclosed shower.

To the rear of the property and accessed via the communal hallway is a fenced and gated section of the rear garden, ideal for summer entertaining.

Rotherfield Street is a wide, attractive residential tree lined street in the heart of the East Canonbury Conservation Area.

The nearest station can be found at Essex Road (0.3 miles - Overground) providing access to the City via Moorgate. Highbury & Islington (0.9 miles - Victoria, Overground & Mainline services) is also a short distance away and provides easy access to the West End. Haggerston (0.8 miles - Overground) is also within easy reach.

A variety of local amenities can be found on Southgate Road and Islington's fashionable Upper Street within close proximity as are the green open spaces of Rosemary Gardens.

detailedDescription: An extremely spacious 2 double bedroom Live/Work apartment set across the 1st & 2nd floors of this small development off Caledonian Road, by the Regents Canal and close to Kings Cross/ St Pancras International. The property does require updating but provides a superb opportunity for an incoming buyer to finish to their own taste, style & quality of finish. It also services the ability in this new era to utilise the Live/Work usage. Accommodation is light and South facing, comprising 2 good size rooms on the second floor, with a kitchen & bathroom also on this level. The 1st floor is home to a 28ft X 12 ft room with double doors opening to a small balcony which looks in to the courtyard. Also on this level is a guest WC and an additional room with a small kitchenette. It should be noted that the property comes with an allocated parking space and use of a communal canal side terrace. The property is ideally located in the heart of the popular area of King's Cross and is within easy reach of all the shops, bars and restaurants of Granary Square & Coal Drops Yard. The property is set just off Caledonian Road, by the Regents Canal and only minutes to the urban development of Regent Quarter bringing a dynamic mix of living, working and leisure space. Kings Cross has a history of bustling businesses that thrived on Britain's great rail networks. Railways still play a big part in King's Cross and St Pancras, as it is one of London's busiest links between the National Rail network, with no fewer than six Underground lines and nine bus routes, with of course a direct link to mainland Europe. The regeneration is being built upon by the continued investment attracting blue chip employers such as Google and Central St Martins College.

The property is located only a short walk to Holloway Underground Station (Piccadilly Line) and within easy reach of the green open spaces of Caledonian Park, Paradise Park and Highbury Fields.

This charming one double bedroom apartment situated on the ground floor of a well maintained purpose built development has just been refurbished through its entirety and offers flexible and naturally bright living space of approximately 533 SqFt.

Entered through a private entrance the property comprises of brand new fully fitted kitchen with some integrated appliances and selection of wall and base units, spacious reception room with ample room for dining and direct access to the garden. The generously sized bathroom has a fitted bath and shower attachment, wash basin with single lever tap and low level W.C, whilst the double bedroom offers ample space for freestanding furniture of choice. To the rear of the property is a private landscaped garden with stone slabs and slate chippings laid to railway sleeper planters. Further benefits include double glazed windows, gas central heating, large utility cupboard and storage to the front of the building.

Belfont Walk is located on a quiet side road set back from Camden Road with well maintained communal gardens and close to the local shopping facilities and eateries on Holloway Road. Further amenities are only a short journey away with Camden Town and its restaurants, cafés, famous market, supermarkets and multiple music venues.

There is a number of transports links close by with Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line) being the closest, there is also a number of bus routes close by offering easy access to many different underground lines, national rail services and Eurostar at Kings Cross/St Pancras International.<br /><br />

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Three Bedroom Ground & First Floor Maisonette – all interest and offers are invited.

Internal:
Entrance Hall - The front entrance door opens to the hall, with the staircase leading up to the first floor landing and doors to the kitchen, lounge and WC.
Kitchen - Fitted with a range of white wall and base units with laminate worktops over. Inset stainless steel sink basin with a drainer and mixer tap and an integrated electric oven with a countertop hob and overhead extractor hood. Space for appliances, a front aspect window and a storage cupboard.
Lounge - Offering generous space for furniture with rear aspect windows and a door to the garden.
WC - With a WC and a wash hand basin. Front aspect obscure window.

First Floor Landing - With doors to the bedrooms, the bathroom, and the storage cupboard.
Bedroom One - Double size room with a rear aspect window and a built-in storage cupboard.
Bedroom Two - Double size room with a front aspect window and a built-in storage cupboard.
Bedroom Three - Single size room with a rear aspect window and a built-in storage cupboard.
Bathroom - Comprising a WC, a vanity unit enclosed wash hand basin and a panelled bath with an overhead shower. Front aspect window.

External:
Sheltered entrance to the front. To the rear is a large garden with wooden fencing and a patio area.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

address: Seaview Cottage, Southgate Road, London N1
detailedDescription:
A deceptively spacious home lies behind the delightful frontage of Seaview Cottage on Southgate Road, De Beauvoir. The current owners have used a neutral palette of colours and materials to create a serene environment, amplified by the abundance of natural light within the house and its position set back from the road. Seaview Cottage is situated in the heart of De Beauvoir amongst the handsome Georgian terraces and wide, tree-lined streets that define the locality.

The Tour

A charming patio garden greets visitors to Seaview Cottage. Climbing plants form a natural arch above the front door, and a timber sash window set in the rendered first floor completes the unassuming façade. A long entrance hall within leads past a walk-in shower and WC, passing a space that could be used for a multitude of purposes, and finally opening into a modern kitchen and dining area. A large skylight over the dining table illuminates the space, as does the kitchen window overlooking the garden. Full-height tri-fold glazed doors open from the open-plan living area onto the tropical courtyard garden, also visible from two of the bedrooms.

There are three double bedrooms on the ground floor, two of which share a lightwell. The main bedroom is furnished with louvred timber shutters and a spacious walk-in wardrobe, and has views onto the garden. It has a private door onto the bathroom, which can also be accessed via the corridor. A further double bedroom lies upstairs at the front of the plan; there is also another room upstairs which could be used as a single bedroom or a study.

A neutral palette has been used throughout Seaview Cottage, with walls painted white and simple timber flooring. The kitchen worktops are timber too, and one wall of the hallway has been clad in vertical timber slats. Black doorframes mark the entrances to the living area and main bedroom, a smart detail that has been repeated in the frames of the ground floor lightwell.

Outdoor Space

The central courtyard garden is visually impressive and makes ingenious use of space. Mature banana trees form a natural wall and canopy around the garden; climbing plants have taken up residence on two of the walls, and a fig tree and other large plants add to the feeling of tranquillity. The garden is laid to gravel, with a timber walkway around the perimeter. The front patio garden provides further green-fingered opportunities and the lightwell serving two of the ground floor bedrooms has also been planted.

The Area

Seaview Cottage is conveniently positioned for the pubs, restaurants, shops and cafes of both Islington and Dalston. The Scolt Head and De Beauvoir Arms are both excellent local pubs. The De Beauvoir Deli is a few moments away and is a firm favourite with locals, offering locally sourced produce alongside seasonal fruit and vegetables, sandwiches and salads. Regent’s Canal is within easy reach of Seaview Cottage, providing a gateway to the rest of London. The shops, galleries and restaurants of Shoreditch are also close at hand.

Haggerston Station is 10 minutes walk away, where the London Overground has connections to Canary Wharf via Canada Water. Regular buses run to the City and beyond from Kingsland Road. Kings Cross St Pancras is two miles to the west.

Benefitting from close proximity to the City of London, the development is located moments from Old Street Station for links around the city while a range of shops and amenities can be found in Clerkenwell, Islington and nearby Shoreditch.

A one bedroom, one bathroom apartment on the sixth floor with 24 hour concierge service, resident’s gym, short walk to zone 2 Piccadilly line tube station, two cafés and a Sainsbury’s Local on-site.

detailedDescription:
A modern and unique one bedroom flat set over the second floor of this impressive warehouse conversion in East Canonbury. The flat offers light filled rooms through large Crittal style windows and is offered in fantastic condition throughout.
The living room and kitchen features a semi open plan layout which creates a wonderfully social entertaining space. The kitchen offers plenty of storage space and boasts solid stone worktops whilst wooden floors feature throughout. The double bedroom is a generous size as is the contemporary family sized bathroom.

Elmore House is a small development which benefits from secure gated entry and is set on an exceptionally desirable, tree lined, residential street located between Essex Road and De Beauvoir. The flat is within easy reach of the restaurants, bars and boutique shops on Upper Street as well as being just moments from a terrific selection of restaurants and independent shops, including the iconic De Beauvoir Deli, on Southgate Road. Transport to the City and Canary Wharf is easily facilitated by the overground services from Essex Road and various bus routes along Southgate road whilst the frequent buses on Essex Road provide easy access to the West End. Highbury and Islington station offers the closest underground service on the Victoria line whilst Angel station on the Northern line is also within easy reach. Kings Cross is only a couple of stops away and from here international links are facilitated from St Pancras.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: The Courtyard, 154 Goswell Road, Clerkenwell, London EC1V
detailedDescription:
This larger than average two bedroom apartment is situated in a quiet location at the rear of a gated development with a secure parking space, patio and long lease.
Approx 1062 sq.ft

On entering the property you are greeted with a large hallway with space for a console table, wooden flooring and two storage cupboards.

The kitchen has a window looking out to the courtyard with integrated appliances including a fridge/freezer, Siemen’s washer/dryer, full size dishwasher, microwave, fan oven and ceramic hob, there are granite worktops, a tiled splashback and tiled flooring.

A full size bathroom leads off the hall, with a tiled floor and walls, low level WC, heated towel rail, bath with screen and shower attachment, wall mirror, wash hand basin with vanity unit, low voltage lighting.

Double doors open to the large reception room, with ample space for a large dining table, several sofas and a desk.

Glass doors open onto the patio area which is demised to the property.

Bedroom two has a good sized fitted wardrobe and a window with a west aspect overlooking the residents only courtyard

The master bedroom is also a good size with a fitted wardrobe, a window overlooking the courtyard and an en-suite shower room.
The location of this apartment is superb, Clerkenwell is renowned for the quality and variety of its bars and restaurants. There is a thriving specialty coffee scene, and in addition to two Waitroses, each just a short walk away, there is a fantastic range of food and wine purveyors within a few minutes' walk. Filled with narrow streets, cobbled alleyways and secret squares, Clerkenwell boasts a wealth of green space.

Exmouth Market, St Paul’s and The City are a short walk away. Nearby Farringdon station (Circle, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City lines and National Rail) provides ready access to the West End, and Canary Wharf, and links to the airports, outer London and beyond. When Crossrail (Elizabeth Line) opens, Farringdon station will provide high-speed links east and west, as well as direct access to four of London’s five major airports.<br /><br />

On Southgate Road, the property is a matter of a few doors down from De Beauvoir's parade of shops and delicatessens. Haggerston station is within a half mile walk and the Canal and Park are at the end of the Road.

address: Tufnell Park Road, Tufnell Park, Islington, London N19
detailedDescription:
Stunning One-Double-Bedroom Apartment just '2 Minutes' Walk' from Tufnell Park Underground Station (Northern Line), and easy reach of Hampstead Heath and Waterlow Park.

Located on the first floor of secure purpose built block off Tufnell Park Road, having been tastefully modernised throughout this naturally bright and spacious apartment offers approximately 475 SqFt of internal living space and would be well suited to a first-time buyer or someone who requires a well-placed pied á terre close to town. Entered from a large entrance hall, the open-plan kitchen and reception room provide wonderful entertainment space comprising of a newly fitted kitchen with some integrated appliances and breakfast bar finished with a bespoke miniature brick tile splash back and solid wood worktops.

The double bedroom finished with soft carpet provides ample room for freestanding furniture whilst the adjacent contemporary bathroom suite boasts bath tub with overhead waterfall shower and wall mounted controls, wash basin with single lever mixer tap, W.C and heated rail. Further benefits include built in storage cupboard, electric central heating and double glazed windows.

Longley House is superbly placed for a range of amenities which run along Tufnell Park High Street including supermarket, organic food shops, eateries and cafés. Vibrant Kentish Town and Camden Town are also a short ride away with further selection of restaurants, live music events and breweries.

Tufnell Park Underground Station is just 2 minutes’ walk (Google), providing links to both branches of the Northern Line. The immediate area is spoilt with green open spaces with Hampstead Heath just 18 minutes’ walk and Waterlow Park in less than 20 minutes’ walk (Google)<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious two bedroomed apartment of over 900sqft, with a large private balcony, located moments from Angel Station and easy walking distance of The City of London.

This well-proportioned apartment is situated on the 1st floor of a stylish, modern development that has lift access. There is a wonderful sense of light and space throughout the property and it also benefits from a full length southwest-facing balcony.

The main living area is cavernous and is supremely well-lit by wall-to-wall, full height windows. The is more than enough room to accommodate a separate dining area and gives access to the private balcony. The kitchen comes with fully integrated appliances including a dishwasher and fridge-freezer units.

The double bedrooms are both spacious and offer great storage options via built-in Poliform wardrobes in the master bedroom, which also benefits from its own private en suite shower room. The large, well-appointed bathroom suite and multiple storage cupboards are accessible from the main hallway.
Goswell Road is conveniently located and provides easy access to Islington's ever-popular Upper Street and fashionable Clerkenwell. The City is around a fifteen minute walk South and for a great selection of cafe's, bars and restaurants there is also trendy Exmouth Market and nearby Shoreditch, just moments from your door.

Angel Underground Station (northern Line Services) is less than a five minute walk from the apartment and are also multiple bus routes in the vicinity, that provide connections to the West End, The City and beyond.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented, Georgian, Grade II listed, four storey freehold, benefitting from a circa 60 ft rear garden, enviably positioned in the heart of Canonbury and moments from the New River Walk. Accommodation is light filled and well proportioned comprising; a double reception room which retains ornate period details on the raised ground floor, spacious kitchen/dining room on the lower ground floor, which provides access along with the W.C on the lower half landing to the tranquil rear garden which backs on to Alwyne Villas. The principal bedroom and family bathroom suite are housed on the first floor with a further two double bedrooms on the top floor. Canonbury Road is positioned behind Upper Street and off of Canonbury Square, moments from the peace and tranquillity of the New River Walk, whilst retaining convenient access to the community focal point of the local shops on Canonbury Place, and within close proximity of the shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street. Transport can be found at Highbury & Islington station (Victoria Line, London Overground and National Rail) with fabulous connections to the City and West End.

detailedDescription:
Overlooking Percy Circus is this charming one bedroom apartment positioned on the first floor of a handsome Georgian property. This beautifully presented home has been tastefully renovated in a manner that gives a stylish modern take whilst accentuating its original period character. The impressive and tastefully finished 24’1 x 16’7 reception room oozes atmosphere with wooden sash windows and an original fireplace. Across the hallway is a separate modern kitchen that overlooks gardens to the rear. The remaining accommodation consists of a bright and airy double bedroom and bathroom that is full of natural light.

Situation
This delightful pocket of Finsbury is known for its quiet roads and Dickensian charm as well as its close proximity to Kings Cross St Pancras, with Angel also being within easy reach. For eating and drinking one can head to the ever popular Exmouth market or the newly completed Granary Square. You will find that many parts of central London become walkable from this location.

The living accommodation comprises of a bright and airy open-plan kitchen-reception room which offers flexible living and, with its direct access to the terrace, a perfect entertaining space. There are two double bedrooms (one with an en-suite shower room) which both have access to the terrace. Off the hallway is a sleek modern bathroom and walk-in storage.

Situation
York Way is located in the heart of Kings Cross, just moments away from Kings Cross St Pancras stations. Nearby are the enormously popular Granary Square and Coal Drops Yard which offer fine dining and boutique shopping options. Islington and Camden are both within easy reach and there are numerous bus links in to The City and West End. Regents Canal is an excellent option for walkers/runners.

detailedDescription:
A period family home built in the mid-1800s and totalling near 2,100 sq ft. It has been owned by the same family for generations which is testament to the much loved location. The property boasts period features to include wooden flooring, sash windows with shutters and fireplaces. The favourable orientation floods the house with natural light while the high ceilings give an enviable sense of space. The property offers interchangeable space and an ideal template to create an idyllic family home. Accommodation currently comprises of five bedrooms, double reception, separate kitchen, two bathrooms and a near 50 ft rear garden. There is potential to extend the property via a mansard and rear extension subject to the usual consents. We expect high interest in this property which is available chain free.

Situation
Newington Green is an ideal location positioned between Highbury, Stoke Newington, Hackney and Islington. Lizzie’s on the Green is a local coffee favourite along with the award winning Alma public house for something stronger. Access across town is effortless with ample bus routes including the 73 which goes to Kings Cross, Euston and Victoria. The green open space of Clissold Park is just over a mile away.

detailedDescription:
An immaculate top floor apartment in Dance Square.

Location

Dance Square is located on Peartree Street, providing easy access to Farringdon, Barbican and Old Street Underground Stations.

Within walking distance of the City and the various amenities found in central Clerkenwell along with the bars and restaurants found in Shoreditch, Old Street and Angel. Once Crossrail opens the property will also benefit from direct access to Heathrow airport.

Description

An immaculate, top floor, one bedroom apartment in the popular Dance Square development.

Internally the apartment is finished to a high standard with a modern kitchen featuring a corian work surface along with an induction hob and pop-up extra fan. The lounge opens out onto a private balcony which enjoys plenty of natural light.

The bedroom is well proportioned with fitted storage and a further access point out to the balcony.

Dance Square is one of the areas most popular developments where residents have the luxury of a concierge, well tended communal gardens, lifts and relatively competitive service charges. The building has recently been issued with an EWS1 fire certificate.

Square Footage: 545 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 115 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Behind the facade of a former gallery, hides this spectacular three-bedroom maisonette with a private patio. Bright, spacious and airy, with room to work, relax and entertain, this Highbury home is an oasis in the heart of an established and well-regarded neighbourhood.

Brickworks Says

This three-bedroom home is an architectural marvel hidden in plain sight. Behind its storefront façade is an ingeniously reimagined space, bathed in light and arranged over two floors.

Downstairs is the big living/dining/kitchen area and self-contained study, both opening onto a pretty walled patio garden. It’s an unabashedly modern, almost loft-like space, thanks primarily to the clever reconfiguration of the big shopfront window as a skylight. Upstairs, a wall of glass filters light into the distinctly more period master suite, with its whitewashed brick walls, sash window and en suite shower room. There’s another meticulously remodelled bathroom on this floor, and the second bedroom is perfect as a kid’s quarters or a guest room. With plenty of subtly integrated storage and even a downstairs loo, this home strikes that elusive balance between comfort and convenience, communal space and private sanctuary.

Gillespie Park, with its pretty little nature reserve, is at the end of the road. The green spaces of Highbury Fields and Clissold Park are strollable, too. And Finsbury Park itself is just nearby, as are the indie shops, restaurants, pubs and nightspots between Highbury and Islington and Stoke Newington Church Street. Arsenal Underground station is on the doorstep, with Piccadilly Line service to Kings Cross in less than 15 minutes.

The Owners Say

This is a beautiful, calm home with a space for everything. It was extremely well thought out by the architects who designed it. We love the finishes and the style, and the space flows brilliantly. There are three loos, two showers and a bath, as well as a laundry room and outside space—hard-to-find luxuries for a flat in this part of town.

We’ve really loved living here. The neighbourhood is so lovely and quiet, and it’s getting hipper by the minute: Fink’s coffee shop just opened a branch three doors down!

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current Energy Efficiency Rating of E.

In the Borough of Islington, the maisonette falls into Council Tax Band D (£1640.14).

One of only two in the building, the maisonette has a share of freehold with 900+ years remaining on the lease. There is no service charge.

Over the past two years, the current owners have relocated and reconfigured the kitchen.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

The Legal Bit

While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

detailedDescription:
A fabulous period home on this popular road

Location

This period freehold house is located on this popular residential road in the heart of the Barnsbury Conservation area. The property is well placed for the numerous shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street. King's Cross/St. Pancras International Station is within easy reach, along with Highbury & Islington Station (Victoria Line and Overground), Caledonian Road Station (Piccadilly Line) and Barnsbury Station (Overground).

Description

This elegant Grade II listed house has been remodelled and extended to give a charming family home with a contemporary feel, while maintaining a number of period features.

Arranged over five floors, the accommodation has a lovely flow to it and offers flexible use. The main entrance is to the side of the house, which offers a wide double reception over the ground floor, an ideal space for entertaining and family living. Stairs lead down to a bright garden reception room to the rear of the house, with double doors leading straight out on to the 50' mature garden. Further stairs drop down again to a large open plan kitchen and dining room. Also, over this level is a really handy utility, cellar, WC/shower room and a further study/playroom. Bedrooms are arranged on the top three floors. On the first floor is a large master bedroom with floor to ceiling windows. Also on the first floor is the main bathroom and a purpose built office that could double as a 5th bedroom. Over the second floor are two double bedrooms and a third bathroom and over the top floor is an airy double room with plenty of eaves storage space.

This is a great example of one of the larger homes in Islington.

Square Footage: 2921 sq ft

address: Seven Sisters Road, Upper Hollloway, London N7
detailedDescription:
Summary
Part of a Victorian conversion, offering views of the Emirates stadium & Parliament Hill, this beautifully presented top (3rd) floor apartment has been expertly integrated into the intricate eave space to offer delightful character and charm with modernised bathroom & extensive built-in storage.

Description
Located just off Holloway Road, the flat is superbly situated for the wide selection of facilities provided locally. Shopping is well catered for, from small independents to large supermarkets such as Waitrose, Morrison's & Sainsbury. Restaurants are also well covered, with a huge range including those in the renowned Blackstock Road restaurant district.

Leisure facilities are extensive too, with local landmarks including the Arsenal Emirates Stadium & Finsbury Park which provides access to the Parkland Walk, a green route to Muswell Hill running through Crouch End & Highgate. The park runs to 110 acres and provides a mixture of open ground, formal gardens, avenues of mature trees and an arboretum, along with a lake, a children's play area, a cafe and an art exhibition space as well as an American football field, home to the London Blitz, and diamonds for softball and baseball, home to the London Mets. London Metropolitan University is also close by.

Alongside myriad bus routes, the area is well served by rail services with stations within approximately 1/2 mile including Upper Holloway (Overground), Holloway (Piccadilly Line) & Finsbury Park (Piccadilly, Victoria & Great Northern), providing excellent links into and around Central London, whilst Archway, Tufnell Park, Caledonian Road & Highbury & Islington, with the buzzing Upper Street Islington beyond, are only a mile away.

detailedDescription:
Full description Offering plentiful scope to accommodate a large growing family as well as a home office, this five storey house is situated on a quiet street adjacent to Highbury Barn. To the front, there is a traditional Victorian stoop with stairs to the front door and also down to separate access to the lower floor of the house.

The South facing rear garden is accessed from bi-fold doors from the kitchen diner and family room. With central island, the kitchen lends itself well to accommodating the young family and as an entertaining space. To the front of the house, there is a separate room utilised currently as a home treatment studio but would suit very well as home office, with an adjacent cloak. The stairs to the rear of the house access a shower room on the way up to the raised ground floor level.

The raised ground floor is home to a double through reception room. To the front of the house is a huge bay window with views out to the street. Behind is a further reception room, with doors overlooking a small roof terrace

The entrance hall leads up to a Study/Dressing Room on the half landing, then up to the first floor. A breathtaking master bathroom is to the rear of the house, with stand alone Victorian style bathtub, exposed brickwork and walk-in rainfall shower. The front bedroom boasts high ceilings and double windows overlooking the street, a feature fireplace and gorgeous handmade wooden shutters on the windows.

On the second floor are two further double bedrooms, and the final staircase leads to the suite on the top floor. There are floor to ceiling windows in this room with stunning views over the Juliet balcony South towards the City. With an en suite shower room, this floor is ideal for visitors, nannies or even lucky teenagers.

With an increased inclination to working from home for at least part of the week, or for the home based professional with family, this beautiful dwelling is sure to make a happy family home for decades to come. The home has full CCTV and adt house alarm.

Situation Kelvin Road is adjacent to Highbury Barn, which boasts an eclectic array of amenities. After a while, local residents become friends with the traders and workers on the Barn. Top quality meat can be sourced from Godfreys Butchers, and there are usually queues at all times of the day to get in Bournes Fishmongers. La Fromagerie is famous the world over for the cheese connoisseur. Mario's delicatessen offers a range of cold meats, and groceries to tantalise even the most demanding of palates.

There are also a couple of convenience stores, Lovells Greengrocer and people watching central at The Highness café. Highbury Fields is opposite with tennis courts and plenty of greenery. Piccadilly, Victoria and Overground lines are all within walking distance

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This bright flat is located on the first floor of a large Victorian terraced house on Northolme Road, N5 with high ceilings and a large bay reception window attracting plenty of natural light. The reception is open plan and well-proportioned to incorporate lounge seating and dining. The stylish kitchen has been fitted by the current owner maximising this area to create a fresh feel with good storage and preparation space. The master bedroom is really spacious with high celings, built in wardrobes and is located toward the rear with a trio of sash windows overlooking neighbouring gardens. The second bedroom also has high ceilings with built in storage where the adjacent bathroom has a contemporary feel.

Northolme Road, N5 is a sought-after address due to its obvious charm and appeal within the Sotheby Road conservation area, which helps preserve an idyllic residential tree lined street. Highbury Barn is nearby, offering an impressive variety of independent stores such as La Fromagerie, Godfreys, Bourne’s Fishmonger and Highbury Vintners. The nearest underground station is Arsenal (Piccadilly) which is only 10 mins walk away. Finsbury Park station (Victoria and Piccadilly) is a further 5 mins walk and also offers a national rail direct route to Moorgate in The City, which is only a 15 minute commute in four stops. There are a number of bus routes that may be taken south from Highbury Barn towards Highbury & Islington Station, Upper Street and Angel or northwards towards Arsenal station and Finsbury Park station.

The nearest open space is Clissold Park, which offers 56 acres of mature trees, lakes and tennis courts as well as the popular Clissold House offering a public cafe. The 1930s West Reservoir Centre red brick building is home to various water sports activities including canoeing, sailing and kayaking and also offers both a cafe and a wedding venue. New River Walk is just at your doorstep offering a welcome destination for walking or running and enjoying the terrific views of the parks and reservoirs. Highbury Fields is also a pleasant short walk and offers the largest green space in Islington, and also local leisure facilities such as local open-air tennis courts and a public swimming pool and gym.

*reception and dining furniture is CGI

address: Waterloo Gardens, Milner Square, London N1
detailedDescription:
Set over the first floor of this wonderfully central development is this first floor one bedroom flat with balcony and private gated parking.
The flat spans 518sqft and offers light filled and well-proportioned rooms throughout. The open plan living room and kitchen provides the most fantastic entertaining space and is flooded in natural light through floor to ceiling, sliding glass doors which lead onto a peaceful, west facing, private balcony. The double bedroom is a generous size and benefits from inbuilt storage whilst the family bathroom has been tiled throughout and offers overhead shower. The flat further benefits from private gated off street parking, secure entry and porter.

Waterloo Gardens is situated on Milner Square, one of Islington most prestigious garden square locations.
The property is just a short distance from a vast selection of restaurants, bars and shops on Upper Street as well as being withing striking distance from a number hugely popular gastro pubs. An array of brilliant transport links are on hand with a number of options for easy travel across London. Angel station (Northern line) and Highbury and Islington (Victoria line and overground) are both within easy reach whilst a large number of bus routes facilitate effortless access to the City and West End. St Pancras is also close by for convenient international transport links.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:

Occupying 617 Sq ft of living accommodation, this desirable apartment has a 16ft. X 14ft. Reception room with super light due to the south-west orientation of the window's, large kitchen and a modern bathroom suite with underfoot heating. The property also has access to boarded storage loft via a pull down ladder.

The development is situated off Green Lanes within close proximity to the nearby amenities in and around Finsbury Park, Highbury and Stoke Newington, with its vast array of local restaurants, gastro pubs and coffee shops. Nearest transport links are at Manor House and Finsbury Park with its underground and Over Ground Station (National Rail) with its links into the City and the West End.

address: Bartholomew Close, Farringdon, Barbican, London EC1A
detailedDescription:
An exceptional one bedroom apartment.

Location

Barts Square is a short walk from the heart of the City. It sits on a long-established route between the Smithfield Conservation Area and St Paul’s, linking London’s historic heart with its financial centre. With the arrival of Farringdon Crossrail
station in 2018 and planned regeneration around Smithfield Market, Barts Square is adding an exciting new chapter to one
of London’s oldest stories.

Description

An expansive one bedroom apartment with open plan reception room, luxury fully fitted kitchen, engineered oak flooring and ample storage. A large double bedroom with built in wardrobes and a modern bathroom with contrasting marble finishes. The bedroom opens out onto a large balcony with courtyard views.

Furnished to an exceptional standard the apartment offers top of the range appliances and consolidated controls for heating, cooling and lighting.

Residents of Abernethy House will have exclusive use of a range of on-site facilities including but not limited to five star 24 hour concierge service, private meeting room, cinema with lounge bar, and a resident's lounge.

Square Footage: 809 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 992 years remaining
