detailedDescription:
Full description A beautiful one bedroom garden flat, offered with vacant possession and no onward chain has come to the market offering a lucky buyer the opportunity to enjoy a City home just one street back from Highbury Fields.

Relatively few garden flats can boast direct access via the rear garden agte to the exclusive Highbury Terrace Mews, offering a sheltered and exclusive access up to the glorious open space of Highbury Fields. Larger than the average apartment, this dwelling is light, spacious and luxurious. The accommodation starts with access to a hallway with access to a reception room to the front, with window overlooking the front garden.

Behind this is the double bedroom with window over side return. A well designed bespoke shower room is in the mid section, and there is a separate w/c with character high level cistern. The kitchen diner overlooks the rear garden which is accessed through the back door

The rear garden is mature and low maintenance, extremely private, and gated at the rear

situation and tenure Battledean Road offers fantastic access to the Fields without being disturbed by the constant activity. Highbury & Islington station is within easy walking distance for Victorua and Overground lines. Drayton Park station nearby offers a 10 minute ride into Morrgate for the City worker.

There is a bewildering array of shops, boutiques and eateries to choose from. Cafes include Peche Mignon, The Highness, Pias among others. Waitrose Local is on Holloway Road, Tesco Express and other convenience stores are nearby. Godfreys Butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Marios deli and Bournes Fishmongers are on nearby Highbury Barn

This property enjoys a long leasehold

detailedDescription:
A bright fifth floor small style studio, known as a Type F1A, with full width windows facing west.

Situated on the 5th. Floor, this bright studio flat (known as a Type F1A) benefits from having floor to ceiling windows giving lots of light as well as access onto a west facing balcony/ fire exit looking towards Barbican towers and Cripplegate building.

On entering this studio flat, you have a kitchenette with the original stainless steel worktop with inset two ring hob, space for a fridge and washing machine and a range of cabinets. The bathroom has a full-sized bath with tiled walls and flooring, a low level w.c. And wash hand basin. The studio room has space for a double bed, wardrobe, sofa and a desk.

Both Barbican and Moorgate stations are within easy reach, and St’ Paul, Farringdon Station and Liverpool Street Station are within a short walk. The new Crossrail stations at Moorgate and Farringdon are opening next year which will reduce travel times to Canary Wharf to 8 min and Bond Street to 5min.

The wealth of local amenities and entertainment venues the City of London, Clerkenwell and Shoreditch has to offer are easily accessible including Waitrose, large M&S, the Barbican Arts Centre (with its concert & exhibition hall, cinemas and library), and local pubs and restaurants.

Exercise and fresh air at the door: Access to Barbican private resident garden and lake terrace, resident tennis court (small fee applies), 5min walk to Virgin Active gym with swimming pool, jacuzzi and Reformer Pilates studio, and nice running routes along the Thames and Regent’s Canal.<br /><br />

Lovely second floor apartment in the heart of Islington. The property is composed of a spacious open plan living/dining room, with adjacent kitchen. A large double bedroom with built in wardrobes and drawers, benefitting from French windows leading out onto a South-East facing balcony with beautiful morning sun and views to old street.

The carpet and wooden floors have recently been replaced and the kitchen was also modernised a few years ago. The size of the rooms means that there is desk space in both the living room and bedroom to enable working from home, with rapid internet connection.

The flat is in a secluded location with very little traffic noise, and is also just off Essex Road offering a wide variety of shops and eateries, whilst being a 5-minute walk to Upper Street or Islington Green. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description Located in a striking red brick mansion block close to the eclectic array of boutiques and eateries of Highbury Barn, this one bedroom flat offers convenient and reasonably priced living in a fantastic location.

During their ownership of the flat, the current occupier has made many improvements, creating a contemporary and efficient living space. There is a wirelessly controlled Nest heating system to the new combination boilers, and lots of thought has gone into maximising the storage and space on offer.

The kitchen boasts a Neff hide and slide oven for ease of access as well as a full suite of fitted white goods, all fitted by the current owner.

The architect who designed this block went on to design Islington Town Hall a few years later, so plenty of heritage in the building. A spacious double bedroom enjoys a Southerly orientation which complements nicely the dual aspect in the living room all contributing toward a light, bright, happy flat.

Situation and tenure Highbury Grange is in the heart of N5. There is a dazzling array of local shops on Highbury Barn, with world famous La Fromagerie cheese shop as well as Godfrey's butchers, Da Mario's deli and plenty of convenience stores.

The 19 bus goes from Highbury Grove, along with the 4,236 and 263 - offering excellent access to all areas of London. Victoria and Overground Lines are easily accessible via Highbury & Islington tube, and Piccadilly via Arsenal.

The property is held on a long leasehold and the service charge is £965.04 per annum, including ground rent

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
2,730 sq ft of lateral space in the rarely available Shepherdess Walk Buildings. A large 3 double bedroom modernised loft apartment on the third floor. Converted in the late 1990’s from an original Victorian Warehouse, this prominent building is known for the unique apartments located within.

Occupying a a prominent corner of the building, light streams in through the dual aspect original sash windows that run the entire length of both sides of the apartment. Measuring a vast 160 sqm the main living space is large enough to easily accommodate two dining areas, tv and sitting area. To one side is a modern, well proportioned kitchen complete with two walk-in pantries and a breakfast bar. The three bedrooms are located off a wide hallway; the master bedroom has a dressing room plus en-suite with twin sinks and each of the two other bedrooms have their own en-suite shower rooms. There is a guest WC, a utility room, built in wardrobes and plenty of storage space. There is also a second entrance providing access to Underwood Row.

The apartment was reconfigured circa 7 years ago by the award winning Architect Manuel Irsara of sirs. The combination of classic loft with modern fixtures & fittings blends seamlessly from the oak strip parquet to the original cast iron doors/pillars, to Lutron lighting, underfloor heating throughout and a fresh air filtration system.

Shepherdess Walk is close to Clerkenwell, Shoreditch & Islington with numerous transport connections nearby including Moorgate & Old Street tube stations plus an extensive bus network from City Road. You can walk along the canal to the Towpath Cafe or Broadway Market, or to the shops, cinema and theatre in Islington. Secure underground car parking spaces are available to rent on a long lease and/or purchase by separate negotiation.

Share of Freehold - 999 year lease from March 1996.

detailedDescription: An elegant 4 double bedroom bay fronted Victorian mid-terraced family home set on this no-through road within an ever popular quiet enclave close to the shops & amenities of Holloway Road. The house is packed full of original charm & character with many features remaining. Accommodation comprises 2 good size double bedrooms on the top (2nd) floor, with a shower room on the top half landing. On the 1st floor can be found the beautiful master bedroom to the front encompassing 2 elegant sash windows, double second bedroom to the rear, with the family bathroom located on the half landing. The ground floor is home to a fabulous through reception room encompassing the beautiful bay window with stunning timber reveals, exposed floor boards and ornate fireplace. Of particular note is the sheer volume & grandeur of the room with fabulous high ceilings combining with many of the wonderful original features. The kitchen is accessed off the reception room with doors opening to the private garden. Transport links are varied with Holloway Road Underground (Piccadilly Line through to the West End) and Highbury and Islington Station (Victoria Line and London Overground) within easy reach. Nearby Drayton Park Station also provides fast trains to Old Street and Moorgate. There are many local amenities within easy reach including Waitrose and Marks & Spencer. Upper Street's many shops and bars are nearby, as is Highbury Fields, the largest open green space in the borough.

detailedDescription:
Full description This stunning upper maisonette is offered for sale with no onward chain, moments from Highbury Barn

Stairs lead from the front door of this impressive red brick Victorian conversion to first floor access to this dwelling. There is a large reception room with bay window to the front of the property with lovely views over the character dwellings of this quiet residential road. Next to this is a separate and fully fitted kitchen which is a lovely space for the chef to rustle up an amazing meal using products bought from the eclectic array of shops on the Barn.

The large hallway is flooded with light and space and takes you to the upper floor which consists of two double bedrooms and bathroom with a huge amount of storage. There is sole access to a roof terrace demised to the Freehold but used solely by the owners. This space has great potential with beautiful sunset views.

This charming period duplex apartment is presented in excellent decorative order throughout and would make a fantastic home for City working professionals

situation and tenure Roseleigh Avenue is a peaceful residential street close to Highbury Barn and Highbury Fields. Highbury Barn offers an exclusive array of boutiques and delis including Godfreys Butcher, Bournes Fishmonger, Da Mario delicatessen and La Fromagerie as well as a few convenience stores/ newsagents. Highbury Fields are moments away, and there is good access to public transport links. Highbury & Islington station offers Victoria and Overground Lines, Arsenal tube for Piccadilly line, and Drayton Park station has direct trains to Moorgate in 10 minutes

This property benefits from a Share of the Freehold and the maintenance costs are split between the three flats.

detailedDescription:
Located on a quiet cobbled street and rarely available to the market this chain free stylish one-bedroom end of terrace modern build house offers every modern convenience.

Much loved and cared for by the present owners, features include a spacious dual aspect open plan reception space with attractive oak parquet flooring and a minimalist white gloss kitchen offered with integrated high specification appliances.
The upper level is accessed via an attractive oak staircase with complementary glass balustrade.

A large double bedroom with a pretty Juliet balcony creates a calm relaxing space further enhanced with a complete wall of bespoke storage. A pull-down ladder provides access into the loft space which offers useful additional ample storage. The spa-like bathroom next door is complete with walk-in double shower, large vanity unit, mirror demister and underfloor heating.

Intelligent Home controls with integrated music system, lighting and heating control all operated via smartphone or tablet. Externally there is an allocated parking space close to the front door, making everyday life a little easier.
Nestled between Stroud Green, Crouch End & Holloway a wonderful selection of local bars, restaurants and shopping amenities are all close by. Finsbury Park (Victoria & Piccadilly lines) and Archway (Northern line are all easily accessible. Wray Crescent, Finsbury Park and the Parklane Walk provide green and pleasant open spaces for the more active among us.

A stunning one bedroom raised ground floor apartment set in an imposing period house. This bright luxury apartment offers a sizeable open plan reception room and kitchen with high ceilings, a bedroom with huge sash windows and built in storage space. Contemporary bathrooms and communal gardens.

Features include solid wooden flooring, character features including fireplace and sash windows.

Located in the desirable Barnsbury area of Islington, the property is just a short walk away from Highbury and Islington underground and the shops, cafes and restaurants of Upper Street.

detailedDescription:
Unique and beautifully presented one bedroom flat on a sought after residential road in the heart of Finsbury Park.

The large reception room is one of the main draws to the property with a stunning bay window flooding the space with natural light.

The high ceilings offers a great sense of space and with ample room for a dinning table making it ideal to relax and entertain.

The separate kitchen has plenty of work surfaces and is fully integrated with all your everyday mod cons.

The bathroom is well proportioned for the size of the property and has a separate WC which is great for guests.

The bedroom is a good size offering space for wardrobes and chest of draws.

There are two storage cupboards in the hallway for all your large personal items.

The property is secured with a private gate and there is a large communal garden.

The property is in excellent condition throughout.

Location:

Queens Drive is a tree-lined residential road located between Finsbury Park and Clissold Park.

Also, conveniently located between Stroud Green and Highbury Park with several award-winning bars and restaurants.

For other activities, there is Rowans Ten Pin Bowling and The Park Theatre.

Blackstock Road and Seven Sisters Road are closest to your everyday amenities and supermarkets.

The soon to be finished City North development will further benefit the area with a GymBox, Cineworld and Marks & Spencer.

Transport:

Finsbury Park Underground on the Victoria and Piccadilly Lines and National Rail Station offers quick routes to Central London, the West End and beyond. Ideal for first-time buyers, those looking to both upsize and downsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended​.

detailedDescription: A bright and spacious 2 double bedroom ground floor garden flat in a small, modern and secure, private purpose built block, offering excellent access to all the amenities of Dalston Junction & Newington Green. The property comprises 2 double bedrooms, a large and bright open plan kitchen/reception room with access to a patio, family bathroom suite and a well maintained private garden. The property further benefits from having a private car park offering first come, first served off street parking for one car. King Henry's Walk is conveniently located for access to the trains at both Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction, which forms part of the London Overground network, whilst a plethora of shops, bars and restaurants can be found locally on Newington Green and on Southgate Road, such as the renowned De Beauvoir Deli. For those wishing to travel by bus, Kingsland Road and Southgate Road provide a number of good routes, with the delights of vibrant, trendy Hoxton and Shoreditch just a short journey away, as are the National Rail and Victoria Line trains of Highbury & Islington.

detailedDescription:
An immaculate two bedroom maisonette with garden.

Location

Arlington way is a small side street in the Northern section of Clerkenwell. It's just East of Myddelton Square and connects Rosebery Avenue and St. John Street. There road is a mixture of small independent retailers and residential units.

Arlington Way is approximately 330 yards from Angel Station and approximately 0.7miles from both King Cross and Farringdon Stations.

Hugh Myddelton Primary school and the Elizabeth Garrett Anderson School are both in very close proximity and are very highly regarded.

Description

An immaculate two bedroom maisonette with garden in a picturesque turning in Clerkenwell.

Forming the upper part of a Georgian Grade II terrace, a mixture of residential and small retail units.

A private entrance from the street leads through to a rear garden. The first floor reception room has generous ceiling heights and two large sash windows making for a bright and inviting living space. The kitchen/diner to the rear of the first floor has the same high ceilings and has views toward the rear garden. The upper floor is home to the principal bedroom suite, bathroom and second bedroom/study.

Square Footage: 731 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 97 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Set on top of the City Approach building on City Road this collection of 4 unique penthouse apartments offering a rare opportunity to secure a spacious home with far reaching views and plenty of outside space.

City Road has fast become the epicentre for high end residential homes in East London and with a number of well regarded developments having sculpted the Skyline here and its not difficult to see why.

Benefitting from close proximity to the City of London and Old Street, which earnt its reputation as the "Silicon Roundabout", the area is perfectly situated between Shoreditch, Clerkenwell and Islington providing something for everyone. From nightlife and restaurants to shopping, along with the green spaces at Shoreditch Park and the Canal walkways that reach from Victoria Park to Kings Cross and Regents Park.

*Images shown are of a finished penthouse (unit 37) but only indicative of the overall development.

detailedDescription: Guide Price £700,000 - £725,000. A stunning, two double bedroom garden flat on sought-after Lucerne Road, in the heart of Highbury. Located on the lower floor of a red-brick Victorian building on an intimate street a short distance from Highbury Barn. Comprising two spacious double bedrooms, both are well proportioned, and finished in a bright, neutral tone. The vendor&rsquo;s keen eye for interior design is subtly promoted throughout the property; clean lines, and delicate tones underpin a careful management of sought-after period features and contemporary interior accents. The shower room is a sleek, slate tiled suite at the centre of the home. The rainfall shower and elegant glass screen are tastefully features, matched by a heated towel rail and large washbasin. There is a second WC, recently installed. The open plan living room is a spacious, modern environment. The kitchen is separated by a screen wall, which helps form a small dining area, too. Benefiting from overhead and knee-level storage which compliments the expansive, hard wood worktops. The living and kitchen space includes hard flooring throughout. The garden is landscaped, and in addition to the tiled patio, a bespoke drip irrigation system keeps the flora green. A hidden rear patio is perfect for catching the morning sun, too.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful maisonette situated within an appealing exposed brick building is found in a prime N1 location. The end of terrace property boasts an excess 578 sq. Ft and has been meticulously designed from double glazed sash windows to high end materials. The property is well positioned on the doorstep of Upper Street, a hub of restaurants, shops, theatres and cinemas. Transport links could not be any closer with Angel, Essex Road and Highbury & Islington stations within walking distance.

The Property

The spacious open plan kitchen/reception is fitted with shelving units which have built in motion sensor lights and have large, double-glazed sash windows that have a fantastic rear aspect.
The reception and kitchen spaces are divided by a lovely breakfast diner. The fully integrated kitchen is equipped with a fridge/freezer, electric hob, oven and even a dishwasher.

On the second floor, is the sizeable double bedroom which is large enough to accommodate bedroom furniture and already has a massive free-standing wardrobe which is tailored with automated lights.

The Bathroom is fitted with a panel bathtub, a rainfall shower head, a large mirror and hand wash basin with vanity storage. You also have the washing machine inside the bathroom.
Next to the bathroom is the utility closet perfect for storing household items. This property definitely does not fall short of storage space as you also have direct access to the property’s loft space.

Another highlight of this property is the newly fitted boiler and not to mention the property also has a fully installed Nest heating system.

The Location

The property is positioned between major transport links such as Essex Road Underground Station (Great Northern Line) and Angel Underground Station (Northern Line) taking you straight to Central London. Shoreditch is also within minutes’ walk away should you wish to stroll around and enjoy the views of Central London. This area is also abundant in green spaces all within arm’s reach such as Rotherfield Court Park, Rosemary Gardens, Morton Road Park and many more.

Call us at your earliest convenience to arrange a viewing. Immediate interest is expected.

‘Think…Property Inc!’

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Unique and beautifully appointed two bedroom Victorian property with accommodation over three floors - formally a cobbler's shop - enviably located in a highly sought after location close to the Angel in the heart of Islington. The property has been lovingly refurbished and finished to an exacting standard, with wonderful period features, sympathetically updated, including high ceilings to the entrance floor, large sash windows, original tiled flooring with under-floor heating to the lower level, cast iron feature fireplace, bespoke inbuilt storage, and feature spiral staircase. The property also boasts a delightful secluded and a small enclosed patio area to the rear.

Accommodation comprises entrance leading into the bright and spacious open plan reception/kitchen with very large front aspect windows, further sash window to the rear with Victorian panel surround, wood flooring and cast iron fireplace with white marble surround. The kitchen area comprises a range of base and drawer units with granite work surface area, under-counter sink unit, gas hob, and integrated fridge and dishwasher. A beautiful spiral staircase leads both up and down to the upper and lower levels. To the first floor, there is a large open plan bedroom with bespoke inbuilt shelving, two front aspect sash windows overlooking a flat roof area, and Victorian style free-standing bath. The lower level, with exposed wooden beams and Victorian tiled flooring with under-floor heating, comprises a further open plan bedroom with bespoke inbuilt storage and shelving space, along with Victorian style wet room with brass fittings and heated towel rail.

The property is superbly located within a short walk of Angel station, a host of bus routes, and an array of shops, bars, restaurants and amenities.

Lease Information

We understand the lease is 125 years from 19 June 1998 and there is also a share of the freehold.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Available to view 7 days A week

Victorstone are delighted to market this modern share of freehold 1-bedroom apartment set within a luxury riverside development in the ever-popular Hoxton, N1.

The residents have purchased the freehold and formed a right to manage company. This once leasehold apartment is now offered as a share of freehold with 991 years remaining on the lease. The new development mandatory building insurance is valid until 2023 and the building has a valid EWS1 certificate (available on request) offering further peace of mind to any would-be buyers.

The development is in a peaceful spot next to Regent's Canal and only moments away from bustling Hoxton Street and the numerous bars and restaurants that’s pepper the nearby Kingsland Road. Excellently located for public transport, the apartment is located only a short walk from Haggerston Station (London Overground) and the nearby Kingsland Road (A10) providing swift and easy access to the City, Canary Wharf and Central London.

Situated on the first floor and accessed via a lift the apartment boasts secure and tranquil surroundings. The apartment briefly comprises; Spacious open-plan reception/ kitchen area featuring soft-close cabinetry and integrated Siemens appliances, a large family bathroom, and a generously proportioned master bedroom with built-in wardrobes. Both bedroom and reception lead on to a private patio terrace. Finished to an impeccable standard, with excellent attention to detail throughout, further benefits include underfloor heating, hardwood flooring, spotlighting and floor to ceiling windows in the living space.

The building further features a secure entry system, bike store and lift access.

Offered to market chain free and sold with vacant possession this could make for an excellent first purchase or investment property alike.

detailedDescription:

The L shaped kitchen is fitted with a plethora of fresh white, touch close cabinets enveloping the integrated oven and hob, chrome sink area and granite effect worktops. Space to lounge and dine awaits to your left, with room for both styles of furniture. Next door resides the double bedroom, awash with the same fresh white decor and views out to neighbouring gardens via shuttered window above the radiator. The bathroom can be accessed as an en suite from the bedroom, or from the hallway, featuring enclosed shower, WC and sink area in crisp whites and chromes. This one bedroom apartment is an ideal blank canvas for those looking to assert their style stamp in the buzz of inner North London, moments from outdoor green spaces.

Enviably located just 0.5 miles from Finsbury Park Station, you are within walking distance of excellent transport links and direct access to East or Central London. address: Thorpedale Road, Finsbury Park, London N4
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?
We fell in love with the Period touches and double glazed sash windows in the bright and airy living space the moment we walked through the door. With all-day sunshine and a lovely view of the park, relaxing in the front room is a dream. We love cooking in an open-plan setting, meaning we can prepare meals while catching up with friends. Having two good sized bedrooms has meant we can have guests at the drop of a hat while also having ample space for home-working, something that's been essential recently. We also love our comfy bedroom which benefits from two windows for fresh air in the summer and soft morning light. Abundant storage in the loft and floor to ceiling cupboards is another plus in a relatively small footprint meaning we never feel cramped and can keep the place neat and tidy. Finally, the park is our giant front garden where we've enjoyed BBQs, strolls, sun bathing and of course, the outdoor gym.

Why are you moving?
Having just got married, we are now looking to grow our family so we're looking for our forever home nearer to the sea.

What do you love about the area?
We've both lived in all four compass points within London but the Finsbury Park and Stroud Green area is where we most feel at home. The tube station provides quick and easy access to both major London airports in under an hour and the West End or City is 30 minutes door to door. Stroud Green Road has our favourite shops and restaurants, from Mustpha at Green and Glory to the guys at Deli at 80, micro-brews at The Brave Sir Robin and the tastiest coffee and cake at Big Jo, we have everything we need right on our doorstep. We are also extremely close to a lot of unspoilt nature in the Parkland Walk, Highbury and Queens Wood and the expansive views from both Alexandra Palace and Parliament Hill, all within walking distance. In addition, we have been able to take part in growing the community garden which is literally opposite our front door, bringing us closer to the community and making new friends. It's been our fabulous home for four and a half years and it will be with a heavy heart when the time comes to say goodbye.

Property Details:
Accommodation comprises entrance hall with two inbuilt storage cupboards, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with ample space for both relaxing and dining, and flooded with natural light from dual windows overlooking Wray Crescent Park. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized double bedrooms, with dual aspect windows to the master, plus a stylish shower room with modern suite and elegant tiling.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of stations at Crouch Hill, Archway and Upper Holloway, as well as regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. Finsbury Park station is also within a short distance for excellent additional connections. Crouch End Broadway is within walking distance, offering an array of shops, cafes and boutique shops, with further amenities available on Holloway Road, just a short distance away. The lovely open spaces of Elthorne Park, Highbury/Queen's Woods and the Parkland Walk are also close-by, with Finsbury Park itself within easy reach.

Viewings are highly recommended.

A beautifully presented three double bedroom split-level maisonette in a sought-after location. Accommodation comprises; a fabulous 30ft living room which leads on to a modern fully fitted kitchen, two private patio gardens, three double bedrooms, family bathroom, and en-suite bathroom.

Arlington Avenue is one of the Arlington conservation areas quieter and most sought after roads as there is no access via New North Road, and is situated at the south side of the greenery of Arlington Square. The many amenities of Islington Green are a short walk away, as well as a plethora of transportation links encompassing many bus routes to the City and West End, whilst Essex Road British Rail connection is close by, whilst Angel underground can also be found locally.

Stamp duty holiday extension - Continue your search for the perfect property with JLL and benefit from the same incredible stamp duty savings previously offered by the government, up to £15,000.
A 425 sq ft studio apartment in The Makers, Shoreditch. The open-plan living area has been finished with engineered oak flooring and the kitchen offers integrated appliances by Siemens and Bosch. The sophisticated bathroom design includes heated towel rails, porcelain tiles, bespoke cabinets and statement black fittings that set them apart from the norm.

The Makers is a new residential development comprising studio, one, two and three-bedroom apartments for sale in Shoreditch. The Makers is just four minutes’ walk from Old Street station (Silicon Roundabout) and less than a 20-minute walk from Angel Islington station and Liverpool Street station. Access to the rest of the City, West End and Canary Wharf can all be achieved within 30 minutes.

The vibrancy and dynamism of Shoreditch, the countless restaurants, bars and private member’s clubs, and its proximity to Islington, Clerkenwell, Barbican and the City, make the area an exciting place to live.

Residents of The Makers will enjoy a 24-hour concierge service, private screening room, residents’ lounge and library, well-equipped gym and two impressive roof gardens.

Enquire now to book your appointment at The Makers marketing suite.

detailedDescription:
Description

For sale by conditional sale Guide Price £30,000+ Houseboat and Secure & Private Mooring in Wenlock Basin, Islington, the pair can be purchased together or separately.

The mooring has a Guide price of £30,000+

The House Boat has a Guide Price £45,000+

Please note the pair can either be purchased together or separately.

Built in 2005, Engine Vetus 3.09,25hp Diesel with techno drive gearbox. Foredeck with hatch to water tankard half glazed, wooden doors leading to living area. Solid fuel stove and TV cabinet, walk through fully fitted gallery, privacy door to cross over bathroom with half bath and shower.

Full description
The houseboat including secure and private mooring in prime spot on Wenlock Basin, Islington with spectacular views from the deck up and down the Regent's canal, with neighbouring bird life, from the coot's nest just off the bow, to the passing swans, cormorants and grey herons.

Wenlock Basin is gated and secure with private mooring situated close to Angel tube station, Upper Street, Islington Green and Old Street. Landscaped trees, bushes and plants run the entire length of its wooden jetty with good sized areas for socialising with benches and tables all along. A social area at the entrance to the mooring is especially large, situated under trees right next to the canal it is perfect for alfresco dinning and barbecues. Each mooring is provided with a separately metered shore power, from this your water, electricity and a telephone/Wi-Fi can be accessed.

Bedroom 1

Double bed, with hanging wardrobe and overhead storage

Bathroom

Privacy door to cross over the bathroom

Lounge

Open through layout, kitchen area and single seating area which doubles up as the second bedroom with a single bed. Walk through access to the outdoor viewing area.

Garden

Secure & Private Mooring

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented two double bedroom new build flat with view over the Kingsland Basin, in the heart of Haggerston.

The open plan reception room with floor to ceiling windows, with access to the balcony that spans the whole width of the flat, is one of the main draws to the property.

The flow between the kitchen and reception room works perfectly and makes it a great space to relax and entertain with ample space for dining table.

The kitchen is fully integrated with all your everyday mod cons further adding to the enjoyment of living in the property.

Both bedrooms are good size double bedrooms with the master bedroom further benefiting from built in wardrobes and an ensuite bathroom.

The family bathroom is well proportioned for the size of the property, has a full length bath and excellent storage.

In the hallway there are two additional storage cupboards and with separate utility area.

The property is in excellent condition throughout.

Location;

Reliance Wharf is located on the Regents Canal and in the heart of De Beauvoir Town. Southgate Road has an array of independent cafés, local shops, and an excellent deli.

Hoxton Street and Kingsland Road are ideal for your groceries and everyday shopping.

Shoreditch, Essex Road and Upper Street are close-by offering a selection of award-winning bars and restaurants.

Transport;

Haggerston Overground Station is your nearest station.

There are also many bus routes on both Kingsland Road and Balls Pond Road, offering great access to the City and West End.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

The property has approximately 1290 sq ft of accommodation including an 18ft reception room with Juliet balcony over looking the garden, luxury kitchen and a charming wooden staircase and benefits from an entry phone system to enter the mews, gas central heating, double glazed windows and beautifully maintained interior. The rear courtyard garden offers a calm and private outside space, the property has an integral garage and parking is available within the mews.

Mews house in Private gated development
Design by Architect and Broadcaster maxwell hutchinson
Two/three bedrooms (one could double as a reception room)
Integral garage
First floor reception with Juliet balcony
Arsenal and Drayton Park Stations within 0.5 miles

detailedDescription: A converted upper maisonette set over the first and second floors of this late Georgian property. The first floor has tall ceilings and windows to the front which enhances the feeling of space and light. To the rear is a fabulous eat in fitted kitchen/ breakfast room to take in the morning sun. The top floor has two spacious double bedrooms with master bedroom set across the front elevation. The bathroom has been modernised to a very high standard with contemporary finishings. The garden is set to the front and approx. 26' in length. The property itself is spacious and well proportioned. The ceiling heights just enhance the space and light. The kitchen units are bespoke and the main door has a dual function which has an architectural flair, this is a fabulous room. The transport is great with rapid and regular bus routes into the City, whilst King's Cross and St Pancras Stations are very close by. Caledonian Road is a good shopping hub for day to day needs. Upper Street and Angel are a little further but also close by. This property could be available to buy by the end of June to help with the Stamp Duty holiday.

detailedDescription:
A split-level duplex apartment with a fantastic roof terrace, just five minutes from central Islington and Angel tube station.

This apartment is one of just two in this Georgian terraced property, sympathetically renovated to retain much of the historic charm and original features alongside the comforts and conveniences of modern living. Exposed brick walls, double-glazed sash windows and engineered wood floors are complemented by a contemporary fitted kitchen, en suite bathroom, and video entry system. Both floors are east-west dual aspect and the apartment has been skilfully designed to exploit the wonderful levels of natural light.

The second-floor main living space has direct access to the vast terrace at the rear of the apartment. The terrace is quiet and triple aspect so benefits from all day sun for much of the year. The stairs and half landing to the top floor offer additional storage space, whilst the large top floor bedroom has high ceilings and great views.

Penton Street is set amidst a charming mix of local independent shops and cafes, with the popular Chapel Market nearby. Islington and Clerkenwell have an eclectic mix of boutiques, high-end fashion and interiors stores and numerous bars and restaurants. There are many garden squares and small parks nearby, and the Regent’s Canal towpath provides an easy pedestrian and cycle route to Regent’s Park, a green oasis with numerous facilities and attractions.

Less than a mile from King’s Cross, the apartment is perfectly located to offer excellent access to the City and West End on foot, by bike or via public transport.

detailedDescription:
This beautiful one-bedroom flat has been tastefully decorated by the current owners to create a light and smart interior. The open-plan reception is a good size to incorporate comfortable lounge seating, coffee table and dining table with large casement windows and access to a spacious balcony. A crisp white kitchen is set back against the rear wall offering good storage and preparation space. The roomy bedroom is flooded with natural light and also has direct access to the balcony. The bathroom has a fresh look with bath and shower and fantastic dressing room style lighting with under sink storage. A separate utility ‘room’ is a welcome addition to this flat offering increase functionality as some residents in the block have used this space as a home office.

Sturmer Way, N7 is a local authority building designed Sir Basil Spence in the 1970’s which extends the length of Stock Orchard Crescent, N7 and offers easy access to amenities such as Waitrose or Odeon Lux on Holloway Road, N7. The nearest station is Caledonian Road underground station which is only 5 mins walk, where you will also find additional shops, cafes and smaller supermarkets. Buses are plentiful from Caledonian Road southbound towards Kings Cross, where buses to Camden can be 1taken from nearby Camden Road. An extensive array of cafes, restaurants, bars, shops and theatres are also with easy reach on fashionable Upper Street, N1 as are the green open spaces of Highbury Fields, N5.

detailedDescription:
This fantastic two-bedroom apartment is positioned on the second floor of a former Jewellers’ warehouse in the heart of Clerkenwell, a short walk from Shoreditch and Exmouth Market.

Built in 1933, the building’s street-facing facade exhibits a smart, post-industrial profile of red-brick, punctuated by large sections of glazing, across four storeys. The internal aesthetic of the apartment wears the hallmarks of warehouse living in a clean and understated style.

The plan is configured around a large open-plan living space, bathed in natural light by south-facing Crittal windows. A contemporary kitchen with breakfast bar was added last year and is positioned to one side of the adjoining dining area, which in turn, flows out into the living room. These spaces have wooden floorboards underfoot and high ceilings.

A pair of glazed doors separate these living quarters from the sleeping accommodation. Both double bedrooms are generously proportioned and have large Crittal windows overlooking St Paul’s in the distance and the grounds of the Charterhouse Building in the foreground; a peaceful enclave established in 1348, which has been used variously as a monastery, private mansion and now as almshouses. There are two bathrooms, one bath and one shower room, positioned at the far end of the plan.

Clerkenwell Road runs laterally, from Old Street west towards Bloomsbury in Central London. Popular with architects and design-studios, the neighbourhood is renowned for the quality and variety of its bars, pubs and restaurants, most notably the nearby St. John and Luca. Exmouth Market, Covent Garden and Soho, are all within walking distance and offer excellent further choices for shopping and eating.

The Barbican Centre, with its world-class cultural programme of cinema, music, theatre, talks and exhibitions, is a few minutes’ walk from the apartment.

Farringdon station (Circle, Metropolitan and Hammersmith & City lines and National Rail) is approximately seven minutes’ walk from the apartment and provides quick access to the West End and London’s major airports. Farringdon Station will also benefit from the opening of Crossrail including a direct route to Heathrow Airport.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 976 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £2,500 per annum
Council Tax Band: F

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Smartly presented two double bedroom purpose built flat, set within a popular development in an enviable location just a short walk from Archway and Upper Holloway stations. The property has been beautifully appointed by the current owners, providing light and spacious, well planned accommodation with stylish interiors and high quality finish throughout. Features include a stunning open plan reception/fitted kitchen, elegant metro-tiled shower room, gas central heating, double glazing, and quality floor coverings.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with attractive feature fireplace, wood effect flooring, and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized bedrooms, each with carpeted flooring and space for free-standing furniture, plus a stylish shower room with walk-in shower suite and elegant metro-tiling.

The property is enviably located within walking distance of Archway and Upper Holloway stations, as well as, slightly further afield, Finsbury Park mainline station. Numerous regular bus routes also provide excellent connections to the surrounding area. There are a variety of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants within a short distance on Holloway Road, as well as the beautiful open spaces of Waterlow Park and Hampstead Heath within easy reach.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 89 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is circa £2,400 per annum (including £1,000 sinking fund contribution), with ground rent of £250 per annum. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Beautiful Georgian house in the heart of the Angel but very quiet location.

Location

This house is so well placed for all the amenities in central Islington. Colebrooke Row sits just behind Camden Passage moments from The Angel with its extensive shopping and restaurants. Additionally the excellent transport links provide easy access to the City, West End and beyond. Colebrooke Row is extremely central yet in a quiet, largely residential street.

Description

This wonderful Georgian house is perfectly located in the heart of Islington but set on a very quiet part of Colebrooke Row. The accommodation is very flexible throughout. The principle bedroom with en suite and dressing room is on the second floor with two further bedrooms and bathroom on the first floor. On the ground floor is the reception room with period fireplace and original floorboards. There is a further bedroom to the rear on this level.

The beautifully finished kitchen with stunning Aga cooker and dining room are on the lower ground floor along with a very useful separate utility room and guest cloakroom.

The East facing town garden is accessed through the kitchen.

This house is offered chain free.

detailedDescription:
This outstanding two bedroom, two bathroom garden flat is located in a small modern block of flat located in East Canonbury. The property benefits from its own front door and offers well-proportioned rooms throughout and wrap around front and rear private garden.
The internal accommodation spans in excess of 700sqft and comprises of two even sized double bedrooms, both of which benefit from inbuilt storage and master further offering private ensuite shower room. A further family sized bathroom is located in the hallway alongside a useful storage cupboard. The open plan living room kitchen offers a most wonderful entertaining space and provides direct access to the private garden.

Canonbury Apartments is located on the corner of Ecclesbourne road and New North road. Transport to the City and Canary Wharf is easily facilitated by the overground services from Essex Road and various bus routes along New North Road, whilst frequent buses on Essex Road provide easy access to the West End. Upper Street, with its famous boutique shops, restaurants and bars, and Shoreditch with its selection of galleries, independent retailers, bars and eateries, are a short distance away.

address: Residence Tower, Woodberry Down, London N4
detailedDescription:
A luxury (662 sq ft) two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located on the 2nd floor with balcony overlooking the garden and west reservoir (water views) in Residence Tower Woodberry Down N4.

This development offers benefit from a 24 hour concierge service, residents spa, gym and swimming pool. Manor House station on the Piccadilly line is a 6 minute walk from Woodberry Down.

North London’s Woodberry Down is a multi award winning regeneration scheme located in the London Borough of Hackney, only moments from Finsbury Park. Once complete it will feature over 5,500 new homes set in 64 across acres with 15 acres of parkland and an additional 42 acres of open water – the spectacular natural surroundings of two existing reservoirs (the Woodberry Wetlands Nature Reserve and a serene sailing lake).

Woodberry Down is conveniently located just 8 minutes walk to Manor House station (Piccadilly line) providing direct links to Kings Cross St Pancras (National Rail, Eurostar) in 20 minutes.

Leasehold: 999 years (from new)
Service charge : GBP2.56 psf pa
Ground rent: GBP300 pa
Developer: Berkeley Homes

Please contact our sales team to arrange a viewing or for further information.

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful one-bedroom flat has been recently refurbished to a high standard by the current owners, creating a bright and well-proportioned home. The luxurious bedroom is located towards the front of the building with duel sash windows attracting a lot of natural light and there is plenty of floor space for a wardrobes, chest of drawers and relaxed seating. The adjacent bathroom is fully tiled with attractive contemporary fittings and under sink storage, also with natural light and ventilation. The reception room is located towards the rear of the building with a central marble fire place and gas fire with wood flooring throughout. The current owners have generous lounge seating and the room currently has a large dining table which can comfortably seat six guests. The stylish kitchen has just been newly fitted, providing good storage and preparation space. The vault is accessed via the patio area, which has a number of possible uses for a new owner. The glorious communal garden is accessed via attractive patio steps and has East as well as South facing aspects.

Compton Terrace, N1 is a Grade II Listed Georgian Terrace originally built in the 1820's which looks out onto Compton Terrace Gardens. This enviable location also lays parallel with Upper Street, which offers a huge variety of cafes, restaurants, bars and cinemas all of which are within easy reach. Highbury Fields is also a short walk, offering the largest open space in Islington as well as open air tennis courts and a local indoor swimming pool.

Transport links are unrivalled with Highbury and Islington station just moments away (Victoria Line, National Rail & London Overground). Buses towards The City can be taken from Canonbury Road or from Upper Street towards Angel Station (Northern Line).

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantial, three-bedroom, three-bathroom, split level period conversion set across the second and third floor of this handsome Victorian building in N4. Standing at an impressive 1,171 sqft, the property has been cleverly extended by the current owners to make use of every square foot through whilst being presented in immaculate condition and décor including porcelain files, Farrow ad Ball wallpaper, Burlington toilet fixtures and remote-controlled blinds, not to mention the roof being replaced fully in 2021. After entering the first floor, the second floor offers a wonderfully bright, east facing open plan living room/kitchen featuring two larger windows facing the quiet road. The rear of the building on the second floor occupies two good sized bedrooms and two intelligently designed showerooms. Leading up to the third floor on the half landing is an accessible west facing private roof terrace benefitting from outdoor lights and a superb view across London and neighbouring gardens. The third (top floor) is home to the master bedroom, a beautifully finished en-suite bathroom, and an abundance of eaves storage.
The ever-popular Wilberforce Road allows for easy access to Finsbury Park and Arsenal stations as well as the green spaces of both Finsbury Park and Clissold Park. A variety of shops, cafes and eateries are located on Blackstock Road and nearby Highbury Park. Stoke Newington Church Street is also a short walk away through Clissold Park. The nearest public transport link is Finsbury Park Station (Victoria, Piccadilly and National Rail Lines) and Arsenal Underground Station (Piccadilly Line), whilst there are numerous bus routes taking you into Angel, the City and the West End.

After entering the first floor, the second floor offers a wonderfully bright, east facing open plan living room/kitchen featuring two larger windows facing the quiet road. Leading up to the third floor on the half landing is an accessible west facing private roof terrace benefitting from outdoor lights and a superb view across London and neighbouring gardens. The third (top floor) is home to the master bedroom, a beautifully finished en-suite bathroom, and an abundance of eaves storage.
The ever-popular Wilberforce Road allows for easy access to Finsbury Park and Arsenal stations as well as the green spaces of both Finsbury Park and Clissold Park. A variety of shops, cafes and eateries are located on Blackstock Road and nearby Highbury Park. Stoke Newington Church Street is also a short walk away through Clissold Park. The nearest public transport link is Finsbury Park Station (Victoria, Piccadilly and National Rail Lines) and Arsenal Underground Station (Piccadilly Line), whilst there are numerous bus routes taking you into Angel, the City and the West End.

address: Brecknock Road, Kentish Town, London N7
detailedDescription: A well-proportioned one bedroom apartment with beautiful high ceilings and two Juliet balconies, positioned a short walk from all local amenities. This bright and airy apartment is situated on the ground floor, to the rear of a characterful period residence and comprises a luxury open plan kitchen/reception room, generous double bedroom and a modern bathroom. Other benefits include hard wood flooring and ample storage. Brecknock Road has a blossoming village feel and is a hub for independent restaurants, family run delicatessens & shops whilst Camden Town is less than one mile away famous for its diverse markets, a warren of fashion & curiosities and a haven of counter culture offering an array of independent stores and iconic music venues. Alternatively a short and pleasant stroll down Regents Canal will lead you to the ever evolving Kings Cross where one can indulge in the delights of Granary Square which hosts a wide selection of stylish eateries, sleek bars, popular recreational squares & arts centres, this is also the location of the brand new offices for Google, Facebook, YouTube & The Guardian. For something less urban the green open spaces of Regents Park & breath-taking city scape views from Primrose Hill are just over one mile away. Kings Cross & St Pancras Stations (these stations are served by six underground lines and the Eurostar connecting you to local, national & international destinations) are 1.4 miles away, also there are several bus routes connecting you to London's West-End in under 20 minutes. Other transport links include Kentish Town (Northern Line & National Rail) 0.5 miles, Camden Road Station (Overground Line) 0.6 miles, Camden Town Station (Northern Line) 0.8 miles.

detailedDescription:
A sleek, bright and modern one double bedroom apartment for sale on the 3rd floor of this sought after red brick 1930's building on Lloyd Baker Street, minutes from Exmouth market, WC1X.

Handsomely remodelled by the current owner, this delightful home is well-proportioned and bathed in plenty of light via no less than eight sash windows. The dual aspect living space overlooks Granville Square and an attractive row of period properties along Lloyd Baker Street below, whilst a useful breakfast bar connects the rear of the room to a sizeable, open-plan kitchen offering plenty of scope for adaptation. The master bedroom itself, is a generous double and the tiled bathroom is finished to an equally high standard, offering shower above bath. The overall sense of this home is clean, tasteful and zen. Further benefits include double glazing, wood flooring and entry phone for controlled access. The property's spacious entrance hallway also contains three sizeable storage cupboards.

Riceyman House itself is one of several listed buildings that make up the Lloyd Baker Estate. It is situated just minutes from Exmouth Market, under ten minutes to Russell Square station and central Bloomsbury, whilst under 15 minutes in either direction to St Pancras International, Angel Islington and/or Farringdon Central.

With a long remaining lease and reasonable service charge this is an absolutely superb prospect for homebuyers and investors alike. Early viewings highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
This most immaculately presented two double bedroom, one bathroom modern apartment is enviably located in Hoxton Square. The property is set on the second floor with floor to ceiling windows which provide an incredible view of Hoxton Square and the Roman Catholic Church of St Monica's Priory.

Hoxton Square is at the centre of London’s most vibrant and creative hubs. Old Street, popularly known as Silicon Roundabout runs immediately to the west of the square and has become closely connected to the global digital industry. The square itself is well known to be one of East London’s most sociable locations.

Living in Hoxton Square means you're within a short walk of some of London’s liveliest and most eccentric shops and boutiques. It's one of the area's most desirable locations with a plethora of bars, shops and restaurants on your doorstep with central Shoreditch just moments away. Columbia Road with its famous flower market, Brick Lane and Spitalfields Market are also all close by. The Frog Hoxton restaurant in Hoxton Square by Adam Handling being a definite highlight. The former MasterChef finalist's innovative Modern British cooking served in a stylish, casual space is a must visit.

Transport links include Old Street (Northern Line and National Rail), Shoreditch (East London Line) and Liverpool Street (Central, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City and Circle lines and National Rail) stations with the City just moments away.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An imposing early Victorian semi-detached family home built in 1846 and offering an enviable amount of lateral space with near 4,000 sq ft across five floors. There are six bedrooms, four bathrooms, mud room, utility room, two reception rooms and an open plan kitchen and dining space. The property has been interior designed throughout yet sympathetically restored retaining period features to include ceiling roses, cornicing and fire places, particularly in the raised ground floor living and study areas. The lower ground floor showcases a bold Artichoke kitchen with stone worktops and built in Miele and Wolf appliances. This leads through to a dining area and in turn to an east facing near 65 ft landscaped rear garden with green house. There is side access for easy maintenance and potential to extend subject to the usual consents. The first floor is home to the principal suite with oak flooring, marble fireplace, ornate cornicing, bespoke wooden wardrobes and an en-suite featuring glass tiling, Cole and Sons wallpaper and rain shower. Five more bedrooms occupy the upper floors with a family bathroom showcasing double sink, free standing tub and walk in shower. The windows have been replaced and double glazed throughout and the bones and exterior of the house have been renovated to the same exacting standard as the interior. An unobstructed view at both ends of the property mean the space is flooded with natural light. There is also off street parking to the front of the property.

Situation
One of the most sought after locations in Islington. St Mary's Grove sits in the heart of the Canonbury Triangle and Canonbury Conservation Area, within 0.2 miles of Upper Street. Highbury and Islington and Canonbury Stations offers easy access across town and North Bridge House Senior Canonbury is within 0.1 miles.

detailedDescription:
Full description A splendid garden flat on the quieter section of Grosvenor Avenue, boasting generous accommodation and private garden.

This period conversion is accessed via its own front door, welcoming into a pleasant entrance lobby. Insulated from the rest of the flat, a door opens onto the entrance hall and gives access to the main living space. Accommodation comprises an open plan living/ dining room with lovely views over the rear garden and plenty of entertaining space, a separate kitchen with views again over the rear, and a big bedroom with ancillary home office/ study.

The bathroom has been recently renovated, and the building has been well maintained by the Freeholders who enjoy a productive relationship.

The property benefits from plentiful storage - including for bikes! - and is presented in good decorative order throughout.

Situation and tenure The section of Grosvenor Avenue is quieter than the stretch leading to Highbury Grove. Canonbury station is a few minutes' walk away which gives direct access to the City, and a 1 minute travel to Highbury & Islington station for Victoria and Overground services.

A great selection of local shops and cafes are nearby. Perennially popular Newington Fruit and Veg is always bustling, and newcomer Vins on the junction opposite The Snooty Fox offers a great space to enjoy fine wines, coffee and people watching. Clissold Park and Highbury Fields are both within walking distance, as is Islington's trendy Upper Street.

This apartment has a long leasehold and a share of the freehold. Maintenance costs are shared with the other flats in the conversion

A classic Clerkenwell lateral loft space.

Location

Berry Street runs between Great Sutton Street and Clerkenwell Road, in the heart of Clerkenwell and central to the amenities and transport links.

A classic lateral loft conversion in the heart of Clerkenwell.

The flat is approximately 1,234 square feet and occupies part of the second floor of this popular development.

detailedDescription:
A fabulous six bedroom Georgian house, which has been extended to offer wonderful family accommodation in the heart of Clerkenwell, moments from Farringdon station.

This deceptively spacious Grade II listed home spans approximately 3,235 sq. Ft, and is spread over five floors. Located on the highly sought-after Britton Street in the heart of Clerkenwell, this Freehold home offers superb family accommodation, looking over St. John's Gardens.

The lower floor offers a well appointed one bedroom self contained apartment. The raised ground floor boasts a bright and airy living space, which incorporates a spacious open plan kitchen/dining area to the rear of the house, whilst enjoying views over the park via a large floor to ceiling window. There is a glass lift situated in the centre of the house, which accesses the lower ground, ground and first floors, where an atrium opens out onto a large west-facing roof terrace.

Just a short walk from Cowcross Street, close to Smithfield Market and Farringdon Road, an excellent location for the surrounding transport links at Barbican, Farringdon and Chancery Lane. Farringdon Station and the surrounding area will undoubtedly benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail and retail development. With already existing fantastic transport links, Farringdon station will soon be the only station in London with direct lines to all London based airports making it arguably London's most sought after transport hub.
title: 6 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
Occupying the upper two floors of a handsome Victorian property is this wonderfully bright and airy two bedroom apartment with its own private roof terrace. This immaculately presented property has been lovingly maintained by the current owner to emphasise its original period charm and offers all of the features one would hope for such as high ceilings, cornicing and original fireplaces. On the first floor there is a magnificent light filled 15’11 x 12’6 reception room with two wooden sash windows, next door is the sleek and contemporary kitchen which offers plenty of dining space should one want. On a half level is a delightfully serene bathroom with a roll top bathtub and garden views. Upstairs on the top floor are two generously proportioned double bedrooms and a shower room. There is also a door out to a fantastic roof terrace which offers ample space to eat and relax.

Situation
Westbourne Road is very well located for all the facilities on Upper Street. Transport Links are at Highbury & Islington (Victoria and London Overground lines) and Caledonian Road (Picadilly line). Angel and Kings Cross St Pancras are also within easy reach.

detailedDescription: A well proportioned two double bedroom apartment with accommodation arranged over the raised and lower levels of an imposing Georgian building, benefitting from direct access to a communal garden, moments from Angel Underground. Accommodation is light filled and well balanced comprising; a semi open plan kitchen/reception room occupying the raised ground floor, with two double bedrooms and a bathroom suite on the lower level. There is also direct access from both the rear bedroom and half landing to a secluded communal garden. Barnsbury Roadis situated in leafy Barnsbury with its parks and squares, yet with easy access to Angel station (Northern Line); Highbury & Islington station (National Rail and Victoria Line) and the new Cycleway on Liverpool Road. The eateries and shops of Upper Street, Angel and Camden Passage are a short walk away, as are gastro pubs such as the Albion and the Drapers Arms. Waitrose, Sainsburys and M&S are also conveniently located nearby at the southern end of Liverpool Road. There is an excellent choice of cinemas and theatres on the doorstep. A stroll along the Regents Park Canal or one stop on the underground, takes you to Granary Square and Coal Drops Yard for more eating, shopping and entertainment opportunities as well as the Kings Cross/ St Pancras International transport hub for getting around London or travelling to Europe.

detailedDescription:
A very bright 5th floor, double aspect, two bedrooms apartment located in "Spenlow Apartments", part of the impressive Folio development completed in 2015.

This large flat is in excellent condition having been well maintained by the current owners and comprises of an entrance/corridor, a large kitchen/living area with floor to ceiling windows leading into a west facing balcony, a large master bedroom with ensuite and large built-in wardrobe, a double bedroom with again built-in wardrobe and spacious family bathroom.

The flat is provided also with under floor heating, Duravit sanitary ware, Siemens kitchen appliances and Deltalight lights fittings.

In addition residents of Spenlow Apartmemnts benefit from a concierge service and residents' gym.

The building is ideally located off City Road, close to the Regent's Canal footpath that leads towards Angel in one direction, and Victoria Park in the other and at the doorstep of "The City".

Shepherdess Walk Park is just few steps from the building’s entrance. The fashionable shops, bars and restaurants of Islington, Clerkenwell, Shoreditch and Hoxton are a short walk distance.

The nearest Underground station is at Old Street (Northern Line) and City Road provides excellent bus links to the City, the West End and north to St Pancras International with high speed rail connections to continental Europe.

detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire a rare, five storey, Grade II listed, Georgian family home in the heart of Barnsbury, beautifully redesigned, benefiting from an east facing rear garden and west facing roof terrace. Accommodation is well arranged and generously proportioned comprising; a fabulous double reception space on the raised ground floor, bathed in natural light courtesy of the large stained glass sash windows, high ceilings and dual aspect, a vast kitchen/dining room, leading to a snug/further reception on the lower level, which has been excavated to provide direct access to the lower level of the rear garden. There is access to the vaults on this level to the front, and further garden access on the upper half landing, leading to the manicured rear garden. The principal bedroom suite is housed on the first floor, with two further double bedrooms and a shower room on the second floor, and a double bedroom on the fifth floor, providing access to the roof terrace, which is incredibly hard to find in properties of this size and type within the location. This is an immaculate house that must be viewed to be appreciated. Liverpool Road sits right in the heart of Barnsbury, affording superb access to Angel Underground station (Northern Line), along with Highbury & Islington station (National Rail and Victoria Line trains). The buzz of Upper Street is only a short walk, alternatively the gastro pubs of the Albion and the Drapers Arms can be found locally within Barnsbury, with the supermarkets of Waitrose and Sainsburys located at the Southern end of Liverpool Road, close to Angel. Kings Cross/ St Pancras International is only 1 stop on the Underground, ideal for an evening out, getting around London or travelling to Europe.

detailedDescription:
30% Shared Ownership ** Offered with no onward chain and a long lease is a stunning two bedroom purpose built flat, boasting circa 650sq ft of internal floor space. Set within a sought after development located in Woodberry Down, a moments walk to Manor House underground and Stamford Hill station. This unusually spacious apartment offers exceptional contemporary living space and is beautifully presented throughout.

Location

Stoke Newington and Finsbury Park are both within a mile and offer a large choice of bars and restaurants. For transport Manor House tube station is very close and Finsbury Park is also close for further tube and train options. Journey times from Manor House; Kings Cross, 10 minutes, Covent Garden, 15 minutes, Piccadilly Circus, 20 minutes.

Lease Information

122 years remaining on lease. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries via a solicitor.

Features

Comprising of a stunning large reception room that boasts large double glazed windows and patio doors that stretch from floor to ceiling and lead out to a private balcony that offers elevated views of the local area. The open plan kitchen diner is equipped with modern fitted cabinetry offering ample storage, solid wood work surfaces and high-end integrated appliances. Both bedroom are well proportioned offering space for wardrobes. The stylish family bathroom boasts ceramic tiled walls and floor, white bathroom suite with chrome fittings.

Stoke Newington and Finsbury Park are only short walks away with a wide variety of restaurants, pubs and cafes and the wide-open green spaces of Clissold Park and Finsbury Park. Local transport links include Manor House Station (Piccadilly line, Zones 2 & 3) Finsbury Park station (Piccadilly and Victoria lines, Zone 2, National Rail / Thameslink) and Stamford Hill overground station.

Shared Ownership

The rent is £931.24, and the service charge is £221.25 per month. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own inquiries via a solicitor.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This light and airy, one bedroom apartment is ideal for those seeking a newly refurbished home in the heart of ever popular inner North London.

Residing along buzzing and community spirited Stroud Green Road, this one bedroom flat provides the perfect blank canvas for your personal design flair. Crisp white walls compliment grey tone laminate flooring throughout, while shuttered windows lend a flood of natural light into each room. Upon entry you’ll find the open plan kitchen and living area, on swathes of neutral tones and hosting the nice sized L shaped kitchen, decked with an abundance of gloss white cabinets, chrome fittings and integrated oven/hob. The open plan layout provides space for both lounge and dining furniture, with room to cook up a storm and entertain guests as lockdown eases. Next door lies the double bedroom, with the same fresh white decor and leafy views via the shuttered window above the radiator. Up a small flight of stairs to the mezzanine area you’ll find the bathroom, with full sized bath tub and overhead shower, WC and sink area in fresh white shades and chrome fittings. A skylight provides rooftop and starry views, fitted into the cosy sloping ceiling. This one bedroom apartment is an ideal blank canvas for those looking to assert their style stamp in the buzz of inner North London, moments from outdoor green spaces, and is offered chain free.

Located across the top floor, number 38 sits proudly on vibrant Stroud Green Road awash with award winning local eateries and independent retail. What’s more you are a mere 0.6 miles away from Finsbury Park Station with direct access to the City and East London.

address: Ockendon Road, East Canonbury, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire an impressive Victorian freehold property currently converted into two leasehold apartments. Located in a quiet child/cycling friendly, tree lined street (no through road for cars) with a village feel in the heart of East Canonbury Conservation Area, Islington. Accommodation is arranged over 3 floors and comprises; a generous 1 bedroom garden apartment benefitting from its own private entrance, high ceilings and good room proportions throughout. The master bedroom has integrated wardrobes, shutters and is situated at the front of the property, with the hallway leading to the spacious reception room, in turn leading to the bathroom suite and kitchen. It should be noted that the large and secluded, circa 44 ft private garden is accessed via the reception room. The upper maisonette is accessed via the raised ground floor and the main entrance of the house. Upon entering you are greeted with plenty of natural light, ornate cornicing and a vast entrance hallway leading to the impressive double reception space, which features high ceilings and further period detailing including cornicing, ceiling roses, original fireplace and large sash windows which provide a sunny dual aspect. The kitchen is situated on this level at the rear of the property. There are 2 generous double bedrooms on the top floor, as well as the family bathroom suite. Subject to necessary planning consents there is potential to extend to the rear of the property and also add an additional floor to increase the current footprint. The fortunate new owner will benefit from a real sense of community with the Ockendon Association arranging events such as coffee mornings, book clubs and rambling days out. There is an array of sought after local amenities which include the independent De-Beauvoir deli, Trade coffee store, Sweet Thursday pizza restaurant and De- Beauvoir pub all on Southgate Road. The property is conveniently located for access to Angel (Northern Line), Highbury and Islington (Victoria Line), Canonbury (Overground) and Essex Road (Great Northern) with Dalston, Old Street, Hoxton and Shoreditch all found locally. It should be of further note that there are direct bus routes to Kings Cross, Oxford Street, Piccadilly Circus, City of London, St Paul's, Covent Garden and London Bridge.

detailedDescription:
* virtual tour * - cash buyers only -

Fraser & Co are delighted to offer to the sales market this stunning two bedroom, two bathroom apartment within the prestigious development of Eagle Point.

This fantastic apartment is set on the 13th floor with East facing views from both bedrooms. Finished to the very highest standard with parquet wooden flooring throughout the living areas, this apartment offers the best of modern living whilst retaining the character of the Art-Deco building. Measuring approximately 908 sq. Ft. The open-plan living/kitchen area benefits from a separate built in storage cupboard, high end integrated appliances and exceptional furniture. Both double bedrooms benefit from built in storage with the master also comprising an en-suite bathroom. A separate, second bathroom is accessible from the hallway.

Eagle Point is both indulgent and sophisticated - from the 12-seater art-deco inspired screening room with facilities to the Spa that boasts not only the expected pool, sauna and steam room but also provides an experience shower and heater loungers. There is also a 24-hr concierge service as well as a residents’ gym.

Eagle Point could not be better placed in terms of transport - a short 5minute walk away finds you at Old Street station - providing both National Rail & Underground services.

The area provides much in the way of activities and amenities - from the boutique shops nearby in Old Street but also a host of restaurant and bars that provide a range of dining and entertaining experiences.

An immaculate one bedroom apartment in one of the areas best locations.

An immaculate one bedroom, third floor apartment in a desirable turning in Clerkenwell.
