detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?

The view is the best feature of the flat, and is what made me want to buy it when I first saw it. You can see the entire London skyline, from Canary Wharf, the City, the Shard, and all the way over the west of London—there can't be many flats in the area that have such a good view! The building has a communal lounge and roof terrace with a similar view which is great to use in the summer months as it gets sun all day. The flat is clean, bright, and modern which was another big selling point for me.

Why are you moving?

I'm moving in with my partner. And after living in Archway for five years, i'm keen to explore another part of London.

What do you love about the area?

The flat is in a great area. The walk to the tube station is less than a minute which means you can be in central London in no time. It's also only a 10 minute walk to Hampstead Heath and Highgate, so I spend most of my weekends walking around or finding nice spots to read. Archway itself is a great area, with multiple weekly markets and good independent restaurants & shops.

Property Details:

Set within a highly sought after modern development in the heart of Archway which was designed and built by Hawkins Brown architects. The property comprises; entrance leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with superb London skyline views and ample space for entertaining, relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and a range of integrated appliances. There is a well sized double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe, plus a stylish shower room with modern suite and elegant tiling.

The property is enviably located just a minute's walk from Archway station, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing unrivalled connections to the City, West End and the surrounding area. There are a variety of vibrant shops, bars and restaurants nearby, as well as the beautiful open spaces of Hampstead Heath and Waterlow Park within a short distance.

Ideal as either a first time or investment purchase, viewings of this beautiful apartment are highly recommended.

This lateral space comprises open-plan kitchen/dining area, separate reception, two large double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes, two bathrooms (one en-suite) and plenty of storage throughout.

The property is ideally located on Farringdon Road, adjacent to Farringdon Station, and will undoubtedly benefit from the forthcoming Crossrail and retail developments. It is also within walking distance of both the City and the West End.

Beautifully presented one bedroom second floor flat with private balcony, superbly located within a modern development in the heart of Hoxton, close to Old Street station and a host of vibrant amenities. The property boasts immaculately presented accommodation, stylishly appointed and well maintained throughout. Representing an ideal first time or investment purchase in this fantastic central location, the property further features an inviting open plan reception/quality fitted kitchen, brand new modern bathroom, ample inbuilt storage, district heating, double glazing and quality oak wood flooring. The development itself provides a secure environment with concierge services.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage and new quality oak wood flooring (evident through the property), leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful south facing private balcony and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a well sized double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe, plus a stylish brand new bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant metro tiling.

The property is enviably located within a short distance of Old Street, Hoxton and Angel stations, each providing excellent cross-London links, as well as numerous regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: A Grade II listed Georgian family home built in 1791 and located on one of the most sought after roads in Angel. Located on the raised pavement side of Duncan Terrace you are positioned moments from Camden Passage and the hustle and bustle of Islington yet enough removed to benefit from the tranquillity the Conservation Area provides. The property retains period features throughout but has been renovated to an exacting standard down to the bones across the near 3,000 sq ft of internal space. There are four double bedrooms arranged over five floors and the accommodation remains interchangeable. The ground floor boasts a through reception with wooden floors, fire place, intricate cornicing and sash windows, there is also a study on this floor with floor to ceiling glass overlooking the garden. The lower ground floor is a brilliant example of how the finish has been juxtaposed throughout with contemporary design and it features a Bulthaup kitchen complete with underfloor heating, family room and glass extension dining area leading to a landscaped west facing rear garden. The architect’s vision is evident from the rear with the triple storey glass extension taking centre stage. The favourable orientation coupled with the clever use of glass flood the entire house with natural light. The first floor has been retained as an impressive sitting room with treble sash windows, Juliet balconies, cornicing and fire place. This provides an option for a grand fifth bedroom. The second floor houses an impressive principal suite with en-suite bathroom finished in marble with a floating sink. The top floor bedroom has two roof terraces with enviable views of the London skyline.

detailedDescription:
An impressive Victorian family home built in 1860 adjacent to De Beauvoir Square. Arranged over four floors with an enviable amount of lateral space nearing 3,200 sq ft and offering four/five bedrooms and three bathrooms. The property has been renovated to an exacting standard throughout but retains period charm and numerous original features. It has been architecturally extended to the rear to create a full width double storey extension with air conditioning, floor to ceiling glass and bi folding doors opening out on to the garden, flooding the property with natural light and capitalizing on the east-west aspect. The raised ground floor boasts an L-shaped double through reception with sash windows, working shutters, high ceilings, coving and ceiling rose, dual fireplaces and wooden flooring. The lower ground floor is home to the bespoke kitchen and dining space leading to a landscaped garden set in York stone with composite decking, complete with summer house or optional additional gym/studio or work from home space. On the same floor is an additional soundproofed audio visual room which could easily be adapted to a guest or nanny’s bedroom. A utility room with double butler sinks and granite worktops and another bathroom complete this floor. The principal suite occupies the entire first floor with a beautifully selfish dressing room and limestone tiled Hansgrohe bathroom. The top floor offers three further bedrooms and additional walk in shower room.

Situation
De Beauvoir Town is nestled between the boroughs of Hackney and Islington, ideally situated for local amenities including the popular De Beauvoir Deli. The area has a cosmopolitan feel, promoting a community atmosphere. Transport links are plentiful including Essex Road (0.25 miles) and Hagerstown (0.4 miles).

address: Highbury Crescent, Highbury, Islington, London N5
detailedDescription: A beautifully presented 3 double bedroom lateral apartment set across this pair of attractive Grade II listed Georgian houses situated within the Highbury Fields conservation area and benefitting from a substantial communal garden. The property occupies a prominent position on the crescent, with the pair of houses fronting Highbury Fields. Accommodation comprises 3 good size double bedrooms, main family bathroom, separate wet room, 17ft X 15ft reception room, separate kitchen and a good size entrance hall with space for a study area. It should be noted that the apartment benefits from its own private entrance and access from 2 of the bedrooms out to the private patio. To the rear there is a substantial communal garden spreading across 2 pairs of houses. Situated towards the South West corner of Highbury Fields, Highbury Crescent sits within the Highbury Fields Conservation Area, offering superb access to the community focal point of the shops at Highbury Barn which includes Godfreys Butchers, La Fromagerie, Da'Mario Italian Delicatessen and a fishmongers, along with the greenery and amenities of Highbury Fields (gym, tennis courts, etc). Transport can be found locally at Highbury & Islington station (National Rail & Victoria Line), along with Arsenal Underground (Piccadilly Line) Canonbury Station (London Overground), with a number of bus routes running along Highbury Grove. The delights of Trullo & Prawn On The Lawn, by Highbury Corner, offer superb local dining.

Smartly presented two double bedroom fifth floor apartment set within a modern development enviably located between Old Street and Angel, next to the Wenlock Basin and Regent's Canal. detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

Superbly located in a Grade II listed building in the heart of King's Cross, this bright and spacious three bedroom apartment, offered to the market with no onward chain and boasting impressive London skyline views. The property has been well maintained and modernised by the current owner, providing light and spacious, well planned accommodation including a generous reception room, stylish dual aspect kitchen, and modern bathroom. Features include gas central heating, quality floor coverings and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing and dining, and door through to the separate kitchen. The kitchen, flooded with natural light from dual aspect windows, comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are three well sized bedrooms, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite.

The property is enviably located within just a few minutes' walk of Kings Cross St Pancras offering unrivalled cross-London, national and international rail links, as well as Angel station with further underground connections. This vibrant location provides a multitude of shops and amenities, with the Regent's Canal also close-by, and nearby Granary Square offering a further array of fashionable bars, restaurants and cafes.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

detailedDescription: A characterful, four storey, 3 double bedroom Victorian freehold, with an impressive, full height, top floor principal bedroom suite and granted planning permission (P2020/3511/ful), situated within the Arlington Conservation area. Accommodation is generously proportioned comprising; a light filled double reception room that occupies the raised ground floor and retains ornate period details, the spacious kitchen/dining room is housed on the lower level and provides access to the light well at the front, and patio to the rear. There is a W.C and storage on the lower half landing in between the raised and lower levels, that provides access to the secluded rear garden. It should be noted that there is granted planning permission (P2020/3511/ful) to create a rear extension. There are two double bedrooms and the family bathroom suite on the first floor, and an impressive principal suite on the top floor, featuring full head height, which is rare within the area, with a separate shower room, and stand alone bath, as well as bi-folding doors across the rear of the room. A really impressive space. Linton Street is one of the Arlington conservation areas quieter and most sought after roads as there is no access via New North road, moments from the greenery of Arlington Square. The many amenities of Islington Green, Upper Street, Angel and Broadway Market are a short walk away, with the canal providing a wonderful tranquil passage. A plethora of transportation links encompassing' many bus routes to the City and West End van be found at New North Road and Essex Road, with Essex Road station providing National Rail trains to Moorgate. The trendy bars, restaurants, galleries and boutique shops of Hoxton, Shoreditch, London Fields & Old Street are all easily accessible.

detailedDescription:
This fabulous Two Bedroom apartment has been redesigned by interior architects and completely refurbished to offer luxury accommodation in a prime location, with easy access to Camden Town, Kings Cross/St Pancras International and Upper Street in the heart of Islington.

Benefitting from a full schedule of refurbishment works, this naturally bright and spacious property measuring approximately 574 Sq.Ft has been completely transformed throughout. The reception room provides ample entertaining space with room for dinning whilst the adjacent fitted kitchen has been meticulously designed and fitted for functionality and is shown with a range of integrated appliances. From the expansive hall, the contemporary bathroom suite is fitted with full bathtub, floating wash basin with single lever mixer tap and low level W.C, finished in a wonderful tile surround.

Both double bedrooms provide space for free-standing furniture with the main bedroom benefits from built in wardrobes. This very unique property further benefits from engineered wood flooring, double glazed windows and further built in storage cupboards and room.

Hilldrop Crescent is just a short walk from a number of amenities on Caledonian Road and Brecknock Road, including independent coffee shops, popular restaurants, well-known organic grocers and a large Waitrose on Holloway Road. Within easy walking distance are the attractions of Camden market and Granary Square, with their many worldly eateries and shops.

The area is serviced by a number of transport links with Caledonian Road Underground being the closest, (Piccadilly Line), with Tufnell Park and Kentish Town Underground Stations also within easy reach. Bus routes close by include the 390,253,254,91,17 and 29 (some 24hr services) providing quick and direct access to the West End, City and Kings Cross/St Pancras International.<br /><br />

Full description:
shared ownership (Advertised price represents 25% share. Full market value £350,000). This well-proportioned flat is on the third floor and has windows to the front and rear of the building, providing good natural light and a cooling flow of air in the warmer months. In winter, a recently installed air-exchange system serves to filter and dehumidify the air for a pleasant, year-round living environment. There is a spacious bedroom with built-in wardrobe, a simple, white-tiled bathroom and a reception room with semi-open-plan kitchen and sliding door leading out onto a west/south-west-facing balcony. The energy-efficiency rating is good, thanks to well insulated walls, modern Velfac double/triple glazing (windows and doors were all replaced new in 2018 and still under guarantee) and gas central heating. The development benefits from a communal garden and recently cyclical maintenance and the communal areas have all been decorated and carpeted. Nearby Finsbury Park Station offers services to a number of destinations including into Moorgate or King's Cross and the park itself provides attractive outside space to enjoy. Upper Holloway (London Overground), Archway (Northern Line) and Holloway Road (Piccadilly) are also within easy reach.

address: Barts Square, 56 West Smithfield, Smithfield Market, City Of London EC1A
detailedDescription:
Barts Square is a vibrant new Residential Quarter in the heart of historic Smithfield. The development houses a mix of contemporary architecture and characterful restoration.

Location

On the doorstep of The City, St Pauls, Crossrail's Farringdon Station and the ever popular Clerkenwell, the scheme offers the perfect balance of new and old, village life and city living, exclusivity and accessibility.

The development is the only residential offering of its kind in the square mile and is perfectly positioned for all that life in the City has to offer; St Paul's, the Barbican and Museum of London are all moments away. The neighbourhood offers a wealth of restaurants and bars, from the street food of Exmouth Market and Whitecross Street to the fine dining of Club Gascon, Hix and St John's, every taste is catered for.

Description

The final phase at Barts Square will bring a range of contemporary new residences whilst respectfully maintaining the areas historic streetscape with careful design.

Set across 3 buildings, each with its own distinct design and personality, Phase 2 arguably offers the best views within the scheme. With apartments looking towards the domes of St Paul's and Old Bailey, the historic courtyards of St Bartholomew Church or the beautiful Grade II listed St Barts Hospital, there is something for everyone. The three buildings comprise of 92 new residential residences with a mix of studios, one, two, three bedroom and Penthouse apartments available.

Residents will benefit from a range of intimate and elegant amenities including a residents' lounge, residents' bar, private dining and meeting rooms and a private cinema room.

Square Footage: 897 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 996 years remaining

detailedDescription:
An exceptional two bedroom, two bathroom flat with private terrace first floor of this exciting development. The property spans 840sqft and has been exceptionally well designed to offer the most phenomenal social living space alongside two double bedrooms and two contemporary bathrooms with master bedroom benefitting from custom inbuilt dressing area and stylish ensuite.
The flats have been beautifully designed and finished with the finest high end materials as well as offering a host of unique smart home features. Integrated network cabling features throughout as do built in speakers whilst the underfloor heating system is compatible with Google Home, Alexa and Homekit. Miele appliances feature in the kitchen alongside wine cooler and instant boiling hot water tap with filter and a video entry system features in each hallway.

34 Chapel market is an outstanding boutique development of only three exceptional flats which have been beautifully finished to an exacting standard and have adopted the finest contemporary design which perfectly epitomises the vibrant location.
The development is perfectly situated at the east end of Chapel market and is ideally located for an array of local cafes, restaurants and shops on Upper Street as well as being within easy reach of Regents Canal and Granary Square at Kings Cross. Transport links are some of the best around with Angel station offering the closest underground links on the Northern line whilst further links across London are facilitated from Kings Cross.
Shoreditch and the City can be easily reached on foot although many prefer a leisurely cycle or an effortless bus ride from one of the many stops located nearby.

Pictures are of the show flat and for illustrative purposes only.

detailedDescription:
Found within the 11 Esther Anne Place phase of the Islington Square development this stunning 1 bedroom 5th floor apartment has been beautifully designed throughout.

This exclusive development, Islington Square, is formed of three separate buildings; 8,11 and 17 Esther Anne Place. 8 Esther Anne Place can be found within a unique Edwardian Royal Mail sorting office creating stunning warehouse apartments with beautiful original features. 11 Esther Anne Place is set to become the focal point of the development with striking exteriors, and 17 Esther Anne Place has been designed to reflect the historic qualities of the sorting office while combining this with modern décor.

The fabulous range of studio, one, two and three bedrooms apartments, maisonettes and penthouses are positioned within each of these buildings.

Boasting a sought-after location within Islington for an excellent range of trendy shops, bars and restaurants with many transport links moments away for access into central London.

Service charge £7 psf

999 Years lease

Parking is available via separate negotiation

detailedDescription:
Islington Square will be the latest addition to an already bustling borough with a rich heritage. Home to flagship restaurants, independent shops, cafes and galleries. Islington Square offers considered, design-led living spaces where each apartment has an unmistakable air of luxury
and comfort.

Islington Square is a rare flagship 4.5 acre development in the heart of Islington that restores the former North London Mail Centre into beautiful warehouse style apartments within a vibrant modern village, including retail, The Lounge by Odeon and a 40,000 sq ft Third Space health and fitness club.

The Edwardian former Royal Mail sorting office at the centre of the scheme is not only handsome and imposing, it is part of the personality of the place. A grand, important building, it was once a critical crossroads of the capital's social, commercial and cultural life. It is a privilege to be giving it new purpose and vitality.

The site's Edwardian heritage is beautifully restored with magnificent flair by czwg Architects' stunning and inspirational designs. This is Islington as creative and cutting edge as ever.

1015 sq ft

Parking is available via separate negotiation.

Service charge tbc

detailedDescription:
Islington Square will offer a variety of premier residential accommodation incorporating communal gardens, optional secure underground car parking, access to memberships in various facilities such as London's fastest growing car club.

There will be coffee shops and café bars, innovative restaurants and stylish shops showcasing the latest fashions and design and a 40,000 sq ft premium family health club, with state of the art facilities including a 25m pool for adults and separate pool facilities for children plus a luxury cinema with 5 screens with no more than 50 seats each hosting films from blockbusters to art productions.

London is famously a city of squares. Wherever these squares appear they quickly become natural meeting points for the communities around them. Islington Square will be no different. Sheltered from the traffic on Upper Street, it will be a fresh and lively locality. Linked to Upper Street by two covered retail arcades, Islington Square will be the centre of a community with everything on its doorstep. It will soon be hard to imagine Islington without it.

detailedDescription:
Ideally located on a tree lined residential street within the Hillmarton Conservation Area, is this beautifully presented and newly refurbished two double bedroom apartment with private section of a large shared garden.

Occupying the entire ground floor of an imposing semi-detached Victorian conversion, the owners have redesigned and renovated the apartment throughout using a clever blend of both period and contemporary decoration whilst providing modern living. This naturally bright apartment comprises of newly fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and ample preparation space, large reception room to front aspect which is filled with light from two oversized windows, two rear facing double bedrooms complete with built in wardrobes, spacious hall and newly fitted fully tiled bathroom suite.

The property further benefits from double glazing throughout, gas heating with modern combination boiler, wood flooring and substantial private section of communal rear garden.

Hillmarton Road is just a short walk from a number of amenities on Caledonian Road and Holloway Road including Cafés, supermarkets and well known eateries.

Transport links moments from the property include Caledonian Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line, which is just 5 minutes’ walk (Google). title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented Georgian town house.

Location

Richmond Avenue sits in the heart of the Barnsbury Conservation area, extremely well placed for the many amenities in central Islington and the local shops in Barnsbury and Upper Street. There are excellent transport links at The Angel and Highbury Corner providing easy access to the City and the West End with many bus routes and the underground stations (Northern Line, Victoria Line and Overland). Furthermore, the International transport hub at King's Cross St Pancras is within easy reach from the property.

Description

A wonderful home located in this highly popular location in the Barnsbury conservation area. The house has been modernised to an exceptionally high standard with quality fixtures and fittings. The character and finish have been enhanced to provide a beautiful and very stylish home.

Unlike others in this stretch of the road, this house benefits from a side extension offering an extremely useful entrance lobby and therefore does not interfere with the ground floor reception, which retains period features including beautiful fireplaces and working shutters. The kitchen, with top of the range fitted appliances, is at the rear of the house, across the ground floor and leads from the entrance lobby, with sliding doors leading to the landscaped garden.

Stairs from the kitchen (along with access via the main stairwell) lead down to an open plan reception room/play room which is extremely flexible space and can be used as a guest bedroom, home cinema or simply a further reception room. There is a useful utility room, along with a shower and wc at this level, whilst retaining access to the rear garden. There are two under pavement vaults, extremely useful for storage.

The top three floors offer a master bedroom with a large ensuite bathroom over the first floor, two further double bedrooms on the second floor and a fabulous double bedroom at the top of the house with ensuite bathroom and south facing roof terrace with view of the City.

This is a handsome Victorian family home and is offered with no onward chain.

Square Footage: 2491 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A well presented four bedroom early-Victorian house offering over 1,700 sq ft of accommodation on this popular no-through road in the heart of the Barnsbury Conservation Area.

Refurbished by the current owner, the property features a delightful through reception room on the ground floor with built-in alcove storage together with a pretty aspect over neighbouring gardens to the rear.

On the lower ground floor is a smart modern kitchen with ample room to sit and eat. This opens on to a large utility room with an adjacent shower room. Subject to obtaining necessary planning permission, the two rooms could be opened up further to create a large open plan living space.

There are four double bedrooms on the two upper floors and a family bathroom at the top of the house.

To the rear is a south east facing patio garden.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Crescent Street is a no-through road which runs between Huntingdon Street and Offord Road in the heart of leafy Barnsbury.

Ideally located for transport, Caledonian Road & Barnsbury (Overground - 0.1 miles) station is a short distance away and provides easy access to the City via Shoreditch High Street. The nearest Underground station can be found at Caledonian Road (Piccadilly line - 0.6 miles) for access to the West End and to King's Cross / St Pancras International for national and international rail services.

A variety of local amenities can be found in Barnsbury, including a number of excellent gastropubs. Islington's Upper Street with its shops, bars and restaurants is also easily accessible.

Please note that all distances are approximate.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Just moments away from Angel and positioned on the second floor of a period property is this truly special two bedroom and two bathroom apartment. This beautifully presented flat has been meticulously renovated and perfectly blends contemporary chic with the building’s original period charm. Natural light floods into the vast open-plan reception room through three sash windows, this space is perfect for entertaining and merges with a stylish contemporary kitchen that offers among its features Miele appliances, a wine cooler and an instant boiling water tap. Both double bedrooms are bright and airy and have bespoke built-in wardrobe space, one has an en-suite bathroom with a second stylish bathroom off the hallway. Further benefits include smart home features such as integrated network cabling throughout, underfloor heating and built-in speakers.

Situation
Chapel market has all of the buzz one would hope for in a central Angel location whilst also benefitting from Barnsbury's village like feel. On your doorstep you have wonderful gastro pubs, shops, cinemas and theatres. Angel underground station is just moments away with Kings Cross St Pancras also within easy reach.

address: Royle Building, 31 Wenlock Road, Hoxton, London N1
detailedDescription: Formerly the Royle printworks, this landmark building was converted into one of the first loft style residential buildings in the area. The 3 metre high ceilings and enormous windows overlooking the basin captured an ever changing scenic view of Canal life. The Royle offers a rugged mix of concrete, open spaces and metal windows and balcony doors overlooking the basin. This light and spacious one bedroom loft apartment takes in the Westerly views and afternoon light with dreamy views over Wenlock Basin and Regents Canal. The building is very well cared for by a weekday concierge. There is a cycle store and an internal passenger lifts to all floors. The Royle is position on this prominent and picturesque corner of Wenlock Basin and Regents Canal with its own private wharf. The Royle is an easy walk from Upper Street past the Narrow Boat pub or along the Canal to Angel. Old Street roundabout is a little further showing how conveniently sited The Royle is for work and social living.

detailedDescription:
Wonderfully located on a popular residential turning within easy walking distance of Holloway Road Underground Station, Gillespie Park and expansive green open spaces of Highbury Fields, is this beautifully presented light filled two bedroom split level apartment with joint use of a sizable rear garden.

Benefitting from being recently updated, this charming Stucco fronted Victorian conversion offers a wealth of natural light and excellent living space measuring approximately 810 SqFt. Entered on the first floor, the staircase leads up to the second floor where the spacious open-plan reception/dining rooms draws in light from two oversized sash windows, whilst the adjacent kitchen has been finished in contemporary style offering a range of wall and base units and some integrated appliances. From the landing the bathroom offers a full bath tub with classic brick tile surround, was basin with mixer tap, heated rail and low level W.C.

Ascending the stairs, the third floor comprises of two well laid out double bedrooms with main room providing ample space for free standing furniture and built in storage, whilst the second room offers its occupants room for a home office and guest room.

To the rear of the property is a large private garden for residents of the building, where the mature lawn, planters and patio area provide further entertainment space.

Tollington Road is close to local amenities including Waitrose and Morrisons on Holloway Road with further restaurants, vibrant bars, cafés and boutiques on nearby Upper Street and Highbury Barn.

Holloway Road Underground Station (Piccadilly Line) is just 9 minutes’ walk (Google), with Drayton Park Station (National Rail) also within easy walking distance, providing direct access to Moorgate in the City.<br /><br />

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description With stunning high ceilings, huge sash windows and an ideal location in the coveted mid section of Highbury Hill, this apartment makes a terrific first time buy. The current owner lived here for 14 years before moving abroad; all the proof you need this is a happy home.

To the front of the property is a wide living room, the kitchen island providing a natural separation from the living area, as well as a convivial spot for the odd glass of wine. The smart kitchen sports white units and urban steel splashbacks, gas hob and white goods. The remaining living space gives plenty of space for lounge area, and family dining table with a classic London outlook over the period grandeur of Highbury Hill

Central bathroom is fully tiled and has pinspots lighting deep full bath with central taps and rainfall shower over. To the rear, a sizable double bedroom offers exceptional storage space and a lovely West facing aspect to catch the evening sun.

A wonderful bonus to this home is a large storage room, with window to rear, off the communal staircase. A great spot for storage of skiis, suitcases etc., or with a bit of imagination a home office.

Situation and tenure This beautiful period home enjoys a Share of the Freehold. The maintenance costs are shared between the fellow Freeholders.

Transport links could hardly be better. Drayton Park overground is a short walk away, offering the commuter a direct train to Moorgate on ten minutes., Victoria line is also a lovely walk across Highbury Fields to Highbury & Islington station. The local shops offer a number of perennial favourites; Da Marios deli, Godfreys Butchers, La Fromagerie, and Bournes fishmonger. After a short burst of shopping, enjoy a latte and panini at The Highness, or skip across the road for something stronger at The Highbury Barn before winding your way home down the hill.

detailedDescription:
Peach Properties in partnership with Boatshed London are delighted to offer this 55ft Narrowboat for sale with London mooring at Ice Wharf Marina, King's Cross.

This 1995 narrowboat is located in one of London's most desirable moorings because of it's central location and excellent transport links. A perfect bolthole for someone who needs a place in London.

Offered in excellent condition inside and out, the boat's layout is well proportioned and has lots of storage throughout. The interior is tidy and bright if not the most modern - the next owner could certainly add some value here.

The boat was blacked in 2017 and has a bss to January 2024.

The residential mooring at Ice Wharf is fully transferable and current mooring fees are £12,000 per annum. There is electric, water, landline phone connection, pump out and laundry onsite.

detailedDescription:
Available on shared ownership - 25% share
Available for full private ownership - 100%

Modern and large one bedroom apartment situated on the floor four of a luxury development between Angel (7 mins on foot) and King’s Cross St. Pancras (12 mins on foot).

The apartment benefits from approx. 591sq ft of internal space featuring a double bedroom, large living room and open-plan kitchen/dining room (with excellent built-in storage).

The property also boasts an East-facing balcony without any overhanging balcony above, so lots of sunlight.

Kings Cross Quarter, completed in late 2018, is a new development positioned close to Regent’s Canal, Angel/Islington and King’s Cross.

The residents benefit from a 24-hour concierge, bicycle storage, swimming pool & jacuzzi, gym, sauna, steam room, private residents’ cinema and access to a large communal garden.

The development is perfectly situated between Islington and the restaurants and shops of Upper Street, as well as the new cultural hub of London, historical King’s Cross, a vibrant and bustling community connected to central London, with excellent tube, rail and bus links.

The building is an architectural achievement displaying a stunning exterior of harmoniously balanced brick and glass, with luxury interiors displaying features such as scandi-style light wooden floors, ample storage, well sized kitchens with high spec appliances, luxe bathrooms (with bath TVs) and bedrooms with lush carpets and integrated wardrobes.

Kings Cross Quarter apartments are conscientiously designed for modern, elegant and professional living.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

With a share of the freehold is this stunning two bedroom lower ground floor period conversion with private garden leading onto superbly maintained communal gardens and off street parking, enviably located close to excellent transport links and fashionable amenities. The property has been recently refurbished by the current owner to a superb standard, offering bright and spacious accommodation with period elegance complimented by stylish interiors throughout. Features include a beautiful open plan reception/quality fitted kitchen, stylish bathroom, gas central heating via cast iron radiators, shuttered windows, and quality wood effect flooring.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with access through a versatile second bedroom/reception area into a further inner hall with doors to all rooms. The bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen offers direct access out onto the glorious gardens, as well as ample space for entertaining, relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a beautifully designed high quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and central island, incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a further well sized master bedroom with dual front aspect shuttered windows, plus an inviting family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Location

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of Canonbury Station and numerous regular bus routes, and also within easy access of Highbury & Islington Station with overground and underground connections. Ever popular Highbury Barn is close-by with its independent shops, specialist butcher, fishmonger and a fromagerie. A wide variety of shops, fashionable bars, restaurants and amenities on Upper Street and Stoke Newington Church Street are also very easily accessible within a short walk, as well as the lovely open spaces of Highbury Fields and Clissold Park.

Lease Information

We are advised the flat has 92 years left on the lease and comes with a share of the freehold. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

£150 per month. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

address: Mortimer Road, De Beauvoir, London N1
detailedDescription:
A stunning 3 double bedroomed Georgian Terrace house, with a fabulous garden, situated in one of De Beauvoir's most desirable locations. This house is generously arranged over 3 floors, including a sumptuous 25ft double reception room, complemented by a plethora of original features. On the lower ground floor, there is a superb kitchen with an adjoining family area. On the upper floor, there are two double bedrooms and two bathrooms.

Mortimer Road is a wide picturesque tree-lined street, off De Beauvoir Square, which is a much sort after area with a children's area and rose garden. The property is conveniently positioned for the great shopping on Kingsland Road as well as not being too far from Upper Street. Access into the City or West End is made possible by the many local bus routes as well as the London Overground at Haggerston (approx. 5 mins away).

Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home? The friendly neighbours, the peace and quiet - its a no through road, so only cars delivering or from owners of other houses come down the road. The garden at the back has an abundance of birds and our local Robin. I have also cultivated palm trees and a wooden patio which is great for bbq and sunbathing and again is really quiet. There is also amazing light in the house, the sun comes up on the front of the house and is on the back garden in the afternoon - something I really love.

Why are you moving? Very sad to be giving up this house where you can see the sunset and take amazing pics.

What do you love about the area? It's a real urban house, near everything. Easy access to the river thames, coffee shops, restaurants, cinema, the city, cannery wharf, west end. There are a couple of organic pubs/restaurants too, and on the canal of course there are even more restaurants and places to have breakfast as you watch the narrow boats go by. Ref: Isl

address: Northumberland House, Highbury Crescent, London N5
detailedDescription:
Positioned on Highbury Fields and set within a grand Victorian Villa is this truly special two bedroom garden flat that seamlessly blends period charm with contemporay chic. This immaculately presented property is laterally arranged over the ground floor and boasts 1042sq ft of internal area. Natural light floods into the magnificent open-plan reception room and kitchen through a large bay window and French doors, this 24’8 x 18’3 room has been meticulously designed to the highest standard and offers a fantastic entertaining space that seamlessly blends with the 31’1 x 18’3 private garden for the perfect summer party. The main bedroom is bright and airy thanks to its own bay window facing the Fields and benefits from a spacious en-suite shower room and an abundance of built-in wardrobe space. detailedDescription:
Spacious and well presented three bedroom split level maisonette with own ground floor entrance facing communal garden, as well as private patio to the rear, set within a popular purpose built block in a sought after Islington location. The property offers bright and well proportioned accommodation, neutrally decorated with modern interiors throughout, including a generous reception room, separate kitchen and upstairs family bathroom. Further features include gas central heating, double glazing, plentiful inbuilt storage and a lease of 95 years.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of stations at Archway, Upper Holloway and Crouch Hill, as well as regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area. Holloway Road is within walking distance, offering an array of shops, cafes and restaurants, with further amenities available in nearby Crouch End Broadway, just a short distance away. The lovely open spaces of Hillside Park and Elthorne Park are also close-by.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 125 years from 25th March 1990 therefore 95 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the Service Charges are circa £1800 p.a. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor. Service charge includes all heating and hot water for the property.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
'The Studio' is a charming and sunny three double bedroom, two-bathroom property situated close to lively Newington Green, in Highbury Islington N5 and offering unique potential for future further development. Offered to the market on a chain-free basis, it is set across three floors standing in excess of 1,000 sq ft. It is tastefully decorated and cleverly remodelled to create a perfect balance of modern living with flexibility of layout, along with the potential to extend further STPP. Planning permission previously granted for a 4th floor; alternatively a large roof garden or combination of garden/living space could be accommodated. Entrance via own front garden. The lower ground floor consists of a well-proportioned south-facing reception room leading out to a private patio, plus a family bathroom. The raised ground floor comprises of a spacious kitchen with French windows and ample space for dining, then to the front of the house a good-sized double bedroom overlooking the front garden. The first (top) floor occupies two further double bedrooms, one being the master bedroom featuring in-built storage, the other with French windows, plus a second bathroom. 'The Studio' is offered to the market on a share of freehold basis with existing lease extended to 900 years.
Ferntower Road is a cul-de-sac, perfectly located for local shops, cafes and restaurants situated nearby in Newington Green, Highbury Barn and Stoke Newington which are all well known for their village atmosphere. Upper Street is also close by and provides a selection of boutique shops and bars as well as theatres and a vibrant nightlife. The green spaces of Highbury Fields and Clissold Park are just a short distance away. Transport across London is made easy with Overground links at nearby Canonbury, providing easy access to the City and East London, whilst Highbury and Islington (Victoria line) is the closest underground link. Numerous good bus routes can also be found nearby along with easy access to St Pancras International and links to Stansted Airport.

detailedDescription:
Cash Buyers Only - Square Quarters are pleased to present this brand newly refurbished self-contained basement studio for sale in Islingtons Barnsbury area off Caledonian Road moments to Kings Cross.

This studio represents excellent value and a great investment opportunity consisting of a lower ground studio with a brand new kitchen boasting white gloss units and black sparkle worktops, a large skylight and a separate bathroom.

Caledonian Road is an envy-inspiring location minutes away from Upper Street with its trendy bars restaurants and boutiques. The property is only a 3 minutes walk to Caledonian Road and Barnsbury Train Station or 10 Minute Walk to Caledonian Road tube and served well for buses to Kings Cross, Old Street, and West End.

detailedDescription:
This very large (approx. 960 sq. Ft.) one bedroom top floor apartment is in a well run development, superbly located just off Goswell Road and comes with secure underground parking and a share of the freehold.

The apartment is comprised of a large L shaped hallway/corridor, large living room with ceiling to floor glass doors that provide an aspect over the garden courtyard, separate fitted kitchen, double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, en-suite three piece bathroom and separate guest W.C. The apartment also comes with a secure underground parking space.

Silverdale Court is fantastically and centrally located between Angel Islington, Clerkenwell, Farringdon and Old Street, all being within walking distance. The location also offers ease of access to the western part of the City of London which lies to the south. The local area, especially Goswell Road, offers a wide selection of boutiques, coffee shops, gyms, bars and restaurants. The area is well served by public transport with regular taxis and a number of bus routes along Goswell Road and Clerkenwell Road and with the nearest stations being Barbican (Circle, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City), Farringdon (Circle, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City, National Rail and with the Elizabeth Line (Cross Rail) to open and Old Street (Northern and National Rail).

We bring this apartment to the market as sole agent.

Ground rent: N/a
EPC rating: C
Local authority and council tax band: Lb of Islington, Band E, £1,892 pa

detailedDescription:
A modern four bedroom townhouse with the rare inclusion of private off-street parking.

Located on a quiet square in Archway, this property would make an ideal family home as it has the benefit of two bathrooms plus a downstairs cloakroom. There is a private garden along with additional outdoor spaces and play areas within the Square.

Archway Underground Station (Northern Line) is within a ten minute walk, whilst the nearby A1 provides easy access into and out of London by car.

The large open plan kitchen and dining room has views onto the private garden and has a separate utility room.

The first floor sitting room has a Juliet balcony overlooking Cornwallis Square. The remaining upper floor accommodation features two bathrooms and four bedrooms giving flexible space for growing families and those looking to work from home.

This modern townhouse has undergone some recent refurbishment by the current owners and also could be extended on the ground floor and/or into the loft space STPP and necessary consents.

detailedDescription:
Situated in Zone 1,0.5 miles from Angel tube and a 2 min walk to regents canal. This generously proportioned bright and airy 1 bed flat is arranged over the 12th floor of purpose built block which has no cladding. It has a concierge service and CCTV. This flat has always been really secure. Lift access, with 2 x lifts, recycling point for everyday and larger items, and a residents bike hanger available to use within the grounds.

Kitchen - Separate contemporary eat in kitchen with modern integrated appliances, great counter and storage space, and does include a washing machine and new dishwasher.
Living room - Bright south facing spacious living room with windows spanning across one wall to make the most of the views over St Pauls. This reception room easily fits a 3 seater and 2 seater sofabed, plus additional furniture.

Bedroom - Large light south facing bedroom.
A Kingsize bed fits with ease into this space and leaves plenty more room for wardrobes etc.

Bathroom - Electric power shower over bath, new mixer taps and hand held shower.
This bathroom has great water pressure.

Storage - Off the entrance hall there is a large walk in closet with built in shelves and rails, a fantastic extra space. There is a seperate cupboard which houses gas and electric meters and additional linen cupboard.

The energy performance cert. For this apartment is a B, there are double glazed windows throughout and a new energy efficient combi boiler that is only a couple of years old. This has been serviced up to date since instalment, last service was Nov 2020, gas safety cert for this apartment also done Nov 2020.

detailedDescription:
Positioned on the second floor of a smart contemporary block in Islington is this bright and airy two bedroom apartment. This beautifully presented property enjoys excellent levels of natural light through out and boasts a feeling of space. The 19’11 x 15’11 open-plan reception room offers flexible living and comes with a fitted modern kitchen. The two double bedrooms both have two windows each and also ample space for storage. Off the hallways is a family bathroom and a storage cupboard. This superb flat would be perfect as a first time purchase and would also suit investors and benefits from a gym, parking space and caretaker. Chain free.

Situation
Southgate Road runs through the highly sought after De Beauvoir conservation area near The Regents Canal. Well placed for all the local amenities including the De Beauvoir Deli, award winning gastro pubs and local shops. There are excellent bus routes on Southgate Road into the City and beyond and Haggerston Overland and Dalston Junction stations are a short walk away, with services to Canada Water and Highbury & Islington stations.

Property is entered via smart communal areas and comprises – two double bedrooms both of which are comfortable and decorated to a high standard, a striking Kitchen diner with modern fitted units, stylish shower room and a charming reception room that leads directly to the private terrace. detailedDescription:
This stylish one bedroom apartment is the perfect base when living in London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Angel and Old St., close to vibrant Shoreditch and Hoxton and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle as this apartment is super quiet! With lovely wooden heated flooring, clean white interior walls and elegant finishing touches, this is a truly stylish and comfortable place to live.

The open plan living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can really kick back.

If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the contemporary kitchen, as the sleek white kitchen units are well equipped with modern and easy to use appliances essential for cooking up a tasty snack or feast.

The master bedroom is super quite with absolutely no street noise, exactly what you need for a good night’s sleep. The big built-in mirrored wardrobes and closets in the hall and bedroom means there is plenty of storage room so you can move in and start feeling at home right away. There is also a fabulous make up area in the hall.

Freshen up in the gorgeous bathroom which has sleek tiled walls and a long wall mirror. Indulge in a long hot soak in the large tub after discovering the bustling city, or wake up in the mornings with the fantastic shower.

You can also enjoy the spa facilities! The Spa facilities include the following: Swimming pool, gym, sauna, steam room, jacuzzi.

detailedDescription:
Stunning three bedroom penthouse set within a converted Victorian school benefitting from a share of the freehold.

This duplex apartments offers an abundance of character with exposed wooden beams which complement the impressive vaulted ceilings. The open-plan living area is bathed in natural light thanks to the large windows and Southerly aspect which also offers a magnificent view of the London City skyline. The kitchen is modern with high-specification appliances with ample space for dining alongside. There are three well-proportioned double bedrooms all of which have access to en-suite facilities in addition to a communal WC. The upper floor houses the master suite which also boasts access to a private terrace area.

Tottenham Road is regarded as one of the premier destinations within De Beauvoir, N1. This tree-lined street is enviably located and provides easy access to the bountiful array of amenities the local area has to offer ranging from independent eateries to gastro pubs all within walking distance. The green spaces of De Beauvoir Square are a short walk from the property whilst both Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations are easily accessible and offer direct routes to Highbury and Islington (Victoria line), Stratford (Central line and Westfield Shopping Centre) and Canary Wharf. Residents also have the option of numerous bus routes offering swift and easy access into London Liverpool Street and City.

detailedDescription:
This stylish one bedroom apartment is the perfect base when living in London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Angel and Old St., close to vibrant Shoreditch and Hoxton and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle as this apartment is super quiet! With lovely wooden heated flooring, clean white interior walls and elegant finishing touches, this is a truly stylish and comfortable place to live.

The open plan living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can really kick back.

If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the contemporary kitchen, as the sleek white kitchen units are well equipped with modern and easy to use appliances essential for cooking up a tasty snack or feast.

The master bedroom is super quite with absolutely no street noise, exactly what you need for a good night’s sleep. The big built-in mirrored wardrobes and closets in the hall and bedroom means there is plenty of storage room so you can move in and start feeling at home right away. There is also a fabulous make up area in the hall.

Freshen up in the gorgeous bathroom which has sleek tiled walls and a long wall mirror. Indulge in a long hot soak in the large tub after discovering the bustling city, or wake up in the mornings with the fantastic shower.

You can also enjoy the spa facilities! The Spa facilities include the following: Swimming pool, gym, sauna, steam room, jacuzzi.

detailedDescription:
Well presented and spacious, this two bedroom split level maisonette is superbly located within a short walk of Archway station and the vibrant local amenities of Highgate Village. The property, set within an attractive period building and boasting a wealth of character and original features, offers bright and spacious accommodation with modern interiors and neutral decoration. Features include large reception with fireplace and feature bay, separate well equipped eat-in kitchen, family bathroom and further en-suite, gas central heating, part double glazing, ample inbuilt storage and long lease.

Accommodation comprises entrance with stairs rising to the first floor, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with cast iron fireplace, feature bay, and ample space for entertaining and relaxing. The separate kitchen, with space for table and chairs, comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and further space for appliances. The first floor further accommodates a generous rear aspect bedroom, modern bathroom and separate WC. To the second floor, there is an inviting and characterful master bedroom with inbuilt wardrobes and access to a light and airy en-suite bathroom with white suite and elegant tiling.

The property is enviably located on Waterlow Road, a popular tree-lined street ideally positioned within a few minutes walk to the beautiful surroundings of Waterlow Park, the restaurants, cafes and bars of Highgate Village and the multiple transport facilities on offer in Archway, Zone 2. The property is also in very close proximity to Hampstead Heath, as well as a number of outstanding nearby schools. Including Highgate and Channing Independent Schools, which are within a 10 minute walk.

Permit parking is available on Waterlow Road.

To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 125 years from 29 September 1993 - 98 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

detailedDescription:
Spacious two bedroom split level property situated within a secure gated development (previously, police housing). The property is comprised of a master bedroom with built-in storage as well as an additional bedroom with lots of natural light, a separate kitchen diner, 2-piece bathroom suite, separate WC and large lounge with the potential to be converted into a further bedroom. Boasting a private patio garden, neutral decor and ample storage.

Whilst located within a quiet, residential area the vibrant holloway road is right on your doorstep, hosting gyms, restaurants and shops and a variety of traditional cafes as well as a cinema within a listed building, offering a certain retro charm. With green open spaces such as Finsbury Park and Hampstead Heath within walking distance as well as vibrant Camden and Kentish Town.

Garden is South-West facing so gets the sun most of the day and very sheltered even in winter.

Local transport links include Tufnell Park station (Northern), Kentish Town (Thameslink, Northern) Caledonian road (Piccadilly) Holloway Road station (Piccadilly) as well as local bus routes, many of which offer a 24-hour service allow easy access to Kings Cross as well as the City and the West End.

Management Fee £215 including Water and ground rent

Sq footage does not include garden or shed.

2 parking spaces are currently let but come with the property.

Leasehold circa 95 years left on the lease.

detailedDescription:
An excellent one double bedroom split level conversion with terrace arranged over the entire first floor of an impressive detached double fronted Victorian house. The flat benefits from a generously sized dual aspect living room, kitchen breakfast room, large double bedroom, bathroom with bath and separate shower cubicle, an additional guest cloakroom and a lovely terrace with far reaching views. Anson road is a wide tree-lined road located close to the independent shops and cafes along Tufnell Parks high street and within walking distance of Parliament Hill Fields with it's good choice of amenities including a running track, tennis courts, Sunday market and cafe all of which lead onto the wide open spaces of Hampstead Heath. The property is offered with a share of freehold and is chain free.

First Floor

Hallway

Entryphone, large storage cupboard.

Living Room

This generously sized room benefits from dual aspect large sash windows allowing plenty of natural light in and has a lovely working cast iron fireplace which is gas fed and fitted media points.

Kitchen Breakfast Room

Steps leading down to this lovely room with an impressive high vaulted ceiling and bi-folding doors leading directly onto the rear terrace. Offering a range of wall and base units finished in high gloss white with wood preparation surfaces. Integrated appliances include an oven with four ring gas hob and extractor canopy, fridge freezer and plumbed for a washing machine.

Double Bedroom

Triple bay sash windows give this room plenty of natural light with ample space for wardrobes and further storage.

Bathroom/W.C.

A white suite comprising of a panel enclosed bath with hand held shower attachment, walk in shower cubicle with wall mounted adjustable shower head, pedestal wash hand basin, w.c. And chrome heated towel rail. Finished in white ceramic wall tiles and grey ceramic floor tiles.

Guest Cloakroom

Wash hand basin and w.c.

Terrace

Accessed directly from the kitchen via bi-folding doors is this lovely roof terrace with uninterrupted views along the rear gardens.

Additional Information

Council tax band: E
2021/2022 £2005

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This substantial, light-filled warehouse conversion occupies a significant portion of a former tram shed in lower Holloway, within easy reach of Highbury and Kentish Town. It represents an excellent opportunity for updating, with internal space that extends to approximately 4,556 sq ft, including five bedrooms, six bathrooms, an integral garage and a large, south-facing roof terrace.

The house is accessed via a discrete frontage on a quiet side street of Camden Road. Once through the integrated garage, the property opens to a wide galleried hall with industrial staircases that lead to the lower and upper levels. Utilising the width and height of the property, the floors are staggered, brilliantly optimising light and space. To the right is a grand master bedroom suite, with open bathroom and large built-in wardrobes, and a second bedroom also with en-suite bathroom. A further bedroom and bathroom can be found on the first floor.

The expansive main living space is on the second floor, and includes a sleek bespoke kitchen by Beckerman, with Corian countertops and Gaggenau appliances. An extraordinary amount of natural light pours into the space from a soaring roof lantern that spans the length of the room. A mezzanine-level study and shower room, are accessed via a short staircase that rises above the living/dining space. A sun terrace is accessed via a set of painted steps at the far end of the room.

On the lower-ground floor are two further bedrooms with bathrooms, and an open study, arranged around a second living area set within a double-height void, with light from rows of street-level windows.

Camden Road is a short distance from Islington and the shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street. Highgate Village and the open spaces of Hampstead Heath are also close by. There are a number of excellent pubs in the area, including St John’s Tavern and The Landseer, and a weekly farmers’ market is held at the Tufnell Park Tavern.

The area has excellent transport links, with connections to the Piccadilly Line at nearby Holloway Road and Caledonian Road stations. Highbury and Islington station, a short bus ride away, has Victoria Line and London Overground services.

The 2nd floor is home to the beautiful reception room to the front encompassing 3 charming sash windows. Second double bedroom with en-suite shower room to the rear of the property. The half landing is home to the spacious kitchen/ breakfast room.

The property is conveniently located for access to the shops of Highbury Barn, including the renowned Godfreys Butchers, the fishmongers and the Fromagerie, along with the greenery of Highbury Park & Clissold Park the trains and Underground at Highbury & Islington station, Finsbury Park station, Arsenal Underground and Drayton Park station, all providing superb links across London. Arsenal is the closest of the above mentioned stations, with trains on the Piccadilly Line through the Theatre District, Covent Garden, Piccadilly and out to Heathrow. It is worth noting that the Highbury Stadium Square development, formerly home to Arsenal Football Club, houses an all singing, all dancing Fitness First gym, complete with swimming pool.

title: 2 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A sizable purpose built maisonette, found in a prime N19 location only 5 minutes from Archway Underground Station. It does not fall short of Green Spaces, amenities, shopping centres and great schools. The property is literally a stones throw away from Archway Park, neighbouring Archway Road making this one of North Londons most desirbale places to live.

The property has approximately 800 sq. Ft. Of liveable space and is arranged over two substantial levels. Natural light wooden floors run throughout the property, surrounded by bright white walls. The First Floor contains the large reception room which has direct access to the private garden. The garden is approximately 45 sq. Ft. In size and is part paved, it can be a lovely place to sit back and relax. On the same floor, we have the separate kitchen which is equipped with a fridge/freezer and gas hob. Beside the kitchen we have a bathroom with a shower, toilet, and hand wash basin. On the Second Floor are three bedrooms, the bathroom, and a separate WC. The master’s bedroom is significant in size beaming with natural light from the end to end double glazed windows. The two single rooms are adequate in size furnished with wardrobes. Between the three bedrooms is the bathroom. Yes, you read that right, the property benefits from having two bathrooms perfect for large families.
Location


The surround of the property boasts ample amenities, just around the corner we have an abundance of local schools such as, the new Whitehall Park, Ashmount Primary School, Coleridge Primary school, Duncombe Primary school, as well as the City Of London Highgate Hill secondary school.
Many shopping districts are local and in close proximity to the flat as well, including Highgate Crouch End, Archway, Stroud Green and Finsbury Park. All offering a vast array of places to dine, drink or shop. If its green spaces in demand Hillside Park, Elthorne Park, Waterlow Park, Hampstead Heath, Finsbury Park and The Parkland Walk are all in walking distance, offering beautiful grassland walking paths, ideal spaces and spend the day to relax should the weather permit it.
And if that is not enough, getting around the city could not be made easier in this location, within minutes you can reach Archway Underground Station (Northern Line, Zone 2), Upper Holloway Overground (Northern Line), Crouch Hill Overground. Hardly ever can a property boast immediacy to three different train lines of London! Not only is the location perfect for families but for buy to let investors as well.

Imminent interest is expected. Call us now to arrange a viewing.

‘Think…Property Inc!’

Video available
This lovely three bedroom flat is presented in immaculate condition and was refurbished in the last three years. Type 3A

This three bedroom flat has a dual aspect reception room with a wraparound balcony/ fire exit to enjoy the views north and east of the City of London. There is a second reception room which could be used as a study or a dining room.

A refitted kitchen has been extended to incorporate the utility room with ample white gloss cabinets, an Indesit ceramic hob and extractor fan above, an integrated oven and microwave, fridge and freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, tiled splashback and a wood effect floor. A dining area is adjacent to the galley kitchen.

Bedrooms two and three have fitted cupboards and full height easterly aspect windows and a door to the balcony/fire exit.

The master bedroom has a large window facing east, a walk-in wardrobe and another cupboard fitted with shelves.

The main bathroom has a shower, low level w.c. Wash hand basin with vanity unit below.
Mirror fronted cabinet, tiled walls and flooring.
There is also a separate w.c. With a wash basin.

Residents have use of the private gardens within the estate.

Cromwell Tower is the furthest east of the three high-rise tower blocks situated at the junction of Whitecross Street and Beech Street (Chiswell Street) and the building is adjacent to the entrance to the Barbican Arts Centre with its cinemas, theatres, art gallery, restaurants and bars. The shopping facilities of Whitecross Street (Full size Waitrose) and Finsbury Pavement (Marks & Spencer food and clothing store) are within walking distance. Cromwell Tower provides 24hr porterage. As at Autumn 2001 the Barbican Estate became Grade II listed.<br /><br />

Entered on the ground floor the spacious hall way leads through to a separate reception room, eat-in-kitchen / dining room ideal for entertaining with direct access to the garden and fully tiled bathroom with separate W.C.

Ascending the staircase, the first floors comprises of three double bedrooms with the main room benefiting from floor to ceiling window that claws light in. In addition, the property offers further potential to extend (STPP),
The wonderful landscaped rear garden offers further entertaining space with large stone patio area laid to mature lawn which runs the length of the garden to a further seating area at the end of the garden.

This popular area in one of Islington's fastest changing areas benefits from being within close proximity of a range of amenities along Holloway Road including organic supermarkets, coffee shops, eateries and leisure centres. Caledonian Road and Holloway Road are the closest underground stations with direct access to the Piccadilly Line with Drayton Park Mainline Station also nearby. address: The Factory, 1 Nile Street, London N1.
detailedDescription:
A spacious and beautifully presented two bedroom loft apartment which is located on the first floor of The Factory in the heart of Tech City.

Spanning in excess of 1,870sqft the property offers a fantastic feeling of space which is assisted by high ceilings, the accommodation briefly comprises a huge reception room with an open plan fitted kitchen. There is a utility room, a principal bedroom with a large en suite bathroom with separate walk in shower and a connecting study. An additional double bedroom and bathroom complete the accommodation.

A wealth of warehouse character remain, to include exposed brick walls, crittal windows and loading doors which open out onto a Juliette balcony. The apartment is sold with a share of Freehold, an allocated parking space, an internal communal courtyard and the factory also has a dedicated porter.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Originally re-developed by Manhattan Loft Corporation, The Factory remains one of the most iconic conversions in the Old Street district with a number of bus routes to choose within close proximity as is Old Street station (Northern Line/Main Line). There are also a number useful amenities close to hand. Some of the capitals best bars and restaurants can also be found in Shoreditch, Hoxton, and Clerkenwell.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully residing across the ground floor of this unique and modern bespoke built building awaits this one bedroom maisonette, complete with private outside space and located in the heart of popular Stroud Green Road.

This striking apartment boasts a wealth of unique features and contemporary design throughout, not least in the open plan layout across the main living space, incorporating enough space for a lounge/diner, with a smart modern kitchen to your left. Here you’ll find fresh, pale mint walls, recessed spot lighting and brilliantly polished cabinets in a light concrete effect grey, copper handles, slick modern range hood with glass elements and a matching oven with an gas stove. From this space you have access to the yard outside via sliding doors, providing more room for al fresco dining and hosting outdoor get togethers. Though to the hallway you’ll find the bathroom, fully fitted with full sized bath tub and over head shower, modern silver accents and bold, oversized terracotta tiling adding even more personality. To the front of the property lies the double bedroom, featuring solid oak floorboards found throughout the apartment, complemented by crisp white walls and lit via two windows, one providing views out to the yard beyond. This is the ideal home for young professionals wishing to discover a slice of calm in the bustling and covetable surrounds of Stroud Green Road.

Located on the ground floor of this unique modern building, 51a sits proudly on the vibrant Stroud Green Road awash with award winning local eateries and independent retail. What’s more you are a mere 0.6 miles away from Finsbury Park Station with direct access to the City and East London.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** zero stamp duty ** A very impressive and extremely bright one bedroom apartment located on the top floor (5th) of this luxury development.

The property benefits from a large open plan lounge / Kitchen with large windows allowing for excellent natural light, walnut wooden floors, a large double bedroom with built in wardrobes, a fully fitted kitchen with all mod cons and a luxury bathroom.

Situated on Stroud Green Road, Vista house is only seconds away from Finsbury Park Station (Piccadilly line, Victoria line and National Rail) and 6 minutes to Crouch Hill Station. Also within walking distance to the open green spaces of Finsbury Park and an array of array of eateries and boutique shops.

Tenure = Leasehold (125 years from 2011)
Service Charge = £1,316.88 pa
Ground Rent = £250 pa

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered chain free this open plan, split level two double bedroom home resides a mere 0.5 miles from Finsbury Park Station in Stroud Green.

The paved front garden and black-and-white chequerboard pathway welcome you inside, through a jet-black front door with smart silver detailing. Beyond your private door on the first level, you’re welcomed by the first with the open plan kitchen and reception room, complete with three wood-framed sash windows. Handle-less, glossy white cabinetry and sleek worktops in the the kitchen area, alongside cleverly concealed and expertly integrated appliances. The adjoining reception area provides space for both living and dining room furniture, with green views and calmly lit by dimmable recessed spotlighting. Gracing the master bathroom next door is a full-sized bathtub, shower attachment, chrome heated towel rail and a wall-mounted mirrored cabinet with integrated LED lighting. The two double bedrooms are located to the rear of the property.

This charming property is situated on a sought after residential road in Finsbury Park, inner north London and is less than a 10 minute walk away from Finsbury Park underground station (zone 2), hosted by the Victoria, Piccadilly and National rail lines. Neighbouring Stroud Green, locally known as the foodie strip, is awash with award winning cafes and restaurants as well as ethical independent retail.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Discover handsome wood flooring, contemporary fittings throughout and even a private balcony via the master bedroom; this three double bedroom home resides a mere 0.4 miles from Finsbury Park Station in the bosom of Stroud Green.

The paved front garden and black-and-white chequerboard pathway welcome you inside, through a jet-black front door with smart silver detailing. Beyond your private door on the first level and ascending to the second, you’re welcomed by the first double bedroom residing towards the rear of the property, for added calm and peaceful evenings. Ascending another split level, you’ll discover the L shaped, open plan kitchen and reception room, complete with three wood-framed sash windows. Handle-less, glossy white cabinetry and sleek worktops create the kitchen area, alongside cleverly concealed and expertly integrated appliances. The adjoining reception area provides space for both living and dining room furniture, with green views and calmly lit by dimmable recessed spotlighting. Gracing the master bathroom next door is a full-sized bathtub, shower attachment, chrome heated towel rail and a wall-mounted mirrored cabinet with integrated LED lighting. The second bedroom, which could be used as a second living space, is also decked with light wooden flooring and surrounded by fresh, white painted walls. Upstairs awaits the master bedroom, boasting slanted ceiling, eaves storage, an ensuite bathroom and doors opening onto a small, picturesque French balcony that overlooks neighbouring residential streets.

This charming property is situated on a sought after residential road in Finsbury Park, inner north London and is less than a 10 minute walk away from Finsbury Park underground station (zone 2), hosted by the Victoria, Piccadilly and National rail lines. Neighbouring Stroud Green, locally known as the foodie strip, is awash with award winning cafes and restaurants as well as ethical independent retail.
